Text

Chapter I. It is a truth universally acknowledged , that [a single man in possession of a good fortune]228-a single man in possession of a good fortune must be in want of [a wife]229-a wife . However little known the feelings or views of [such a man]230-such a man may be on [his]230-such a man first entering [a neighbourhood]231-a neighbourhood , this truth is so well fixed in the minds of [the surrounding families]232-the surrounding families , that [he]230-such a man is considered as the rightful property of [some one or other of [[their]232-the surrounding families daughters]234-their daughters]233-some one or other of their daughters . “ [[My]235-his lady dear]3066-my dear [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet , ”[235-his lady] said [[his]230-such a man lady]235-his lady to [him]230-such a man one day , “ have [you]230-such a man heard that [Netherfield Park]1-netherfield park is let at last ? ”[235-his lady] [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet replied that [he]81-mr. bennet had not . “ But it is , ”[235-his lady] returned [she]235-his lady ; “ for [Mrs. Long]82-mrs. long has just been [here]3067-here , and [she]82-mrs. long told [me]235-his lady all about it . ”[235-his lady] [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet made no answer . “ Do not [you]230-such a man want to know who has taken it ? ”[236-his wife] cried [[his]230-such a man wife]236-his wife , impatiently . “ [You]230-such a man want to tell [me]236-his wife , and [I]236-his wife have no objection to hearing it . ”[236-his wife] [ Illustration : “ [He]230-such a man came down to see [the place]3068-the place ”[236-his wife] This was invitation enough . “ Why , [[my]236-his wife dear]3066-my dear , [you]3066-my dear must know , [Mrs. Long]82-mrs. long says that [Netherfield]2-netherfield is taken by [a young man of large fortune]3070-a young man of large fortune from [the north of [England]3-england]3071-the north of england ; that [he]230-such a man came down on Monday in a chaise and four to see [the place]3068-the place , and was so much delighted with it that [he]230-such a man agreed with [Mr. Morris]83-mr. morris immediately ; that [he]230-such a man is to take possession before [Michaelmas]84-michaelmas , and [some of [[his]230-such a man servants]3074-his servants]3073-some of his servants are to be in [the house]3075-the house by the end of next week . ”[236-his wife] “ What is [his]230-such a man name ? ”[236-his wife] “ [Bingley]85-mr. bingley . ”[236-his wife] “ Is [he]230-such a man married or single ? ”[236-his wife] “ Oh , single , [[my]236-his wife dear]3066-my dear , to be sure ! [A single man of large fortune]3077-a single man of large fortune ; four or five thousand a year . What a fine thing for [[our]3078-our girls]3079-our girls ! ”[236-his wife] “ How so ? how can it affect [them]3079-our girls ? ”[236-his wife] “ [[My]236-his wife dear]3066-my dear [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet , ”[236-his wife] replied [[his]237-his wife]236-his wife , “ how can [you]81-mr. bennet be so tiresome ? [You]81-mr. bennet must know that [I]236-his wife am thinking of [his]230-such a man marrying one of [them]3079-our girls . ”[236-his wife] “ Is that [his]230-such a man design in settling [here]3067-here ? ”[236-his wife] “ Design ? Nonsense , how can [you]81-mr. bennet talk so ! But it is very likely that [he]230-such a man may fall in love with one of [them]3079-our girls , and therefore [you]81-mr. bennet must visit [him]230-such a man as soon as [he]230-such a man comes . ”[236-his wife] “ [I]236-his wife see no occasion for that . [You]81-mr. bennet and [the girls]3082-the girls may go -- or [you]81-mr. bennet may send [them]3082-the girls by [themselves]3082-the girls , which perhaps will be still better ; for as [you]81-mr. bennet are as handsome as any of [them]3082-the girls , [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley might like [you]81-mr. bennet the best of the party . ”[236-his wife] “ [[My]236-his wife dear]3066-my dear , [you]81-mr. bennet flatter [me]236-his wife . [I]236-his wife certainly have had [my]236-his wife share of beauty , but [I]236-his wife do not pretend to be anything extraordinary now . When [a woman]3084-a woman has [five grown - up daughters]3085-five grown - up daughters , [she]3084-a woman ought to give over thinking of [her]3084-a woman own beauty . ”[236-his wife] “ In such cases , [a woman]3084-a woman has not often much beauty to think of . ”[236-his wife] “ But , [[my]236-his wife dear]3066-my dear , [you]81-mr. bennet must indeed go and see [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley when [he]85-mr. bingley comes into [the neighbourhood]3088-the neighbourhood . ”[236-his wife] “ It is more than [I]236-his wife engage for , [I]236-his wife assure [you]81-mr. bennet . ”[236-his wife] “ But consider [[your]81-mr. bennet daughters]3089-your daughters . Only think what an establishment it would be for [one of [them]3089-your daughters]3090-one of them . [Sir William]86-sir william and [Lady Lucas]87-lady lucas are determined to go , merely on that account ; for in general , [you]81-mr. bennet know , [they]3089-your daughters visit [no new comers]3091-no new comers . Indeed [you]81-mr. bennet must go , for it will be impossible for [us]3092-us to visit [him]85-mr. bingley , if [you]81-mr. bennet do not . ”[236-his wife] “ [You]81-mr. bennet are over scrupulous , surely . [I]236-his wife dare say [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley will be very glad to see [you]81-mr. bennet ; and [I]236-his wife will send a few lines by [you]81-mr. bennet to assure [him]85-mr. bingley of [my]236-his wife hearty consent to [his]85-mr. bingley marrying whichever [he]85-mr. bingley chooses of [the girls]3082-the girls -- though [I]236-his wife must throw in a good word for [[my]236-his wife little [Lizzy]88-elizabeth]3094-my little lizzy . ”[236-his wife] “ [I]236-his wife desire [you]81-mr. bennet will do no such thing . [Lizzy]88-elizabeth is not a bit better than the others : and [I]236-his wife am sure [she]88-elizabeth is not half so handsome as [Jane]89-jane , nor half so good - humoured as [Lydia]90-lydia . But [you]81-mr. bennet are always giving [her]88-elizabeth the preference . ”[236-his wife] “ [They]3082-the girls have none of [them]3082-the girls much to recommend [them]3082-the girls , ”[239-i] replied [he]239-i : “ [they]3082-the girls are all silly and ignorant like [other girls]3095-other girls ; but [Lizzy]88-elizabeth has something more of quickness than [[her]88-elizabeth sisters]3096-her sisters . ”[239-i] “ [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet , how can [you]81-mr. bennet abuse [[your]81-mr. bennet own children]3097-your own children in such a way ? [You]81-mr. bennet take delight in vexing [me]236-his wife . [You]81-mr. bennet have no compassion on [my]236-his wife poor nerves . ”[236-his wife] “ [You]81-mr. bennet mistake [me]236-his wife , [[my]236-his wife dear]3066-my dear . [I]236-his wife have a high respect for [your]81-mr. bennet nerves . [They]3097-your own children are [[my]236-his wife old friends]3099-my old friends . [I]236-his wife have heard [you]81-mr. bennet mention [them]3097-your own children with consideration these twenty years at least . ”[236-his wife] “ Ah , [you]81-mr. bennet do not know what [I]239-i suffer . ”[239-i] “ But [I]236-his wife hope [you]81-mr. bennet will get over it , and live to see [many young men of four thousand a year]3100-many young men of four thousand a year come into [the neighbourhood]3088-the neighbourhood . ”[236-his wife] “ It will be no use to [us]3102-us , if [twenty such]3103-twenty such should come , since [you]81-mr. bennet will not visit [them]3103-twenty such . ”[236-his wife] “ Depend upon it , [[my]239-i dear]3066-my dear , that when there are twenty , [I]239-i will visit [them]3103-twenty such all . ”[239-i] [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet was so odd a mixture of quick parts , sarcastic humour , reserve , and caprice , that the experience of three - and - twenty years had been insufficient to make [[his]81-mr. bennet wife]236-his wife understand [his]81-mr. bennet character . [Her]236-his wife mind was less difficult to develope . [She]236-his wife was [a woman of mean understanding]241-a woman of mean understanding , little information , and uncertain temper . When [she]236-his wife was discontented , [she]236-his wife fancied [herself]236-his wife nervous . The business of [her]236-his wife life was to get [[her]236-his wife daughters]242-her daughters married : its solace was visiting and news . [ Illustration : M^{r . } & [M^{rs]91-m^{rs . } [Bennet]81-mr. bennet [ Illustration : “ [I]81-mr. bennet hope [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley will like it ”[81-mr. bennet] CHAPTER II . [ Illustration ] [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet was among [the earliest of those who waited on [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley . [He]81-mr. bennet had always intended to visit [him]85-mr. bingley , though to the last always assuring [[his]81-mr. bennet wife]236-his wife that [he]85-mr. bingley should not go]243-the earliest of those who waited on mr. bingley . he had always intended to visit him , though to the last always assuring his wife that he should not go ; and till the evening after the visit was paid [she]236-his wife had no knowledge of it . It was then disclosed in the following manner . Observing [[his]81-mr. bennet second daughter]245-his second daughter employed in trimming a hat , [he]81-mr. bennet suddenly addressed [her]236-his wife with,-- “ [I]81-mr. bennet hope [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley will like it , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ [We]3105-we are not in a way to know what [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley likes , ”[246-her mother] said [[her]236-his wife mother]246-her mother , resentfully , “ since [we]3105-we are not to visit . ”[246-her mother] “ But [you]246-her mother forget , [mamma]3106-mamma , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ that [we]3105-we shall meet [him]85-mr. bingley at [the assemblies]3107-the assemblies , and that [Mrs. Long]82-mrs. long has promised to introduce [him]85-mr. bingley . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]246-her mother do not believe [Mrs. Long]82-mrs. long will do any such thing . [She]82-mrs. long has [two nieces of [her]82-mrs. long own]3108-two nieces of her own . [She]82-mrs. long is [a selfish , hypocritical woman]3109-a selfish , hypocritical woman , and [I]246-her mother have no opinion of [her]82-mrs. long . ”[246-her mother] “ No more have [I]81-mr. bennet , ”[81-mr. bennet] said [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet ; “ and [I]81-mr. bennet am glad to find that [you]81-mr. bennet do not depend on [her]82-mrs. long serving [you]81-mr. bennet . ”[81-mr. bennet] [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet deigned not to make any reply ; but , unable to contain [herself]92-mrs. bennet , began scolding [one of [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughters]242-her daughters]247-one of her daughters . “ Do n’t keep coughing so , [Kitty]93-lady catherine , for heaven ’s sake ! Have a little compassion on [my]249-her father nerves . [You]93-lady catherine tear [them]3110-them to pieces . ”[249-her father] “ [Kitty]93-lady catherine has no discretion in [her]93-lady catherine coughs , ”[249-her father] said [[her]247-one of her daughters father]249-her father ; “ [she]93-lady catherine times them ill . ”[249-her father] “ [I]93-lady catherine do not cough for [my]93-lady catherine own amusement , ”[93-lady catherine] replied [Kitty]93-lady catherine , fretfully . “ When is [your]81-mr. bennet next ball to be , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth ? ”[93-lady catherine] “ To - morrow fortnight . ”[249-her father] “ Ay , so it is , ”[246-her mother] cried [[her]247-one of her daughters mother]246-her mother , “ and [Mrs. Long]82-mrs. long does not come back till the day before ; so , it will be impossible for [her]82-mrs. long to introduce [him]249-her father , for [she]82-mrs. long will not know [him]249-her father [herself]82-mrs. long . ”[246-her mother] “ Then , [[my]249-her father dear]3066-my dear , [you]81-mr. bennet may have the advantage of [[your]81-mr. bennet friend]3112-your friend , and introduce [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley to [her]3112-your friend . ”[249-her father] “ Impossible , [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet , impossible , when [I]249-her father am not acquainted with [him]249-her father [myself]249-her father ; how can [you]81-mr. bennet be so teasing ? ”[249-her father] “ [I]3082-the girls honour [your]81-mr. bennet circumspection . A fortnight ’s acquaintance is certainly very little . [One]3113-one can not know what [a man]3114-a man really is by the end of a fortnight . But if [we]3115-we do not venture , [somebody else]3116-somebody else will ; and after all , [Mrs. Long]82-mrs. long and [[her]82-mrs. long nieces]3117-her nieces must stand [their]3082-the girls chance ; and , therefore , as [she]82-mrs. long will think it an act of kindness , if [you]81-mr. bennet decline [the office]3118-the office , [I]3082-the girls will take it on [myself]3082-the girls . ”[3082-the girls] [The girls]3082-the girls stared at [[their]3082-the girls father]252-their father . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet said only , “ Nonsense , nonsense ! ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ What can be the meaning of that emphatic exclamation ? ”[252-their father] cried [he]252-their father . “ Do [you]81-mr. bennet consider the forms of introduction , and the stress that is laid on them , as nonsense ? [I]252-their father can not quite agree with [you]81-mr. bennet there . What say [you]81-mr. bennet , [Mary]94-mary ? For [you]81-mr. bennet are [a young lady of deep reflection]3119-a young lady of deep reflection , [I]252-their father know , and read great books , and make extracts . ”[252-their father] [Mary]94-mary wished to say something very sensible , but knew not how . “ While [Mary]94-mary is adjusting [her]94-mary ideas , ”[252-their father] [he]252-their father continued , “ let [us]3120-us return to [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley . ”[252-their father] “ [I]236-his wife am sick of [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , ”[236-his wife] cried [[his]252-their father wife]236-his wife . “ [I]252-their father am sorry to hear that ; but why did [you]252-their father not tell [me]252-their father so before ? If [I]252-their father had known as much this morning , [I]252-their father certainly would not have called on [him]85-mr. bingley . It is very unlucky ; but as [I]252-their father have actually paid the visit , [we]3120-us can not escape the acquaintance now . ”[252-their father] The astonishment of [the ladies]254-the ladies was just what [he]252-their father wished -- that of [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet perhaps surpassing the rest ; though when the first tumult of joy was over , [she]92-mrs. bennet began to declare that it was what [she]92-mrs. bennet had expected all the while . “ How good it was in [you]252-their father , [[my]92-mrs. bennet dear]3066-my dear [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet ! But [I]92-mrs. bennet knew [I]92-mrs. bennet should persuade [you]252-their father at last . [I]92-mrs. bennet was sure [you]252-their father loved [[your]252-their father girls]3122-your girls too well to neglect such an acquaintance . Well , how pleased [I]92-mrs. bennet am ! And it is such a good joke , too , that [you]252-their father should have gone this morning , and never said a word about it till now . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ Now , [Kitty]93-lady catherine , [you]93-lady catherine may cough as much as [you]93-lady catherine choose , ”[81-mr. bennet] said [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet ; and , as [he]81-mr. bennet spoke , [he]81-mr. bennet left [the room]255-the room , fatigued with the raptures of [[his]81-mr. bennet wife]236-his wife . “ What [an excellent father]3123-an excellent father [you]252-their father have , [girls]3124-girls , ”[236-his wife] said [she]236-his wife , when the door was shut . “ [I]236-his wife do not know how [you]252-their father will ever make [him]81-mr. bennet amends for [his]81-mr. bennet kindness ; or [me]236-his wife either , for that matter . At [our]3125-our time of life , it is not so pleasant , [I]236-his wife can tell [you]252-their father , to be making [new acquaintances]3126-new acquaintances every day ; but for [your]252-their father sakes [we]3125-our would do anything . [Lydia]90-lydia , [[my]236-his wife love]3127-my love , though [you]252-their father are the youngest , [I]236-his wife dare say [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley will dance with [you]252-their father at the next ball . ”[236-his wife] “ Oh , ”[90-lydia] said [Lydia]90-lydia , stoutly , “ [I]90-lydia am not afraid ; for though [I]90-lydia am [the youngest]3128-the youngest , [I]90-lydia ’m the tallest . ”[90-lydia] The rest of the evening was spent in conjecturing how soon [he]257-he would return [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet ’s visit , and determining when [they]258-they should ask [him]257-he to dinner . [ Illustration : “ [I]90-lydia ’m the tallest ”[90-lydia] ] [ Illustration : “ [He]85-mr. bingley rode a black horse ”[90-lydia] ] CHAPTER III . [ Illustration ] Not all that [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , however , with the assistance of [[her]92-mrs. bennet five daughters]259-her five daughters , could ask on the subject , was sufficient to draw from [[her]92-mrs. bennet husband]260-her husband any satisfactory description of [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley . [They]258-they attacked [him]85-mr. bingley in various ways , with barefaced questions , ingenious suppositions , and distant surmises ; but [he]85-mr. bingley eluded the skill of [them]258-they all ; and [they]258-they were at last obliged to accept the second - hand intelligence of [[their]258-they neighbour]261-their neighbour , [Lady Lucas]87-lady lucas . [Her]87-lady lucas report was highly favourable . [Sir William]86-sir william had been delighted with [him]85-mr. bingley . [He]85-mr. bingley was quite young , wonderfully handsome , extremely agreeable , and , to crown the whole , [he]85-mr. bingley meant to be at the next assembly with a large party . Nothing could be more delightful ! To be fond of dancing was a certain step towards falling in love ; and very lively hopes of [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s heart were entertained . “ If [I]92-mrs. bennet can but see [one of [[my]92-mrs. bennet daughters]3130-my daughters]3129-one of my daughters happily settled at [Netherfield]2-netherfield , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet to [[her]92-mrs. bennet husband]260-her husband , “ and [all the others]3131-all the others equally well married , [I]92-mrs. bennet shall have nothing to wish for . ”[92-mrs. bennet] In a few days [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley returned [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet ’s visit , and sat about ten minutes with [him]81-mr. bennet in [[his]85-mr. bingley library]263-his library . [He]85-mr. bingley had entertained hopes of being admitted to a sight of [the young ladies]264-the young ladies , of whose beauty [he]85-mr. bingley had heard much ; but [he]85-mr. bingley saw only [the father]265-the father . [The ladies]254-the ladies were somewhat more fortunate , for [they]254-the ladies had the advantage of ascertaining , from an upper window , that [he]81-mr. bennet wore a blue coat and rode a black horse . An invitation to dinner was soon afterwards despatched ; and already had [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet planned the courses that were to do credit to [[her]92-mrs. bennet housekeeping]267-her housekeeping , when an answer arrived which deferred it all . [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley was obliged to be in [town]268-town the following day , and consequently unable to accept the honour of [their]254-the ladies invitation , etc . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet was quite disconcerted . [She]92-mrs. bennet could not imagine what business [he]85-mr. bingley could have in [town]268-town so soon after [his]85-mr. bingley arrival in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire ; and [she]92-mrs. bennet began to fear that [he]85-mr. bingley might always be flying about from [one place]270-one place to another , and never settled at [Netherfield]2-netherfield as [he]85-mr. bingley ought to be . [Lady Lucas]87-lady lucas quieted [her]87-lady lucas fears a little by starting the idea of [his]85-mr. bingley [ Illustration : “ When [the Party]3132-the party entered ”[85-mr. bingley] being gone to [London]5-london only to get a large party for the ball ; and a report soon followed that [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley was to bring [twelve ladies]271-twelve ladies and [seven gentlemen]272-seven gentlemen with [him]85-mr. bingley to the assembly . [The girls]3082-the girls grieved over [such a number of [ladies]275-ladies]274-such a number of ladies ; but were comforted the day before the ball by hearing that , instead of twelve , [he]85-mr. bingley had brought only six with [him]85-mr. bingley from [London]5-london , [[his]85-mr. bingley five sisters]276-his five sisters and [a cousin]277-a cousin . And when [the party]3132-the party entered [the assembly - room]279-the assembly - room , it consisted of only [five altogether]280-five altogether : [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , [[his]85-mr. bingley two sisters]281-his two sisters , [the husband of the eldest]282-the husband of the eldest , and [another young man]283-another young man . [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley was good - looking and gentlemanlike : [he]85-mr. bingley had a pleasant countenance , and easy , unaffected manners . [[His]85-mr. bingley sisters]284-his sisters were [fine women]285-fine women , with an air of decided fashion . [[His]85-mr. bingley brother - in - law]286-his brother - in - law , [Mr. Hurst]95-mr. hurst , merely looked [the gentleman]287-the gentleman ; but [[his]85-mr. bingley friend]288-his friend [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy soon drew the attention of [the room]255-the room by [his]85-mr. bingley [fine , tall person]290-fine , tall person , handsome features , [noble mien]291-noble mien , and the report , which was in general circulation within five minutes after [his]85-mr. bingley entrance , of [his]85-mr. bingley having ten thousand a year . [The gentlemen]292-the gentlemen pronounced [him]85-mr. bingley to be a fine figure of [a man]3114-a man , [the ladies]254-the ladies declared [he]85-mr. bingley was much handsomer than [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , and [he]85-mr. bingley was looked at with great admiration for about half the evening , till [his]85-mr. bingley manners gave a disgust which turned the tide of [his]85-mr. bingley popularity ; for [he]85-mr. bingley was discovered to be proud , to be above [his]85-mr. bingley company , and above being pleased ; and not all [his]85-mr. bingley large estate in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire could save [him]85-mr. bingley from having a most forbidding , disagreeable countenance , and being unworthy to be compared with [[his]85-mr. bingley friend]288-his friend . [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley had soon made [himself]85-mr. bingley acquainted with [all the principal people in [the room]255-the room]296-all the principal people in the room : [he]85-mr. bingley was lively and unreserved , danced every dance , was angry that the ball closed so early , and talked of giving [one]3113-one [himself]85-mr. bingley at [Netherfield]2-netherfield . Such amiable qualities must speak for [themselves]296-all the principal people in the room . What a contrast between [him]85-mr. bingley and [[his]85-mr. bingley friend]288-his friend ! [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy danced only once with [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst and once with [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , declined being introduced to [any other lady]300-any other lady , and spent the rest of the evening in walking about [the room]255-the room , speaking occasionally to one of [[his]96-mr. darcy own party]302-his own party . [His]96-mr. darcy character was decided . [He]96-mr. darcy was [the proudest , most disagreeable man in [the world]304-the world]303-the proudest , most disagreeable man in the world , and [everybody]305-everybody hoped that [he]96-mr. darcy would never come [there]306-there again . Amongst the most violent against [him]96-mr. darcy was [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , whose dislike of [his]96-mr. darcy general behaviour was sharpened into particular resentment by [his]96-mr. darcy having slighted [one of [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughters]242-her daughters]247-one of her daughters . [Elizabeth Bennet]88-elizabeth had been obliged , by the scarcity of [gentlemen]309-gentlemen , to sit down for two dances ; and during part of that time , [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy had been standing near enough for [her]92-mrs. bennet to overhear a conversation between [him]96-mr. darcy and [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , who came from the dance for a few minutes to press [[his]85-mr. bingley friend]288-his friend to join it . “ Come , [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , ”[96-mr. darcy] said [he]96-mr. darcy , “ [I]96-mr. darcy must have [you]96-mr. darcy dance . [You]96-mr. darcy had much better dance . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ [I]96-mr. darcy certainly shall not . [You]96-mr. darcy know how [I]96-mr. darcy detest it , unless [I]96-mr. darcy am particularly acquainted with [[my]96-mr. darcy partner]3133-my partner . [[Your]96-mr. darcy sisters]3134-your sisters are engaged , and there is [not another woman in [the room]255-the room whom it would not be a punishment to [me]96-mr. darcy to stand up with]3135-not another woman in the room whom it would not be a punishment to me to stand up with . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ [I]85-mr. bingley would not be so fastidious as [you]96-mr. darcy are , ”[85-mr. bingley] cried [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , “ for a kingdom ! [She]88-elizabeth told the story , however , with great spirit among [[her]88-elizabeth friends]311-her friends ; for [she]88-elizabeth had a lively , playful disposition , which delighted in anything ridiculous . The evening altogether passed off pleasantly to [the whole family]312-the whole family . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet had seen [[her]92-mrs. bennet eldest daughter]313-her eldest daughter much admired by the Netherfield party . [Jane]89-jane was as much gratified by this as [[her]89-jane mother]246-her mother could be , though in a quieter way . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth felt [Jane]89-jane ’s pleasure . [Mary]94-mary had heard [herself]94-mary mentioned to [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley as [the most accomplished girl in [the neighbourhood]3088-the neighbourhood]316-the most accomplished girl in the neighbourhood ; and [Catherine]93-lady catherine and [Lydia]90-lydia had been fortunate enough to be never without [partners]318-partners , which was all that [they]319-they had yet learnt to care for at a ball . [They]319-they returned , therefore , in good spirits to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , [the village]320-the village where [they]319-they lived , and of which [they]319-they were [the principal inhabitants]321-the principal inhabitants . [They]319-they found [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet still up . With a book , [he]81-mr. bennet was regardless of time ; and on the present occasion [he]81-mr. bennet had a good deal of curiosity as to the event of an evening which had raised such splendid expectations . [He]81-mr. bennet had rather hoped that all [[his]81-mr. bennet wife]236-his wife ’s views on [the stranger]323-the stranger would be disappointed ; but [he]81-mr. bennet soon found that [he]81-mr. bennet had a very different story to hear . “ Oh , [[my]236-his wife dear]3066-my dear [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet , ”[236-his wife] as [she]236-his wife entered [the room]255-the room , “ [we]319-they have had a most delightful evening , a most excellent ball . [I]236-his wife wish [you]3147-you had been [there]306-there . [Jane]89-jane was so admired , nothing could be like it . [ Illustration ] When [Jane]89-jane and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth were alone , [the former]327-the former , who had been cautious in [her]327-the former praise of [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley before , expressed to [[her]327-the former sister]328-her sister how very much [she]327-the former admired [him]85-mr. bingley . “ [He]85-mr. bingley is just what [a young - man]3164-a young - man ought to be , ”[327-the former] said [she]327-the former , “ sensible , good - humoured , lively ; and [I]327-the former never saw such happy manners ! so much ease , with such perfect good breeding ! ”[327-the former] “ [He]85-mr. bingley is also handsome , ”[88-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ which [a young man]3165-a young man ought likewise to be if [he]3165-a young man possibly can . [His]85-mr. bingley character is thereby complete . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]327-the former was very much flattered by [his]85-mr. bingley asking [me]327-the former to dance a second time . [I]327-the former did not expect such a compliment . ”[327-the former] “ Did not [you]327-the former ? [I]327-the former did for [you]327-the former . But that is one great difference between [us]3166-us . Compliments always take [you]327-the former by surprise , and [me]327-the former never . What could be more natural than [his]85-mr. bingley asking [you]327-the former again ? [He]85-mr. bingley could not help seeing that [you]327-the former were about five times as pretty as [every other woman in [the room]255-the room]3167-every other woman in the room . No thanks to [his]85-mr. bingley gallantry for that . Well , [he]85-mr. bingley certainly is very agreeable , and [I]327-the former give [you]327-the former leave to like [him]85-mr. bingley . [You]327-the former have liked many [a stupider person]3169-a stupider person . ”[327-the former] “ [Dear Lizzy]103-dear lizzy ! ”[88-elizabeth] “ Oh , [you]327-the former are a great deal too apt , [you]327-the former know , to like [people in general]3170-people in general . [You]327-the former never see a fault in [anybody]3171-anybody . All [the world]304-the world are good and agreeable in [your]327-the former eyes . [I]327-the former never heard [you]327-the former speak ill of [a human being]3173-a human being in [my]327-the former life . ”[327-the former] “ [I]327-the former would wish not to be hasty in censuring [anyone]3174-anyone ; but [I]327-the former always speak what [I]327-the former think . ”[327-the former] “ [I]88-elizabeth know [you]327-the former do : and it is that which makes the wonder . With [your]327-the former good sense , to be so honestly blind to the follies and nonsense of [others]3175-others ! Affectation of candour is common enough ; [one]3113-one meets with it everywhere . But to be candid without ostentation or design,--to take the good of [everybody]305-everybody ’s character and make it still better , and say nothing of the bad,--belongs to [you]327-the former alone . And so , [you]327-the former like [[this man]3178-this man ’s sisters]3179-this man ’s sisters , too , do [you]327-the former ? [Their]3179-this man ’s sisters manners are not equal to [his]3178-this man . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Certainly not , at first ; but [they]3179-this man ’s sisters are very pleasing [women]3180-women when [you]327-the former converse with [them]3179-this man ’s sisters . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley is to live with [[her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother , and keep [[his]3181-her brother house]3182-his house ; and [I]327-the former am much mistaken if [we]3183-we shall not find [a very charming neighbour]3184-a very charming neighbour in [her]98-miss bingley . ”[327-the former] [Elizabeth]103-dear lizzy listened in silence , but was not convinced : [their]329-they behaviour at the assembly had not been calculated to please in general ; and with more quickness of observation and less pliancy of temper than [[her]103-dear lizzy sister]328-her sister , and with a judgment , too , unassailed by any attention to [herself]103-dear lizzy , [she]103-dear lizzy was very little disposed to approve [them]329-they . [They]329-they were , in fact , [very fine ladies]331-very fine ladies ; not deficient in good - humour when [they]329-they were pleased , nor in the power of being agreeable where [they]329-they chose it ; but proud and conceited . [They]329-they were rather handsome ; had been educated in [one of the first private seminaries in [town]268-town]332-one of the first private seminaries in town ; had a fortune of twenty thousand pounds ; were in the habit of spending more than [they]329-they ought , and of associating with [people of rank]334-people of rank ; and were , therefore , in every respect entitled to think well of [themselves]329-they and meanly of [others]3175-others . [They]329-they were of [a respectable family in [the north of [England]3-england]3071-the north of england]336-a respectable family in the north of england ; a circumstance more deeply impressed on [their]329-they memories than that [[their]329-they brother]338-their brother ’s fortune and [their]329-they own had been acquired by trade . [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley inherited property to the amount of nearly a hundred thousand pounds from [[his]85-mr. bingley father]339-his father , who had intended to purchase an estate , but did not live to do it . [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley intended [it]340-it likewise , and sometimes made choice of [[his]85-mr. bingley county]341-his county ; but , as [he]85-mr. bingley was now provided with [a good house]342-a good house and the liberty of [a manor]343-a manor , it was doubtful to [many of those who best knew the easiness of [his]85-mr. bingley temper , whether [he]85-mr. bingley might not spend the remainder of [his]85-mr. bingley days at [Netherfield]2-netherfield , and leave [the next generation]345-the next generation to purchase]344-many of those who best knew the easiness of his temper , whether he might not spend the remainder of his days at netherfield , and leave the next generation to purchase . [[His]85-mr. bingley sisters]284-his sisters were very anxious for [his]85-mr. bingley having [an estate of [his]85-mr. bingley own]347-an estate of his own ; but though [he]85-mr. bingley was now established only as [a tenant]348-a tenant , [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley was by no means unwilling to preside at [his]85-mr. bingley table ; nor was [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst , who had married [a man of more fashion than fortune]349-a man of more fashion than fortune , less disposed to consider [[his]85-mr. bingley house]3182-his house as [[her]97-mrs. hurst home]351-her home when it suited [her]97-mrs. hurst . [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley had not been of age two years when [he]85-mr. bingley was tempted , by an accidental recommendation , to look at [Netherfield House]8-netherfield house . [He]85-mr. bingley did look at [it]8-netherfield house , and into [it]8-netherfield house , for half an hour ; was pleased with the situation and [the principal rooms]352-the principal rooms , satisfied with what [the owner]353-the owner said in its praise , and took it immediately . Between [him]85-mr. bingley and [Darcy]96-mr. darcy there was a very steady friendship , in spite of a great opposition of character . [Bingley]85-mr. bingley was endeared to [Darcy]96-mr. darcy by the easiness , openness , and ductility of [his]85-mr. bingley temper , though no disposition could offer a greater contrast to [his]85-mr. bingley own , and though with [his]85-mr. bingley own [he]85-mr. bingley never appeared dissatisfied . On the strength of [Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s regard , [Bingley]85-mr. bingley had the firmest reliance , and of [his]85-mr. bingley judgment the highest opinion . In understanding , [Darcy]96-mr. darcy was the superior . [Bingley]85-mr. bingley was by no means deficient ; but [Darcy]96-mr. darcy was clever . [He]96-mr. darcy was at the same time haughty , reserved , and fastidious ; and [his]96-mr. darcy manners , though well bred , were not inviting . In that respect [[his]85-mr. bingley friend]288-his friend had greatly the advantage . [Bingley]85-mr. bingley was sure of being liked wherever [he]85-mr. bingley appeared ; [Darcy]96-mr. darcy was continually giving offence . The manner in which [they]355-they spoke of [the Meryton assembly]356-the meryton assembly was sufficiently characteristic . [Bingley]85-mr. bingley had never met with [pleasanter people]357-pleasanter people or [prettier girls]358-prettier girls in [his]85-mr. bingley life ; [everybody]305-everybody had been most kind and attentive to [him]85-mr. bingley ; there had been no formality , no stiffness ; [he]85-mr. bingley had soon felt acquainted with all [the room]255-the room ; and as to [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , [he]85-mr. bingley could not conceive [an angel more beautiful]361-an angel more beautiful . [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , on the contrary , had seen a collection of [people in whom there was little beauty and no fashion]362-people in whom there was little beauty and no fashion , for none of whom [he]96-mr. darcy had felt the smallest interest , and from [none received either attention or pleasure]363-none received either attention or pleasure . [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth [he]96-mr. darcy acknowledged to be pretty ; but [she]88-elizabeth smiled too much . [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst and [[her]97-mrs. hurst sister]328-her sister allowed it to be so ; but still [they]365-they admired [her]88-elizabeth and liked [her]88-elizabeth , and pronounced [her]88-elizabeth to be [a sweet girl]366-a sweet girl , and one whom [they]365-they should not object to know more of . [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth was therefore established as [a sweet girl]366-a sweet girl ; and [[their]365-they brother]338-their brother felt authorized by such commendation to think of [her]88-elizabeth as [he]338-their brother chose . [ Illustration : CHAPTER V. [ Illustration ] Within a short walk of [Longbourn]7-longbourn lived [a family with whom [the Bennets]105-the bennets were particularly intimate]369-a family with whom the bennets were particularly intimate . [Sir William Lucas]86-sir william had been formerly in trade in [Meryton]9-meryton , where [he]86-sir william had made a tolerable fortune , and risen to the honour of knighthood by an address to [the king]370-the king during [his]86-sir william mayoralty . The distinction had , perhaps , been felt too strongly . It had given [him]86-sir william a disgust to [his]86-sir william business and to [his]86-sir william residence in [a small market town]371-a small market town ; and , quitting [them]372-them both , [he]86-sir william had removed with [[his]86-sir william family]373-his family to [a house about a mile from [Meryton]9-meryton , denominated from that period [Lucas Lodge]10-lucas lodge]374-a house about a mile from meryton , denominated from that period lucas lodge ; where [he]86-sir william could think with pleasure of [his]86-sir william own importance , and , unshackled by business , occupy [himself]86-sir william solely in being civil to [all the world]375-all the world . For , though elated by [his]86-sir william rank , it did not render [him]86-sir william supercilious ; on the contrary , [he]86-sir william was all attention to [everybody]305-everybody . By nature inoffensive , friendly , and obliging , [his]86-sir william presentation at [[St. James]11-st. james ’s]377-st. james ’s had made [him]86-sir william courteous . [Lady Lucas]87-lady lucas was [a very good kind of woman]378-a very good kind of woman , not too clever to be [a valuable neighbour to [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet]379-a valuable neighbour to mrs. bennet . [They]380-they had [several children]381-several children . [The eldest of [them]381-several children]382-the eldest of them , [a sensible , intelligent young woman , about twenty - seven]383-a sensible , intelligent young woman , about twenty - seven , was [[Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s intimate friend]384-elizabeth ’s intimate friend . That [the Miss Lucases]106-the lucases and [the Miss Bennets]105-the bennets should meet to talk over a ball was absolutely necessary ; and the morning after the assembly brought [the former]327-the former to [Longbourn]7-longbourn to hear and to communicate . “ [You]99-miss lucas began the evening well , [Charlotte]107-charlotte , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , with civil self - command , to [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas . “ [You]99-miss lucas were [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s first choice . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ Yes ; but [he]85-mr. bingley seemed to like [his]85-mr. bingley second better . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ Oh , [you]99-miss lucas mean [Jane]89-jane , [I]92-mrs. bennet suppose , because [he]85-mr. bingley danced with [her]89-jane twice . To be sure that did seem as if [he]85-mr. bingley admired [her]89-jane -- indeed , [I]92-mrs. bennet rather believe [he]85-mr. bingley did -- [I]92-mrs. bennet heard something about it -- but [I]92-mrs. bennet hardly know what -- something about [Mr. Robinson]108-mr. robinson . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ Perhaps [you]99-miss lucas mean what [I]92-mrs. bennet overheard between [him]85-mr. bingley and [Mr. Robinson]108-mr. robinson : did not [I]92-mrs. bennet mention it to [you]99-miss lucas ? Well , that was very decided , indeed -- that does seem as if -- but , however , it may all come to nothing , [you]99-miss lucas know . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ [My]107-charlotte overhearings were more to the purpose than [yours]99-miss lucas , [Eliza]88-elizabeth , ”[107-charlotte] said [Charlotte]107-charlotte . “ [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy is not so well worth listening to as [[his]96-mr. darcy friend]288-his friend , is [he]96-mr. darcy ? [Poor Eliza]109-lizzy ! to be only just tolerable . ”[107-charlotte] “ [I]110-illustration beg [you]99-miss lucas will not put it into [Lizzy]109-lizzy ’s head to be vexed by [his]96-mr. darcy ill - treatment , for [he]96-mr. darcy is such [a disagreeable man]3190-a disagreeable man that it would be quite a misfortune to be liked by [him]96-mr. darcy . With [them]3192-his intimate acquaintance [he]96-mr. darcy is remarkably agreeable . ”[89-jane] “ [I]107-charlotte do not believe a word of it , [[my]107-charlotte dear]3066-my dear . [One]3113-one can not wonder that [so very fine a young man]3198-so very fine a young man , with [family]3199-family , fortune , everything in [his]96-mr. darcy favour , should think highly of [himself]96-mr. darcy . If [I]99-miss lucas may so express it , [he]96-mr. darcy has a right to be proud . ”[99-miss lucas] “ That is very true , ”[109-lizzy] replied [Elizabeth]109-lizzy , “ and [I]109-lizzy could easily forgive [his]96-mr. darcy pride , if [he]96-mr. darcy had not mortified [mine]109-lizzy . ”[109-lizzy] “ [Pride]111-pride , ”[94-mary] observed [Mary]94-mary , who piqued [herself]94-mary upon the solidity of [her]94-mary reflections , “ is a very common failing , [I]94-mary believe . By all that [I]94-mary have ever read , [I]94-mary am convinced that it is very common indeed ; that human nature is particularly prone to it , and that there are very few of [us]3200-us [who do not cherish a feeling of self - complacency on the score of some quality or other , real or imaginary]3201-who do not cherish a feeling of self - complacency on the score of some quality or other , real or imaginary . Vanity and pride are different things , though the words are often used synonymously . [A person]3202-a person may be proud without being vain . Pride relates more to [our]3200-us opinion of [ourselves]3200-us ; vanity to what [we]3200-us would have [others]3175-others think of [us]3200-us . ”[94-mary] “ If [I]388-a young lucas were as rich as [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , ”[388-a young lucas] cried [a young Lucas]388-a young lucas , who came with [[his]388-a young lucas sisters]284-his sisters , “ [I]388-a young lucas should not care how proud [I]388-a young lucas was . [I]388-a young lucas would keep a pack of foxhounds , and drink a bottle of wine every day . ”[388-a young lucas] “ Then [you]388-a young lucas would drink a great deal more than [you]388-a young lucas ought , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet ; “ and if [I]92-mrs. bennet were to see [you]388-a young lucas at it , [I]92-mrs. bennet should take away [your]388-a young lucas bottle directly . ”[92-mrs. bennet] [The boy]390-the boy protested that [she]92-mrs. bennet should not ; [she]92-mrs. bennet continued to declare that [she]92-mrs. bennet would ; and the argument ended only with the visit . [ Illustration ] [ Illustration ] CHAPTER VI . [ Illustration ] [The ladies of [Longbourn]7-longbourn]391-the ladies of longbourn soon waited on [those of [Netherfield]2-netherfield]392-those of netherfield . The visit was returned in due form . [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth ’s pleasing manners grew on the good - will of [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst and [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ; and though [the mother]393-the mother was found to be intolerable , and [the younger sisters]394-the younger sisters not worth speaking to , a wish of being better acquainted with [them]394-the younger sisters was expressed towards [the two eldest]395-the two eldest . By [Jane]89-jane this attention was received with the greatest pleasure ; but [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth still saw superciliousness in [their]394-the younger sisters treatment of [everybody]305-everybody , hardly excepting even [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , and could not like [them]394-the younger sisters ; though [their]394-the younger sisters kindness to [Jane]89-jane , such as it was , had a value , as arising , in all probability , from the influence of [[their]394-the younger sisters brother]338-their brother ’s admiration . It was generally evident , whenever [they]394-the younger sisters met , that [he]338-their brother did admire [her]89-jane ; and to [her]89-jane it was equally evident that [Jane]89-jane was yielding to the preference which [she]89-jane had begun to entertain for [him]338-their brother from the first , and was in a way to be very much in love ; but [she]89-jane considered with pleasure that it was not likely to be discovered by [the world]304-the world in general , since [Jane]89-jane united with great strength of feeling , a composure of temper and an uniform cheerfulness of manner , which would guard [her]89-jane from the suspicions of the impertinent . [She]89-jane mentioned this to [[her]89-jane friend]400-her friend , [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas . “ It may , perhaps , be pleasant , ”[107-charlotte] replied [Charlotte]107-charlotte , “ to be able to impose on [the public]3204-the public in such a case ; but it is sometimes a disadvantage to be so very guarded . If [a woman]3084-a woman conceals [her]3084-a woman affection with the same skill from the object of it , [she]3084-a woman may lose the opportunity of fixing [him]338-their brother ; and it will then be but poor consolation to believe [the world]304-the world equally in the dark . There is so much of gratitude or vanity in almost every attachment , that it is not safe to leave any to itself . [We]3207-we can all begin freely -- a slight preference is natural enough ; but there are very few of [us]3207-we who have [heart enough to be really in love without encouragement]3208-heart enough to be really in love without encouragement . In nine cases out of ten , [a woman]3084-a woman had better show more affection than [she]3084-a woman feels . [Bingley]98-miss bingley likes [[your]3210-your sister]3211-your sister undoubtedly ; but [he]338-their brother may never do more than like [her]3211-your sister , if [she]3211-your sister does not help [him]338-their brother on . ”[107-charlotte] “ But [she]3211-your sister does help [him]338-their brother on , as much as [her]3211-your sister nature will allow . If [I]89-jane can perceive [her]3211-your sister regard for [him]338-their brother , [he]338-their brother must be [a simpleton]3212-a simpleton indeed not to discover it too . ”[89-jane] “ Remember , [Eliza]88-elizabeth , that [he]338-their brother does not know [Jane]89-jane ’s disposition as [you]88-elizabeth do . ”[89-jane] “ But if [a woman]3084-a woman is partial to [a man]3114-a man , and does not endeavor to conceal it , [he]338-their brother must find it out . ”[107-charlotte] “ Perhaps [he]338-their brother must , if [he]338-their brother sees enough of [her]89-jane . But though [Bingley]98-miss bingley and [Jane]89-jane meet tolerably often , it is never for many hours together ; and as [they]3215-they always see [each other]3216-each other in large mixed parties , it is impossible that every moment should be employed in conversing together . [Jane]89-jane should therefore make the most of every half hour in which [she]89-jane can command [his]338-their brother attention . When [she]89-jane is secure of [him]338-their brother , there will be leisure for falling in love as much as [she]89-jane chooses . ”[89-jane] “ [Your]88-elizabeth plan is a good one , ”[88-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ where nothing is in question but the desire of being well married ; and if [I]88-elizabeth were determined to get [a rich husband]3217-a rich husband , or [any husband]3218-any husband , [I]88-elizabeth dare say [I]88-elizabeth should adopt it . But these are not [Jane]89-jane ’s feelings ; [she]89-jane is not acting by design . As yet [she]89-jane can not even be certain of the degree of [her]89-jane own regard , nor of its reasonableness . [She]89-jane has known [him]338-their brother only a fortnight . [She]89-jane danced four dances with [him]338-their brother at [Meryton]9-meryton ; [she]89-jane saw [him]338-their brother one morning at [[his]338-their brother own house]3219-his own house , and has since dined in company with [him]338-their brother four times . This is not quite enough to make [her]89-jane understand [his]338-their brother character . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Not as [you]88-elizabeth represent it . Had [she]89-jane merely dined with [him]338-their brother , [she]89-jane might only have discovered whether [he]338-their brother had a good appetite ; but [you]88-elizabeth must remember that four evenings have been also spent together -- and four evenings may do a great deal . ”[89-jane] “ Yes : these four evenings have enabled [them]3220-they to ascertain that [they]3220-they both like [Vingt]112-vingt - un better than Commerce , but with respect to any other leading characteristic , [I]88-elizabeth do not imagine that much has been unfolded . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Well , ”[107-charlotte] said [Charlotte]107-charlotte , “ [I]107-charlotte wish [Jane]89-jane success with all [my]107-charlotte heart ; and if [she]89-jane were married to [him]338-their brother to - morrow , [I]107-charlotte should think [she]89-jane had as good a chance of happiness as if [she]89-jane were to be studying [his]338-their brother character for a twelvemonth . Happiness in marriage is entirely a matter of chance . If the dispositions of [the parties]3221-the parties are ever so well known to [each other]3216-each other , or ever so similar beforehand , it does not advance [their]3220-they felicity in the least . [They]3220-they always continue to grow sufficiently unlike afterwards to have [their]3220-they share of vexation ; and it is better to know as little as possible of the defects of [the person with whom [you]3224-you are to pass [your]3224-you life]3223-the person with whom you are to pass your life . ”[107-charlotte] “ [You]3224-you make [me]96-mr. darcy laugh , [Charlotte]107-charlotte ; but it is not sound . [You]3224-you know it is not sound , and that [you]3224-you would never act in this way [yourself]3224-you . ”[96-mr. darcy] Occupied in observing [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s attention to [[her]401-her sister]328-her sister , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was far from suspecting that [she]88-elizabeth was [herself]88-elizabeth becoming an object of some interest in the eyes of [[his]85-mr. bingley friend]288-his friend . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy had at first scarcely allowed [her]88-elizabeth to be pretty : [he]96-mr. darcy had looked at [her]88-elizabeth without admiration at the ball ; and when [they]404-they next met , [he]96-mr. darcy looked at [her]88-elizabeth only to criticise . But no sooner had [he]96-mr. darcy made it clear to [himself]96-mr. darcy and [[his]96-mr. darcy friends]405-his friends that [she]88-elizabeth had hardly a good feature in [her]88-elizabeth face , than [he]96-mr. darcy began to find it was rendered uncommonly intelligent by the beautiful expression of [her]88-elizabeth dark eyes . To this discovery succeeded some others equally mortifying . Though [he]96-mr. darcy had detected with a critical eye more than one failure of perfect symmetry in [her]88-elizabeth form , [he]96-mr. darcy was forced to acknowledge [her]88-elizabeth figure to be light and pleasing ; and in spite of [his]96-mr. darcy asserting that [her]88-elizabeth manners were not those of the fashionable world , [he]96-mr. darcy was caught by [their]404-they easy playfulness . Of this [she]88-elizabeth was perfectly unaware : to [her]88-elizabeth [he]96-mr. darcy was only [the man who made [himself]96-mr. darcy agreeable nowhere , and who had not thought [her]88-elizabeth handsome enough to dance with]406-the man who made himself agreeable nowhere , and who had not thought her handsome enough to dance with . [He]96-mr. darcy began to wish to know more of [her]88-elizabeth ; and , as a step towards conversing with [her]88-elizabeth [himself]96-mr. darcy , attended to [her]88-elizabeth conversation with [others]3175-others . [His]96-mr. darcy doing so drew [her]88-elizabeth notice . It was at [[Sir William Lucas]86-sir william ’s]408-sir william lucas ’s , where [a large party]409-a large party were assembled . “ What does [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy mean , ”[88-elizabeth] said [she]88-elizabeth to [Charlotte]107-charlotte , “ by listening to [my]88-elizabeth conversation with [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ That is a question which [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy only can answer . ”[88-elizabeth] “ But if [he]96-mr. darcy does it any more , [I]88-elizabeth shall certainly let [him]96-mr. darcy know that [I]88-elizabeth see what [he]96-mr. darcy is about . [He]96-mr. darcy has a very satirical eye , and if [I]88-elizabeth do not begin by being impertinent [myself]88-elizabeth , [I]88-elizabeth shall soon grow afraid of [him]96-mr. darcy . ”[88-elizabeth] [ Illustration : “ The entreaties of several ”[88-elizabeth] On [his]86-sir william approaching [them]410-them soon afterwards , though without seeming to have any intention of speaking , [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas defied [[her]99-miss lucas friend]400-her friend to mention such a subject to [him]86-sir william , which immediately provoking [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth to do it , [she]99-miss lucas turned to [him]86-sir william and said,-- “ Did not [you]86-sir william think , [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , that [I]99-miss lucas expressed [myself]99-miss lucas uncommonly well just now , when [I]99-miss lucas was teasing [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster to give [us]3225-us a ball at [Meryton]9-meryton ? ”[99-miss lucas] “ With great energy ; but it is a subject which always makes [a lady]3226-a lady energetic . ”[99-miss lucas] “ [You]86-sir william are severe on [us]3225-us . ”[99-miss lucas] “ It will be [her]3226-a lady turn soon to be teased , ”[99-miss lucas] said [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas . “ [I]99-miss lucas am going to open the instrument , [Eliza]88-elizabeth , and [you]88-elizabeth know what follows . ”[99-miss lucas] “ [You]88-elizabeth are [a very strange creature]3227-a very strange creature by way of [a friend]3228-a friend -always wanting [me]99-miss lucas to play and sing before [anybody]3171-anybody and [everybody]305-everybody ! If [my]99-miss lucas vanity had taken a musical turn , [you]88-elizabeth would have been invaluable ; but as it is , [I]99-miss lucas would really rather not sit down before [those who must be in the habit of hearing the very best performers]3231-those who must be in the habit of hearing the very best performers . ”[99-miss lucas] On [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas ’s persevering , however , [she]99-miss lucas added , “ Very well ; if it must be so , it must . ”[99-miss lucas] And gravely glancing at [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , “ There is a very fine old saying , which [everybody here]3232-everybody here is of course familiar with--‘Keep [your]88-elizabeth breath to cool [your]88-elizabeth porridge,’--and [I]99-miss lucas shall keep [mine]99-miss lucas to swell [my]99-miss lucas song . ”[99-miss lucas] [Her]99-miss lucas performance was pleasing , though by no means capital . After a song or two , and before [she]99-miss lucas could reply to the entreaties of several that [she]99-miss lucas would sing again , [she]99-miss lucas was eagerly succeeded at the instrument by [[her]99-miss lucas sister]328-her sister [Mary]94-mary , who having , in consequence of being [the only plain one in [the family]414-the family]413-the only plain one in the family , worked hard for knowledge and accomplishments , was always impatient for display . [Mary]94-mary had neither genius nor taste ; and though vanity had given [her]94-mary application , it had given [her]94-mary likewise a pedantic air and conceited manner , which would have injured a higher degree of excellence than [she]94-mary had reached . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , easy and unaffected , had been listened to with much more pleasure , though not playing half so well ; and [Mary]94-mary , at the end of a long concerto , was glad to purchase praise and gratitude by [Scotch and Irish airs]415-scotch and irish airs , at the request of [[her]94-mary younger sisters]416-her younger sisters , who with [some of [the Lucases]418-the lucases]417-some of the lucases , and [two or three officers]419-two or three officers , joined eagerly in dancing at one end of [the room]255-the room . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy stood near [them]416-her younger sisters in silent indignation at such a mode of passing the evening , to the exclusion of all conversation , and was too much engrossed by [his]96-mr. darcy own thoughts to perceive that [Sir William Lucas]86-sir william was [[his]96-mr. darcy neighbour]421-his neighbour , till [Sir William]86-sir william thus began - “ What a charming amusement for [young people]3233-young people this is , [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ! There is nothing like dancing , after all . [I]86-sir william consider it as one of the first refinements of polished societies . ”[86-sir william] “ Certainly , [sir]3234-sir ; and it has the advantage also of being in vogue amongst [the less polished societies of [the world]304-the world]3235-the less polished societies of the world : [every savage]3237-every savage can dance . ”[86-sir william] [Sir William]86-sir william only smiled . “ [[Your]96-mr. darcy friend]3112-your friend performs delightfully , ”[86-sir william] [he]86-sir william continued , after a pause , on seeing [Bingley]85-mr. bingley join [the group]422-the group ; “ and [I]86-sir william doubt not that [you]96-mr. darcy are an adept in the science [yourself]96-mr. darcy , [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy . ”[86-sir william] “ [You]96-mr. darcy saw [me]86-sir william dance at [Meryton]9-meryton , [I]86-sir william believe , [sir]3234-sir . ”[86-sir william] “ Yes , indeed , and received no inconsiderable pleasure from the sight . Do [you]96-mr. darcy often dance at [[St. James]11-st. james ’s]377-st. james ’s ? ”[86-sir william] “ Never , [sir]3234-sir . ”[86-sir william] “ Do [you]96-mr. darcy not think it would be a proper compliment to [the place]3068-the place ? ”[86-sir william] “ It is a compliment which [I]86-sir william never pay to [any place]3243-any place if [I]86-sir william can avoid it . ”[86-sir william] “ [You]96-mr. darcy have [a house in [town]268-town]3244-a house in town , [I]86-sir william conclude ? ”[86-sir william] [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy bowed . “ [I]96-mr. darcy had once some thoughts of fixing in [town]268-town [myself]96-mr. darcy , for [I]96-mr. darcy am fond of superior society ; but [I]96-mr. darcy did not feel quite certain that the air of [London]5-london would agree with [Lady Lucas]87-lady lucas . ”[96-mr. darcy] [He]96-mr. darcy paused in hopes of an answer : but [[his]96-mr. darcy companion]423-his companion was not disposed to make any ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth at that instant moving towards [them]424-them , [he]96-mr. darcy was struck with the notion of doing a very gallant thing , and called out to [her,--]423-his companion “ [[My]96-mr. darcy dear]3066-my dear [Miss Eliza]88-elizabeth , why are not [you]88-elizabeth dancing ? [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , [you]88-elizabeth must allow [me]96-mr. darcy to present [this young lady]3248-this young lady to [you]88-elizabeth as [a very desirable partner]3249-a very desirable partner . [You]88-elizabeth can not refuse to dance , [I]96-mr. darcy am sure , when so much beauty is before [you]88-elizabeth . ”[96-mr. darcy] And , taking [her]423-his companion hand , [he]96-mr. darcy would have given it to [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , who , though extremely surprised , was not unwilling to receive it , when [she]423-his companion instantly drew back , and said with some discomposure to [Sir William,--]114-sir william,-- “ Indeed , [sir]3234-sir , [I]96-mr. darcy have not the least intention of dancing . [I]96-mr. darcy entreat [you]3234-sir not to suppose that [I]96-mr. darcy moved this way in order to beg for [a partner]3251-a partner . ”[96-mr. darcy] [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , with grave propriety , requested to be allowed the honour of [her]423-his companion hand , but in vain . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was determined ; nor did [Sir William]86-sir william at all shake [her]88-elizabeth purpose by [his]86-sir william attempt at persuasion . “ [You]88-elizabeth excel so much in the dance , [Miss Eliza]88-elizabeth , that it is cruel to deny [me]86-sir william the happiness of seeing [you]88-elizabeth ; and though [this gentleman]3252-this gentleman dislikes the amusement in general , [he]3252-this gentleman can have no objection , [I]86-sir william am sure , to oblige [us]3253-us for one half hour . ”[86-sir william] “ [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy is all politeness , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , smiling . “ [He]96-mr. darcy is , indeed : but considering the inducement , [[my]88-elizabeth dear]3066-my dear [Miss Eliza]88-elizabeth , [we]3253-us can not wonder at [his]96-mr. darcy complaisance ; for who would object to [such a partner]3255-such a partner ? ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth looked archly , and turned away . [Her]88-elizabeth resistance had not injured [her]88-elizabeth with [the gentleman]287-the gentleman , and [he]287-the gentleman was thinking of [her]88-elizabeth with some complacency , when thus accosted by [Miss Bingley,--]115-miss bingley,-- “ [I]115-miss bingley,-- can guess the subject of [your]88-elizabeth reverie . ”[115-miss bingley,--] “ [I]115-miss bingley,-- should imagine not . ”[115-miss bingley,--] “ [You]88-elizabeth are considering how insupportable it would be to pass many evenings in this manner,--in such society ; and , indeed , [I]115-miss bingley,-- am quite of [your]88-elizabeth opinion . [I]115-miss bingley,-- was never more annoyed ! The insipidity , and yet the noise -- the nothingness , and yet the self - importance , of [all these people]3256-all these people ! What would [I]115-miss bingley,-- give to hear [your]88-elizabeth strictures on [them]3256-all these people ! ”[115-miss bingley,--] “ [Your]88-elizabeth conjecture is totally wrong , [I]98-miss bingley assure [you]88-elizabeth . [My]98-miss bingley mind was more agreeably engaged . [I]98-miss bingley have been meditating on the very great pleasure which a pair of fine eyes in the face of [a pretty woman]3257-a pretty woman can bestow . ”[98-miss bingley] [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley immediately fixed [her]98-miss bingley eyes on [his]426-his face , and desired [he]426-his would tell [her]98-miss bingley what [lady]427-lady had the credit of inspiring such reflections . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy replied , with great intrepidity,-- “ [Miss Elizabeth Bennet]88-elizabeth . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ [Miss Elizabeth Bennet]88-elizabeth ! ”[98-miss bingley] repeated [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley . “ [I]98-miss bingley am all astonishment . How long has [she]88-elizabeth been such a favourite ? and pray when am [I]98-miss bingley to wish [you]88-elizabeth joy ? ”[98-miss bingley] “ That is exactly the question which [I]96-mr. darcy expected [you]88-elizabeth to ask . [A lady]3226-a lady ’s imagination is very rapid ; it jumps from admiration to love , from love to matrimony , in a moment . [I]96-mr. darcy knew [you]88-elizabeth would be wishing [me]96-mr. darcy joy . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ Nay , if [you]88-elizabeth are so serious about it , [I]428-i shall consider the matter as absolutely settled . [You]88-elizabeth will have [a charming mother - in - law]3259-a charming mother - in - law , indeed , and of course [she]3259-a charming mother - in - law will be always at [Pemberley]12-pemberley with [you]88-elizabeth . ”[428-i] [He]428-i listened to [her]98-miss bingley with perfect indifference , while [she]98-miss bingley chose to entertain [herself]98-miss bingley in this manner ; and as [his]428-i composure convinced [her]98-miss bingley that all was safe , [her]98-miss bingley wit flowed along . [ Illustration : “ A note for [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth ”[98-miss bingley] CHAPTER VII . [ Illustration ] [[Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet ’s property]429-mr. bennet ’s property consisted almost entirely in an estate of two thousand a year , which , unfortunately for [[his]81-mr. bennet daughters]430-his daughters , was entailed , in default of [heirs male]431-heirs male , on [a distant relation]432-a distant relation ; and [[their]430-his daughters mother]433-their mother ’s fortune , though ample for [her]433-their mother situation in life , could but ill supply the deficiency of [his]81-mr. bennet . [[Her]98-miss bingley father]249-her father had been [an attorney in [Meryton]9-meryton]435-an attorney in meryton , and had left [her]98-miss bingley four thousand pounds . [She]98-miss bingley had [a sister]436-a sister married to [a Mr. Philips]116-mr. philips , who had been [a clerk to [[their]430-his daughters father]252-their father and succeeded [him]81-mr. bennet in the business , and [a brother]439-a brother settled in [London]5-london in a respectable line of trade]437-a clerk to their father and succeeded him in the business , and a brother settled in london in a respectable line of trade . [The village of Longbourn]440-the village of longbourn was only one mile from [Meryton]9-meryton ; a most convenient distance for [the young ladies , who were usually tempted thither three or four times a week]441-the young ladies , who were usually tempted thither three or four times a week , to pay [their]441-the young ladies , who were usually tempted thither three or four times a week duty to [[their]441-the young ladies , who were usually tempted thither three or four times a week aunt]442-their aunt , and to [[a milliner]443-a milliner ’s shop just over the way]444-a milliner ’s shop just over the way . [The two youngest of [the family]414-the family]445-the two youngest of the family , [Catherine]93-lady catherine and [Lydia]90-lydia , were particularly frequent in these attentions : [their]445-the two youngest of the family minds were more vacant than [[their]445-the two youngest of the family sisters]447-their sisters ’ , and when nothing better offered , a walk to [Meryton]9-meryton was necessary to amuse [their]445-the two youngest of the family morning hours and furnish conversation for the evening ; and , however bare of news [the country]448-the country in general might be , [they]445-the two youngest of the family always contrived to learn some from [[their]445-the two youngest of the family aunt]442-their aunt . At present , indeed , [they]445-the two youngest of the family were well supplied both with news and happiness by the recent arrival of [a militia regiment in [the neighbourhood]3088-the neighbourhood]450-a militia regiment in the neighbourhood ; it was to remain the whole winter , and [Meryton]9-meryton was the head - quarters . [Their]445-the two youngest of the family visits to [Mrs. Philips]117-mrs. philips were now productive of the most interesting intelligence . Every day added something to [their]445-the two youngest of the family knowledge of [the officers]452-the officers ’ names and connections . [[Their]445-the two youngest of the family lodgings]453-their lodgings were not long a secret , and at length [they]445-the two youngest of the family began to know [the officers]452-the officers [themselves]445-the two youngest of the family . [Mr. Philips]116-mr. philips visited [them]445-the two youngest of the family all , and this opened to [[his]116-mr. philips nieces]455-his nieces a source of felicity unknown before . [They]445-the two youngest of the family could talk of nothing but [officers]456-officers ; and [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s large fortune , the mention of which gave animation to [[their]445-the two youngest of the family mother]433-their mother , was worthless in [their]445-the two youngest of the family eyes when opposed to the regimentals of [an ensign]458-an ensign . After listening one morning to [their]445-the two youngest of the family effusions on this subject , [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet coolly observed,-- “ From all that [I]81-mr. bennet can collect by [your]445-the two youngest of the family manner of talking , [you]445-the two youngest of the family must be [two of [the silliest girls in [the country]448-the country]3261-the silliest girls in the country]3260-two of the silliest girls in the country . [I]81-mr. bennet have suspected it some time , but [I]81-mr. bennet am now convinced . ”[81-mr. bennet] [Catherine]93-lady catherine was disconcerted , and made no answer ; but [Lydia]90-lydia , with perfect indifference , continued to express [her]90-lydia admiration of [Captain Carter]118-captain carter , and [her]90-lydia hope of seeing [him]118-captain carter in the course of the day , as [he]118-captain carter was going the next morning to [London]5-london . “ [I]92-mrs. bennet am astonished , [[my]92-mrs. bennet dear]3066-my dear , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , “ that [you]3066-my dear should be so ready to think [[your]3066-my dear own children]3097-your own children silly . If [I]92-mrs. bennet wished to think slightingly of [[anybody]3171-anybody ’s children]3266-anybody ’s children , it should not be of [my]92-mrs. bennet own , however . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ If [[my]90-lydia children]3267-my children are silly , [I]90-lydia must hope to be always sensible of it . ”[90-lydia] “ Yes ; but as it happens , [they]3267-my children are all of [them]3267-my children very clever . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ This is the only point , [I]90-lydia flatter [myself]90-lydia , on which [we]3268-our do not agree . [I]90-lydia had hoped that [our]3268-our sentiments coincided in every particular , but [I]90-lydia must so far differ from [you]3066-my dear as to think [[our]3268-our two youngest daughters]3269-our two youngest daughters uncommonly foolish . ”[90-lydia] “ [[My]90-lydia dear]3066-my dear [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet , [you]3066-my dear must not expect [such girls]3271-such girls to have the sense of [[their]3271-such girls father]252-their father and [mother]3273-mother . When [they]3271-such girls get to [our]3268-our age , [I]90-lydia dare say [they]3271-such girls will not think about [officers]456-officers any more than [we]3268-our do . [I]90-lydia remember the time when [I]90-lydia liked a red coat [myself]90-lydia very well -- and , indeed , so [I]90-lydia do still at [my]90-lydia heart ; and if [a smart young colonel]3275-a smart young colonel , with five or six thousand a year , should want [one of [[my]90-lydia girls]3277-my girls]3276-one of my girls , [I]90-lydia shall not say nay to [him]3275-a smart young colonel ; and [I]90-lydia thought [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster looked very becoming the other night at [Sir William]86-sir william ’s in [[his]113-colonel forster regimentals]3278-his regimentals . ”[90-lydia] “ [Mamma]119-mamma , ”[90-lydia] cried [Lydia]90-lydia , “ [[my]90-lydia aunt]3279-my aunt says that [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster and [Captain Carter]118-captain carter do not go so often to [Miss Watson]120-miss watson ’s as [they]3280-they did when [they]3280-they first came ; [she]3279-my aunt sees [them]3280-they now very often standing in [[Clarke]121-clarke ’s library]3281-clarke ’s library . ”[90-lydia] [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet was prevented replying by the entrance of [the footman]459-the footman with a note for [Miss Bennet]90-lydia ; it came from [Netherfield]2-netherfield , and [the servant]460-the servant waited for an answer . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet ’s eyes sparkled with pleasure , and [she]92-mrs. bennet was eagerly calling out , while [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughter]461-her daughter read,-- “ Well , [Jane]89-jane , who is it from ? What is it about ? What does [he]459-the footman say ? Well , [Jane]89-jane , make haste and tell [us]462-us ; make haste , [[my]92-mrs. bennet love]3127-my love . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ It is from [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , ”[89-jane] said [Jane]89-jane , and then read it aloud . / * NIND “ [[My]92-mrs. bennet dear friend]3283-my dear friend , * / “[92-mrs. bennet] If [you]461-her daughter are not so compassionate as to dine to - day with [Louisa]122-louisa and [me]0-i , [we]462-us shall be in danger of hating [each other]3216-each other for the rest of [our]462-us lives ; for a whole day ’s tête - à - tête between [two women]464-two women can never end without a quarrel . Come as soon as [you]461-her daughter can on the receipt of this . [[My]0-i brother]465-my brother and [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen are to dine with [the officers]452-the officers . [Yours]461-her daughter ever , “ [CAROLINE BINGLEY]123-caroline . ”[461-her daughter] “ With [the officers]452-the officers ! ”[90-lydia] cried [Lydia]90-lydia : “ [I]90-lydia wonder [[my]90-lydia aunt]3279-my aunt did not tell [us]462-us of that . ”[90-lydia] “ Dining out , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet ; “ that is very unlucky . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ Can [I]89-jane have [the carriage]3286-the carriage ? ”[89-jane] said [Jane]89-jane . “ No , [[my]89-jane dear]3066-my dear , [you]3066-my dear had better go on horseback , because it seems likely to rain ; and then [you]3066-my dear must stay all night . ”[89-jane] “ That would be a good scheme , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ if [you]3066-my dear were sure that [they]452-the officers would not offer to send [her]3279-my aunt [home]3288-home . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Oh , but [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen will have [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s chaise to go to [Meryton]9-meryton ; and [the Hursts]124-the hursts have no horses to [theirs]124-the hursts . ”[89-jane] “ [I]89-jane had much rather go in [the coach]3290-the coach . ”[89-jane] “ But , [[my]89-jane dear]3066-my dear , [[your]3066-my dear father]3292-your father can not spare the horses , [I]89-jane am sure . [They]452-the officers are wanted in [the farm]3293-the farm , [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet , are not [they]452-the officers ? ”[89-jane] [ [Illustration]110-illustration : Cheerful prognostics ] “ [They]452-the officers are wanted in [the farm]3293-the farm much oftener than [I]89-jane can get [them]452-the officers . ”[89-jane] “ But if [you]3066-my dear have got [them]452-the officers to - day , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ [[my]88-elizabeth mother]3295-my mother ’s purpose will be answered . ”[88-elizabeth] [She]88-elizabeth did at last extort from [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father an acknowledgment that the horses were engaged ; [Jane]89-jane was therefore obliged to go on horseback , and [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother attended [her]88-elizabeth to the door with many cheerful prognostics of a bad day . [Her]88-elizabeth hopes were answered ; [Jane]89-jane had not been gone long before it rained hard . [[Her]88-elizabeth sisters]3096-her sisters were uneasy for [her]88-elizabeth , but [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother was delighted . The rain continued the whole evening without intermission ; [Jane]89-jane certainly could not come back . “ This was a lucky idea of [mine]92-mrs. bennet , indeed ! ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , more than once , as if the credit of making it rain were all [her]92-mrs. bennet own . Till the next morning , however , [she]92-mrs. bennet was not aware of all the felicity of [her]92-mrs. bennet contrivance . Breakfast was scarcely over when [a servant from [Netherfield]2-netherfield]472-a servant from netherfield brought the following note for [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth - / * NIND “ [[My]0-i dearest]3296-my dearest [Lizzie]88-elizabeth , * / “[0-i] [I]0-i find [myself]0-i very unwell this morning , which , [I]0-i suppose , is to be imputed to [my]0-i getting wet through yesterday . [[My]0-i kind friends]473-my kind friends will not hear of [my]0-i returning [home]3288-home till [I]0-i am better . [They]473-my kind friends insist also on [my]0-i seeing [Mr. Jones]125-mr. jones -- therefore do not be alarmed if [you]88-elizabeth should hear of [his]125-mr. jones having been to [me]0-i -- and , excepting a sore throat and a headache , there is not much the matter with [me]0-i . “ [Yours]88-elizabeth , etc . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ Well , [[my]81-mr. bennet dear]3066-my dear , ”[81-mr. bennet] said [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet , when [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had read the note aloud , “ if [[your]88-elizabeth daughter]3298-your daughter should have a dangerous fit of illness -- if [she]3298-your daughter should die -- it would be a comfort to know that it was all in pursuit of [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , and under [your]88-elizabeth orders . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ Oh , [I]88-elizabeth am not at all afraid of [her]3298-your daughter dying . [People]3299-people do not die of little trifling colds . [She]3298-your daughter will be taken good care of . As long as [she]3298-your daughter stays [there]306-there , it is all very well . [I]88-elizabeth would go and see [her]3298-your daughter if [I]88-elizabeth could have [the carriage]3286-the carriage . ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , feeling really anxious , determined to go to [her]88-elizabeth , though [the carriage]3286-the carriage was not to be had : and as [she]88-elizabeth was [no horsewoman]476-no horsewoman , walking was [her]88-elizabeth only alternative . [She]88-elizabeth declared [her]88-elizabeth resolution . “ How can [you]88-elizabeth be so silly , ”[88-elizabeth] cried [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother , “ as to think of such a thing , in all this dirt ! [You]88-elizabeth will not be fit to be seen when [you]88-elizabeth get [there]306-there . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]246-her mother shall be very fit to see [Jane]89-jane -- which is all [I]246-her mother want . ”[246-her mother] “ Is this a hint to [me]249-her father , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , ”[249-her father] said [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father , “ to send for the horses ? ”[249-her father] “ No , indeed . [I]246-her mother do not wish to avoid the walk . The distance is nothing , when [one]3113-one has a motive ; only three miles . [I]246-her mother shall be back by dinner . ”[246-her mother] “ [I]94-mary admire the activity of [your]88-elizabeth benevolence , ”[94-mary] observed [Mary]94-mary , “ but every impulse of feeling should be guided by reason ; and , in [my]94-mary opinion , exertion should always be in proportion to what is required . ”[94-mary] “ [We]479-we will go as far as [Meryton]9-meryton with [you]88-elizabeth , ”[93-lady catherine] said [Catherine]93-lady catherine and [Lydia]90-lydia .
