[Elizabeth]88-elizabeth accepted [their]479-we company , and [the three young ladies]480-the three young ladies set off together . “ If [we]479-we make haste , ”[90-lydia] said [Lydia]90-lydia , as [they]479-we walked along , “ perhaps [we]479-we may see something of [Captain Carter]118-captain carter , before [he]118-captain carter goes . ”[90-lydia] In [Meryton]9-meryton [they]479-we parted : [the two youngest]481-the two youngest repaired to [the lodgings of [one of [the officers]452-the officers ’ wives]483-one of the officers ’ wives]482-the lodgings of one of the officers ’ wives , and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth continued [her]88-elizabeth walk alone , crossing [field]485-field after [field]485-field at a quick pace , jumping over stiles and springing over puddles , with impatient activity , and finding [herself]88-elizabeth at last within view of [the house]3075-the house , with weary ancles , dirty stockings , and a face glowing with the warmth of exercise . [She]88-elizabeth was shown into [the breakfast parlour]488-the breakfast parlour , where all but [Jane]89-jane were assembled , and where [her]88-elizabeth appearance created a great deal of surprise . That [she]88-elizabeth should have walked three miles so early in the day in such dirty weather , and by [herself]88-elizabeth , was almost incredible to [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst and [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was convinced that [they]479-we held [her]88-elizabeth in contempt for it . [She]88-elizabeth was received , however , very politely by [them]479-we ; and in [[their]479-we brother]338-their brother ’s manners there was something better than politeness -- there was good - humour and kindness . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy said very little , and [Mr. Hurst]95-mr. hurst nothing at all . [The former]327-the former was divided between admiration of the brilliancy which exercise had given to [her]88-elizabeth complexion and doubt as to the occasion ’s justifying [her]88-elizabeth coming so far alone . [The latter]491-the latter was thinking only of [his]491-the latter breakfast . [Her]88-elizabeth inquiries after [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister were not very favourably answered . [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth had slept ill , and though up , was very feverish , and not well enough to leave [[her]88-elizabeth room]493-her room . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was glad to be taken to [her]88-elizabeth immediately ; and [Jane]89-jane , who had only [been withheld by the fear of giving alarm or inconvenience]494-been withheld by the fear of giving alarm or inconvenience , from expressing in [her]89-jane note how much [she]89-jane longed for such a visit , was delighted at [her]89-jane entrance . [She]89-jane was not equal , however , to much conversation ; and when [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley left [them]495-they together , could attempt little beside expressions of gratitude for the extraordinary kindness [she]89-jane was treated with . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth silently attended [her]89-jane . When breakfast was over , [they]495-they were joined by [the sisters]496-the sisters ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth began to like [them]496-the sisters [herself]88-elizabeth , when [she]88-elizabeth saw how much affection and solicitude [they]496-the sisters showed for [Jane]89-jane . [The apothecary]497-the apothecary came ; and having examined [[his]497-the apothecary patient]498-his patient , said , as might be supposed , that [she]498-his patient had caught a violent cold , and that [they]495-they must endeavour to get the better of it ; advised [her]498-his patient to return to bed , and promised [her]498-his patient some draughts . The advice was followed readily , for the feverish symptoms increased , and [her]498-his patient head ached acutely . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth did not quit [[her]88-elizabeth room]493-her room for a moment , nor were [the other ladies]500-the other ladies often absent ; [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen being out , [they]292-the gentlemen had in fact nothing to do elsewhere . When the clock struck three , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth felt that [she]88-elizabeth must go , and very unwillingly said so . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley offered [her]88-elizabeth [the carriage]3286-the carriage , and [she]88-elizabeth only wanted a little pressing to accept it , when [Jane]89-jane testified such concern at parting with [her]88-elizabeth that [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley was obliged to convert the offer of the chaise into an invitation to remain at [Netherfield]2-netherfield for the present . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth most thankfully consented , and [a servant]503-a servant was despatched to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , to acquaint [the family]414-the family with [her]88-elizabeth stay , and bring back a supply of clothes . [ Illustration : “ [The Apothecary]497-the apothecary came ”[503-a servant] ] [ Illustration : “ covering a screen ”[503-a servant] ] CHAPTER VIII . [ Illustration ] At five o’clock [the two ladies]505-the two ladies retired to dress , and at half - past six [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was summoned to dinner . To the civil inquiries which then poured in , and amongst which [she]88-elizabeth had the pleasure of distinguishing the much superior solicitude of [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , [she]88-elizabeth could not make a very favourable answer . [Jane]89-jane was by no means better . [The sisters]496-the sisters , on hearing this , repeated three or four times how much [they]496-the sisters were grieved , how shocking it was to have a bad cold , and how excessively [they]496-the sisters disliked being ill [themselves]496-the sisters ; and then thought no more of the matter : and [their]496-the sisters indifference towards [Jane]89-jane , when not immediately before [them]496-the sisters , restored [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth to the enjoyment of all [her]88-elizabeth original dislike . [[Their]496-the sisters brother]338-their brother , indeed , was [the only one of the party whom [she]88-elizabeth could regard with any complacency]508-the only one of the party whom she could regard with any complacency . [His]338-their brother anxiety for [Jane]89-jane was evident , and [his]338-their brother attentions to [herself]89-jane most pleasing ; and [they]509-they prevented [her]88-elizabeth feeling [herself]88-elizabeth so much [an intruder]510-an intruder as [she]88-elizabeth believed [she]88-elizabeth was considered by [the others]511-the others . [She]88-elizabeth had very little notice from any but [him]338-their brother . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley was engrossed by [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , [[her]98-miss bingley sister]328-her sister scarcely less so ; and as for [Mr. Hurst]95-mr. hurst , by whom [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth sat , [he]95-mr. hurst was [an indolent man , who lived only to eat , drink , and play at cards]513-an indolent man , who lived only to eat , drink , and play at cards , who , when [he]95-mr. hurst found [her]88-elizabeth prefer a plain dish to a ragout , had nothing to say to [her]88-elizabeth . When dinner was over , [she]88-elizabeth returned directly to [Jane]89-jane , and [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley began abusing [her]88-elizabeth as soon as [she]88-elizabeth was out of [the room]255-the room . [Her]88-elizabeth manners were pronounced to be very bad indeed,--a mixture of pride and impertinence : [she]88-elizabeth had no conversation , no style , no taste , no beauty . [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst thought the same , and added,-- “ [She]88-elizabeth has nothing , in short , to recommend [her]88-elizabeth , but being [an excellent walker]3305-an excellent walker . [I]97-mrs. hurst shall never forget [her]88-elizabeth appearance this morning . [She]88-elizabeth really looked almost wild . ”[97-mrs. hurst] “ [She]88-elizabeth did indeed , [Louisa]122-louisa . [I]97-mrs. hurst could hardly keep [my]97-mrs. hurst countenance . Very nonsensical to come at all ! Why must [she]88-elizabeth be scampering about [the country]448-the country , because [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister had a cold ? [Her]88-elizabeth hair so untidy , so blowzy ! ”[97-mrs. hurst] “ Yes , and [her]88-elizabeth petticoat ; [I]97-mrs. hurst hope [you]122-louisa saw [her]88-elizabeth petticoat , six inches deep in mud , [I]97-mrs. hurst am absolutely certain , and the gown which had been let down to hide it not doing its office . ”[97-mrs. hurst] “ [Your]122-louisa picture may be very exact , [Louisa]122-louisa , ”[98-miss bingley] said [Bingley]98-miss bingley ; “ but this was all lost upon [me]98-miss bingley . [I]98-miss bingley thought [Miss Elizabeth Bennet]88-elizabeth looked remarkably well when [she]88-elizabeth came into [the room]255-the room this morning . [Her]88-elizabeth dirty petticoat quite escaped [my]98-miss bingley notice . ”[98-miss bingley] “ [You]122-louisa observed it , [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , [I]98-miss bingley am sure , ”[98-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ; “ and [I]98-miss bingley am inclined to think that [you]96-mr. darcy would not wish to see [[your]96-mr. darcy sister]3211-your sister make such an exhibition . ”[98-miss bingley] “ Certainly not . ”[98-miss bingley] “ To walk three miles , or four miles , or five miles , or whatever it is , above [her]88-elizabeth ancles in dirt , and alone , quite alone ! what could [she]88-elizabeth mean by it ? It seems to [me]98-miss bingley to show an abominable sort of conceited independence , a most country - town indifference to decorum . ”[98-miss bingley] “ It shows an affection for [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister that is very pleasing , ”[98-miss bingley] said [Bingley]98-miss bingley . “ [I]98-miss bingley am afraid , [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , ”[98-miss bingley] observed [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , in a half whisper , “ that this adventure has rather affected [your]96-mr. darcy admiration of [her]88-elizabeth fine eyes . ”[98-miss bingley] “ Not at all , ”[515-he] [he]515-he replied : “ they were brightened by the exercise . ”[515-he] A short pause followed this speech , and [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst began again,-- “ [I]97-mrs. hurst have an excessive regard for [Jane Bennet,--she]89-jane is really [a very sweet girl,--and]3311-a very sweet girl,--and [I]97-mrs. hurst wish with all [my]97-mrs. hurst heart [she]89-jane were well settled . But with such [a father]3312-a father and [mother]3273-mother , and such low connections , [I]97-mrs. hurst am afraid there is no chance of it . ”[97-mrs. hurst] “ [I]97-mrs. hurst think [I]97-mrs. hurst have heard [you]97-mrs. hurst say that [[their]517-they uncle]3314-their uncle is [an attorney in [Meryton]9-meryton]435-an attorney in meryton ? ”[97-mrs. hurst] “ Yes ; and [they]517-they have another , who lives somewhere near [Cheapside]13-cheapside . ”[97-mrs. hurst] “ That is capital , ”[328-her sister] added [[her]97-mrs. hurst sister]328-her sister ; and [they]517-they both laughed heartily . “ If [they]517-they had [uncles]3316-uncles enough to fill all [Cheapside]13-cheapside , ”[98-miss bingley] cried [Bingley]98-miss bingley , “ it would not make [them]517-they one jot less agreeable . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ But it must very materially lessen [their]517-they chance of marrying [men of any consideration]3317-men of any consideration in [the world]304-the world , ”[96-mr. darcy] replied [Darcy]96-mr. darcy . To this speech [Bingley]98-miss bingley made no answer ; but [[his]518-his sisters]284-his sisters gave it [their]284-his sisters hearty assent , and indulged [their]284-his sisters mirth for some time at the expense of [[their]284-his sisters dear friend]520-their dear friend ’s vulgar relations . With a renewal of tenderness , however , [they]284-his sisters repaired to [[her]97-mrs. hurst room]493-her room on leaving [the dining - parlour]522-the dining - parlour , and sat with [her]97-mrs. hurst till summoned to coffee . [She]97-mrs. hurst was still very poorly , and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth would not quit [her]97-mrs. hurst at all , till late in the evening , when [she]88-elizabeth had the comfort of seeing [her]97-mrs. hurst asleep , and when it appeared to [her]88-elizabeth rather right than pleasant that [she]88-elizabeth should go down [stairs]523-stairs [herself]88-elizabeth . On entering [the drawing - room]524-the drawing - room , [she]88-elizabeth found [the whole party]525-the whole party at loo , and was immediately invited to join [them]525-the whole party ; but suspecting [them]525-the whole party to be playing high , [she]88-elizabeth declined it , and making [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister the excuse , said [she]88-elizabeth would amuse [herself]88-elizabeth , for the short time [she]88-elizabeth could stay below , with a book . [Mr. Hurst]95-mr. hurst looked at [her]88-elizabeth with astonishment . “ Do [you]88-elizabeth prefer reading to cards ? ”[95-mr. hurst] said [he]95-mr. hurst ; “ that is rather singular . ”[95-mr. hurst] “ [Miss Eliza Bennet]88-elizabeth , ”[98-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , “ despises cards . [She]88-elizabeth is [a great reader]3319-a great reader , and has no pleasure in anything else . ”[98-miss bingley] “ [I]88-elizabeth deserve neither such praise nor such censure , ”[88-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; “ [I]88-elizabeth am not [a great reader]3319-a great reader , and [I]88-elizabeth have pleasure in many things . ”[88-elizabeth] “ In nursing [[your]88-elizabeth sister]3211-your sister [I]98-miss bingley am sure [you]88-elizabeth have pleasure , ”[98-miss bingley] said [Bingley]98-miss bingley ; “ and [I]98-miss bingley hope it will soon be increased by seeing [her]3211-your sister quite well . ”[98-miss bingley] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth thanked [him]95-mr. hurst from [her]88-elizabeth heart , and then walked towards a table where a few books were lying . [He]95-mr. hurst immediately offered to fetch [her]88-elizabeth others ; all that [[his]95-mr. hurst library]263-his library afforded . “ And [I]95-mr. hurst wish [my]95-mr. hurst collection were larger for [your]88-elizabeth benefit and [my]95-mr. hurst own credit ; but [I]95-mr. hurst am [an idle fellow]3322-an idle fellow ; and though [I]95-mr. hurst have not many , [I]95-mr. hurst have more than [I]95-mr. hurst ever looked into . ”[95-mr. hurst] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth assured [him]95-mr. hurst that [she]88-elizabeth could suit [herself]88-elizabeth perfectly with those in [the room]255-the room . “ [I]98-miss bingley am astonished , ”[98-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , “ that [[my]98-miss bingley father]3323-my father should have left so small a collection of books . What [a delightful library [you]88-elizabeth have at [Pemberley]12-pemberley]3324-a delightful library you have at pemberley , [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ! ”[98-miss bingley] “ It ought to be good , ”[95-mr. hurst] [he]95-mr. hurst replied : “ it has been the work of many generations . ”[95-mr. hurst] “ And then [you]88-elizabeth have added so much to it [yourself]88-elizabeth -- [you]88-elizabeth are always buying books . ”[98-miss bingley] “ [I]98-miss bingley can not comprehend the neglect of a family library in such days as these . ”[98-miss bingley] “ Neglect ! [I]95-mr. hurst am sure [you]88-elizabeth neglect nothing that can add to the beauties of [that noble place]3325-that noble place . [Charles]126-charles , when [you]88-elizabeth build [[your]88-elizabeth house]3326-your house , [I]95-mr. hurst wish it may be half as delightful as [Pemberley]12-pemberley . ”[95-mr. hurst] “ [I]98-miss bingley wish it may . ”[98-miss bingley] “ But [I]98-miss bingley would really advise [you]88-elizabeth to make [your]88-elizabeth purchase in [that neighbourhood]3327-that neighbourhood , and take [Pemberley]12-pemberley for a kind of model . There is [not a finer county in [England]3-england]3328-not a finer county in england than [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire . ”[98-miss bingley] “ With all [my]95-mr. hurst heart : [I]95-mr. hurst will buy [Pemberley]12-pemberley itself , if [Darcy]96-mr. darcy will sell it . ”[95-mr. hurst] “ [I]98-miss bingley am talking of possibilities , [Charles]126-charles . ”[98-miss bingley] “ Upon [my]95-mr. hurst word , [Caroline]123-caroline , [I]95-mr. hurst should think it more possible to get [Pemberley]12-pemberley by purchase than by imitation . ”[95-mr. hurst] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was so much caught by what passed , as to leave [her]88-elizabeth very little attention for [her]88-elizabeth book ; and , soon laying it wholly aside , [she]88-elizabeth drew near the card - table , and stationed [herself]88-elizabeth between [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley and [[his]85-mr. bingley eldest sister]529-his eldest sister , to observe the game . “ Is [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy much grown since the spring ? ”[98-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley : “ will [she]128-miss darcy be as tall as [I]98-miss bingley am ? ”[98-miss bingley] “ [I]98-miss bingley think [she]128-miss darcy will . [She]128-miss darcy is now about [Miss Elizabeth Bennet]88-elizabeth ’s height , or rather taller . ”[98-miss bingley] “ How [I]98-miss bingley long to see [her]128-miss darcy again ! [I]98-miss bingley never met with anybody who delighted [me]98-miss bingley so much . Such a countenance , such manners , and so extremely accomplished for [her]128-miss darcy age ! [Her]128-miss darcy performance on the pianoforte is exquisite . ”[98-miss bingley] “ It is amazing to [me]85-mr. bingley , ”[85-mr. bingley] said [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , “ how [young ladies]3329-young ladies can have patience to be so very accomplished as [they]3329-young ladies all are . ”[85-mr. bingley] “ [All young ladies]3330-all young ladies accomplished ! [[My]98-miss bingley dear]3066-my dear [Charles]126-charles , what do [you]126-charles mean ? ”[98-miss bingley] “ Yes , all of [them]3330-all young ladies , [I]98-miss bingley think . [They]3330-all young ladies all paint tables , cover screens , and net purses . [I]98-miss bingley scarcely know [any one who can not do all this]3332-any one who can not do all this ; and [I]98-miss bingley am sure [I]98-miss bingley never heard [a young lady]3333-a young lady spoken of for the first time , without being informed that [she]3333-a young lady was very accomplished . ”[98-miss bingley] “ [Your]85-mr. bingley list of the common extent of accomplishments , ”[128-miss darcy] said [Darcy]128-miss darcy , “ has too much truth . The word is applied to many [a woman who deserves it no otherwise than by netting a purse or covering a screen]3334-a woman who deserves it no otherwise than by netting a purse or covering a screen ; but [I]128-miss darcy am very far from agreeing with [you]85-mr. bingley in [your]85-mr. bingley estimation of ladies in general . [I]128-miss darcy can not boast of knowing more than half - a - dozen in the whole range of [my]128-miss darcy acquaintance that are really accomplished . ”[128-miss darcy] “ Nor [I]98-miss bingley , [I]98-miss bingley am sure , ”[98-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley . “ Then , ”[88-elizabeth] observed [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ [you]85-mr. bingley must comprehend a great deal in [your]85-mr. bingley idea of [an accomplished woman]3335-an accomplished woman . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Yes ; [I]128-miss darcy do comprehend a great deal in it . ”[128-miss darcy] “ Oh , certainly , ”[531-his faithful assistant] cried [[his]530-his faithful assistant]531-his faithful assistant , “ [no one]3336-no one can be really esteemed accomplished who does not greatly surpass what is usually met with . [A woman]3084-a woman must have a thorough knowledge of music , singing , drawing , dancing , and the modern languages , to deserve the word ; and , besides all this , [she]3084-a woman must possess a certain something in [her]3084-a woman air and manner of walking , the tone of [her]3084-a woman voice , [her]3084-a woman address and expressions , or the word will be but half deserved . ”[531-his faithful assistant] “ All this [she]3084-a woman must possess , ”[128-miss darcy] added [Darcy]128-miss darcy ; “ and to all [she]3084-a woman must yet add something more substantial in the improvement of [her]3084-a woman mind by extensive reading . ”[128-miss darcy] “ [I]531-his faithful assistant am no longer surprised at [your]85-mr. bingley knowing only [six accomplished women]3338-six accomplished women . [I]531-his faithful assistant rather wonder now at [your]85-mr. bingley knowing any . ”[531-his faithful assistant] “ Are [you]85-mr. bingley so severe upon [your]85-mr. bingley own sex as to doubt the possibility of all this ? ”[128-miss darcy] “ [I]531-his faithful assistant never saw [such a woman]3339-such a woman . [I]531-his faithful assistant never saw such capacity , and taste , and application , and elegance , as [you]85-mr. bingley describe , united . ”[531-his faithful assistant] [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst and [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley both cried out against the injustice of [her]98-miss bingley implied doubt , and were both protesting that [they]532-them knew [many women who answered this description]533-many women who answered this description , when [Mr. Hurst]95-mr. hurst called [them]532-them to order , with bitter complaints of [their]532-them inattention to what was going forward . As all conversation was thereby at an end , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth soon afterwards left [the room]255-the room . “ [Eliza Bennet]88-elizabeth , ”[98-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , when the door was closed on [her]98-miss bingley , “ is one of [those young ladies who seek to recommend [themselves]3340-those young ladies who seek to recommend themselves to the other sex by undervaluing their own to the other sex by undervaluing [their]3340-those young ladies who seek to recommend themselves to the other sex by undervaluing their own own]3340-those young ladies who seek to recommend themselves to the other sex by undervaluing their own ; and with [many men]3341-many men , [I]98-miss bingley daresay , it succeeds ; but , in [my]98-miss bingley opinion , it is a paltry device , a very mean art . ”[98-miss bingley] “ Undoubtedly , ”[128-miss darcy] replied [Darcy]128-miss darcy , to whom this remark was chiefly addressed , “ there is meanness in all the arts which [ladies]275-ladies sometimes condescend to employ for captivation . Whatever bears affinity to cunning is despicable . ”[128-miss darcy] [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley was not so entirely satisfied with this reply as to continue the subject . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth joined [them]532-them again only to say that [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister was worse , and that [she]88-elizabeth could not leave [her]88-elizabeth . [Bingley]98-miss bingley urged [Mr. Jones]125-mr. jones ’s being sent for immediately ; while [[his]125-mr. jones sisters]284-his sisters , convinced that no country advice could be of any service , recommended an express to [town]268-town for [one of [the most eminent physicians]539-the most eminent physicians]538-one of the most eminent physicians . This [she]88-elizabeth would not hear of ; but [she]88-elizabeth was not so unwilling to comply with [[their]532-them brother]338-their brother ’s proposal ; and it was settled that [Mr. Jones]125-mr. jones should be sent for early in the morning , if [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth were not decidedly better . [Bingley]98-miss bingley was quite uncomfortable ; [[his]125-mr. jones sisters]284-his sisters declared that [they]284-his sisters were miserable . [They]284-his sisters solaced [their]284-his sisters wretchedness , however , by duets after supper ; while [he]125-mr. jones could find no better relief to [his]125-mr. jones feelings than by giving [[his]125-mr. jones housekeeper]542-his housekeeper directions that every possible attention might be paid to [the sick lady]543-the sick lady and [[her]543-the sick lady sister]328-her sister . [ Illustration : [M^{rs } Bennet]91-m^{rs and [[her]543-the sick lady two youngest girls]545-her two youngest girls CHAPTER IX . [ Illustration ] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth passed [the chief of the night]546-the chief of the night in [[[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ’s room]548-her sister ’s room , and in the morning had the pleasure of being able to send a tolerable answer to the inquiries which [she]88-elizabeth very early received from [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley by [a housemaid]549-a housemaid , and some time afterwards from [the two elegant ladies who waited on [[his]125-mr. jones sisters]284-his sisters]550-the two elegant ladies who waited on his sisters . In spite of this amendment , however , [she]88-elizabeth requested to have a note sent to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , desiring [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother to visit [Jane]89-jane , and form [her]88-elizabeth own judgment of [her]88-elizabeth situation . The note was immediately despatched , and its contents as quickly complied with . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , accompanied by [[her]92-mrs. bennet two youngest girls]545-her two youngest girls , reached [Netherfield]2-netherfield soon after the family breakfast . Had [she]92-mrs. bennet found [Jane]89-jane in any apparent danger , [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet would have been very miserable ; but being satisfied on seeing [her]89-jane that [her]89-jane illness was not alarming , [she]92-mrs. bennet had no wish of [her]89-jane recovering immediately , as [her]89-jane restoration to health would probably remove [her]89-jane from [Netherfield]2-netherfield . [She]92-mrs. bennet would not listen , therefore , to [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughter]461-her daughter ’s proposal of being carried [home]3288-home ; neither did [the apothecary , who arrived about the same time]556-the apothecary , who arrived about the same time , think it at all advisable . After sitting a little while with [Jane]89-jane , on [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s appearance and invitation , [the mother]393-the mother and [three daughters]558-three daughters all attended [her]92-mrs. bennet into [the breakfast parlour]488-the breakfast parlour . [Bingley]98-miss bingley met [them]558-three daughters with hopes that [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet had not found [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth worse than [she]92-mrs. bennet expected . “ Indeed [I]92-mrs. bennet have , [sir]3234-sir , ”[92-mrs. bennet] was [her]92-mrs. bennet answer . “ [She]88-elizabeth is a great deal too ill to be moved . [Mr. Jones]125-mr. jones says [we]3344-we must not think of moving [her]88-elizabeth . [We]3344-we must trespass a little longer on [your]92-mrs. bennet kindness . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ Removed ! ”[98-miss bingley] cried [Bingley]98-miss bingley . “ It must not be thought of . [[My]98-miss bingley sister]3345-my sister , [I]98-miss bingley am sure , will not hear of [her]88-elizabeth removal . ”[98-miss bingley] “ [You]98-miss bingley may depend upon it , [madam]3346-madam , ”[98-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , with cold civility , “ that [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth shall receive every possible attention while [she]88-elizabeth remains with [us]3344-we . ”[98-miss bingley] [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet was profuse in [her]92-mrs. bennet acknowledgments . “ [I]92-mrs. bennet am sure , ”[92-mrs. bennet] [she]92-mrs. bennet added , “ if it was not for [such good friends]3347-such good friends , [I]92-mrs. bennet do not know what would become of [her]88-elizabeth , for [she]88-elizabeth is very ill indeed , and suffers a vast deal , though with the greatest patience in [the world]304-the world , which is always the way with [her]88-elizabeth , for [she]88-elizabeth has , without exception , the sweetest temper [I]92-mrs. bennet ever met with . [I]92-mrs. bennet often tell [[my]92-mrs. bennet other girls]3349-my other girls [they]3349-my other girls are nothing to [her]88-elizabeth . [You]3350-you have [a sweet room]3351-a sweet room [here]3067-here , [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , and a charming prospect over [that gravel walk]3353-that gravel walk . [I]92-mrs. bennet do not know [a place in [the country]448-the country that is equal to [Netherfield]2-netherfield]3354-a place in the country that is equal to netherfield . [You]3350-you will not think of quitting it in a hurry , [I]92-mrs. bennet hope , though [you]3350-you have but a short lease . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ Whatever [I]560-i do is done in a hurry , ”[560-i] replied [he]560-i ; “ and therefore if [I]560-i should resolve to quit [Netherfield]2-netherfield , [I]560-i should probably be off in five minutes . At present , however , [I]560-i consider [myself]560-i as quite fixed here . ”[560-i] “ That is exactly what [I]88-elizabeth should have supposed of [you]560-i , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ [You]88-elizabeth begin to comprehend [me]560-i , do [you]88-elizabeth ? ”[560-i] cried [he]560-i , turning towards [her]88-elizabeth . “ Oh yes -- [I]560-i understand [you]88-elizabeth perfectly . ”[560-i] “ [I]560-i wish [I]560-i might take this for a compliment ; but to be so easily seen through , [I]560-i am afraid , is pitiful . ”[560-i] “ That is as it happens . It does not necessarily follow that a deep , intricate character is more or less estimable than such a one as [yours]88-elizabeth . ”[246-her mother] “ [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , ”[246-her mother] cried [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother , “ remember where [you]88-elizabeth are , and do not run on in the wild manner that [you]88-elizabeth are suffered to do at [home]3288-home . ”[246-her mother] “ [I]85-mr. bingley did not know before , ”[85-mr. bingley] continued [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , immediately , “ that [you]88-elizabeth were [a studier of character]3357-a studier of character . It must be an amusing study . ”[85-mr. bingley] “ Yes ; but [intricate characters]3358-intricate characters are the most amusing . [They]3358-intricate characters have at least that advantage . ”[246-her mother] “ [The country]448-the country , ”[128-miss darcy] said [Darcy]128-miss darcy , “ can in general supply but few subjects for such a study . In [a country neighbourhood]3360-a country neighbourhood [you]88-elizabeth move in a very confined and unvarying society . ”[128-miss darcy] “ But [people]3299-people [themselves]3299-people alter so much , that there is something new to be observed in [them]3299-people for ever . ”[246-her mother] “ Yes , indeed , ”[92-mrs. bennet] cried [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , offended by [his]85-mr. bingley manner of mentioning [a country neighbourhood]3360-a country neighbourhood . “ [I]246-her mother assure [you]88-elizabeth there is quite as much of that going on in [the country]448-the country as in [town]268-town . ”[246-her mother] [Everybody]305-everybody was surprised ; and [Darcy]128-miss darcy , after looking at [her]92-mrs. bennet for a moment , turned silently away . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , who fancied [she]92-mrs. bennet had gained a complete victory over [him]85-mr. bingley , continued [her]92-mrs. bennet triumph,-- “ [I]92-mrs. bennet can not see that [London]5-london has any great advantage over [the country]448-the country , for [my]92-mrs. bennet part , except [the shops]3365-the shops and [public places]3366-public places . [The country]448-the country is a vast deal pleasanter , is not it , [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ? ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ When [I]85-mr. bingley am in [the country]448-the country , ”[85-mr. bingley] [he]85-mr. bingley replied , “ [I]85-mr. bingley never wish to leave it ; and when [I]85-mr. bingley am in [town]268-town , it is pretty much the same . [They]3370-they have each [their]3370-they advantages , and [I]85-mr. bingley can be equally happy in either . ”[85-mr. bingley] “ Ay , that is because [you]85-mr. bingley have the right disposition . But [that gentleman]3371-that gentleman , ”[92-mrs. bennet] looking at [Darcy]128-miss darcy , “ seemed to think [the country]448-the country was nothing at all . ”[128-miss darcy] “ Indeed , [mamma]3106-mamma , [you]3106-mamma are mistaken , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , blushing for [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother . “ [You]3106-mamma quite mistook [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy . [He]96-mr. darcy only meant that there was not such a variety of [people]3299-people to be met with in [the country]448-the country as in [town]268-town , which [you]88-elizabeth must acknowledge to be true . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Certainly , [[my]246-her mother dear]3066-my dear , [nobody]3152-nobody said there were ; but as to not meeting with [many people in [this neighbourhood]3380-this neighbourhood]3379-many people in this neighbourhood , [I]246-her mother believe there are few neighbourhoods larger . [I]246-her mother know [we]3381-we dine with [four - and - twenty families]3382-four - and - twenty families . ”[246-her mother] Nothing but concern for [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth could enable [Bingley]85-mr. bingley to keep [his]85-mr. bingley countenance . [[His]85-mr. bingley sister]565-his sister was less delicate , and directed [her]565-his sister eye towards [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy with a very expressive smile . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , for the sake of saying something that might turn [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother ’s thoughts , now asked [her]246-her mother if [Charlotte Lucas]107-charlotte had been at [Longbourn]7-longbourn since [her]107-charlotte coming away . “ Yes , [she]107-charlotte called yesterday with [[her]107-charlotte father]249-her father . What [an agreeable man]3384-an agreeable man [Sir William]86-sir william is , [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley -- is not [he]86-sir william ? so much [the man of fashion]3385-the man of fashion ! so genteel and so easy ! [He]86-sir william has always something to say to [everybody]305-everybody . That is [my]107-charlotte idea of good breeding ; and [those persons who fancy [themselves]3387-those persons who fancy themselves very important and never open their mouths very important and never open [their]3387-those persons who fancy themselves very important and never open their mouths mouths]3387-those persons who fancy themselves very important and never open their mouths quite mistake the matter . ”[107-charlotte] “ Did [Charlotte]107-charlotte dine with [you]85-mr. bingley ? ”[565-his sister] “ No , [she]107-charlotte would go [home]3288-home . [I]107-charlotte fancy [she]107-charlotte was wanted about the mince - pies . For [my]107-charlotte part , [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , [I]107-charlotte always keep servants that can do [their]3387-those persons who fancy themselves very important and never open their mouths own work ; [[my]107-charlotte daughters]3130-my daughters are brought up differently . But [everybody]305-everybody is to judge for [themselves]305-everybody , and [the Lucases]106-the lucases are [a very good sort of girls]3391-a very good sort of girls , [I]107-charlotte assure [you]85-mr. bingley . It is a pity [they]106-the lucases are not handsome ! Not that [I]107-charlotte think [Charlotte]107-charlotte so very plain ; but then [she]107-charlotte is [[our]3392-our particular friend]3393-our particular friend . ”[107-charlotte] “ [She]107-charlotte seems [a very pleasant young woman]3394-a very pleasant young woman , ”[85-mr. bingley] said [Bingley]85-mr. bingley . “ Oh dear , yes ; but [you]85-mr. bingley must own [she]107-charlotte is very plain . [Lady Lucas]87-lady lucas [herself]87-lady lucas has often said so , and envied [me]85-mr. bingley [Jane]89-jane ’s beauty . [I]85-mr. bingley do not like to boast of [[my]85-mr. bingley own child]3395-my own child ; but to be sure , [Jane]89-jane -- [one]3113-one does not often see [anybody]3171-anybody better looking . It is what [everybody]305-everybody says . [I]85-mr. bingley do not trust [my]85-mr. bingley own partiality . When [she]89-jane was only fifteen there was [a gentleman at [[my]85-mr. bingley brother]465-my brother [Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner ’s in [town]268-town]3399-a gentleman at my brother gardiner ’s in town so much in love with [her]89-jane , that [[my]85-mr. bingley sister - in - law]3402-my sister - in - law was sure [he]3399-a gentleman at my brother gardiner ’s in town would make [her]89-jane an offer before [we]3403-we came away . But , however , [he]3399-a gentleman at my brother gardiner ’s in town did not . Perhaps [he]3399-a gentleman at my brother gardiner ’s in town thought [her]89-jane too young . However , [he]3399-a gentleman at my brother gardiner ’s in town wrote some verses on [her]89-jane , and very pretty they were . ”[85-mr. bingley] “ And so ended [his]3399-a gentleman at my brother gardiner ’s in town affection , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , impatiently . “ There has been many a one , [I]88-elizabeth fancy , overcome in the same way . [I]88-elizabeth wonder who first discovered the efficacy of poetry in driving away love ! ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]96-mr. darcy have been used to consider poetry as the food of love , ”[96-mr. darcy] said [Darcy]96-mr. darcy . “ Of a fine , stout , healthy love it may . Everything nourishes what is strong already . But if it be only a slight , thin sort of inclination , [I]96-mr. darcy am convinced that [one good sonnet]3404-one good sonnet will starve it entirely away . ”[96-mr. darcy] [Darcy]96-mr. darcy only smiled ; and the general pause which ensued made [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth tremble lest [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother should be exposing [herself]246-her mother again . [She]88-elizabeth longed to speak , but could think of nothing to say ; and after a short silence [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet began repeating [her]92-mrs. bennet thanks to [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley for [his]85-mr. bingley kindness to [Jane]89-jane , with an apology for troubling [him]85-mr. bingley also with [Lizzy]88-elizabeth . [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley was unaffectedly civil in [his]85-mr. bingley answer , and forced [[his]85-mr. bingley younger sister]568-his younger sister to be civil also , and say what the occasion required . [She]568-his younger sister performed [her]568-his younger sister part , indeed , without much graciousness , but [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet was satisfied , and soon afterwards ordered [her]568-his younger sister carriage . Upon this signal , [the youngest of [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughters]242-her daughters]569-the youngest of her daughters put [herself]569-the youngest of her daughters forward . [The two girls]571-the two girls had been whispering to [each other]3216-each other during the whole visit ; and the result of it was , that [the youngest]3128-the youngest should tax [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley with having promised on [his]85-mr. bingley first coming into [the country]448-the country to give a ball at [Netherfield]2-netherfield . [Lydia]90-lydia was [a stout , well - grown girl of fifteen , with a fine complexion and good - humoured countenance]575-a stout , well - grown girl of fifteen , with a fine complexion and good - humoured countenance ; [a favourite with [[her]90-lydia mother]246-her mother , whose affection had brought [her]90-lydia into public at an early age]576-a favourite with her mother , whose affection had brought her into public at an early age . [She]90-lydia had high animal spirits , and a sort of natural self - consequence , which the attentions of [the officers]452-the officers , to whom [[her]90-lydia uncle]579-her uncle ’s good dinners and [her]90-lydia own easy manners recommended [her]90-lydia , had increased into assurance . [She]90-lydia was very equal , therefore , to address [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley on the subject of the ball , and abruptly reminded [him]85-mr. bingley of [his]85-mr. bingley promise ; adding , that it would be the most shameful thing in [the world]304-the world if [he]85-mr. bingley did not keep it . [His]85-mr. bingley answer to this sudden attack was delightful to [[her]90-lydia mother]246-her mother ’s ear . “ [I]90-lydia am perfectly ready , [I]90-lydia assure [you]246-her mother , to keep [my]90-lydia engagement ; and , when [[your]246-her mother sister]3211-your sister is recovered , [you]246-her mother shall , if [you]246-her mother please , name the very day of the ball . But [you]246-her mother would not wish to be dancing while [she]3211-your sister is ill ? ”[90-lydia] [Lydia]90-lydia declared [herself]90-lydia satisfied . “ Oh yes -- it would be much better to wait till [Jane]89-jane was well ; and by that time , most likely , [Captain Carter]118-captain carter would be at [Meryton]9-meryton again . And when [you]246-her mother have given [your]246-her mother ball , ”[90-lydia] [she]90-lydia added , “ [I]90-lydia shall insist on [their]3406-their giving one also . [I]90-lydia shall tell [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster it will be quite a shame if [he]113-colonel forster does not . ”[90-lydia] [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet and [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughters]242-her daughters then departed , and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth returned instantly to [Jane]89-jane , leaving [her]88-elizabeth own and [[her]88-elizabeth relations]583-her relations ’ behaviour to the remarks of [the two ladies]505-the two ladies and [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ; [the latter of whom]585-the latter of whom , however , could not be prevailed on to join in [their]505-the two ladies censure of [her]90-lydia , in spite of all [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s witticisms on fine eyes . [ Illustration ] CHAPTER X. [ Illustration ] The day passed much as the day before had done . [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst and [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley had spent some hours of the morning with [the invalid , who continued , though slowly , to mend]586-the invalid , who continued , though slowly , to mend ; and , in the evening , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth joined [their]505-the two ladies party in [the drawing - room]524-the drawing - room . The loo table , however , did not appear . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy was writing , and [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , seated near [him]96-mr. darcy , was watching the progress of [his]96-mr. darcy letter , and repeatedly calling off [his]96-mr. darcy attention by messages to [[his]96-mr. darcy sister]565-his sister . [Mr. Hurst]95-mr. hurst and [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley were at piquet , and [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst was observing [their]505-the two ladies game . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth took up some needlework , and was sufficiently amused in attending to what passed between [Darcy]96-mr. darcy and [[his]96-mr. darcy companion]423-his companion . The perpetual commendations of [the lady]590-the lady either on [his]96-mr. darcy hand - writing , or on the evenness of [his]96-mr. darcy lines , or on the length of [his]96-mr. darcy letter , with the perfect unconcern with which [her]590-the lady praises were received , formed a curious dialogue , and was exactly in unison with [her]590-the lady opinion of each . “ How delighted [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy will be to receive such a letter ! ”[96-mr. darcy] [He]96-mr. darcy made no answer . “ [You]96-mr. darcy write uncommonly fast . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ [You]96-mr. darcy are mistaken . [I]590-the lady write rather slowly . ”[590-the lady] “ How many letters [you]96-mr. darcy must have occasion to write in the course of a year ! Letters of business , too ! How odious [I]590-the lady should think them ! ”[590-the lady] “ It is fortunate , then , that they fall to [my]96-mr. darcy lot instead of to [yours]96-mr. darcy . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ Pray tell [[your]96-mr. darcy sister]3211-your sister that [I]590-the lady long to see [her]3211-your sister . ”[590-the lady] “ [I]590-the lady have already told [her]3211-your sister so once , by [your]590-the lady desire . ”[590-the lady] “ [I]590-the lady am afraid [you]591-you do not like [your]591-you pen . Let [me]590-the lady mend it for [you]591-you . [I]590-the lady mend pens remarkably well . ”[590-the lady] “ Thank [you]591-you -- but [I]96-mr. darcy always mend [my]96-mr. darcy own . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ How can [you]591-you contrive to write so even ? ”[591-you] [He]591-you was silent . “ Tell [[your]96-mr. darcy sister]3211-your sister [I]591-you am delighted to hear of [her]3211-your sister improvement on the harp , and pray let [her]3211-your sister know that [I]591-you am quite in raptures with [her]3211-your sister beautiful little design for a table , and [I]591-you think it infinitely superior to [Miss Grantley]130-miss grantley ’s . ”[591-you] “ Will [you]591-you give [me]96-mr. darcy leave to defer [your]591-you raptures till [I]96-mr. darcy write again ? At present [I]96-mr. darcy have not room to do them justice . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ Oh , it is of no consequence . [I]96-mr. darcy shall see [her]3211-your sister in [January]14-january . But do [you]591-you always write such charming long letters to [her]3211-your sister , [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ? ”[96-mr. darcy] “ They are generally long ; but whether always charming , it is not for [me]591-you to determine . ”[591-you] “ It is a rule with [me]96-mr. darcy , that [a person who can write a long letter with ease]3409-a person who can write a long letter with ease can not write ill . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ That will not do for a compliment to [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , [Caroline]123-caroline , ”[3181-her brother] cried [[her]592-her brother]3181-her brother , “ because [he]96-mr. darcy does not write with ease . [He]96-mr. darcy studies too much for words of four syllables . Do not [you]591-you , [Darcy]96-mr. darcy ? ”[96-mr. darcy] “ [My]96-mr. darcy style of writing is very different from [yours]591-you . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ Oh , ”[98-miss bingley] cried [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , “ [Charles]126-charles writes in the most careless way imaginable . [He]126-charles leaves out half [his]126-charles words , and blots the rest . ”[98-miss bingley] “ [My]96-mr. darcy ideas flow so rapidly that [I]96-mr. darcy have not time to express them ; by which means [my]96-mr. darcy letters sometimes convey no ideas at all to [[my]96-mr. darcy correspondents]3410-my correspondents . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ [Your]96-mr. darcy humility , [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ must disarm reproof . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Nothing is more deceitful , ”[96-mr. darcy] said [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , “ than the appearance of humility . It is often only carelessness of opinion , and sometimes an indirect boast . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ And which of the two do [you]591-you call [my]96-mr. darcy little recent piece of modesty ? ”[96-mr. darcy] “ The indirect boast ; for [you]96-mr. darcy are really proud of [your]96-mr. darcy defects in writing , because [you]96-mr. darcy consider them as proceeding from a rapidity of thought and carelessness of execution , which , if not estimable , [you]96-mr. darcy think at least highly interesting . The power of doing anything with quickness is always much prized by [the possessor]3411-the possessor , and often without any attention to the imperfection of the performance . When [you]96-mr. darcy told [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet this morning , that if [you]96-mr. darcy ever resolved on quitting [Netherfield]2-netherfield [you]96-mr. darcy should be gone in five minutes , [you]96-mr. darcy meant it to be a sort of panegyric , of compliment to [yourself]96-mr. darcy ; and yet what is there so very laudable in a precipitance which must leave very necessary business undone , and can be of no real advantage to [yourself]96-mr. darcy or [anyone else]3412-anyone else ? ”[96-mr. darcy] “ Nay , ”[85-mr. bingley] cried [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , “ this is too much , to remember at night all the foolish things that were said in the morning . And yet , upon [my]85-mr. bingley honour , [I]85-mr. bingley believed what [I]85-mr. bingley said of [myself]85-mr. bingley to be true , and [I]85-mr. bingley believe it at this moment . At least , therefore , [I]85-mr. bingley did not assume the character of needless precipitance merely to show off before [the ladies]254-the ladies . ”[85-mr. bingley] “ [I]96-mr. darcy daresay [you]96-mr. darcy believed it ; but [I]96-mr. darcy am by no means convinced that [you]96-mr. darcy would be gone with such celerity . [Your]96-mr. darcy conduct would be quite as dependent on chance as that of [any man [I]96-mr. darcy know]3414-any man i know ; and if , as [you]96-mr. darcy were mounting [your]96-mr. darcy horse , [a friend]3228-a friend were to say , ‘ [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , [you]96-mr. darcy had better stay till next week , ’ [you]96-mr. darcy would probably do it -- [you]96-mr. darcy would probably not go -- and , at another word , might stay a month . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ [You]96-mr. darcy have only proved by this , ”[88-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ that [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley did not do justice to [his]85-mr. bingley own disposition . [You]96-mr. darcy have shown [him]85-mr. bingley off now much more than [he]85-mr. bingley did [himself]85-mr. bingley . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]85-mr. bingley am exceedingly gratified , ”[85-mr. bingley] said [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , “ by [your]96-mr. darcy converting what [[my]85-mr. bingley friend]3416-my friend says into a compliment on the sweetness of [my]85-mr. bingley temper . But [I]85-mr. bingley am afraid [you]96-mr. darcy are giving it a turn which [that gentleman]3371-that gentleman did by no means intend ; for [he]3371-that gentleman would certainly think the better of [me]85-mr. bingley if , under such a circumstance , [I]85-mr. bingley were to give a flat denial , and ride off as fast as [I]85-mr. bingley could . ”[85-mr. bingley] “ Would [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy then consider the rashness of [your]96-mr. darcy original intention as atoned for by [your]96-mr. darcy obstinacy in adhering to it ? ”[96-mr. darcy] “ Upon [my]96-mr. darcy word , [I]96-mr. darcy can not exactly explain the matter -- [Darcy]96-mr. darcy must speak for [himself]96-mr. darcy . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ [You]96-mr. darcy expect [me]85-mr. bingley to account for opinions which [you]96-mr. darcy choose to call [mine]85-mr. bingley , but which [I]85-mr. bingley have never acknowledged . Allowing the case , however , to stand according to [your]96-mr. darcy representation , [you]96-mr. darcy must remember , [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , that [the friend who is supposed to desire [his]3371-that gentleman return to [the house]3075-the house , and the delay of [his]3371-that gentleman plan]3418-the friend who is supposed to desire his return to the house , and the delay of his plan , has merely desired it , asked it without offering one argument in favour of its propriety . ”[85-mr. bingley] “ To yield readily -- easily -- to the persuasion of [a friend]3228-a friend is no merit with [you]96-mr. darcy . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ To yield without conviction is no compliment to the understanding of either . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ [You]96-mr. darcy appear to [me]85-mr. bingley , [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , to allow nothing for the influence of friendship and affection . A regard for [the requester]3421-the requester would often make [one]3113-one readily yield to a request , without waiting for arguments to reason one into it . [I]85-mr. bingley am not particularly speaking of such a case as [you]96-mr. darcy have supposed about [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley . [We]3423-we may as well wait , perhaps , till the circumstance occurs , before [we]3423-we discuss the discretion of [his]85-mr. bingley behaviour thereupon . But in general and ordinary cases , between [friend]3424-friend and [friend]3424-friend , where one of [them]3426-them is desired by [the other]3427-the other to change a resolution of no very great moment , should [you]96-mr. darcy think ill of [that person for complying with the desire , without waiting to be argued into it]3428-that person for complying with the desire , without waiting to be argued into it ? ”[85-mr. bingley] “ Will it not be advisable , before [we]3423-we proceed on this subject , to arrange with rather more precision the degree of importance which is to appertain to this request , as well as the degree of intimacy subsisting between [the parties]3221-the parties ? ”[96-mr. darcy] “ By all means , ”[85-mr. bingley] cried [Bingley]85-mr. bingley ; “ let [us]3423-we hear all the particulars , not forgetting their comparative height and size , for that will have more weight in the argument , [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , than [you]96-mr. darcy may be aware of . [I]85-mr. bingley assure [you]96-mr. darcy that if [Darcy]96-mr. darcy were not such [a great tall fellow]3430-a great tall fellow , in comparison with [myself]85-mr. bingley , [I]85-mr. bingley should not pay [him]96-mr. darcy half so much deference . [I]85-mr. bingley declare [I]85-mr. bingley do not know a more awful object than [Darcy]96-mr. darcy on particular occasions , and in particular places ; at [[his]96-mr. darcy own house]3219-his own house especially , and of a Sunday evening , when [he]96-mr. darcy has nothing to do . ”[85-mr. bingley] [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy smiled ; but [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth thought [she]88-elizabeth could perceive that [he]96-mr. darcy was rather offended , and therefore checked [her]88-elizabeth laugh . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley warmly resented the indignity [he]96-mr. darcy had received , in an expostulation with [[her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother for talking such nonsense . “ [I]288-his friend see [your]96-mr. darcy design , [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , ”[288-his friend] said [[his]96-mr. darcy friend]288-his friend . “ [You]96-mr. darcy dislike an argument , and want to silence this . ”[288-his friend] “ Perhaps [I]88-elizabeth do . Arguments are too much like disputes . If [you]85-mr. bingley and [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth will defer [yours]85-mr. bingley till [I]88-elizabeth am out of [the room]255-the room , [I]88-elizabeth shall be very thankful ; and then [you]85-mr. bingley may say whatever [you]85-mr. bingley like of [me]88-elizabeth . ”[88-elizabeth] “ What [you]96-mr. darcy ask , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ is no sacrifice on [my]88-elizabeth side ; and [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy had much better finish [his]96-mr. darcy letter . ”[88-elizabeth] [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy took [her]88-elizabeth advice , and did finish [his]96-mr. darcy letter . When that business was over , [he]96-mr. darcy applied to [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth for the indulgence of some music . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley moved with alacrity to the pianoforte , and after a polite request that [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth would lead the way , which [the other as politely and more earnestly negatived]596-the other as politely and more earnestly negatived , [she]88-elizabeth seated [herself]88-elizabeth . [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst sang with [[her]97-mrs. hurst sister]328-her sister ; and while [they]598-they were thus employed , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth could not help observing , as [she]88-elizabeth turned over some music - books that lay on the instrument , how frequently [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s eyes were fixed on [her]88-elizabeth . [She]88-elizabeth hardly knew how to suppose that [she]88-elizabeth could be an object of admiration to [so great a man]599-so great a man , and yet that [he]96-mr. darcy should look at [her]88-elizabeth because [he]96-mr. darcy disliked [her]88-elizabeth was still more strange . [She]88-elizabeth could only imagine , however , at last , that [she]88-elizabeth drew [his]96-mr. darcy notice because there was something about [her]88-elizabeth more wrong and reprehensible , according to [his]96-mr. darcy ideas of right , than in [any other person present]600-any other person present . The supposition did not pain [her]88-elizabeth . [She]88-elizabeth liked [him]96-mr. darcy too little to care for [his]96-mr. darcy approbation . After playing some Italian songs , [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley varied the charm by a lively Scotch air ; and soon afterwards [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , drawing near [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , said to [her,--]88-elizabeth “ Do [you]88-elizabeth not feel a great inclination , [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , to seize such an opportunity of dancing a reel ? ”[96-mr. darcy] [She]88-elizabeth smiled , but made no answer . [He]96-mr. darcy repeated the question , with some surprise at [her]88-elizabeth silence . “ Oh , ”[88-elizabeth] said [she]88-elizabeth , “ [I]88-elizabeth heard [you]96-mr. darcy before ; but [I]88-elizabeth could not immediately determine what to say in reply . [You]96-mr. darcy wanted [me]88-elizabeth , [I]88-elizabeth know , to say ‘ Yes , ’ that [you]96-mr. darcy might have the pleasure of despising [my]88-elizabeth taste ; but [I]88-elizabeth always delight in overthrowing those kind of schemes , and cheating [a person]3202-a person of [their]3202-a person premeditated contempt . [I]88-elizabeth have , therefore , made up [my]88-elizabeth mind to tell [you]96-mr. darcy that [I]88-elizabeth do not want to dance a reel at all ; and now despise [me]88-elizabeth if [you]96-mr. darcy dare . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Indeed [I]88-elizabeth do not dare . ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , having rather expected to affront [him]601-him , was amazed at [his]601-him gallantry ; but there was a mixture of sweetness and archness in [her]88-elizabeth manner which made it difficult for [her]88-elizabeth to affront [anybody]3171-anybody , and [Darcy]96-mr. darcy had never been so bewitched by [any woman]603-any woman as [he]96-mr. darcy was by [her]88-elizabeth . [He]96-mr. darcy really believed that , were it not for the inferiority of [her]88-elizabeth connections , [he]96-mr. darcy should be in some danger . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley saw , or suspected , enough to be jealous ; and [her]98-miss bingley great anxiety for the recovery of [[her]98-miss bingley dear friend]604-her dear friend [Jane]89-jane received some assistance from [her]89-jane desire of getting rid of [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . [She]98-miss bingley often tried to provoke [Darcy]96-mr. darcy into disliking [[her]98-miss bingley guest]605-her guest , by talking of [their]606-their supposed marriage , and planning [his]96-mr. darcy happiness in such an alliance . “ [I]98-miss bingley hope , ”[98-miss bingley] said [she]98-miss bingley , as [they]606-their were walking together in the shrubbery the next day , “ [you]96-mr. darcy will give [[your]96-mr. darcy mother - in - law]3434-your mother - in - law a few hints , when this desirable event takes place , as to the advantage of holding [her]3434-your mother - in - law tongue ; and if [you]96-mr. darcy can compass it , to cure [the younger girls]3435-the younger girls of running after [the officers]452-the officers . And , if [I]98-miss bingley may mention so delicate a subject , endeavour to check that little something , bordering on conceit and impertinence , which [[your]96-mr. darcy lady]3437-your lady possesses . ”[98-miss bingley] [ Illustration : “ No , no ; stay where [you]96-mr. darcy are ”[98-miss bingley] “ Have [you]96-mr. darcy anything else to propose for [my]98-miss bingley domestic felicity ? ”[98-miss bingley] “ Oh yes . Do let the portraits of [[your]96-mr. darcy uncle]3438-your uncle and [aunt Philips]3439-aunt philips be placed in [the gallery at [Pemberley]12-pemberley]3440-the gallery at pemberley . Put them next to [[your]96-mr. darcy great - uncle]3441-your great - uncle [the judge]3442-the judge . [They]607-they are in the same profession , [you]96-mr. darcy know , only in different lines . As for [your]96-mr. darcy [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s picture , [you]96-mr. darcy must not attempt to have it taken , for what painter could do justice to those beautiful eyes ? ”[98-miss bingley] “ It would not be easy , indeed , to catch [their]607-they expression ; but their colour and shape , and the eyelashes , so remarkably fine , might be copied . ”[98-miss bingley] At that moment [they]607-they were met from another walk by [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth [herself]88-elizabeth . “ [I]98-miss bingley did not know that [you]88-elizabeth intended to walk , ”[98-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , in some confusion , lest [they]607-they had been overheard . “ [You]88-elizabeth used [us]607-they abominably ill , ”[97-mrs. hurst] answered [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst , “ running away without telling [us]607-they that [you]88-elizabeth were coming out . ”[97-mrs. hurst] Then taking the disengaged arm of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , [she]97-mrs. hurst left [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth to walk by [herself]88-elizabeth . [The path]608-the path just admitted [three]609-three . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy felt [their]607-they rudeness , and immediately said,-- “ [This walk]3443-this walk is not wide enough for [[our]607-they party]3444-our party . [We]607-they had better go into [the avenue]3445-the avenue . ”[96-mr. darcy] But [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , who had not the least inclination to remain with [them]607-they , laughingly answered,-- “ No , no ; stay where [you]96-mr. darcy are . [You]96-mr. darcy are charmingly grouped , and appear to uncommon advantage . The picturesque would be spoilt by admitting a fourth . Good - bye . ”[88-elizabeth] [She]88-elizabeth then ran gaily off , rejoicing , as [she]88-elizabeth rambled about , in the hope of being at [home]3288-home again in a day or two . [Jane]89-jane was already so much recovered as to intend leaving [[her]89-jane room]493-her room for a couple of hours that evening . [ Illustration : “ Piling up the fire ”[254-the ladies] CHAPTER XI . [ Illustration ] When [the ladies]254-the ladies removed after dinner [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ran up to [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , and seeing [her]328-her sister well guarded from cold , attended [her]328-her sister into [the drawing - room]524-the drawing - room , where [she]328-her sister was welcomed by [[her]328-her sister two friends]615-her two friends with many professions of pleasure ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had never seen [them]607-they so agreeable as [they]607-they were during the hour which passed before [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen appeared . [Their]607-they powers of conversation were considerable . [They]607-they could describe an entertainment with accuracy , relate an anecdote with humour , and laugh at [their]607-they acquaintance with spirit . But when [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen entered , [Jane]89-jane was no longer [the first object]618-the first object ; [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s eyes were instantly turned towards [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , and [she]98-miss bingley had something to say to [him]96-mr. darcy before [he]96-mr. darcy had advanced many steps . [He]96-mr. darcy addressed [himself]96-mr. darcy directly to [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth with a polite congratulation ; [Mr. Hurst]95-mr. hurst also made [her]89-jane a slight bow , and said [he]96-mr. darcy was “ very glad ; ”[96-mr. darcy] but diffuseness and warmth remained for [Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s salutation . [He]96-mr. darcy was full of joy and attention . The first half hour was spent in piling up the fire , lest [she]89-jane should suffer from the change of [room]619-room ; and [she]89-jane removed , at [his]96-mr. darcy desire , to the other side of the fireplace , that [she]89-jane might be farther from the door . [He]96-mr. darcy then sat down by [her]89-jane , and talked scarcely to [anyone else]3412-anyone else . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , at work in the opposite corner , saw it all with great delight . When tea was over [Mr. Hurst]95-mr. hurst reminded [[his]95-mr. hurst sister - in - law]621-his sister - in - law of the card - table -- but in vain . [She]621-his sister - in - law had obtained private intelligence that [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy did not wish for cards , and [Mr. Hurst]95-mr. hurst soon found even [his]95-mr. hurst open petition rejected . [She]621-his sister - in - law assured [him]96-mr. darcy that [no one]3336-no one intended to play , and the silence of [the whole party on the subject]623-the whole party on the subject seemed to justify [her]621-his sister - in - law . [Mr. Hurst]95-mr. hurst had , therefore , nothing to do but to stretch [himself]96-mr. darcy on one of the sofas and go to sleep . [Darcy]96-mr. darcy took up a book . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley did the same ; and [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst , principally occupied in playing with [her]97-mrs. hurst bracelets and rings , joined now and then in [[her]97-mrs. hurst brother]3181-her brother ’s conversation with [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s attention was quite as much engaged in watching [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s progress through [his]96-mr. darcy book , as in reading [her]98-miss bingley own ; and [she]98-miss bingley was perpetually either making some inquiry , or looking at [his]96-mr. darcy page . [She]98-miss bingley could not win [him]96-mr. darcy , however , to any conversation ; [he]96-mr. darcy merely answered [her]98-miss bingley question and read on . At length , quite exhausted by the attempt to be amused with [her]98-miss bingley own book , which [she]98-miss bingley had only chosen because it was the second volume of [his]96-mr. darcy , [she]98-miss bingley gave a great yawn and said , “ How pleasant it is to spend an evening in this way ! [I]98-miss bingley declare , after all , there is no enjoyment like reading ! How much sooner one tires of anything than of a book ! When [I]98-miss bingley have [a house of [my]98-miss bingley own]3446-a house of my own , [I]98-miss bingley shall be miserable if [I]98-miss bingley have not [an excellent library]3447-an excellent library . ”[98-miss bingley] [No one]3336-no one made any reply . [She]98-miss bingley then yawned again , threw aside [her]98-miss bingley book , and cast [her]98-miss bingley eyes round [the room]255-the room in quest of some amusement ; when , hearing [[her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother mentioning a ball to [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , [she]98-miss bingley turned suddenly towards [him]3181-her brother and said,-- “ By [the bye Charles]126-charles , are [you]3181-her brother really serious in meditating a dance at [Netherfield]2-netherfield ? [I]98-miss bingley would advise [you]3181-her brother , before [you]3181-her brother determine on it , to consult the wishes of [the present party]3448-the present party ; [I]98-miss bingley am much mistaken if there are not some among [us]3449-us to whom a ball would be rather a punishment than a pleasure . ”[98-miss bingley] “ If [you]98-miss bingley mean [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , ”[3181-her brother] cried [[her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother , “ [he]96-mr. darcy may go to bed , if [he]96-mr. darcy chooses , before it begins ; but as for the ball , it is quite a settled thing , and as soon as [Nicholls]131-nicholls has made white soup enough [I]98-miss bingley shall send round [my]98-miss bingley cards . ”[98-miss bingley] “ [I]98-miss bingley should like balls infinitely better , ”[98-miss bingley] [she]98-miss bingley replied , “ if they were carried on in a different manner ; but there is something insufferably tedious in the usual process of such a meeting . It would surely be much more rational if conversation instead of dancing made the order of the day . ”[98-miss bingley] “ Much more rational , [[my]98-miss bingley dear]3066-my dear [Caroline]123-caroline , [I]98-miss bingley dare say ; but it would not be near so much like a ball . ”[98-miss bingley] [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley made no answer , and soon afterwards got up and walked about [the room]255-the room . [Her]98-miss bingley figure was elegant , and [she]98-miss bingley walked well ; but [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , at whom it was all aimed , was still inflexibly studious . In the desperation of [her]98-miss bingley feelings , [she]98-miss bingley resolved on one effort more ; and , turning to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , said,-- “ [Miss Eliza Bennet]88-elizabeth , let [me]98-miss bingley persuade [you]88-elizabeth to follow [my]98-miss bingley example , and take a turn about [the room]255-the room . [I]98-miss bingley assure [you]88-elizabeth it is very refreshing after sitting so long in one attitude . ”[98-miss bingley] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was surprised , but agreed to it immediately . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley succeeded no less in the real object of [her]98-miss bingley civility : [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy looked up . [He]96-mr. darcy was as much awake to the novelty of attention in that quarter as [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth [herself]88-elizabeth could be , and unconsciously closed [his]96-mr. darcy book . [He]96-mr. darcy was directly invited to join [their]630-their party , but [he]96-mr. darcy declined it , observing that [he]96-mr. darcy could imagine but two motives for [their]630-their choosing to walk up and down [the room]255-the room together , with either of which motives [his]96-mr. darcy joining [them]630-their would interfere . What could [he]96-mr. darcy mean ? [She]88-elizabeth was dying to know what could be [his]96-mr. darcy meaning -- and asked [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth whether [she]88-elizabeth could at all understand [him]96-mr. darcy . “ Not at all , ”[88-elizabeth] was [her]88-elizabeth answer ; “ but , depend upon it , [he]96-mr. darcy means to be severe on [us]630-their , and [our]630-their surest way of disappointing [him]96-mr. darcy will be to ask nothing about it . ”[88-elizabeth] [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , however , was incapable of disappointing [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy in anything , and persevered , therefore , in requiring an explanation of [his]96-mr. darcy two motives . “ [I]96-mr. darcy have not the smallest objection to explaining them , ”[96-mr. darcy] said [he]96-mr. darcy , as soon as [she]88-elizabeth allowed [him]96-mr. darcy to speak . “ [You]88-elizabeth either choose this method of passing the evening because [you]88-elizabeth are in [each other]3216-each other ’s confidence , and have secret affairs to discuss , or because [you]88-elizabeth are conscious that [your]88-elizabeth figures appear to the greatest advantage in walking : if the first , [I]96-mr. darcy should be completely in [your]88-elizabeth way ; and if the second , [I]96-mr. darcy can admire [you]88-elizabeth much better as [I]96-mr. darcy sit by the fire . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ Oh , shocking ! ”[98-miss bingley] cried [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley . “ [I]98-miss bingley never heard anything so abominable . How shall [we]3453-we punish [him]96-mr. darcy for such a speech ? ”[98-miss bingley] “ Nothing so easy , if [you]96-mr. darcy have but the inclination , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ [We]3453-we can all plague and punish [one another]3454-one another . Tease [him]96-mr. darcy -- laugh at [him]96-mr. darcy . Intimate as [you]96-mr. darcy are , [you]96-mr. darcy must know how it is to be done . ”[88-elizabeth] “ But upon [my]98-miss bingley honour [I]98-miss bingley do not . [I]98-miss bingley do assure [you]96-mr. darcy that [my]98-miss bingley intimacy has not yet taught [me]98-miss bingley that . Tease calmness of temper and presence of mind ! No , no ; [I]98-miss bingley feel [he]96-mr. darcy may defy [us]3453-we there . And as to laughter , [we]3453-we will not expose [ourselves]3453-we , if [you]96-mr. darcy please , by attempting to laugh without a subject . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy may hug [himself]96-mr. darcy . ”[98-miss bingley] “ [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy is not to be laughed at ! ”[88-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ That is an uncommon advantage , and uncommon [I]88-elizabeth hope it will continue , for it would be a great loss to [me]88-elizabeth to have [many such acquaintance]3455-many such acquaintance . [I]88-elizabeth dearly love a laugh . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , ”[632-he] said [he]632-he , “ has given [me]632-he credit for more than can be . [The wisest and best of men,--nay]3456-the wisest and best of men,--nay , the wisest and best of [their]3456-the wisest and best of men,--nay actions,--may be rendered ridiculous by [a person whose first object in life is a joke]3457-a person whose first object in life is a joke . ”[632-he] “ Certainly , ”[88-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ there are [such people]3458-such people , but [I]88-elizabeth hope [I]88-elizabeth am not one of [them]3458-such people . [I]88-elizabeth hope [I]88-elizabeth never ridicule what is wise or good . Follies and nonsense , whims and inconsistencies , do divert [me]88-elizabeth , [I]88-elizabeth own , and [I]88-elizabeth laugh at [them]3458-such people whenever [I]88-elizabeth can . But these , [I]88-elizabeth suppose , are precisely what [you]88-elizabeth are without . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Perhaps that is not possible for [anyone]3174-anyone . But it has been the study of [my]88-elizabeth life to avoid those weaknesses which often expose a strong understanding to ridicule . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Such as vanity and pride . ”[632-he] “ Yes , vanity is a weakness indeed . But pride -- where there is a real superiority of mind -- pride will be always under good regulation . ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth turned away to hide a smile . “ [Your]98-miss bingley examination of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy is over , [I]98-miss bingley presume , ”[98-miss bingley] said [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ; “ and pray what is the result ? ”[98-miss bingley] “ [I]632-he am perfectly convinced by it that [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy has no defect . [He]96-mr. darcy owns it [himself]96-mr. darcy without disguise . ”[632-he] “ No , ”[96-mr. darcy] said [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , “ [I]96-mr. darcy have made no such pretension . [I]96-mr. darcy have faults enough , but they are not , [I]96-mr. darcy hope , of understanding . [My]96-mr. darcy temper [I]96-mr. darcy dare not vouch for . It is , [I]96-mr. darcy believe , too little yielding ; certainly too little for the convenience of [the world]304-the world . [I]96-mr. darcy can not forget the follies and vices of [others]3175-others so soon as [I]96-mr. darcy ought , nor [their]3175-others offences against [myself]96-mr. darcy . [My]96-mr. darcy feelings are not puffed about with every attempt to move them . [My]96-mr. darcy temper would perhaps be called resentful . [My]96-mr. darcy good opinion once lost is lost for ever . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ That is a failing , indeed ! ”[88-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ Implacable resentment is a shade in a character . But [you]633-you have chosen [your]633-you fault well . [I]88-elizabeth really can not laugh at it . [You]633-you are safe from [me]88-elizabeth . ”[88-elizabeth] “ There is , [I]96-mr. darcy believe , in every disposition a tendency to some particular evil , a natural defect , which not even the best education can overcome . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ And [your]633-you defect is a propensity to hate [everybody]305-everybody . ”[88-elizabeth] “ And [yours]633-you , ”[633-you] [he]633-you replied , with a smile , “ is wilfully to misunderstand [them]305-everybody . ”[633-you] “ Do let [us]3463-us have a little music , ”[98-miss bingley] cried [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , tired of a conversation in which [she]98-miss bingley had no share . “ [Louisa]122-louisa , [you]122-louisa will not mind [my]98-miss bingley waking [Mr. Hurst]95-mr. hurst . ”[98-miss bingley] [[Her]98-miss bingley sister]328-her sister made not the smallest objection , and the pianoforte was opened ; and [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , after a few moments ’ recollection , was not sorry for it . [He]96-mr. darcy began to feel the danger of paying [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth too much attention . [ Illustration ] CHAPTER XII . [ Illustration ] In consequence of an agreement between [the sisters]496-the sisters , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth wrote the next morning to [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother , to beg that [the carriage]3286-the carriage might be sent for [them]496-the sisters in the course of the day . But [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , who had calculated on [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughters]242-her daughters remaining at [Netherfield]2-netherfield till the following Tuesday , which would exactly finish [Jane]89-jane ’s week , could not bring [herself]92-mrs. bennet to receive [them]496-the sisters with pleasure before . [Her]92-mrs. bennet answer , therefore , was not propitious , at least not to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s wishes , for [she]92-mrs. bennet was impatient to get [home]3288-home . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet sent [them]496-the sisters word that [they]496-the sisters could not possibly have [the carriage]3286-the carriage before Tuesday ; and in [her]92-mrs. bennet postscript it was added , that if [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley and [[his]85-mr. bingley sister]565-his sister pressed [them]496-the sisters to stay longer , [she]92-mrs. bennet could spare [them]496-the sisters very well . Against staying longer , however , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was positively resolved -- nor did [she]88-elizabeth much expect it would be asked ; and fearful , on the contrary , of being considered as intruding [themselves]496-the sisters needlessly long , [she]88-elizabeth urged [Jane]89-jane to borrow [[Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s carriage]642-mr. bingley ’s carriage immediately , and at length it was settled that [their]496-the sisters original design of leaving [Netherfield]2-netherfield that morning should be mentioned , and the request made . The communication excited many professions of concern ; and enough was said of wishing [them]496-the sisters to stay at least till the following day to work on [Jane]89-jane ; and till the morrow [their]496-the sisters going was deferred . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley was then sorry that [she]92-mrs. bennet had proposed the delay ; for [her]92-mrs. bennet jealousy and dislike of [one sister]643-one sister much exceeded [her]92-mrs. bennet affection for [the other]3427-the other . [The master of [the house]3075-the house]645-the master of the house heard with real sorrow that [they]496-the sisters were to go so soon , and repeatedly tried to persuade [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth that it would not be safe for [her]89-jane -- that [she]89-jane was not enough recovered ; but [Jane]89-jane was firm where [she]89-jane felt [herself]89-jane to be right . To [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy it was welcome intelligence : [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had been at [Netherfield]2-netherfield long enough . [She]88-elizabeth attracted [him]96-mr. darcy more than [he]96-mr. darcy liked ; and [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley was uncivil to [her]88-elizabeth and more teasing than usual to [himself]96-mr. darcy . [He]96-mr. darcy wisely resolved to be particularly careful that no sign of admiration should now escape [him]96-mr. darcy -- nothing that could elevate [her]88-elizabeth with the hope of influencing [his]96-mr. darcy felicity ; sensible that , if such an idea had been suggested , [his]96-mr. darcy behaviour during the last day must have material weight in confirming or crushing it . Steady to [his]96-mr. darcy purpose , [he]96-mr. darcy scarcely spoke ten words to [her]88-elizabeth through the whole of Saturday : and though [they]647-they were at one time left by [themselves]647-they for half an hour , [he]96-mr. darcy adhered most conscientiously to [his]96-mr. darcy book , and would not even look at [her]88-elizabeth . On Sunday , after morning service , the separation , so agreeable to almost all , took place . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s civility to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth increased at last very rapidly , as well as [her]98-miss bingley affection for [Jane]89-jane ; and when [they]647-they parted , after assuring [the latter]491-the latter of the pleasure it would always give [her]98-miss bingley to see [her]88-elizabeth either at [Longbourn]7-longbourn or [Netherfield]2-netherfield , and embracing [her]88-elizabeth most tenderly , [she]98-miss bingley even shook hands with [the former]327-the former .
