[He]134-mr. collins joined [them]3082-the girls on [their]3082-the girls entering [the town]3847-the town , and attended [them]3082-the girls to [[their]3082-the girls aunt]442-their aunt ’s , where [his]134-mr. collins regret and vexation and the concern of [everybody]305-everybody were well talked over . To [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , however , [he]134-mr. collins voluntarily acknowledged that the necessity of [his]134-mr. collins absence had been self - imposed . “[0-i] [I]0-i found , ” said [he]0-i , “[0-i] as the time drew near , that [I]0-i had better not meet [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy -that to be in [the same room]1035-the same room , the same party with [him]96-mr. darcy for so many hours together , might be more than [I]0-i could bear , and that scenes might arise unpleasant to more than [myself]0-i . ” [She]88-elizabeth highly approved [his]134-mr. collins forbearance ; and [they]3850-they had leisure for a full discussion of it , and for all the commendations which [they]3850-they civilly bestowed on [each other]3216-each other , as [Wickham]142-wickham and [another officer]3852-another officer walked back with [them]3850-they to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , and during the walk [he]134-mr. collins particularly attended to [her]88-elizabeth . [His]134-mr. collins accompanying [them]3850-they was a double advantage : [she]88-elizabeth felt all the compliment it offered to [herself]88-elizabeth ; and it was most acceptable as an occasion of introducing [him]134-mr. collins to [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father and [mother]3273-mother . [ [Illustration]110-illustration : “[1036-them] Walked back with [them]1036-them ” Soon after [their]3850-they return , a letter was delivered to [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth ; it came from [Netherfield]2-netherfield , and was opened immediately . The envelope contained a sheet of elegant , little , hot - pressed paper , well covered with [a lady]3226-a lady ’s fair , flowing hand ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth saw [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ’s countenance change as [she]88-elizabeth read it , and saw [her]328-her sister dwelling intently on some particular passages . [Jane]89-jane recollected [herself]89-jane soon ; and putting the letter away , tried to join , with [her]89-jane usual cheerfulness , in the general conversation : but [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth felt an anxiety on the subject which drew off [her]88-elizabeth attention even from [Wickham]142-wickham ; and no sooner had [he]142-wickham and [[his]142-wickham companion]423-his companion taken leave , than a glance from [Jane]89-jane invited [her]89-jane to follow [her]89-jane [upstairs]3537-upstairs . When [they]525-the whole party had gained [[their]525-the whole party own room]3859-their own room , [Jane]89-jane , taking out [her]89-jane letter , said , “[1036-them] This is from [Caroline Bingley]123-caroline : what it contains has surprised [me]0-i a good deal . [The whole party]525-the whole party have left [Netherfield]2-netherfield by this time , and are on [their]525-the whole party way to [town]268-town ; and without any intention of coming back again . [You]1039-you shall hear what [she]123-caroline says . ” [She]89-jane then read the first sentence aloud , which comprised the information of [their]525-the whole party having just resolved to follow [[their]525-the whole party brother]338-their brother to [town]268-town directly , and of [their]525-the whole party meaning to dine that day in [Grosvenor Street]26-grosvenor street , where [Mr. Hurst]95-mr. hurst had [a house]3862-a house . The next was in these words -“‘I[123-caroline] do not pretend to regret anything [I]0-i shall leave in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire except [[your]1039-you society]1040-your society , [[my]0-i dearest friend]1041-my dearest friend ; but [we]1042-we will hope , at some future period , to enjoy many returns of that delightful intercourse [we]1042-we have known , and in the meanwhile may lessen the pain of separation by a very frequent and most unreserved correspondence . [I]0-i depend on [you]1039-you for that . ’ ” To these high - flown expressions [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth listened with all the insensibility of distrust ; and though the suddenness of [their]525-the whole party removal surprised [her]88-elizabeth , [she]88-elizabeth saw nothing in it really to lament : it was not to be supposed that [their]525-the whole party absence from [Netherfield]2-netherfield would prevent [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s being [there]306-there ; and as to the loss of [their]525-the whole party society , [she]88-elizabeth was persuaded that [Jane]89-jane must soon cease to regard it in the enjoyment of [his]85-mr. bingley . “[0-i] It is unlucky , ” said [she]88-elizabeth , after a short pause , “[0-i] that [you]1039-you should not be able to see [[your]1039-you friends]1043-your friends before [they]1043-your friends leave [the country]448-the country . But may [we]1045-we not hope that the period of future happiness , to which [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley looks forward , may arrive earlier than [she]98-miss bingley is aware , and that the delightful intercourse [you]1039-you have known as [friends]1046-friends will be renewed with yet greater satisfaction as [sisters]819-sisters ? [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley will not be detained in [London]5-london by [them]1043-your friends . ” “[123-caroline] [Caroline]123-caroline decidedly says that [none of the party]1048-none of the party will return into [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire this winter . [I]0-i will read it to [you]1039-you . “ ‘ When [[my]0-i brother]465-my brother left [us]1045-we yesterday , [he]465-my brother imagined that the business which took [him]465-my brother to [London]5-london might be concluded in three or four days ; but as [we]1045-we are certain it can not be so , and at the same time convinced that when [Charles]126-charles gets to [town]268-town [he]126-charles will be in no hurry to leave it again , [we]1045-we have determined on following [him]126-charles thither , that [he]126-charles may not be obliged to spend [his]126-charles vacant hours in [a comfortless hotel]3866-a comfortless hotel . [Many of [my]0-i acquaintance]3867-many of my acquaintance are already there for the winter : [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could hear that [you]1039-you , [[my]0-i dearest friend]1041-my dearest friend , had any intention of making one in [the crowd]3869-the crowd , but of that [I]0-i despair . [I]0-i sincerely hope [your]1039-you Christmas in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire may abound in the gaieties which that season generally brings , and that [your]1039-you beaux will be so numerous as to prevent [your]1039-you feeling the loss of [the three of whom [we]3871-we shall deprive [you]1039-you]3870-the three of whom we shall deprive you . ’ “[0-i] It is evident by this , ” added [Jane]89-jane , “[0-i] that [he]1049-he comes back no more this winter . ” “[0-i] It is only evident that [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley does not mean [he]1049-he should . ” “[98-miss bingley] Why will [you]1050-you think so ? It must be [his]1049-he own doing ; [he]1049-he is [[his]1049-he own master]1051-his own master . But [you]1050-you do not know all . [I]0-i will read [you]1050-you the passage which particularly hurts [me]0-i . [I]0-i will have no reserves from [you]1050-you . ‘ [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy is impatient to see [[his]96-mr. darcy sister]565-his sister ; and to confess the truth , [we]1053-we are scarcely less eager to meet [her]565-his sister again . [I]0-i really do not think [Georgiana Darcy]153-georgiana has [her]153-georgiana equal for beauty , elegance , and accomplishments ; and the affection [she]153-georgiana inspires in [Louisa]122-louisa and [myself]0-i is heightened into something still more interesting from the hope [we]1053-we dare to entertain of [her]153-georgiana being hereafter [[our]1053-we sister]1054-our sister . [I]0-i do not know whether [I]0-i ever before mentioned to [you]1050-you [my]0-i feelings on this subject , but [I]0-i will not leave [the country]448-the country without confiding them , and [I]0-i trust [you]1050-you will not esteem [them]1056-them unreasonable . [[My]0-i brother]465-my brother admires [her]153-georgiana greatly already ; [he]465-my brother will have frequent opportunity now of seeing [her]153-georgiana on the most intimate footing ; [her]153-georgiana relations all wish the connection as much as [his]465-my brother own ; and [a sister]436-a sister ’s partiality is not misleading [me]0-i , [I]0-i think , when [I]0-i call [Charles]126-charles most capable of engaging [any woman]603-any woman ’s heart . With all these circumstances to favour an attachment , and nothing to prevent it , am [I]0-i wrong , [[my]0-i dearest]3296-my dearest [Jane]89-jane , in indulging the hope of an event which will secure the happiness of [so many]1061-so many ? ’ What think [you]1050-you of this sentence , [[my]0-i dear]3066-my dear [Lizzy]88-elizabeth ? ” said [Jane]89-jane , as [she]89-jane finished it . “[1050-you] Is it not clear enough ? Does it not expressly declare that [Caroline]123-caroline neither expects nor wishes [me]0-i to be [[her]123-caroline sister]328-her sister ; that [she]123-caroline is perfectly convinced of [[her]123-caroline brother]3181-her brother ’s indifference ; and that if [she]123-caroline suspects the nature of [my]0-i feelings for [him]3181-her brother [she]123-caroline means ( most kindly ! ) to put [me]0-i on [my]0-i guard . Can there be any other opinion on the subject ? ” “[123-caroline] Yes , there can ; for [mine]0-i is totally different . Will [you]1050-you hear it ? ” “[1050-you] Most willingly . ” “[1050-you] [You]1050-you shall have it in a few words . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley sees that [[her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother is in love with [you]1050-you and wants [him]3181-her brother to marry [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy . [She]98-miss bingley follows [him]3181-her brother to [town]268-town in the hope of keeping [him]3181-her brother [there]306-there , and tries to persuade [you]1050-you that [he]3181-her brother does not care about [you]1050-you . ” [Jane]89-jane shook [her]89-jane head . “[89-jane] Indeed , [Jane]89-jane , [you]89-jane ought to believe [me]0-i . [No one who has ever seen [you]1050-you together]1068-no one who has ever seen you together can doubt [his]3181-her brother affection ; [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , [I]0-i am sure , can not : [she]98-miss bingley is not such [a simpleton]3212-a simpleton . Could [she]98-miss bingley have seen half as much love in [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy for [herself]98-miss bingley , [she]98-miss bingley would have ordered [her]98-miss bingley wedding clothes . But the case is this -we are not rich enough or grand enough for [them]1070-them ; and [she]98-miss bingley is the more anxious to get [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy for [[her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother , from the notion that when there has been one inter - marriage , [she]98-miss bingley may have less trouble in achieving a second ; in which there is certainly some ingenuity , and [I]0-i dare say it would succeed if [Miss de Bourgh]138-miss de bourgh were out of the way . But , [[my]0-i dearest]3296-my dearest [Jane]89-jane , [you]89-jane can not seriously imagine that , because [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley tells [you]89-jane [[her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother greatly admires [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy , [he]3181-her brother is in the smallest degree less sensible of [your]89-jane merit than when [he]3181-her brother took leave of [you]89-jane on Tuesday ; or that it will be in [her]98-miss bingley power to persuade [him]3181-her brother that , instead of being in love with [you]89-jane , [he]3181-her brother is very much in love with [[her]98-miss bingley friend]400-her friend . ” “[1075-we] If [we]1075-we thought alike of [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , ” replied [Jane]89-jane , “[98-miss bingley] [your]98-miss bingley representation of all this might make [me]0-i quite easy . But [I]0-i know the foundation is unjust . [Caroline]123-caroline is incapable of wilfully deceiving [anyone]3174-anyone ; and all that [I]0-i can hope in this case is , that [she]123-caroline is deceived [herself]123-caroline . ” “[123-caroline] That is right . [You]98-miss bingley could not have started a more happy idea , since [you]98-miss bingley will not take comfort in [mine]0-i : believe [her]123-caroline to be deceived , by all means . [You]98-miss bingley have now done [your]98-miss bingley duty by [her]123-caroline , and must fret no longer . ” “[98-miss bingley] But , [[my]0-i dear sister]1077-my dear sister , can [I]0-i be happy , even supposing the best , in accepting [a man whose sisters and [friends]1046-friends are all wishing [him]1078-a man whose sisters and friends are all wishing him to marry elsewhere to marry elsewhere]1078-a man whose sisters and friends are all wishing him to marry elsewhere ? ” “[98-miss bingley] [You]98-miss bingley must decide for [yourself]98-miss bingley , ” said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; “[98-miss bingley] and if , upon mature deliberation , [you]98-miss bingley find that the misery of disobliging [[his]1078-a man whose sisters and friends are all wishing him to marry elsewhere two sisters]281-his two sisters is more than equivalent to the happiness of being [[his]1078-a man whose sisters and friends are all wishing him to marry elsewhere wife]236-his wife , [I]0-i advise [you]98-miss bingley , by all means , to refuse [him]1078-a man whose sisters and friends are all wishing him to marry elsewhere . ” “[0-i] How can [you]98-miss bingley talk so ? ” said [Jane]89-jane , faintly smiling ; “[98-miss bingley] [you]98-miss bingley must know , that , though [I]0-i should be exceedingly grieved at [their]281-his two sisters disapprobation , [I]0-i could not hesitate . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i did not think [you]98-miss bingley would ; and that being the case , [I]0-i can not consider [your]98-miss bingley situation with much compassion . ” “[0-i] But if [he]1078-a man whose sisters and friends are all wishing him to marry elsewhere returns no more this winter , [my]0-i choice will never be required . A thousand things may arise in six months . ” The idea of [his]1078-a man whose sisters and friends are all wishing him to marry elsewhere returning no more [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth treated with the utmost contempt . It appeared to [her]88-elizabeth merely the suggestion of [Caroline]123-caroline ’s interested wishes ; and [she]88-elizabeth could not for a moment suppose that those wishes , however openly or artfully spoken , could influence [a young man]3165-a young man so totally independent of [everyone]3873-everyone . [She]88-elizabeth represented to [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , as forcibly as possible , what [she]88-elizabeth felt on the subject , and had soon the pleasure of seeing its happy effect . [Jane]89-jane ’s temper was not desponding ; and [she]89-jane was gradually led to hope , though the diffidence of affection sometimes overcame the hope , that [Bingley]98-miss bingley would return to [Netherfield]2-netherfield , and answer every wish of [her]89-jane heart . [They]3875-they agreed that [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet should only hear of the departure of [the family]414-the family , without being alarmed on the score of [the gentleman]287-the gentleman ’s conduct ; but even this partial communication gave [her]89-jane a great deal of concern , and [she]89-jane bewailed it as exceedingly unlucky that [the ladies]254-the ladies should happen to go away just as [they]254-the ladies were all getting so intimate together . After lamenting it , however , at some length , [she]89-jane had the consolation of thinking that [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley would be soon down again , and soon dining at [Longbourn]7-longbourn ; and the conclusion of all was the comfortable declaration , that , though [he]85-mr. bingley had been invited only to a family dinner , [she]89-jane would take care to have two full courses . [ Illustration ] CHAPTER XXII . [ Illustration ] [The Bennets]105-the bennets were engaged to dine with [the Lucases]106-the lucases ; and again , during the chief of the day , was [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas so kind as to listen to [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth took an opportunity of thanking [her]89-jane . “[0-i] It keeps [him]1082-him in good humour , ” said [she]88-elizabeth , “[0-i] and [I]0-i am more obliged to [you]1082-him than [I]0-i can express . ” [Charlotte]107-charlotte assured [[her]107-charlotte friend]400-her friend of [her]107-charlotte satisfaction in being useful , and that it amply repaid [her]107-charlotte for the little sacrifice of [her]107-charlotte time . This was very amiable ; but [Charlotte]107-charlotte ’s kindness extended farther than [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had any conception of -its object was nothing less than to secure [her]88-elizabeth from any return of [[Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ’s addresses]3880-mr. collins ’s addresses , by engaging [them]3880-mr. collins ’s addresses towards [herself]88-elizabeth . Such was [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas ’s scheme ; and appearances were so favourable , that when [they]3881-they parted at night , [she]88-elizabeth would have felt almost sure of success if [he]1082-him had not been to leave [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire so very soon . But here [she]88-elizabeth did injustice to the fire and independence of [his]1082-him character ; for it led [him]1082-him to escape out of [Longbourn House]22-longbourn house the next morning with admirable slyness , and hasten to [Lucas Lodge]10-lucas lodge to throw [himself]1082-him at [her]88-elizabeth feet . [He]1082-him was anxious to avoid the notice of [[his]1082-him cousins]3580-his cousins , from a conviction that , if [they]3580-his cousins saw [him]1082-him depart , [they]3580-his cousins could not fail to conjecture [his]1082-him design , and [he]1082-him was not willing to have the attempt known till its success could be known likewise ; for , though feeling almost secure , and with reason , for [Charlotte]107-charlotte had been tolerably encouraging , [he]1082-him was comparatively diffident since the adventure of [Wednesday]155-wednesday . [His]1082-him reception , however , was of the most flattering kind . [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas perceived [him]1082-him from an upper window as [he]1082-him walked towards [the house]3075-the house , and instantly set out to meet [him]1082-him accidentally in [the lane]3884-the lane . But little had [she]99-miss lucas dared to hope that so much love and eloquence awaited [her]99-miss lucas [there]306-there . In as short a time as [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ’s long speeches would allow , everything was settled between [them]3886-their to the satisfaction of both ; and as [they]3886-their entered [the house]3075-the house , [he]1082-him earnestly entreated [her]99-miss lucas to name the day that was to make [him]1082-him [the happiest of [men]3889-men]3888-the happiest of men ; and though such a solicitation must be waived for the present , [the lady]590-the lady felt no inclination to trifle with [his]1082-him happiness . The stupidity with which [he]1082-him was favoured by nature must guard [his]1082-him courtship from any charm that could make [a woman]3084-a woman wish for its continuance ; and [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas , who accepted [him]1082-him solely from the pure and disinterested desire of [an establishment]3892-an establishment , cared not how soon that establishment were gained . [Sir William]86-sir william and [Lady Lucas]87-lady lucas were speedily applied to for [their]3886-their consent ; and it was bestowed with a most joyful alacrity . [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ’s present circumstances made it a most eligible match for [[their]3886-their daughter]3893-their daughter , to whom [they]3886-their could give little fortune ; and [his]134-mr. collins prospects of future wealth were exceedingly fair . [Lady Lucas]87-lady lucas began directly to calculate , with more interest than the matter had ever [ [Illustration]110-illustration : “[0-i] So much love and eloquence ” excited before , how many years longer [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet was likely to live ; and [Sir William]86-sir william gave it as [his]86-sir william decided opinion , that whenever [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins should be in possession of [the Longbourn estate]3894-the longbourn estate , it would be highly expedient that both [he]134-mr. collins and [[his]134-mr. collins wife]236-his wife should make [their]3886-their appearance at [St. James ’s]11-st. james . [The whole family]312-the whole family in short were properly overjoyed on the occasion . [The younger girls]3435-the younger girls formed hopes of coming out a year or two sooner than [they]3435-the younger girls might otherwise have done ; and [the boys]3898-the boys were relieved from [their]3898-the boys apprehension of [Charlotte]107-charlotte ’s dying [an old maid]3899-an old maid . [Charlotte]107-charlotte [herself]107-charlotte was tolerably composed . [She]107-charlotte had gained [her]107-charlotte point , and had time to consider of it . [Her]107-charlotte reflections were in general satisfactory . [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins , to be sure , was neither sensible nor agreeable : [his]134-mr. collins society was irksome , and [his]134-mr. collins attachment to [her]107-charlotte must be imaginary . But still [he]134-mr. collins would be [[her]107-charlotte husband]260-her husband . Without thinking highly either of [men]3889-men or of matrimony , marriage had always been [her]107-charlotte object : it was the only honourable provision for [well - educated young women of small fortune , and , however uncertain of giving happiness]3902-well - educated young women of small fortune , and , however uncertain of giving happiness , must be [their]3902-well - educated young women of small fortune , and , however uncertain of giving happiness pleasantest preservative from want . This preservative [she]107-charlotte had now obtained ; and at the age of twenty - seven , without having ever been handsome , [she]107-charlotte felt all the good luck of it . The least agreeable circumstance in the business was the surprise it must occasion to [Elizabeth Bennet]88-elizabeth , whose friendship [she]107-charlotte valued beyond that of [any other person]3903-any other person . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth would wonder , and probably would blame [her]107-charlotte ; and though [her]107-charlotte resolution was not to be shaken , [her]107-charlotte feelings must be hurt by such a disapprobation . [She]107-charlotte resolved to give [her]107-charlotte the information [herself]107-charlotte ; and therefore charged [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins , when [he]134-mr. collins returned to [Longbourn]7-longbourn to dinner , to drop no hint of what had passed before [any of [the family]414-the family]3904-any of the family . A promise of secrecy was of course very dutifully given , but it could not be kept without difficulty ; for the curiosity excited by [his]134-mr. collins long absence burst forth in such very direct questions on [his]134-mr. collins return , as required some ingenuity to evade , and [he]134-mr. collins was at the same time exercising great self - denial , for [he]134-mr. collins was longing to publish [his]134-mr. collins prosperous love . As [he]134-mr. collins was to begin [his]134-mr. collins journey too early on the morrow to see [any of [the family]414-the family]3904-any of the family , the ceremony of leave - taking was performed when [the ladies]254-the ladies moved for the night ; and [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , with great politeness and cordiality , said how happy [they]254-the ladies should be to see [him]134-mr. collins at [Longbourn]7-longbourn again , whenever [his]134-mr. collins other engagements might allow [him]134-mr. collins to visit [them]254-the ladies . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear madam]1024-my dear madam , ” [he]0-i replied , “[0-i] this invitation is particularly gratifying , because it is what [I]0-i have been hoping to receive ; and [you]1024-my dear madam may be very certain that [I]0-i shall avail [myself]0-i of it as soon as possible . ” [They]254-the ladies were all astonished ; and [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet , who could by no means wish for so speedy a return , immediately said,-- “[0-i] But is there not danger of [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine ’s disapprobation here , [[my]0-i good sir]1084-my good sir ? [You]1084-my good sir had better neglect [your]1084-my good sir relations than run the risk of offending [[your]1084-my good sir patroness]1085-your patroness . ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear sir]870-my dear sir , ” replied [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins , “[0-i] [I]0-i am particularly obliged to [you]870-my dear sir for this friendly caution , and [you]870-my dear sir may depend upon [my]0-i not taking so material a step without [[her]93-lady catherine Ladyship]3490-her ladyship ’s concurrence . ” “[870-my dear sir] [You]870-my dear sir can not be too much on [your]870-my dear sir guard . Risk anything rather than [her]93-lady catherine displeasure ; and if [you]870-my dear sir find it likely to be raised by [your]870-my dear sir coming to [us]1088-us again , which [I]0-i should think exceedingly probable , stay quietly at [home]3288-home , and be satisfied that [we]1088-us shall take no offence . ” “[0-i] Believe [me]0-i , [[my]0-i dear sir]870-my dear sir , [my]0-i gratitude is warmly excited by such affectionate attention ; and , depend upon it , [you]870-my dear sir will speedily receive from [me]0-i a letter of thanks for this as well as for every other mark of [your]870-my dear sir regard during [my]0-i stay in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire . As for [[my]0-i fair cousins]686-my fair cousins , though [my]0-i absence may not be long enough to render it necessary , [I]0-i shall now take the liberty of wishing [them]686-my fair cousins health and happiness , not excepting [[my]0-i cousin]3477-my cousin [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . ” With proper civilities , [the ladies]254-the ladies then withdrew ; all of [them]254-the ladies equally surprised to find that [he]870-my dear sir meditated a quick return . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet wished to understand by it that [he]870-my dear sir thought of paying [his]870-my dear sir addresses to [one of [[her]92-mrs. bennet younger girls]3911-her younger girls]3910-one of her younger girls , and [Mary]94-mary might have been prevailed on to accept [him]870-my dear sir . [She]92-mrs. bennet rated [his]870-my dear sir abilities much higher than any of the others : there was a solidity in [his]870-my dear sir reflections which often struck [her]92-mrs. bennet ; and though by no means so clever as [herself]92-mrs. bennet , [she]92-mrs. bennet thought that , if encouraged to read and improve [himself]870-my dear sir by such an example as [hers]92-mrs. bennet , [he]870-my dear sir might become [a very agreeable companion]3912-a very agreeable companion . But on the following morning every hope of this kind was done away . [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas called soon after breakfast , and in a private conference with [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth related the event of the day before . The possibility of [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ’s fancying [himself]870-my dear sir in love with [[her]99-miss lucas friend]400-her friend had once occurred to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth within the last day or two : but that [Charlotte]107-charlotte could encourage [him]870-my dear sir seemed almost as far from possibility as that [she]107-charlotte could encourage [him]870-my dear sir [herself]107-charlotte ; and [her]88-elizabeth astonishment was consequently so great as to overcome at first the bounds of decorum , and [she]88-elizabeth could not help crying out,-- “[88-elizabeth] Engaged to [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ! [[my]0-i dear]3066-my dear [Charlotte]107-charlotte , impossible ! ” The steady countenance which [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas had commanded in telling [her]99-miss lucas story gave way to a momentary confusion here on receiving so direct a reproach ; though , as it was no more than [she]88-elizabeth expected , [she]88-elizabeth soon regained [her]88-elizabeth composure , and calmly replied,-- “[107-charlotte] Why should [you]107-charlotte be surprised , [[my]0-i dear]3066-my dear [Eliza]88-elizabeth ? Do [you]107-charlotte think it incredible that [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins should be able to procure [any woman]603-any woman ’s good opinion , because [he]134-mr. collins was not so happy as to succeed with [you]107-charlotte ? ” But [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had now recollected [herself]88-elizabeth ; and , making a strong effort for it , was able to assure [her]88-elizabeth , with tolerable firmness , that the prospect of [their]3914-their relationship was highly grateful to [her]88-elizabeth , and that [she]88-elizabeth wished [her]88-elizabeth all imaginable happiness . “[107-charlotte] [I]0-i see what [you]107-charlotte are feeling , ” replied [Charlotte]107-charlotte ; “[0-i] [you]107-charlotte must be surprised , very much surprised , so lately as [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins was wishing to marry [you]107-charlotte . But when [you]107-charlotte have had time to think it all over , [I]0-i hope [you]107-charlotte will be satisfied with what [I]0-i have done . [I]0-i am not romantic , [you]107-charlotte know . [I]0-i never was . [I]0-i ask only [a comfortable home]1096-a comfortable home ; and , considering [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ’s character , connections , and situation in life , [I]0-i am convinced that [my]0-i chance of happiness with [him]134-mr. collins is as fair as [most people]1097-most people can boast on entering the marriage state . ” [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth quietly answered “[1097-most people] undoubtedly ; ” and , after an awkward pause , [they]3915-they returned to [the rest of [the family]414-the family]3699-the rest of the family . [Charlotte]107-charlotte did not stay much longer ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was then left to reflect on what [she]88-elizabeth had heard . It was a long time before [she]88-elizabeth became at all reconciled to the idea of so unsuitable a match . The strangeness of [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ’s making two offers of marriage within three days was nothing in comparison of [his]134-mr. collins being now accepted . [She]88-elizabeth had always felt that [Charlotte]107-charlotte ’s opinion of matrimony was not exactly like [her]88-elizabeth own ; but [she]88-elizabeth could not have supposed it possible that , when called into action , [she]88-elizabeth would have sacrificed every better feeling to worldly advantage . [Charlotte]107-charlotte , [the wife of [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins]3918-the wife of mr. collins , was a most humiliating picture ! And to the pang of [a friend]3228-a friend disgracing [herself]107-charlotte , and sunk in [her]107-charlotte esteem , was added the distressing conviction that it was impossible for [that friend]903-that friend to be tolerably happy in the lot [she]107-charlotte had chosen . [ Illustration : “[1097-most people] Protested [he]1098-he must be entirely mistaken . ” CHAPTER XXIII . [ Illustration ] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was sitting with [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother and [sisters]819-sisters , reflecting on what [she]88-elizabeth had heard , and doubting whether [she]88-elizabeth was authorized to mention it , when [Sir William Lucas]86-sir william [himself]86-sir william appeared , sent by [[his]86-sir william daughter]3923-his daughter to announce [her]88-elizabeth engagement to [the family]414-the family . With many compliments to [them]414-the family , and much self - gratulation on the prospect of a connection between [the houses]3925-the houses , [he]86-sir william unfolded the matter,--to [an audience]3926-an audience not merely wondering , but incredulous ; for [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , with more perseverance than politeness , protested [he]86-sir william must be entirely mistaken ; and [Lydia]90-lydia , always unguarded and often uncivil , boisterously exclaimed,-- “[1098-he] [Good Lord]156-good lord ! [Sir William]86-sir william , how can [you]86-sir william tell such a story ? Do not [you]86-sir william know that [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins wants to marry [Lizzy]88-elizabeth ? ” Nothing less than the complaisance of [a courtier]3927-a courtier could have borne without anger such treatment : but [Sir William]86-sir william ’s good - breeding carried [him]86-sir william through it all ; and though [he]86-sir william begged leave to be positive as to the truth of [his]86-sir william information , [he]86-sir william listened to all [their]414-the family impertinence with the most forbearing courtesy . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , feeling it incumbent on [her]88-elizabeth to relieve [him]86-sir william from so unpleasant a situation , now put [herself]88-elizabeth forward to confirm [his]86-sir william account , by mentioning [her]88-elizabeth prior knowledge of it from [Charlotte]107-charlotte [herself]88-elizabeth ; and endeavoured to put a stop to the exclamations of [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother and [sisters]819-sisters , by the earnestness of [her]88-elizabeth congratulations to [Sir William]86-sir william , in which [she]88-elizabeth was readily joined by [Jane]89-jane , and by making a variety of remarks on the happiness that might be expected from the match , the excellent character of [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins , and the convenient distance of [Hunsford]15-hunsford from [London]5-london . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet was , in fact , too much overpowered to say a great deal while [Sir William]86-sir william remained ; but no sooner had [he]86-sir william left [them]3930-them than [her]92-mrs. bennet feelings found a rapid vent . In the first place , [she]92-mrs. bennet persisted in disbelieving the whole of the matter ; secondly , [she]92-mrs. bennet was very sure that [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins had been taken in ; thirdly , [she]92-mrs. bennet trusted that [they]3930-them would never be happy together ; and , fourthly , that the match might be broken off . Two inferences , however , were plainly deduced from the whole : one , that [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was the real cause of all the mischief ; and the other , that [she]88-elizabeth [herself]88-elizabeth had been barbarously used by [them]3930-them all ; and on these two points [she]88-elizabeth principally dwelt during the rest of the day . Nothing could console and nothing appease [her]88-elizabeth . Nor did that day wear out [her]88-elizabeth resentment . A week elapsed before [she]88-elizabeth could see [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth without scolding [her]88-elizabeth : a month passed away before [she]88-elizabeth could speak to [Sir William]86-sir william or [Lady Lucas]87-lady lucas without being rude ; and many months were gone before [she]88-elizabeth could at all forgive [[their]3930-them daughter]3893-their daughter . [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet ’s emotions were much more tranquil on the occasion , and such as [he]81-mr. bennet did experience [he]81-mr. bennet pronounced to be of a most agreeable sort ; for it gratified [him]81-mr. bennet , [he]81-mr. bennet said , to discover that [Charlotte Lucas]107-charlotte , whom [he]81-mr. bennet had been used to think tolerably sensible , was as foolish as [[his]81-mr. bennet wife]236-his wife , and more foolish than [[his]81-mr. bennet daughter]3923-his daughter ! [Jane]89-jane confessed [herself]89-jane a little surprised at the match : but [she]89-jane said less of [her]89-jane astonishment than of [her]89-jane earnest desire for [their]3930-them happiness ; nor could [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth persuade [her]89-jane to consider it as improbable . [Kitty]93-lady catherine and [Lydia]90-lydia were far from envying [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas , for [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins was only [a clergyman]3492-a clergyman ; and it affected [them]3930-them in no other way than as a piece of news to spread at [Meryton]9-meryton . [Lady Lucas]87-lady lucas could not be insensible of triumph on being able to retort on [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet the comfort of having [a daughter well married]3935-a daughter well married ; and [she]87-lady lucas called at [Longbourn]7-longbourn rather oftener than usual to say how happy [she]87-lady lucas was , though [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet ’s sour looks and ill - natured remarks might have been enough to drive happiness away . Between [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth and [Charlotte]107-charlotte there was a restraint which kept [them]3930-them mutually silent on the subject ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth felt persuaded that no real confidence could ever subsist between [them]3930-them again . [Her]88-elizabeth disappointment in [Charlotte]107-charlotte made [her]88-elizabeth turn with fonder regard to [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , of whose rectitude and delicacy [she]88-elizabeth was sure [her]88-elizabeth opinion could never be shaken , and for whose happiness [she]88-elizabeth grew daily more anxious , as [Bingley]85-mr. bingley had now been gone a week , and nothing was heard of [his]85-mr. bingley return . [Jane]89-jane had sent [Caroline]123-caroline an early answer to [her]89-jane letter , and was counting the days till [she]89-jane might reasonably hope to hear again . The promised letter of thanks from [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins arrived on Tuesday , addressed to [[their]3930-them father]252-their father , and written with all the solemnity of gratitude which a twelve - month ’s abode in [the family]414-the family might have prompted . After discharging [his]252-their father conscience on that head , [he]252-their father proceeded to inform [them]3930-them , with many rapturous expressions , of [his]252-their father happiness in having obtained the affection of [[their]3930-them amiable neighbour]3939-their amiable neighbour , [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas , and then explained that it was merely with the view of enjoying [her]99-miss lucas society that [he]252-their father had been so ready to close with [their]3930-them kind wish of seeing [him]252-their father again at [Longbourn]7-longbourn , whither [he]252-their father hoped to be able to return on Monday fortnight ; for [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , [he]252-their father added , so heartily approved [his]252-their father marriage , that [she]93-lady catherine wished it to take place as soon as possible , which [he]252-their father trusted would be an unanswerable argument with [his]252-their father amiable [Charlotte]107-charlotte to name an early day for making [him]252-their father [the happiest of [men]3889-men]3888-the happiest of men . [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ’s return into [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire was no longer a matter of pleasure to [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet . On the contrary , [she]92-mrs. bennet was as much disposed to complain of it as [[her]92-mrs. bennet husband]260-her husband . It was very strange that [he]252-their father should come to [Longbourn]7-longbourn instead of to [Lucas Lodge]10-lucas lodge ; it was also very inconvenient and exceedingly troublesome . [She]92-mrs. bennet hated having [visitors]3943-visitors in [the house]3075-the house while [her]92-mrs. bennet health was so indifferent , and [lovers]3945-lovers were of [all people]3946-all people the most disagreeable . Such were the gentle murmurs of [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , and they gave way only to the greater distress of [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s continued absence . Neither [Jane]89-jane nor [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth were comfortable on this subject . Day after day passed away without bringing any other tidings of [him]252-their father than the report which shortly prevailed in [Meryton]9-meryton of [his]252-their father coming no more to [Netherfield]2-netherfield the whole winter ; a report which highly incensed [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , and which [she]92-mrs. bennet never failed to contradict as a most scandalous falsehood . [Even Elizabeth]88-elizabeth began to fear -- not that [Bingley]85-mr. bingley was indifferent -- but that [[his]252-their father sisters]284-his sisters would be successful in keeping [him]252-their father away . Unwilling as [she]88-elizabeth was to admit an idea so destructive to [Jane]89-jane ’s happiness , and so dishonourable to the stability of [[her]88-elizabeth lover]3948-her lover , [she]88-elizabeth could not prevent its frequently recurring . The united efforts of [[his]252-their father two unfeeling sisters]3949-his two unfeeling sisters , and of [[his]252-their father overpowering friend]3950-his overpowering friend , assisted by the attractions of [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy and the amusements of [London]5-london , might be too much , [she]88-elizabeth feared , for the strength of [his]252-their father attachment . As for [Jane]89-jane , [her]89-jane anxiety under this suspense was , of course , more painful than [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s : but whatever [she]89-jane felt [she]89-jane was desirous of concealing ; and between [herself]89-jane and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , therefore , the subject was never alluded to . But as no such delicacy restrained [[her]89-jane mother]246-her mother , an hour seldom passed in which [she]246-her mother did not talk of [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , express [her]246-her mother impatience for [his]252-their father arrival , or even require [Jane]89-jane to confess that if [he]252-their father did not come back [she]89-jane should think [herself]89-jane very ill - used . It needed all [Jane]89-jane ’s steady mildness to bear these attacks with tolerable tranquillity . [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins returned most punctually on the Monday fortnight , but [his]134-mr. collins reception at [Longbourn]7-longbourn was not quite so gracious as it had been on [his]134-mr. collins first introduction . [He]134-mr. collins was too happy , however , to need much attention ; and , luckily for [the others]511-the others , the business of love - making relieved [them]511-the others from a great deal of [his]134-mr. collins company . The chief of every day was spent by [him]134-mr. collins at [Lucas Lodge]10-lucas lodge , and [he]134-mr. collins sometimes returned to [Longbourn]7-longbourn only in time to make an apology for [his]134-mr. collins absence before [the family]414-the family went to bed . [ [Illustration]110-illustration : “[134-mr. collins] Whenever [she]1099-she spoke in a low voice ” ] [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet was really in a most pitiable state . The very mention of anything concerning the match threw [her]92-mrs. bennet into an agony of ill - humour , and wherever [she]92-mrs. bennet went [she]92-mrs. bennet was sure of hearing it talked of . The sight of [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas was odious to [her]92-mrs. bennet . As [[her]92-mrs. bennet successor in [that house]3955-that house]3954-her successor in that house , [she]92-mrs. bennet regarded [her]92-mrs. bennet with jealous abhorrence . Whenever [Charlotte]107-charlotte came to see [them]3956-them , [she]92-mrs. bennet concluded [her]92-mrs. bennet to be anticipating the hour of possession ; and whenever [she]92-mrs. bennet spoke in a low voice to [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins , was convinced that [they]3956-them were talking of [the Longbourn estate]3894-the longbourn estate , and resolving to turn [herself]92-mrs. bennet and [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughters]242-her daughters out of [the house]3075-the house as soon as [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet was dead . [She]92-mrs. bennet complained bitterly of all this to [[her]92-mrs. bennet husband]260-her husband . “[1099-she] Indeed , [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet , ” said [she]92-mrs. bennet , “[81-mr. bennet] it is very hard to think that [Charlotte Lucas]107-charlotte should ever be [mistress of [this house]3479-this house]1100-mistress of this house , that [I]0-i should be forced to make way for [her]107-charlotte , and live to see [her]107-charlotte take [my]0-i place in [it]3479-this house ! ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]3066-my dear , do not give way to such gloomy thoughts . Let [us]1103-us hope for better things . Let [us]1103-us flatter [ourselves]1103-us that [I]0-i may be [the survivor]1104-the survivor . ” This was not very consoling to [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet ; and , therefore , instead of making any answer , [she]92-mrs. bennet went on as before . “[0-i] [I]0-i can not bear to think that [they]1105-their should have all [this estate]681-this estate . If it was not for the entail , [I]0-i should not mind it . ” “[0-i] What should not [you]0-i mind ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i should not mind anything at all . ” “[0-i] Let [us]1103-us be thankful that [you]0-i are preserved from a state of such insensibility . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i never can be thankful , [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet , for anything about the entail . How [anyone]3174-anyone could have the conscience to entail away [an estate from [one ’s own daughters]1109-one ’s own daughters]1108-an estate from one ’s own daughters [I]0-i can not understand ; and all for the sake of [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins , too ! Why should [he]134-mr. collins have it more than [anybody else]1110-anybody else ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i leave it to [yourself]0-i to determine , ” said [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet . [ Illustration ] CHAPTER XXIV . [ Illustration ] [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s letter arrived , and put an end to doubt . The very first sentence conveyed the assurance of [their]1105-their being all settled in [London]5-london for the winter , and concluded with [[her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother ’s regret at not having had time to pay [his]3181-her brother respects to [[his]3181-her brother friends]405-his friends in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire before [he]3181-her brother left [the country]448-the country . Hope was over , entirely over ; and when [Jane]89-jane could attend to the rest of the letter , [she]89-jane found little , except the professed affection of [the writer]3964-the writer , that could give [her]89-jane any comfort . [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy ’s praise occupied [the chief of it]3767-the chief of it . [Her]128-miss darcy many attractions were again dwelt on ; and [Caroline]123-caroline boasted joyfully of [their]1105-their increasing intimacy , and ventured to predict the accomplishment of the wishes which had been unfolded in [her]123-caroline former letter . [She]123-caroline wrote also with great pleasure of [[her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother ’s being [an inmate of [[Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s house]3968-mr. darcy ’s house]3967-an inmate of mr. darcy ’s house , and mentioned with raptures some plans of the latter with regard to new furniture . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , to whom [Jane]89-jane very soon communicated [the chief of all this]3969-the chief of all this , heard it in silent indignation . [Her]89-jane heart was divided between concern for [[her]98-miss bingley sister]328-her sister and resentment against [all others]3971-all others . To [Caroline]123-caroline ’s assertion of [[her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother ’s being partial to [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy , [she]98-miss bingley paid no credit . That [he]3181-her brother was really fond of [Jane]89-jane , [she]98-miss bingley doubted no more than [she]98-miss bingley had ever done ; and much as [she]98-miss bingley had always been disposed to like [him]3181-her brother , [she]98-miss bingley could not think without anger , hardly without contempt , on that easiness of temper , that want of proper resolution , which now made [him]3181-her brother [the slave of [[his]3181-her brother designing friends]3974-his designing friends]3973-the slave of his designing friends , and led [him]3181-her brother to sacrifice [his]3181-her brother own happiness to the caprice of [their]3974-his designing friends inclinations . Had [his]3181-her brother own happiness , however , been the only sacrifice , [he]3181-her brother might have been allowed to sport with it in whatever manner [he]3181-her brother thought best ; but [[her]98-miss bingley sister]328-her sister ’s was involved in it , as [she]98-miss bingley thought [he]3181-her brother must be sensible [himself]3181-her brother . It was a subject , in short , on which reflection would be long indulged , and must be unavailing . [She]98-miss bingley could think of nothing else ; and yet , whether [Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s regard had really died away , or were suppressed by [[his]3181-her brother friends]405-his friends ’ interference ; whether [he]3181-her brother had been aware of [Jane]89-jane ’s attachment , or whether it had escaped [his]3181-her brother observation ; whichever were the case , though [her]98-miss bingley opinion of [him]3181-her brother must be materially affected by the difference , [[her]98-miss bingley sister]328-her sister ’s situation remained the same , [her]328-her sister peace equally wounded . A day or two passed before [Jane]89-jane had courage to speak of [her]89-jane feelings to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; but at last , on [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet ’s leaving [them]3978-them together , after a longer irritation than usual about [Netherfield]2-netherfield and [its master]3979-its master , [she]89-jane could not help saying,-- “[0-i] O that [[my]0-i dear mother]1111-my dear mother had more command over [herself]1111-my dear mother ! [she]1111-my dear mother can have no idea of the pain [she]1111-my dear mother gives [me]0-i by [her]1111-my dear mother continual reflections on [him]1112-him . But [I]0-i will not repine . It can not last long . [He]1112-him will be forgot , and [we]1113-we shall all be as [we]1113-we were before . ” [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth looked at [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister with incredulous solicitude , but said nothing . “[1114-you] [You]1114-you doubt [me]0-i , ” cried [Jane]89-jane , slightly colouring ; “[1114-you] indeed , [you]1114-you have no reason . [He]1112-him may live in [my]0-i memory as [the most amiable man of [my]0-i acquaintance]1115-the most amiable man of my acquaintance but that is all . [I]0-i have nothing either to hope or fear , and nothing to reproach [him]1112-him with . Thank [God]102-god [I]0-i have not that pain . A little time , therefore -- [I]0-i shall certainly try to get the better---- ” With a stronger voice [she]89-jane soon added , “[0-i] [I]0-i have this comfort immediately , that it has not been more than an error of fancy on [my]0-i side , and that it has done no harm to [anyone]3174-anyone but [myself]0-i . ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]3066-my dear [Jane]89-jane , ” exclaimed [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “[0-i] [you]89-jane are too good . [Your]89-jane sweetness and disinterestedness are really angelic ; [I]0-i do not know what to say to [you]89-jane . [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i had never done [you]89-jane justice , or loved [you]89-jane as [you]89-jane deserve . ” [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth eagerly disclaimed all extraordinary merit , and threw back the praise on [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ’s warm affection . “[0-i] Nay , ” said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “[0-i] this is not fair . [You]89-jane wish to think all [the world]304-the world respectable , and are hurt if [I]0-i speak ill of [anybody]3171-anybody . [I]0-i only want to think [you]89-jane perfect , and [you]89-jane set [yourself]89-jane against it . Do not be afraid of [my]0-i running into any excess , of [my]0-i encroaching on [your]89-jane privilege of universal good - will . [You]89-jane need not . There are [few people whom [I]0-i really love]1120-few people whom i really love , and still fewer of whom [I]0-i think well . The more [I]0-i see of [the world]304-the world the more am [I]0-i dissatisfied with it ; and every day confirms [my]0-i belief of the inconsistency of [all human characters]1122-all human characters , and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of either merit or sense . [I]0-i have met with two instances lately : one [I]0-i will not mention , the other is [Charlotte]107-charlotte ’s marriage . It is unaccountable ! in every view it is unaccountable ! ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]3066-my dear [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , do not give way to such feelings as these . [They]1124-they will ruin [your]88-elizabeth happiness . [You]88-elizabeth do not make allowance enough for difference of situation and temper . Consider [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ’s respectability , and [Charlotte]107-charlotte ’s prudent , steady character . Remember that [she]107-charlotte is [one of [a large family]1126-a large family]1125-one of a large family ; that as to fortune it is a most eligible match ; and be ready to believe , for [everybody]305-everybody ’s sake , that [she]107-charlotte may feel something like regard and esteem for [[our]1128-our cousin]1129-our cousin . ” “[88-elizabeth] To oblige [you]88-elizabeth , [I]0-i would try to believe almost anything , but [no one else]1130-no one else could be benefited by such a belief as this ; for were [I]0-i persuaded that [Charlotte]107-charlotte had any regard for [him]134-mr. collins , [I]0-i should only think worse of [her]107-charlotte understanding than [I]0-i now do of [her]107-charlotte heart . [[My]0-i dear]3066-my dear [Jane]89-jane , [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins is [a conceited , pompous , narrow - minded , silly man]1132-a conceited , pompous , narrow - minded , silly man : [you]89-jane know [he]134-mr. collins is , as well as [I]0-i do ; and [you]89-jane must feel , as well as [I]0-i do , that [the woman who marries [him]134-mr. collins]1133-the woman who marries him can not have a proper way of thinking . [You]89-jane shall not defend [her]107-charlotte , though it is [Charlotte Lucas]107-charlotte . [You]89-jane shall not , for the sake of [one individual]1134-one individual , change the meaning of principle and integrity , nor endeavour to persuade [yourself]89-jane or [me]0-i , that selfishness is prudence , and insensibility of danger security for happiness . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i must think [your]89-jane language too strong in speaking of both , ” replied [Jane]89-jane ; “[89-jane] and [I]0-i hope [you]89-jane will be convinced of it , by seeing [them]1135-them happy together . But enough of this . [You]89-jane alluded to something else . [You]89-jane mentioned two instances . [I]0-i can not misunderstand [you]89-jane , but [I]0-i entreat [you]89-jane , [dear [Lizzy]88-elizabeth]1136-dear lizzy , not to pain [me]0-i by thinking [that person]1137-that person to blame , and saying [your]89-jane opinion of [him]1137-that person is sunk . [We]1138-we must not be so ready to fancy [ourselves]1138-we intentionally injured . [We]1138-we must not expect [a lively young man]1139-a lively young man to be always so guarded and circumspect . It is very often nothing but [our]1138-we own vanity that deceives [us]1138-we . [Women]3180-women fancy admiration means more than it does . ” “[3180-women] And [men]3889-men take care that [they]3889-men should . ” “[3889-men] If it is designedly done , [they]3889-men can not be justified ; but [I]0-i have no idea of there being so much design in [the world]304-the world as [some persons]1143-some persons imagine . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am far from attributing any part of [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s conduct to design , ” said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; “[0-i] but , without scheming to do wrong , or to make [others]3175-others unhappy , there may be error and there may be misery . Thoughtlessness , want of attention to [other people]1145-other people ’s feelings , and want of resolution , will do the business . ” “[0-i] And do [you]0-i impute it to either of [those]1146-those ? ” “[0-i] Yes ; to the last . But if [I]0-i go on [I]0-i shall displease [you]0-i by saying what [I]0-i think of [persons]817-persons [you]0-i esteem . [They]284-his sisters can only wish [his]85-mr. bingley happiness ; and if [he]85-mr. bingley is attached to [me]0-i [no other woman]1150-no other woman can secure it . ” “[284-his sisters] [Your]0-i first position is false . [They]284-his sisters have known [her]128-miss darcy much longer than [they]284-his sisters have known [me]0-i ; no wonder if [they]284-his sisters love [her]128-miss darcy better . What [sister]1153-sister would think [herself]1153-sister at liberty to do it , unless there were something very objectionable ? If [they]284-his sisters believed [him]85-mr. bingley attached to [me]0-i [they]284-his sisters would not try to part [us]1154-us ; if [he]85-mr. bingley were so , [they]284-his sisters could not succeed . By supposing such an affection , [you]0-i make [everybody]305-everybody acting unnaturally and wrong , and [me]0-i most unhappy . Do not distress [me]0-i by the idea . [I]0-i am not ashamed of having been mistaken -- or , at least , it is slight , it is nothing in comparison of what [I]0-i should feel in thinking ill of [him]85-mr. bingley or [[his]85-mr. bingley sisters]284-his sisters . Let [me]0-i take it in the best light , in the light in which it may be understood . ” [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth could not oppose such a wish ; and from this time [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s name was scarcely ever mentioned between [them]1154-us . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet still continued to wonder and repine at [his]85-mr. bingley returning no more ; and though a day seldom passed in which [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth did not account for it clearly , there seemed little chance of [her]88-elizabeth ever considering it with less perplexity . [[Her]92-mrs. bennet daughter]461-her daughter endeavoured to convince [her]92-mrs. bennet of what [she]92-mrs. bennet did not believe [herself]92-mrs. bennet , that [his]85-mr. bingley attentions to [Jane]89-jane had been merely the effect of a common and transient liking , which ceased when [he]85-mr. bingley saw [her]89-jane no more ; but though the probability of the statement was admitted at the time , [she]92-mrs. bennet had the same story to repeat every day . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet ’s best comfort was , that [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley must be down again in the summer . [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet treated the matter differently . “[0-i] So , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , ” said [he]0-i , one day , “[88-elizabeth] [[your]88-elizabeth sister]3211-your sister is crossed in love , [I]0-i find . [I]0-i congratulate [her]3211-your sister . Next to being married , [a girl]802-a girl likes to be crossed in love a little now and then . It is something to think of , and gives [her]802-a girl a sort of distinction among [[her]802-a girl companions]1159-her companions . When is [your]88-elizabeth turn to come ? [You]88-elizabeth will hardly bear to be long outdone by [Jane]89-jane . Now is [your]88-elizabeth time . [We]1166-we must not all expect [Jane]89-jane ’s good fortune . ” “[89-jane] True , ” said [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet ; “[89-jane] but it is a comfort to think that , whatever of that kind may befall [you]88-elizabeth , [you]88-elizabeth have [an affectionate mother who will always make the most of it . ” [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham ’s society]3983-an affectionate mother who will always make the most of it . ” mr. wickham ’s society was of material service in dispelling the gloom which the late perverse occurrences had thrown on [many of [the Longbourn family]3558-the longbourn family]3984-many of the longbourn family . [ Illustration ] CHAPTER XXV . [ Illustration ] After a week spent in professions of love and schemes of felicity , [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins was called from [[his]134-mr. collins amiable Charlotte]3991-his amiable charlotte by the arrival of Saturday . The pain of separation , however , might be alleviated on [his]134-mr. collins side by preparations for the reception of [[his]134-mr. collins bride]3992-his bride , as [he]134-mr. collins had reason to hope , that shortly after [his]134-mr. collins next return into [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , the day would be fixed that was to make [him]134-mr. collins [the happiest of [men]3889-men]3888-the happiest of men . [He]134-mr. collins took leave of [[his]134-mr. collins relations]3535-his relations at [Longbourn]7-longbourn with as much solemnity as before ; wished [[his]134-mr. collins fair cousins]3522-his fair cousins health and happiness again , and promised [[their]3522-his fair cousins father]252-their father another letter of thanks . On the following Monday , [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet had the pleasure of receiving [[her]92-mrs. bennet brother]3181-her brother and [[his]134-mr. collins wife]236-his wife , who came , as usual , to spend the Christmas at [Longbourn]7-longbourn . [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner was [a sensible , gentlemanlike man , greatly superior to [[his]157-mr. gardiner sister]565-his sister , as well by nature as education]4000-a sensible , gentlemanlike man , greatly superior to his sister , as well by nature as education . [The Netherfield ladies]4002-the netherfield ladies would have had difficulty in believing that [a man who lived by trade]4003-a man who lived by trade , and within view of [[his]157-mr. gardiner own warehouses]4004-his own warehouses , could have been so well - bred and agreeable . [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner , who was several years younger than [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet and [Mrs. Philips]117-mrs. philips , was [an amiable , intelligent , elegant woman]4005-an amiable , intelligent , elegant woman , and a great favourite with [[her]129-mrs. gardiner Longbourn nieces]4006-her longbourn nieces . Between [the two eldest]395-the two eldest and [herself]129-mrs. gardiner especially , there subsisted a very particular regard . [They]4006-her longbourn nieces had frequently been staying with [her]129-mrs. gardiner in [town]268-town . The first part of [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner ’s business , on [her]129-mrs. gardiner arrival , was to distribute [her]129-mrs. gardiner presents and describe the newest fashions . When this was done , [she]129-mrs. gardiner had a less active part to play . It became [her]129-mrs. gardiner turn to listen . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet had many grievances to relate , and much to complain of . [They]4006-her longbourn nieces had all been very ill - used since [she]129-mrs. gardiner last saw [[her]129-mrs. gardiner sister]328-her sister . [Two of [[her]129-mrs. gardiner girls]4011-her girls]4010-two of her girls had been on the point of marriage , and after all there was nothing in it . “[0-i] [I]0-i do not blame [Jane]89-jane , ” [she]129-mrs. gardiner continued , “[0-i] for [Jane]89-jane would have got [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley if [she]89-jane could . But , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth ! Oh , [sister]1153-sister ! it is very hard to think that [she]89-jane might have been [[Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ’s wife]1168-mr. collins ’s wife by this time , had not it been for [her]89-jane own perverseness . [He]85-mr. bingley made [her]89-jane an offer in [this very room]1169-this very room , and [she]89-jane refused [him]85-mr. bingley . The consequence of it is , that [Lady Lucas]87-lady lucas will have [a daughter]1170-a daughter married before [I]0-i have , and that [Longbourn estate]3494-longbourn estate is just as much entailed as ever . [The Lucases]106-the lucases are [very artful people]1172-very artful people , indeed , [sister]1153-sister . [They]106-the lucases are all for what [they]106-the lucases can get . [I]0-i am sorry to say it of [them]106-the lucases , but so it is . It makes [me]0-i very nervous and poorly , to be thwarted so in [[my]0-i own family]1174-my own family , and to have neighbours who think of [themselves]1175-themselves before [anybody else]1110-anybody else . However , [your]1153-sister coming just at this time is the greatest of comforts , and [I]0-i am very glad to hear what [you]1153-sister tell [us]1177-us of long sleeves . ” [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner , to whom [the chief of this news]4012-the chief of this news had been given before , in the course of [Jane]89-jane and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s correspondence with [her]129-mrs. gardiner , made [[her]129-mrs. gardiner sister]328-her sister a slight answer , and , in compassion to [[her]129-mrs. gardiner nieces]3117-her nieces , turned the conversation . When alone with [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth afterwards , [she]129-mrs. gardiner spoke more on the subject . “[1153-sister] It seems likely to have been a desirable match for [Jane]89-jane , ” said [she]129-mrs. gardiner . “[0-i] [I]0-i am sorry it went off . But these things happen so often ! [A young man]3165-a young man , such as [you]1153-sister describe [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , so easily falls in love with [a pretty girl]1179-a pretty girl for a few weeks , and , when accident separates [them]1180-them , so easily forgets [her]1179-a pretty girl , that these sort of inconstancies are very frequent . ” [ Illustration : “[1181-offended two or three young ladies] [Offended two or three young ladies]1181-offended two or three young ladies ” “[1181-offended two or three young ladies] An excellent consolation in its way , ” said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; “[1181-offended two or three young ladies] but it will not do for [us]1182-us . [We]1182-us do not suffer by accident . It does not often happen that the interference of [friends]1046-friends will persuade [a young man of independent fortune]1184-a young man of independent fortune to think no more of [a girl whom [he]1184-a young man of independent fortune was violently in love with only a few days before]1185-a girl whom he was violently in love with only a few days before . ” “[1046-friends] But that expression of ‘ violently in love ’ is so hackneyed , so doubtful , so indefinite , that it gives [me]0-i very little idea . It is as often applied to feelings which arise only from a half hour ’s acquaintance , as to a real , strong attachment . Pray , how violent was [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s love ? ” “[85-mr. bingley] [I]0-i never saw a more promising inclination ; [he]85-mr. bingley was growing quite inattentive to [other people]1145-other people , and wholly engrossed by [her]1179-a pretty girl . Every time [they]1180-them met , it was more decided and remarkable . At [his]85-mr. bingley own ball [he]85-mr. bingley offended [two or three young ladies]1187-two or three young ladies by not asking [them]1187-two or three young ladies to dance ; and [I]0-i spoke to [him]85-mr. bingley twice [myself]0-i without receiving an answer . Could there be finer symptoms ? Is not general incivility the very essence of love ? ” “[0-i] Oh , yes ! of that kind of love which [I]0-i suppose [him]85-mr. bingley to have felt . Poor [Jane]89-jane ! [I]0-i am sorry for [her]89-jane , because , with [her]89-jane disposition , [she]89-jane may not get over it immediately . It had better have happened to [you]1188-you , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth ; [you]1188-you would have laughed [yourself]1188-you out of it sooner . But do [you]1188-you think [she]89-jane would be prevailed on to go back with [us]1189-we ? Change of scene might be of service -- and perhaps a little relief from [home]3288-home may be as useful as anything . ” [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was exceedingly pleased with this proposal , and felt persuaded of [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ’s ready acquiescence . “[0-i] [I]0-i hope , ” added [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner , “[0-i] that no consideration with regard to [this young man]1191-this young man will influence [her]89-jane . [We]1189-we live in so different [a part of [town]268-town]1192-a part of town , all [our]1189-we connections are so different , and , as [you]1188-you well know , [we]1189-we go out so little , that it is very improbable [they]1194-they should meet at all , unless [he]1191-this young man really comes to see [her]89-jane . ” “[1191-this young man] And that is quite impossible ; for [he]1191-this young man is now in the custody of [[his]1191-this young man friend]288-his friend , and [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy would no more suffer [him]1191-this young man to call on [Jane]89-jane in [such a part of [London]5-london]1196-such a part of london ! [[My]0-i dear aunt]1197-my dear aunt , how could [you]1188-you think of it ? [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy may , perhaps , have heard of such a place as [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street , but [he]1191-this young man would hardly think a month ’s ablution enough to cleanse [him]1191-this young man from its impurities , were [he]1191-this young man once to enter [it]1198-it ; and , depend upon it , [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley never stirs without [him]1191-this young man . ” “[85-mr. bingley] So much the better . [I]0-i hope [they]1199-they will not meet at all . But does not [Jane]89-jane correspond with [[his]85-mr. bingley sister]565-his sister ? [She]89-jane will not be able to help calling . ” “[89-jane] [She]89-jane will drop the acquaintance entirely . ” But , in spite of the certainty in which [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth affected to place this point , as well as the still more interesting one of [Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s being withheld from seeing [Jane]89-jane , [she]88-elizabeth felt a solicitude on the subject which convinced [her]88-elizabeth , on examination , that [she]88-elizabeth did not consider it entirely hopeless . It was possible , and sometimes [she]88-elizabeth thought it probable , that [his]85-mr. bingley affection might be re - animated , and the influence of [[his]85-mr. bingley friends]405-his friends successfully combated by the more natural influence of [Jane]89-jane ’s attractions . [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth accepted [[her]88-elizabeth aunt]4017-her aunt ’s invitation with pleasure ; and [the Bingleys]158-the bingleys were no otherwise in [her]88-elizabeth thoughts at the same time than as [she]88-elizabeth hoped , by [Caroline]123-caroline ’s not living in [the same house]737-the same house with [[her]88-elizabeth brother]3181-her brother , [she]88-elizabeth might occasionally spend a morning with [her]88-elizabeth , without any danger of seeing [him]3181-her brother . [The Gardiners]159-the gardiners stayed a week at [Longbourn]7-longbourn ; and what with [the Philipses]143-the philipses , [the Lucases]418-the lucases , and [the officers]452-the officers , there was not a day without [its]4022-its engagement . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet had so carefully provided for the entertainment of [[her]92-mrs. bennet brother]3181-her brother and [sister]1153-sister , that [they]452-the officers did not once sit down to a family dinner . When the engagement was for [home]3288-home , [some of [the officers]452-the officers]4026-some of the officers always made part of it , of which [officers Mr. Wickham]142-wickham was sure to be one ; and on these occasions [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner , rendered suspicious by [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s warm commendation of [him]3181-her brother , narrowly observed [them]452-the officers both . Without supposing [them]452-the officers , from what [she]88-elizabeth saw , to be very seriously in love , [their]452-the officers preference of [each other]3216-each other was plain enough to make [her]88-elizabeth a little uneasy ; and [she]88-elizabeth resolved to speak to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth on the subject before [she]88-elizabeth left [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , and represent to [her]88-elizabeth the imprudence of encouraging such an attachment . To [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner , [Wickham]142-wickham had one means of affording pleasure , unconnected with [his]142-wickham general powers . About ten or a dozen years ago , before [her]88-elizabeth marriage , [she]88-elizabeth had spent a considerable time in [that very part of [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire to which [he]142-wickham belonged]4029-that very part of derbyshire to which he belonged . [They]452-the officers had , therefore , many acquaintance in common ; and , though [Wickham]142-wickham had been little there since the death of [[Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s father]4030-darcy ’s father , five years before , it was yet in [his]142-wickham power to give [her]88-elizabeth fresher intelligence of [[her]88-elizabeth former friends]4031-her former friends than [she]88-elizabeth had been in the way of procuring . [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner had seen [Pemberley]12-pemberley , and known [the late Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy by character perfectly well . Here , consequently , was an inexhaustible subject of discourse . In comparing [her]88-elizabeth recollection of [Pemberley]12-pemberley with the minute description which [Wickham]142-wickham could give , and in bestowing [her]88-elizabeth tribute of praise on the character of [its late possessor]4032-its late possessor , [she]88-elizabeth was delighting both [him]142-wickham and [herself]88-elizabeth . On being made acquainted with [the present Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s treatment of [him]142-wickham , [she]88-elizabeth tried to remember something of [that gentleman]3371-that gentleman ’s reputed disposition , when quite [a lad]4034-a lad , which might agree with it ; and was confident , at last , that [she]88-elizabeth recollected having heard [Mr. Fitzwilliam Darcy]96-mr. darcy formerly spoken of as [a very proud , ill - natured boy]4035-a very proud , ill - natured boy . [ Illustration : “[89-jane] Will [you]1201-you come and see [me]0-i ? ” ] CHAPTER XXVI . [ Illustration ] [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner ’s caution to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was punctually and kindly given on the first favourable opportunity of speaking to [her]88-elizabeth alone : after honestly telling [her]88-elizabeth what [she]88-elizabeth thought , [she]88-elizabeth thus went on - “[1201-you] [You]1201-you are too sensible [a girl]802-a girl , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , to fall in love merely because [you]1201-you are warned against it ; and , therefore , [I]0-i am not afraid of speaking openly . Seriously , [I]0-i would have [you]1201-you be on [your]1201-you guard . Do not involve [yourself]1201-you , or endeavour to involve [him]1203-he , in an affection which the want of fortune would make so very imprudent . [I]0-i have nothing to say against [him]1203-he : [he]1203-he is [a most interesting young man]1204-a most interesting young man ; and if [he]1203-he had the fortune [he]1203-he ought to have , [I]0-i should think [you]1201-you could not do better . But as it is -- [you]1201-you must not let [your]1201-you fancy run away with [you]1201-you . [You]1201-you have sense , and [we]1205-we all expect [you]1201-you to use it . [[Your]1201-you father]3292-your father would depend on [your]1201-you resolution and good conduct , [I]0-i am sure . [You]1201-you must not disappoint [[your]1201-you father]3292-your father . ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear aunt]1197-my dear aunt , this is being serious indeed . ” “[1197-my dear aunt] Yes , and [I]0-i hope to engage [you]1201-you to be serious likewise . ” “[0-i] Well , then , [you]1201-you need not be under any alarm . [I]0-i will take care of [myself]0-i , and of [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham too . [He]142-wickham shall not be in love with [me]0-i , if [I]0-i can prevent it . ” “[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , [you]1201-you are not serious now . ” “[1201-you] [I]0-i beg [your]1201-you pardon . [I]0-i will try again . At present [I]0-i am not in love with [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham ; no , [I]0-i certainly am not . But [he]142-wickham is , beyond all comparison , [the most agreeable man [I]0-i ever saw]1209-the most agreeable man i ever saw -- and if [he]142-wickham becomes really attached to [me]0-i -- [I]0-i believe it will be better that [he]142-wickham should not . [I]0-i see the imprudence of it . Oh , that abominable [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ! [[My]0-i father]3323-my father ’s opinion of [me]0-i does [me]0-i the greatest honour ; and [I]0-i should be miserable to forfeit it . [[My]0-i father]3323-my father , however , is partial to [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham . In short , [[my]0-i dear aunt]1197-my dear aunt , [I]0-i should be very sorry to be the means of making any of [you]1197-my dear aunt unhappy ; but since [we]1213-we see , every day , that where there is affection [young people]3233-young people are seldom withheld , by immediate want of fortune , from entering into engagements with [each other]3216-each other , how can [I]0-i promise to be wiser than so many of [my]0-i fellow - creatures , if [I]0-i am tempted , or how am [I]0-i even to know that it would be wiser to resist ? All that [I]0-i can promise [you]1197-my dear aunt , therefore , is not to be in a hurry . [I]0-i will not be in a hurry to believe [myself]0-i [his]142-wickham first object . When [I]0-i am in company with [him]142-wickham , [I]0-i will not be wishing . In short , [I]0-i will do [my]0-i best . ” “[0-i] Perhaps it will be as well if [you]1197-my dear aunt discourage [his]142-wickham coming [here]3067-here so very often . At least [you]1197-my dear aunt should not remind [[your]1197-my dear aunt mother]967-your mother of inviting [him]142-wickham . ” “[1197-my dear aunt] As [I]0-i did the other day , ” said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , with a conscious smile ; “[0-i] very true , it will be wise in [me]0-i to refrain from that . But do not imagine that [he]142-wickham is always here so often . It is on [your]1197-my dear aunt account that [he]142-wickham has been so frequently invited this week . [You]1197-my dear aunt know [[my]0-i mother]3295-my mother ’s ideas as to the necessity of constant company for [[her]3295-my mother friends]311-her friends . But really , and upon [my]0-i honour , [I]0-i will try to do what [I]0-i think to be wisest ; and now [I]0-i hope [you]1197-my dear aunt are satisfied . ” [[Her]88-elizabeth aunt]4017-her aunt assured [her]88-elizabeth that [she]88-elizabeth was ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , having thanked [her]4017-her aunt for the kindness of [her]4017-her aunt hints , [they]4037-they parted,--a wonderful instance of advice being given on such a point without being resented . [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins returned into [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire soon after [it]4-hertfordshire had been quitted by [the Gardiners]159-the gardiners and [Jane]89-jane ; but , as [he]134-mr. collins took up [[his]134-mr. collins abode]4038-his abode with [the Lucases]106-the lucases , [his]134-mr. collins arrival was no great inconvenience to [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet . [His]134-mr. collins marriage was now fast approaching ; and [she]92-mrs. bennet was at length so far resigned as to think it inevitable , and even repeatedly to say , in an ill - natured tone , that [she]92-mrs. bennet “[0-i] wished [they]1220-they might be happy . ” Thursday was to be the wedding - day , and on Wednesday [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas paid [her]99-miss lucas farewell visit ; and when [she]99-miss lucas rose to take leave , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , ashamed of [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother ’s ungracious and reluctant good wishes , and sincerely affected [herself]88-elizabeth , accompanied [her]99-miss lucas out of [the room]255-the room . As [they]1222-they went down [stairs]523-stairs together , [Charlotte]107-charlotte said,-- “[0-i] [I]0-i shall depend on hearing from [you]1221-you very often , [Eliza]88-elizabeth . ” “[88-elizabeth] That [you]1221-you certainly shall . ” “[88-elizabeth] And [I]0-i have another favour to ask . Will [you]1221-you come and see [me]0-i ? ” “[1221-you] [We]1222-they shall often meet , [I]0-i hope , in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am not likely to leave [Kent]17-kent for some time . Promise [me]0-i , therefore , to come to [Hunsford]15-hunsford . ” [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth could not refuse , though [she]88-elizabeth foresaw little pleasure in the visit . “[0-i] [[My]0-i father]3323-my father and [Maria]101-maria are to come to [me]0-i in [March]29-march , ” added [Charlotte]107-charlotte , “[0-i] and [I]0-i hope [you]1221-you will consent to be of [the party]3132-the party .
