Indeed , [Eliza]88-elizabeth , [you]1221-you will be as welcome to [me]0-i as [either of [them]1226-them]1225-either of them . ” The wedding took place : [the bride]4042-the bride and [bridegroom]4043-bridegroom set off for [Kent]17-kent from [the church]761-the church door , and [everybody]305-everybody had as much to say or to hear on the subject as usual . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth soon heard from [[her]88-elizabeth friend]400-her friend , and [their]4047-their correspondence was as regular and frequent as it ever had been : that it should be equally unreserved was impossible . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth could never address [her]400-her friend without feeling that all the comfort of intimacy was over ; and , though determined not to slacken as [a correspondent]4048-a correspondent , it was for the sake of what had been rather than what was . [Charlotte]107-charlotte ’s first letters were received with a good deal of eagerness : there could not but be curiosity to know how [she]107-charlotte would speak of [[her]107-charlotte new home]4049-her new home , how [she]107-charlotte would like [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , and how happy [she]107-charlotte would dare pronounce [herself]107-charlotte to be ; though , when the letters were read , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth felt that [Charlotte]107-charlotte expressed [herself]107-charlotte on every point exactly as [she]107-charlotte might have foreseen . [She]107-charlotte wrote cheerfully , seemed surrounded with comforts , and mentioned nothing which [she]107-charlotte could not praise . [The house]3075-the house , furniture , [neighbourhood]4051-neighbourhood , and [roads]4052-roads , were all to [her]107-charlotte taste , and [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine ’s behaviour was most friendly and obliging . It was [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ’s picture of [Hunsford]15-hunsford and [Rosings]18-rosings rationally softened ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth perceived that [she]88-elizabeth must wait for [her]88-elizabeth own visit [there]306-there , to know the rest . [Jane]89-jane had already written a few lines to [[her]89-jane sister]328-her sister , to announce [their]4055-their safe arrival in [London]5-london ; and when [she]89-jane wrote again , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth hoped it would be in [her]88-elizabeth power to say something of [the Bingleys]158-the bingleys . [Her]88-elizabeth impatience for this second letter was as well rewarded as impatience generally is . [Jane]89-jane had been a week in [town]268-town , without either seeing or hearing from [Caroline]123-caroline . [She]89-jane accounted for it , however , by supposing that [her]89-jane last letter to [[her]89-jane friend]400-her friend from [Longbourn]7-longbourn had by some accident been lost . “[88-elizabeth] [[My]0-i aunt]3279-my aunt , ” [she]89-jane continued , “[88-elizabeth] is going to - morrow into [that part of [the town]3847-the town]1228-that part of the town , and [I]0-i shall take the opportunity of calling in [Grosvenor Street]26-grosvenor street . ” [She]89-jane wrote again when the visit was paid , and [she]89-jane had seen [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley . “[0-i] [I]0-i did not think [Caroline]123-caroline in spirits , ” were [her]89-jane words , “[0-i] but [she]123-caroline was very glad to see [me]0-i , and reproached [me]0-i for giving [her]123-caroline no notice of [my]0-i coming to [London]5-london . [I]0-i was right , therefore ; [my]0-i last letter had never reached [her]123-caroline . [I]0-i inquired after [[their]1230-their brother]338-their brother , of course . [He]338-their brother was well , but so much engaged with [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy that [they]1230-their scarcely ever saw [him]338-their brother . [I]0-i found that [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy was expected to dinner : [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could see [her]128-miss darcy . [My]0-i visit was not long , as [Caroline]123-caroline and [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst were going out . [I]0-i dare say [I]0-i shall soon see [them]1230-their here . ” [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth shook [her]88-elizabeth head over this letter . It convinced [her]88-elizabeth that accident only could discover to [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ’s being in [town]268-town . Four weeks passed away , and [Jane]89-jane saw nothing of [him]85-mr. bingley . [She]89-jane endeavoured to persuade [herself]89-jane that [she]89-jane did not regret it ; but [she]89-jane could no longer be blind to [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s inattention . After waiting at [home]3288-home every morning for a fortnight , and inventing every evening a fresh excuse for [her]89-jane , [the visitor]4061-the visitor did at last appear ; but the shortness of [her]89-jane stay , and , yet more , the alteration of [her]89-jane manner , would allow [Jane]89-jane to deceive [herself]89-jane no longer . The letter which [she]89-jane wrote on this occasion to [[her]89-jane sister]328-her sister will prove what [she]89-jane felt - “[0-i] [[My]0-i dearest]3296-my dearest [Lizzy]88-elizabeth will , [I]0-i am sure , be incapable of triumphing in [her]88-elizabeth better judgment , at [my]0-i expense , when [I]0-i confess [myself]0-i to have been entirely deceived in [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s regard for [me]0-i . But , [[my]0-i dear sister]1077-my dear sister , though the event has proved [you]1077-my dear sister right , do not think [me]0-i obstinate if [I]0-i still assert that , considering what [her]88-elizabeth behaviour was , [my]0-i confidence was as natural as [your]1077-my dear sister suspicion . [I]0-i do not at all comprehend [her]88-elizabeth reason for wishing to be intimate with [me]0-i ; but , if the same circumstances were to happen again , [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i should be deceived again . [Caroline]123-caroline did not return [my]0-i visit till yesterday ; and not a note , not a line , did [I]0-i receive in the meantime . When [she]88-elizabeth did come , it was very evident that [she]88-elizabeth had no pleasure in it ; [she]88-elizabeth made a slight , formal apology for not calling before , said not a word of wishing to see [me]0-i again , and was , in every respect , so altered [a creature]1234-a creature , that when [she]88-elizabeth went away [I]0-i was perfectly resolved to continue the acquaintance no longer . [I]0-i pity , though [I]0-i can not help blaming , [her]88-elizabeth . [She]88-elizabeth was very wrong in singling [me]0-i out as [she]88-elizabeth did ; [I]0-i can safely say , that every advance to intimacy began on [her]88-elizabeth side . But [I]0-i pity [her]88-elizabeth , because [she]88-elizabeth must feel that [she]88-elizabeth has been acting wrong , and because [I]0-i am very sure that anxiety for [[her]88-elizabeth brother]3181-her brother is the cause of it . [I]0-i need not explain [myself]0-i farther ; and though [we]1236-we know this anxiety to be quite needless , yet if [she]88-elizabeth feels it , it will easily account for [her]88-elizabeth behaviour to [me]0-i ; and so deservedly dear as [he]3181-her brother is to [[his]3181-her brother sister]565-his sister , whatever anxiety [she]88-elizabeth may feel on [his]3181-her brother behalf is natural and amiable . [I]0-i can not but wonder , however , at [her]88-elizabeth having any such fears now , because if [he]3181-her brother had at all cared about [me]0-i , [we]1236-we must have met long , long ago . [He]3181-her brother knows of [my]0-i being in [town]268-town , [I]0-i am certain , from something [she]88-elizabeth said [herself]88-elizabeth ; and yet it would seem , by [her]88-elizabeth manner of talking , as if [she]88-elizabeth wanted to persuade [herself]88-elizabeth that [he]3181-her brother is really partial to [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy . [I]0-i can not understand it . If [I]0-i were not afraid of judging harshly , [I]0-i should be almost tempted to say , that there is a strong appearance of duplicity in all this . [I]0-i will endeavour to banish every painful thought , and think only of what will make [me]0-i happy , [your]1239-you affection , and the invariable kindness of [[my]0-i dear uncle]1240-my dear uncle and [aunt]1241-aunt . Let [me]0-i hear from [you]1239-you very soon . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley said something of [his]3181-her brother never returning to [Netherfield]2-netherfield again , of giving up [the house]3075-the house , but not with any certainty . [We]1243-we had better not mention it . [I]0-i am extremely glad that [you]1239-you have such pleasant accounts from [[our]1243-we friends]1244-our friends at [Hunsford]15-hunsford . Pray go to see [them]1244-our friends , with [Sir William]86-sir william and [Maria]101-maria . [I]0-i am sure [you]1239-you will be very comfortable [there]306-there . “ [Yours]1239-you , etc . ”[0-i] This letter gave [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth some pain ; but [her]88-elizabeth spirits returned , as [she]88-elizabeth considered that [Jane]89-jane would no longer be duped , by [the sister]1246-the sister at least . All expectation from [the brother]1247-the brother was now absolutely over . [She]88-elizabeth would not even wish for any renewal of [his]1247-the brother attentions . [His]1247-the brother character sunk on every review of it ; and , as a punishment for [him]1247-the brother , as well as a possible advantage to [Jane]89-jane , [she]88-elizabeth seriously hoped [he]1247-the brother might really soon marry [[Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s sister]1248-mr. darcy ’s sister , as , by [Wickham]142-wickham ’s account , [she]88-elizabeth would make [him]1247-the brother abundantly regret what [he]1247-the brother had thrown away . [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner about this time reminded [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth of [her]129-mrs. gardiner promise concerning [that gentleman]3371-that gentleman , and required information ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had such to send as might rather give contentment to [[her]88-elizabeth aunt]4017-her aunt than to [herself]88-elizabeth . [His]1247-the brother apparent partiality had subsided , [his]1247-the brother attentions were over , [he]1247-the brother was [the admirer of [some one else]1252-some one else]1251-the admirer of some one else . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was watchful enough to see it all , but [she]88-elizabeth could see it and write of it without material pain . [Her]88-elizabeth heart had been but slightly touched , and [her]88-elizabeth vanity was satisfied with believing that [she]88-elizabeth would have been [his]1247-the brother only choice , had fortune permitted it . The sudden acquisition of ten thousand pounds was the most remarkable charm of [the young lady to whom [he]1247-the brother was now rendering [himself]1247-the brother agreeable]1253-the young lady to whom he was now rendering himself agreeable ; but [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , less clear - sighted perhaps in this case than in [Charlotte]107-charlotte ’s , did not quarrel with [him]1247-the brother for [his]1247-the brother wish of independence . Nothing , on the contrary , could be more natural ; and , while able to suppose that it cost [him]1247-the brother a few struggles to relinquish [her]88-elizabeth , [she]88-elizabeth was ready to allow it a wise and desirable measure for both , and could very sincerely wish [him]1247-the brother happy . All this was acknowledged to [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner ; and , after relating the circumstances , [she]129-mrs. gardiner thus went on -“I am now convinced , [[my]129-mrs. gardiner dear aunt]1197-my dear aunt , that [I]129-mrs. gardiner have never been much in love ; for had [I]129-mrs. gardiner really experienced that pure and elevating passion , [I]129-mrs. gardiner should at present detest [his]1247-the brother very name , and wish [him]1247-the brother all manner of evil . But [my]129-mrs. gardiner feelings are not only cordial towards [him]1247-the brother , they are even impartial towards [Miss King]100-miss king . [I]129-mrs. gardiner can not find out that [I]129-mrs. gardiner hate [her]100-miss king at all , or that [I]129-mrs. gardiner am in the least unwilling to think [her]100-miss king [a very good sort of girl]4064-a very good sort of girl . There can be no love in all this . [My]129-mrs. gardiner watchfulness has been effectual ; and though [I]129-mrs. gardiner should certainly be a more interesting object to all [my]129-mrs. gardiner acquaintance , were [I]129-mrs. gardiner distractedly in love with [him]1247-the brother , [I]129-mrs. gardiner can not say that [I]129-mrs. gardiner regret [my]129-mrs. gardiner comparative insignificance . Importance may sometimes be purchased too dearly . [Kitty]93-lady catherine and [Lydia]90-lydia take [his]1247-the brother defection much more to heart than [I]129-mrs. gardiner do . [They]4065-they are young in the ways of [the world]304-the world , and not yet open to the mortifying conviction that [handsome young men]4067-handsome young men must have something to live on as well as [the plain]4068-the plain . ”[129-mrs. gardiner] [ Illustration : “ On [the Stairs]30-the stairs ”[129-mrs. gardiner] ] CHAPTER XXVII . [ Illustration ] With no greater events than these in [the Longbourn family]3558-the longbourn family , and otherwise diversified by little beyond the walks to [Meryton]9-meryton , sometimes dirty and sometimes cold , did [January]14-january and [February]163-february pass away . [March]29-march was to take [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth to [Hunsford]15-hunsford . [She]88-elizabeth had not at first thought very seriously of going thither ; but [Charlotte]107-charlotte , [she]88-elizabeth soon found , was depending on the plan , and [she]88-elizabeth gradually learned to consider it [herself]88-elizabeth with greater pleasure as well as greater certainty . [Absence]165-absence had increased [her]88-elizabeth desire of seeing [Charlotte]107-charlotte again , and weakened [her]88-elizabeth disgust of [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins . There was novelty in the scheme ; and as , with such [a mother]1255-a mother and [such uncompanionable sisters]1256-such uncompanionable sisters , [home]3288-home could not be faultless , a little change was not unwelcome for its own sake . The journey would , moreover , give [her]88-elizabeth a peep at [Jane]89-jane ; and , in short , as the time drew near , [she]88-elizabeth would have been very sorry for any delay . Everything , however , went on smoothly , and was finally settled according to [Charlotte]107-charlotte ’s first sketch . [She]107-charlotte was to accompany [Sir William]86-sir william and [[his]86-sir william second daughter]245-his second daughter . The improvement of spending a night in [London]5-london was added in time , and the plan became as perfect as plan could be . The only pain was in leaving [[her]107-charlotte father]249-her father , who would certainly miss [her]107-charlotte , and who , when it came to the point , so little liked [her]107-charlotte going , that [he]249-her father told [her]107-charlotte to write to [him]249-her father , and almost promised to answer [her]107-charlotte letter . The farewell between [herself]107-charlotte and [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham was perfectly friendly ; on [his]249-her father side even more . [His]249-her father present pursuit could not make [him]249-her father forget that [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had been the first to excite and to deserve [his]249-her father attention , [the first to listen and to pity]1260-the first to listen and to pity , the first to be admired ; and in [his]249-her father manner of bidding [her]88-elizabeth adieu , wishing [her]88-elizabeth every enjoyment , reminding [her]88-elizabeth of what [she]88-elizabeth was to expect in [Lady Catherine de Bourgh]93-lady catherine , and trusting [their]1261-their opinion of [her]88-elizabeth -- [their]1261-their opinion of [everybody]305-everybody -- would always coincide , there was a solicitude , an interest , which [she]88-elizabeth felt must ever attach [her]88-elizabeth to [him]249-her father with a most sincere regard ; and [she]88-elizabeth parted from [him]249-her father convinced , that , whether married or single , [he]249-her father must always be [her]88-elizabeth model of [the amiable and pleasing]1263-the amiable and pleasing . [[Her]88-elizabeth fellow - travellers]1264-her fellow - travellers the next day were not of a kind to make [her]88-elizabeth think [him]249-her father less agreeable . [Sir William Lucas]86-sir william , and [[his]86-sir william daughter]3923-his daughter [Maria]101-maria , [a good - humoured girl , but as empty - headed as [himself]86-sir william]1266-a good - humoured girl , but as empty - headed as himself , had nothing to say that could be worth hearing , and were listened to with about as much delight as the rattle of the chaise . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth loved absurdities , but [she]88-elizabeth had known [Sir William]86-sir william ’s too long . [He]86-sir william could tell [her]88-elizabeth nothing new of the wonders of [his]86-sir william presentation and knighthood ; and [his]86-sir william civilities were worn out , like [his]86-sir william information . It was a journey of only twenty - four miles , and [they]1267-they began it so early as to be in [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street by noon . As [they]1267-they drove to [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner ’s door , [Jane]89-jane was at a drawing - room window watching [their]1267-they arrival : when [they]1267-they entered [the passage]1268-the passage , [she]89-jane was there to welcome [them]1267-they , and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , looking earnestly in [her]89-jane face , was pleased to see it healthful and lovely as ever . On the stairs were [a troop of [little boys]1270-little boys and [girls]3124-girls , whose eagerness for [[their]1269-a troop of little boys and girls , whose eagerness for their cousin ’s appearance would not allow them to wait in the drawing - room , and whose shyness , as they had not seen her for a twelvemonth , prevented their coming lower cousin]3506-their cousin ’s appearance would not allow [them]1269-a troop of little boys and girls , whose eagerness for their cousin ’s appearance would not allow them to wait in the drawing - room , and whose shyness , as they had not seen her for a twelvemonth , prevented their coming lower to wait in [the drawing - room]524-the drawing - room , and whose shyness , as [they]1269-a troop of little boys and girls , whose eagerness for their cousin ’s appearance would not allow them to wait in the drawing - room , and whose shyness , as they had not seen her for a twelvemonth , prevented their coming lower had not seen [her]89-jane for a twelvemonth , prevented [their]1269-a troop of little boys and girls , whose eagerness for their cousin ’s appearance would not allow them to wait in the drawing - room , and whose shyness , as they had not seen her for a twelvemonth , prevented their coming lower coming lower]1269-a troop of little boys and girls , whose eagerness for their cousin ’s appearance would not allow them to wait in the drawing - room , and whose shyness , as they had not seen her for a twelvemonth , prevented their coming lower . All was joy and kindness . The day passed most pleasantly away ; the morning in bustle and shopping , and the evening at [one of [the theatres]1275-the theatres]1274-one of the theatres . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth then contrived to sit by [[her]88-elizabeth aunt]4017-her aunt . [Their]1267-they first subject was [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ; and [she]88-elizabeth was more grieved than astonished to hear , in reply to [her]88-elizabeth minute inquiries , that though [Jane]89-jane always struggled to support [her]89-jane spirits , there were periods of dejection . It was reasonable , however , to hope that [they]1267-they would not continue long . [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner gave [her]88-elizabeth the particulars also of [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s visit in [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street , and repeated conversations occurring at different times between [Jane]89-jane and [herself]89-jane , which proved that [the former]327-the former had , from [her]327-the former heart , given up the acquaintance . [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner then rallied [[her]129-mrs. gardiner niece]1279-her niece on [Wickham]142-wickham ’s desertion , and complimented [her]1279-her niece on bearing it so well . “ But , [my]129-mrs. gardiner dear [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , ”[129-mrs. gardiner] [she]129-mrs. gardiner added , “ what sort of girl is [Miss King]100-miss king ? [I]129-mrs. gardiner should be sorry to think [[our]1267-they friend]4069-our friend [mercenary]4070-mercenary . ”[129-mrs. gardiner] “ Pray , [[my]129-mrs. gardiner dear aunt]1197-my dear aunt , what is the difference in matrimonial affairs , between [the mercenary]4072-the mercenary and the prudent motive ? Where does discretion end , and avarice begin ? Last Christmas [you]1197-my dear aunt were afraid of [his]4069-our friend marrying [me]129-mrs. gardiner , because it would be imprudent ; and now , because [he]4069-our friend is trying to get [a girl with only ten thousand pounds]4073-a girl with only ten thousand pounds , [you]1197-my dear aunt want to find out that [he]4069-our friend is [mercenary]4070-mercenary . ”[129-mrs. gardiner] “ If [you]1197-my dear aunt will only tell [me]129-mrs. gardiner what sort of girl [Miss King]100-miss king is , [I]129-mrs. gardiner shall know what to think . ”[129-mrs. gardiner] “ [She]100-miss king is [a very good kind of girl]4075-a very good kind of girl , [I]129-mrs. gardiner believe . [I]129-mrs. gardiner know no harm of [her]100-miss king . ”[129-mrs. gardiner] “ But [he]4069-our friend paid [her]100-miss king not the smallest attention till [[her]100-miss king grandfather]4076-her grandfather ’s death made [her]100-miss king mistress of this fortune ? ”[129-mrs. gardiner] “ No -- why should [he]4069-our friend ? If it were not allowable for [him]4069-our friend to gain [my]129-mrs. gardiner affections , because [I]129-mrs. gardiner had no money , what occasion could there be for making love to [a girl whom [he]4069-our friend did not care about]4077-a girl whom he did not care about , and who was equally poor ? ”[129-mrs. gardiner] “ But there seems indelicacy in directing [his]4069-our friend attentions towards [her]100-miss king so soon after this event . ”[129-mrs. gardiner] “ [A man in distressed circumstances]4078-a man in distressed circumstances has not time for all those elegant decorums which [other people]1145-other people may observe . If [she]100-miss king does not object to it , why should [we]4080-we ? ”[129-mrs. gardiner] “ [Her]100-miss king not objecting does not justify [him]4069-our friend . It only shows [her]100-miss king being deficient in something [herself]100-miss king -- sense or feeling . ”[129-mrs. gardiner] “ Well , ”[88-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ have it as [you]4069-our friend choose . [He]4069-our friend shall be mercenary , and [she]100-miss king shall be foolish . ”[88-elizabeth] “ No , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , that is what [I]129-mrs. gardiner do not choose . [I]129-mrs. gardiner should be sorry , [you]4069-our friend know , to think ill of [a young man who has lived so long in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire]4081-a young man who has lived so long in derbyshire . ”[129-mrs. gardiner] “ Oh , if that is all , [I]88-elizabeth have a very poor opinion of [young men who live in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire]4082-young men who live in derbyshire ; and [[their]4082-young men who live in derbyshire intimate friends who live in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire]4083-their intimate friends who live in hertfordshire are not much better . [I]88-elizabeth am sick of [them]4082-young men who live in derbyshire all . Thank heaven ! [I]88-elizabeth am going to - morrow where [I]88-elizabeth shall find [a man who has not one agreeable quality]4084-a man who has not one agreeable quality , who has neither manners nor sense to recommend [him]4084-a man who has not one agreeable quality . [Stupid men]4085-stupid men are [the only ones worth knowing]4086-the only ones worth knowing , after all . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Take care , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth ; that speech savours strongly of disappointment . ”[129-mrs. gardiner] Before [they]1280-we were separated by the conclusion of the play , [she]1281-she had the unexpected happiness of an invitation to accompany [[her]1281-she uncle]579-her uncle and [aunt]1241-aunt in a tour of pleasure which [they]1280-we proposed taking in the summer . “ [We]1280-we have not quite determined how far it shall carry [us]1280-we , ”[129-mrs. gardiner] said [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner ; “ but perhaps , to [the Lakes]4087-the lakes . ”[129-mrs. gardiner] No scheme could have been more agreeable to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , and [her]88-elizabeth acceptance of the invitation was most ready and grateful . “ [[My]1281-she dear]3066-my dear , [dear aunt]4089-dear aunt , ”[1281-she] [she]1281-she rapturously cried , “ what delight ! what felicity ! [You]4089-dear aunt give [me]1281-she fresh life and vigour . Adieu to disappointment and spleen . What are [men]3889-men to rocks and [mountains]4091-mountains ? Oh , what hours of transport [we]1280-we shall spend ! And when [we]1280-we do return , it shall not be like [other travellers]4092-other travellers , without being able to give one accurate idea of anything . [We]1280-we will know where [we]1280-we have gone -- [we]1280-we will recollect what [we]1280-we have seen . [Lakes , mountains]4093-lakes , mountains , and [rivers]4094-rivers , shall not be jumbled together in [our]1280-we imaginations ; nor , when [we]1280-we attempt to describe any particular scene , will [we]1280-we begin quarrelling about its relative situation . Let [our]1280-we first effusions be less insupportable than those of the generality of [travellers]4095-travellers . ”[1281-she] [ Illustration : “ At the door ”[1281-she] ] CHAPTER XXVIII . [ Illustration ] Every object in the next day ’s journey was new and interesting to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; and [her]88-elizabeth spirits were in a state of enjoyment ; for [she]88-elizabeth had seen [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister looking so well as to banish all fear for [her]88-elizabeth health , and the prospect of [her]88-elizabeth northern tour was a constant source of delight . When [they]1285-they left [the high road]1286-the high road for [the lane]3884-the lane to [Hunsford]15-hunsford , every eye was in search of [the Parsonage]1288-the parsonage , and every turning expected to bring [it]1288-the parsonage in view . The paling of [Rosings park]18-rosings was [their]1285-they boundary on one side . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth smiled at the recollection of all that [she]88-elizabeth had heard of [[its]1288-the parsonage inhabitants]1289-its inhabitants . At length [the Parsonage]1288-the parsonage was discernible . [The garden]1291-the garden sloping to [the road]1292-the road , [the house]3075-the house standing in [it]1288-the parsonage , the green pales and the laurel hedge , everything declared [they]1285-they were arriving . [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins and [Charlotte]107-charlotte appeared at the door , and [the carriage]3286-the carriage stopped at the small gate , which led by a short gravel walk to [the house]3075-the house , amidst the nods and smiles of [the whole party]525-the whole party . In a moment [they]1285-they were all out of the chaise , rejoicing at the sight of [each other]3216-each other . [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins welcomed [[her]166-mrs. collins friend]400-her friend with the liveliest pleasure , and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was more and more satisfied with coming , when [she]88-elizabeth found [herself]88-elizabeth so affectionately received . [She]88-elizabeth saw instantly that [[her]88-elizabeth cousin]821-her cousin ’s manners were not altered by [his]821-her cousin marriage : [his]821-her cousin formal civility was just what it had been ; and [he]821-her cousin detained [her]88-elizabeth some minutes at the gate to hear and satisfy [his]821-her cousin inquiries after [all [her]88-elizabeth family]1300-all her family . [They]1285-they were then , with no other delay than [his]821-her cousin pointing out the neatness of the entrance , taken into [the house]3075-the house ; and as soon as [they]1285-they were in [the parlour]1302-the parlour , [he]821-her cousin welcomed [them]1285-they a second time , with ostentatious formality , to [[his]821-her cousin humble abode]1303-his humble abode , and punctually repeated all [[his]821-her cousin wife]236-his wife ’s offers of refreshment . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was prepared to see [him]821-her cousin in [his]821-her cousin glory ; and [she]88-elizabeth could not help fancying that in displaying the good proportion of [the room]255-the room , [its]255-the room aspect , and [its]255-the room furniture , [he]821-her cousin addressed [himself]821-her cousin particularly to [her]88-elizabeth , as if wishing to make [her]88-elizabeth feel what [she]88-elizabeth had lost in refusing [him]821-her cousin . But though everything seemed neat and comfortable , [she]88-elizabeth was not able to gratify [him]821-her cousin by any sigh of repentance ; and rather looked with wonder at [[her]88-elizabeth friend]400-her friend , that [she]88-elizabeth could have so cheerful an air with [such a companion]1307-such a companion . When [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins said anything of which [[his]134-mr. collins wife]236-his wife might reasonably be ashamed , which certainly was not seldom , [she]236-his wife involuntarily turned [her]236-his wife eye on [Charlotte]107-charlotte . Once or twice [she]236-his wife could discern a faint blush ; but in general [Charlotte]107-charlotte wisely did not hear . After sitting long enough to admire every article of furniture in [the room]255-the room , from the sideboard to the fender , to give an account of [their]1310-them journey , and of all that had happened in [London]5-london , [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins invited [them]1310-them to take a stroll in [the garden]1291-the garden , which was large and well laid out , and to the cultivation of which [he]134-mr. collins attended [himself]134-mr. collins . To work in [[his]134-mr. collins garden]1312-his garden was one of [his]134-mr. collins most respectable pleasures ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth admired the command of countenance with which [Charlotte]107-charlotte talked of the healthfulness of the exercise , and owned [she]88-elizabeth encouraged it as much as possible . Here , leading the way through every walk and cross walk , and scarcely allowing [them]1310-them an interval to utter the praises [he]134-mr. collins asked for , every view was pointed out with a minuteness which left beauty entirely behind . [He]134-mr. collins could number [the fields]1313-the fields in every direction , and could tell how many trees there were in the most distant clump . But of all the views which [[his]134-mr. collins garden]1312-his garden , or which [the country]448-the country or [the kingdom]919-the kingdom could boast , none were to be compared with the prospect of Rosings , afforded by an opening in the trees that bordered [the park]1317-the park nearly opposite the front of [[his]134-mr. collins house]3182-his house . It was [a handsome modern building]1319-a handsome modern building , well situated on rising ground . From [[his]134-mr. collins garden]1312-his garden , [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins would have led [them]1310-them round [[his]134-mr. collins two meadows]1321-his two meadows ; but [the ladies , not having shoes to encounter the remains of a white frost]1322-the ladies , not having shoes to encounter the remains of a white frost , turned back ; and while [Sir William]86-sir william accompanied [him]134-mr. collins , [Charlotte]107-charlotte took [[her]107-charlotte sister]328-her sister and friend over [the house]3075-the house , extremely well pleased , probably , to have the opportunity of showing [it]3075-the house without [[her]107-charlotte husband]260-her husband ’s help . [It]3075-the house was rather small , but well built and convenient ; and everything was fitted up and arranged with a neatness and consistency , of which [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth gave [Charlotte]107-charlotte all the credit . When [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins could be forgotten , there was really a great air of comfort throughout , and by [Charlotte]107-charlotte ’s evident enjoyment of it , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth supposed [he]134-mr. collins must be often forgotten . [She]88-elizabeth had already learnt that [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine was still in [the country]448-the country . It was spoken of again while [they]1327-us were at dinner , when [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins joining in , observed,-- “ Yes , [Miss Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , [you]88-elizabeth will have the honour of seeing [Lady Catherine de Bourgh]93-lady catherine on the ensuing Sunday at [church]4096-church , and [I]134-mr. collins need not say [you]88-elizabeth will be delighted with [her]93-lady catherine . [She]93-lady catherine is all affability and condescension , and [I]134-mr. collins doubt not but [you]88-elizabeth will be honoured with some portion of [her]93-lady catherine notice when service is over . [I]134-mr. collins have scarcely any hesitation in saying that [she]93-lady catherine will include [you]88-elizabeth and [[my]134-mr. collins sister]3345-my sister [Maria]101-maria in every invitation with which [she]93-lady catherine honours [us]1327-us during [your]88-elizabeth stay [here]3067-here . [Her]93-lady catherine behaviour to [[my]134-mr. collins dear]3066-my dear [Charlotte]107-charlotte is charming . [We]1327-us dine at Rosings twice every week , and are never allowed to walk [home]3288-home . [[Her]93-lady catherine Ladyship]3490-her ladyship ’s carriage is regularly ordered for [us]1327-us . [I]134-mr. collins should say , one of [[her]93-lady catherine Ladyship]3490-her ladyship ’s carriages , for [she]93-lady catherine has several . ”[134-mr. collins] “ [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine is [a very respectable , sensible woman]4103-a very respectable , sensible woman , indeed , ”[107-charlotte] added [Charlotte]107-charlotte , “ and [a most attentive neighbour]4104-a most attentive neighbour . ”[107-charlotte] “ Very true , [[my]134-mr. collins dear]3066-my dear , that is exactly what [I]134-mr. collins say . [She]93-lady catherine is the sort of woman whom [one]3113-one can not regard with too much deference . ”[134-mr. collins] The evening was spent chiefly in talking over Hertfordshire news , and telling again what had been already written ; and when it closed , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , in the solitude of [[her]88-elizabeth chamber]1328-her chamber , had to meditate upon [Charlotte]107-charlotte ’s degree of contentment , to understand [her]107-charlotte address in guiding , and composure in bearing with , [[her]107-charlotte husband]260-her husband , and to acknowledge that it was all done very well . [She]88-elizabeth had also to anticipate how [her]107-charlotte visit would pass , the quiet tenour of [their]1330-their usual employments , the vexatious interruptions of [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins , and the gaieties of [their]1330-their intercourse with [Rosings]1331-rosings . A lively imagination soon settled it all . About the middle of the next day , as [she]88-elizabeth was in [[her]88-elizabeth room]493-her room getting ready for a walk , a sudden noise below seemed to speak [the whole house]1333-the whole house in confusion ; and , after listening a moment , [she]88-elizabeth heard [somebody]837-somebody running [upstairs]3537-upstairs in a violent hurry , and calling loudly after [her]88-elizabeth . [She]88-elizabeth opened the door , and met [Maria]101-maria in [the landing - place]1336-the landing - place , who , breathless with agitation , cried out,-- [ Illustration : “ In Conversation with [the ladies]254-the ladies ”[101-maria] [ Copyright 1894 by [George Allen]167-george allen . ] ] “ Oh , [my]88-elizabeth dear [Eliza]88-elizabeth ! pray make haste and come into [the dining - room]3520-the dining - room , for there is such a sight to be seen ! [I]88-elizabeth will not tell [you]88-elizabeth what it is . Make haste , and come down this moment . ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth asked questions in vain ; [Maria]101-maria would tell [her]88-elizabeth nothing more ; and down [they]1337-they ran into [the dining - room]3520-the dining - room which fronted [the lane]3884-the lane , in quest of this wonder ; it was [two ladies]1340-two ladies , stopping in a low phaeton at the garden gate . “ And is this all ? ”[88-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ [I]88-elizabeth expected at least that the pigs were got into [the garden]1291-the garden , and here is nothing but [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine and [[her]93-lady catherine daughter]461-her daughter ! ”[88-elizabeth] “ La ! [[my]101-maria dear]3066-my dear , ”[101-maria] said [Maria]101-maria , quite shocked at the mistake , “ it is not [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine . [The old lady]4112-the old lady is [Mrs. Jenkinson]152-mrs. jenkinson , who lives with [them]1337-they . The other is [Miss De Bourgh]138-miss de bourgh . Only look at [her]138-miss de bourgh . [She]138-miss de bourgh is quite a little creature . Who would have thought [she]138-miss de bourgh could be so thin and small ! ”[101-maria] “ [She]138-miss de bourgh is abominably rude to keep [Charlotte]107-charlotte out of doors in all this wind . Why does [she]138-miss de bourgh not come in ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Oh , [Charlotte]107-charlotte says [she]107-charlotte hardly ever does . It is the greatest of favours when [Miss De Bourgh]138-miss de bourgh comes in . ”[101-maria] “ [I]88-elizabeth like [her]138-miss de bourgh appearance , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , struck with other ideas . “ [She]138-miss de bourgh looks sickly and cross . Yes , [she]138-miss de bourgh will do for [him]86-sir william very well . [She]138-miss de bourgh will make [him]86-sir william [a very proper wife]4113-a very proper wife . ”[88-elizabeth] [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins and [Charlotte]107-charlotte were both standing at the gate in conversation with [the ladies]254-the ladies ; and [Sir William]86-sir william , to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s high diversion , was stationed in the doorway , in earnest contemplation of the greatness before [him]86-sir william , and constantly bowing whenever [Miss De Bourgh]138-miss de bourgh looked that way . At length there was nothing more to be said ; [the ladies]254-the ladies drove on , and [the others]511-the others returned into [the house]3075-the house . [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins no sooner saw [the two girls]571-the two girls than [he]134-mr. collins began to congratulate [them]571-the two girls on [their]571-the two girls good fortune , which [Charlotte]107-charlotte explained by letting [them]571-the two girls know that [the whole party]525-the whole party was asked to dine at Rosings the next day . [ Illustration : ‘ [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , said [she]93-lady catherine , [you]134-mr. collins have given [me]0-i a treasure . ’ CHAPTER XXIX . [ Illustration ] [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ’s triumph , in consequence of this invitation , was complete . The power of displaying the grandeur of [[his]134-mr. collins patroness]3528-his patroness to [[his]134-mr. collins wondering visitors]1348-his wondering visitors , and of letting [them]1348-his wondering visitors see [her]3528-his patroness civility towards [himself]134-mr. collins and [[his]134-mr. collins wife]236-his wife , was exactly what [he]134-mr. collins had wished for ; and that an opportunity of doing it should be given so soon was such an instance of [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine ’s condescension as [he]134-mr. collins knew not how to admire enough . “ [I]134-mr. collins confess , ”[134-mr. collins] said [he]134-mr. collins , “ that [I]134-mr. collins should not have been at all surprised by [[her]93-lady catherine Ladyship]3490-her ladyship ’s asking [us]4115-us on Sunday to drink tea and spend the evening at Rosings . [I]134-mr. collins rather expected , from [my]134-mr. collins knowledge of [her]93-lady catherine affability , that it would happen . But who could have foreseen such an attention as this ? Who could have imagined that [we]4115-us should receive an invitation to dine there ( an invitation , moreover , including [the whole party]525-the whole party ) so immediately after [your]134-mr. collins arrival ? ”[134-mr. collins] “ [I]86-sir william am the less surprised at what has happened , ”[86-sir william] replied [Sir William]86-sir william , “ from that knowledge of what the manners of the great really are , which [my]86-sir william situation in life has allowed [me]86-sir william to acquire . About the court , such instances of elegant breeding are not uncommon . ”[86-sir william] Scarcely anything was talked of the whole day or next morning but [their]1350-them visit to [Rosings]18-rosings . [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins was carefully instructing [them]1350-them in what [they]1350-them were to expect , that the sight of [such rooms]1351-such rooms , so many [servants]1352-servants , and so splendid a dinner , might not wholly overpower [them]1350-them . When [the ladies]254-the ladies were separating for the toilette , [he]134-mr. collins said to [Elizabeth,--]168-elizabeth,-- “ Do not make [yourself]168-elizabeth,-- uneasy , [[my]134-mr. collins dear cousin]983-my dear cousin , about [your]168-elizabeth,-- apparel . [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine is far from requiring that elegance of dress in [us]254-the ladies which becomes [herself]93-lady catherine and [daughter]4118-daughter . [I]134-mr. collins would advise [you]168-elizabeth,-- merely to put on whatever of [your]168-elizabeth,-- clothes is superior to the rest -- there is no occasion for anything more . [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine will not think the worse of [you]168-elizabeth,-- for being simply dressed . [She]93-lady catherine likes to have the distinction of rank preserved . ”[134-mr. collins] While [they]254-the ladies were dressing , [he]134-mr. collins came two or three times to [their]254-the ladies different doors , to recommend [their]254-the ladies being quick , as [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine very much objected to be kept waiting for [her]93-lady catherine dinner . Such formidable accounts of [her]93-lady catherine Ladyship , and [her]93-lady catherine manner of living , quite frightened [Maria Lucas]101-maria , who had been little used to company ; and [she]101-maria looked forward to [her]101-maria introduction at Rosings with as much apprehension as [[her]101-maria father]249-her father had done to [his]249-her father presentation at [[St. James]11-st. james ’s]377-st. james ’s . As the weather was fine , [they]254-the ladies had a pleasant walk of about half a mile across [the park]1317-the park . [Every park]1357-every park has [its]1357-every park beauty and [its]1357-every park prospects ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth saw much to be pleased with , though [she]88-elizabeth could not be in such raptures as [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins expected the scene to inspire , and was but slightly affected by [his]134-mr. collins enumeration of the windows in front of [the house]3075-the house , and [his]134-mr. collins relation of what the glazing altogether had originally cost [Sir Lewis de Bourgh]136-sir lewis de bourgh . When [they]254-the ladies ascended the steps to [the hall]3519-the hall , [Maria]101-maria ’s alarm was every moment increasing , and even [Sir William]86-sir william did not look perfectly calm . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s courage did not fail [her]88-elizabeth . [She]88-elizabeth had heard nothing of [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine that spoke [her]93-lady catherine awful from any extraordinary talents or miraculous virtue , and the mere stateliness of money and rank [she]88-elizabeth thought [she]88-elizabeth could witness without trepidation . From [the entrance hall , of which [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins]1360-the entrance hall , of which mr. collins pointed out , with a rapturous air , the fine proportion and finished ornaments , [they]254-the ladies followed [the servants]3526-the servants through an antechamber to [the room where [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine]1362-the room where lady catherine , [[her]93-lady catherine daughter]461-her daughter , and [Mrs. Jenkinson]152-mrs. jenkinson were sitting . [[Her]93-lady catherine Ladyship]3490-her ladyship , with great condescension , arose to receive [them]254-the ladies ; and as [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins had settled it with [[her]166-mrs. collins husband]260-her husband that the office of introduction should be [hers]166-mrs. collins , it was performed in a proper manner , without any of those apologies and thanks which [he]260-her husband would have thought necessary . In spite of having been at [St. James ’s]11-st. james , [Sir William]86-sir william was so completely awed by the grandeur surrounding [him]86-sir william , that [he]86-sir william had but just courage enough to make a very low bow , and take [his]86-sir william seat without saying a word ; and [[his]86-sir william daughter]3923-his daughter , frightened almost out of [her]3923-his daughter senses , sat on the edge of [her]3923-his daughter chair , not knowing which way to look . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth found [herself]88-elizabeth quite equal to the scene , and could observe [the three ladies]1367-the three ladies before [her]88-elizabeth composedly . [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine was [a tall , large woman , with strongly - marked features , which might once have been handsome]1368-a tall , large woman , with strongly - marked features , which might once have been handsome . [Her]93-lady catherine air was not conciliating , nor was [her]93-lady catherine manner of receiving them such as to make [[her]93-lady catherine visitors]1369-her visitors forget [their]1369-her visitors inferior rank . [She]93-lady catherine was not rendered formidable by silence : but whatever [she]93-lady catherine said was spoken in so authoritative a tone as marked [her]93-lady catherine self - importance , and brought [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham immediately to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s mind ; and , from the observation of the day altogether , [she]88-elizabeth believed [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine to be exactly what [he]142-wickham had represented . When , after examining [the mother]393-the mother , in whose countenance and deportment [she]88-elizabeth soon found some resemblance of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , [she]88-elizabeth turned [her]88-elizabeth eyes on [the daughter]1371-the daughter , [she]88-elizabeth could almost have joined in [Maria]101-maria ’s astonishment at [her]1371-the daughter being so thin and so small . There was neither in figure nor face any likeness between [the ladies]254-the ladies . [Miss de Bourgh]138-miss de bourgh was pale and sickly : [her]138-miss de bourgh features , though not plain , were insignificant ; and [she]138-miss de bourgh spoke very little , except in a low voice , to [Mrs. Jenkinson]152-mrs. jenkinson , in whose appearance there was nothing remarkable , and who was entirely engaged in listening to what [she]138-miss de bourgh said , and placing a screen in the proper direction before [her]138-miss de bourgh eyes . After sitting a few minutes , [they]254-the ladies were all sent to one of the windows to admire the view , [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins attending [them]254-the ladies to point out [its]1373-its beauties , and [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine kindly informing [them]254-the ladies that it was much better worth looking at in the summer . The dinner was exceedingly handsome , and there were [all the servants]1374-all the servants , and all the articles of plate which [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins had promised ; and , as [he]134-mr. collins had likewise foretold , [he]134-mr. collins took [his]134-mr. collins seat at the bottom of the table , by [her]93-lady catherine Ladyship ’s desire , and looked as if [he]134-mr. collins felt that life could furnish nothing greater . [He]134-mr. collins carved and ate and praised with delighted alacrity ; and every dish was commended first by [him]134-mr. collins , and then by [Sir William]86-sir william , who was now enough recovered to echo whatever [[his]86-sir william son - in - law]1375-his son - in - law said , in a manner which [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth wondered [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine could bear . But [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine seemed gratified by [their]254-the ladies excessive admiration , and gave most gracious smiles , especially when any dish on the table proved a novelty to [them]254-the ladies . [The party]3132-the party did not supply much conversation . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was ready to speak whenever there was an opening , but [she]88-elizabeth was seated between [Charlotte]107-charlotte and [Miss de Bourgh]138-miss de bourgh -- the former of whom was engaged in listening to [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , and [the latter]491-the latter said not a word to [her]88-elizabeth all the dinnertime . [Mrs. Jenkinson]152-mrs. jenkinson was chiefly employed in watching how little [Miss de Bourgh]138-miss de bourgh ate , pressing [her]152-mrs. jenkinson to try some other dish and fearing [she]152-mrs. jenkinson was indisposed . [Maria]101-maria thought speaking out of the question , and [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen did nothing but eat and admire . When [the ladies]254-the ladies returned to [the drawing - room]524-the drawing - room , there was little to be done but to hear [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine talk , which [she]93-lady catherine did without any intermission till coffee came in , delivering [her]93-lady catherine opinion on every subject in so decisive a manner as proved that [she]93-lady catherine was not used to have [her]93-lady catherine judgment controverted . [She]93-lady catherine inquired into [Charlotte]107-charlotte ’s domestic concerns familiarly and minutely , and gave [her]93-lady catherine a great deal of advice as to the management of [them]254-the ladies all ; told [her]93-lady catherine how everything ought to be regulated in [so small a family as [hers]93-lady catherine]1381-so small a family as hers , and instructed [her]93-lady catherine as to the care of [her]93-lady catherine cows and [her]93-lady catherine poultry . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth found that nothing was beneath [this great lady]1382-this great lady ’s attention which could furnish [her]88-elizabeth with an occasion for dictating to [others]3175-others . In the intervals of [her]93-lady catherine discourse with [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins , [she]93-lady catherine addressed a variety of questions to [Maria]101-maria and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , but especially to the latter , of whose connections [she]93-lady catherine knew the least , and who , [she]93-lady catherine observed to [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins , was [a very genteel , pretty kind of girl]1384-a very genteel , pretty kind of girl . [She]93-lady catherine asked [her]93-lady catherine at different times how many sisters [she]93-lady catherine had , whether [they]1385-they were older or younger than [herself]93-lady catherine , whether any of [them]1385-they were likely to be married , whether [they]1385-they were handsome , where [they]1385-they had been educated , what carriage [[her]93-lady catherine father]249-her father kept , and what had been [[her]93-lady catherine mother]246-her mother ’s maiden name ? [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth felt all the impertinence of [her]88-elizabeth questions , but answered them very composedly . [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine then observed,-- “ [[Your]88-elizabeth father]3292-your father ’s estate is entailed on [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins , [I]93-lady catherine think ? For [your]88-elizabeth sake , ”[93-lady catherine] turning to [Charlotte]107-charlotte , “ [I]93-lady catherine am glad of it ; but otherwise [I]93-lady catherine see no occasion for entailing estates from [the female line]4120-the female line . It was not thought necessary in [[Sir Lewis de Bourgh]136-sir lewis de bourgh ’s family]4121-sir lewis de bourgh ’s family . Do [you]88-elizabeth play and sing , [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth ? ”[93-lady catherine] “ A little . ”[93-lady catherine] “ Oh then -- some time or other [we]4122-we shall be happy to hear [you]88-elizabeth . [Our]4122-we instrument is a capital one , probably superior to ---- [you]88-elizabeth shall try it some day . Do [[your]88-elizabeth sisters]3134-your sisters play and sing ? ”[93-lady catherine] “ [One of [them]3134-your sisters]3090-one of them does . ”[93-lady catherine] “ Why did not [you]88-elizabeth all learn ? [You]88-elizabeth ought all to have learned . [The Miss Webbs]169-the miss webbs all play , and [[their]169-the miss webbs father]252-their father has not so good an income as [yours]88-elizabeth . Do [you]88-elizabeth draw ? ”[93-lady catherine] “ No , not at all . ”[93-lady catherine] “ What , none of [you]88-elizabeth ? ”[93-lady catherine] “ Not one . ”[93-lady catherine] “ That is very strange . But [I]93-lady catherine suppose [you]88-elizabeth had no opportunity . [[Your]88-elizabeth mother]967-your mother should have taken [you]88-elizabeth to [town]268-town every spring for the benefit of [masters]4128-masters . ”[93-lady catherine] “ [[My]93-lady catherine mother]3295-my mother would have no objection , but [[my]93-lady catherine father]3323-my father hates [London]5-london . ”[93-lady catherine] “ Has [[your]88-elizabeth governess]4131-your governess left [you]88-elizabeth ? ”[93-lady catherine] “ [We]4132-we never had [any governess]4133-any governess . ”[93-lady catherine] “ [No governess]4134-no governess ! How was that possible ? [Five daughters]664-five daughters brought up at [home]3288-home without [a governess]4137-a governess ! [I]88-elizabeth never heard of such a thing . [[Your]93-lady catherine mother]967-your mother must have been quite a slave to [your]93-lady catherine education . ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth could hardly help smiling , as [she]88-elizabeth assured [her]88-elizabeth that had not been the case . “ Then who taught [you]88-elizabeth ? who attended to [you]88-elizabeth ? Without [a governess]4137-a governess , [you]88-elizabeth must have been neglected . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Compared with [some families]4140-some families , [I]88-elizabeth believe [we]4132-we were ; but such of [us]4132-we as wished to learn never wanted the means . [We]4132-we were always encouraged to read , and had [all the masters that were necessary]4141-all the masters that were necessary . [Those who chose to be idle]4142-those who chose to be idle certainly might . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Ay , no doubt : but that is what [a governess]4137-a governess will prevent ; and if [I]88-elizabeth had known [[your]93-lady catherine mother]967-your mother , [I]88-elizabeth should have advised [her]967-your mother most strenuously to engage one . [I]88-elizabeth always say that nothing is to be done in education without steady and regular instruction , and [nobody but a governess]4145-nobody but a governess can give it . It is wonderful how many [families]4146-families [I]88-elizabeth have been the means of supplying in that way . [I]88-elizabeth am always glad to get [a young person]4147-a young person well placed out . [Four nieces of [Mrs. Jenkinson]152-mrs. jenkinson]4148-four nieces of mrs. jenkinson are most delightfully situated through [my]88-elizabeth means ; and it was but the other day that [I]88-elizabeth recommended [another young person]4149-another young person , who was merely accidentally mentioned to [me]88-elizabeth , and [the family]414-the family are quite delighted with [her]4149-another young person . [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins , did [I]88-elizabeth tell [you]166-mrs. collins of [Lady Metcalfe]170-lady metcalfe ’s calling yesterday to thank [me]88-elizabeth ? [She]170-lady metcalfe finds [Miss Pope]171-miss pope a treasure . ‘ [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , ’ said [she]170-lady metcalfe , ‘ [you]93-lady catherine have given [me]88-elizabeth a treasure . ’ Are any of [[your]93-lady catherine younger sisters]4151-your younger sisters out , [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Yes , [ma’am]3191-ma’am , all . ”[88-elizabeth] “ All ! What , [all five]4153-all five out at once ? Very odd ! And [you]93-lady catherine only the second . [The younger ones]3581-the younger ones out before [the elder]4155-the elder are married ! [[Your]93-lady catherine younger sisters]4151-your younger sisters must be very young ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Yes , [[my]88-elizabeth youngest]4157-my youngest is not sixteen . Perhaps [she]4157-my youngest is full young to be much in company . But really , [ma’am]3191-ma’am , [I]88-elizabeth think it would be very hard upon [younger sisters]4159-younger sisters that [they]4159-younger sisters should not have [their]4159-younger sisters share of society and amusement , because [the elder]4155-the elder may not have the means or inclination to marry early . [The last born]4161-the last born has as good a right to the pleasures of youth as the first . And to be kept back on such a motive ! [I]88-elizabeth think it would not be very likely to promote sisterly affection or delicacy of mind . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Upon [my]3490-her ladyship word , ”[3490-her ladyship] said [[her]1388-her Ladyship]3490-her ladyship , “ [you]93-lady catherine give [your]93-lady catherine opinion very decidedly for [so young a person]4162-so young a person . Pray , what is [your]93-lady catherine age ? ”[3490-her ladyship] “ With [three younger sisters]4163-three younger sisters grown up , ”[88-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , smiling , “ [[your]93-lady catherine Ladyship]4164-your ladyship can hardly expect [me]88-elizabeth to own [it]4165-it . ”[88-elizabeth] [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine seemed quite astonished at not receiving a direct answer ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth suspected [herself]88-elizabeth to be [the first creature who had ever dared to trifle with so much dignified impertinence]1390-the first creature who had ever dared to trifle with so much dignified impertinence . “ [You]93-lady catherine can not be more than twenty , [I]88-elizabeth am sure,--therefore [you]93-lady catherine need not conceal [your]93-lady catherine age . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]292-the gentlemen am not one - and - twenty . ”[292-the gentlemen] When [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen had joined [them]292-the gentlemen , and tea was over , the card tables were placed . [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , [Sir William]86-sir william , and [Mr.]1392-mr. and [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins sat down to quadrille ; and as [Miss De Bourgh]138-miss de bourgh chose to play at cassino , [the two girls]571-the two girls had the honour of assisting [Mrs. Jenkinson]152-mrs. jenkinson to make up [her]152-mrs. jenkinson party . [Their]571-the two girls table was superlatively stupid . Scarcely a syllable was uttered that did not relate to the game , except when [Mrs. Jenkinson]152-mrs. jenkinson expressed [her]152-mrs. jenkinson fears of [Miss De Bourgh]138-miss de bourgh ’s being too hot or too cold , or having too much or too little light . A great deal more passed at the other table . [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine was generally speaking -- stating the mistakes of [the three others]1394-the three others , or relating some anecdote of [herself]93-lady catherine . [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins was employed in agreeing to everything [her]93-lady catherine Ladyship said , thanking [her]93-lady catherine for every fish [he]134-mr. collins won , and apologizing if [he]134-mr. collins thought [he]134-mr. collins won too many . [Sir William]86-sir william did not say much . [He]86-sir william was storing [his]86-sir william memory with anecdotes and noble names . When [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine and [[her]93-lady catherine daughter]461-her daughter had played as long as [they]571-the two girls chose , the tables were broken up , [the carriage]3286-the carriage was offered to [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins , gratefully accepted , and immediately ordered . [The party]3132-the party then gathered round the fire to hear [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine determine what weather [they]571-the two girls were to have on the morrow . From these instructions [they]571-the two girls were summoned by the arrival of [the coach]3290-the coach ; and with many speeches of thankfulness on [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ’s side , and as many bows on [Sir William]86-sir william ’s , [they]571-the two girls departed . As soon as [they]571-the two girls had driven from the door , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was called on by [[her]88-elizabeth cousin]821-her cousin to give [her]88-elizabeth opinion of all that [she]88-elizabeth had seen at [Rosings]19-rosings , which , for [Charlotte]107-charlotte ’s sake , [she]88-elizabeth made more favourable than it really was . But [her]88-elizabeth commendation , though costing [her]88-elizabeth some trouble , could by no means satisfy [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins , and [he]134-mr. collins was very soon obliged to take [her]88-elizabeth Ladyship ’s praise into [his]134-mr. collins own hands . [ Illustration ] CHAPTER XXX . [ Illustration ] [Sir William]86-sir william stayed only a week at [Hunsford]15-hunsford ; but [his]86-sir william visit was long enough to convince [him]86-sir william of [[his]86-sir william daughter]3923-his daughter ’s being most comfortably settled , and of [her]3923-his daughter possessing such [a husband]1016-a husband and such [a neighbour]1402-a neighbour as were not often met with . While [Sir William]86-sir william was with [them]1403-them , [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins devoted [his]134-mr. collins mornings to driving [him]86-sir william out in [[his]134-mr. collins gig]1404-his gig , and showing [him]86-sir william [the country]448-the country : but when [he]134-mr. collins went away , [the whole family]312-the whole family returned to [their]312-the whole family usual employments , and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was thankful to find that [they]1403-them did not see more of [[her]88-elizabeth cousin]821-her cousin by the alteration ; for the chief of the time between breakfast and dinner was now passed by [him]821-her cousin either at work in [the garden]1291-the garden , or in reading and writing , and looking out of window in [[his]821-her cousin own book room]1409-his own book room , which fronted [the road]1292-the road . [The room in which [the ladies]254-the ladies sat]1411-the room in which the ladies sat was backwards . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth at first had rather wondered that [Charlotte]107-charlotte should not prefer the dining parlour for common use ; [it]1413-it was [a better sized room]1414-a better sized room , and had a pleasanter aspect : but [she]88-elizabeth soon saw that [[her]88-elizabeth friend]400-her friend had an excellent reason for what [she]88-elizabeth did , for [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins would undoubtedly have been much less in [[his]134-mr. collins own apartment]1416-his own apartment had [they]1417-they sat in one equally lively ; and [she]88-elizabeth gave [Charlotte]107-charlotte credit for the arrangement . From [the drawing - room]524-the drawing - room [they]1417-they could distinguish nothing in [the lane]3884-the lane , and were indebted to [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins for the knowledge of what carriages went along , and how often especially [Miss De Bourgh]138-miss de bourgh drove by in [her]138-miss de bourgh phaeton , which [he]134-mr. collins never failed coming to inform [them]1417-they of , though it happened almost every day . [She]88-elizabeth not unfrequently stopped at [the Parsonage]1288-the parsonage , and had a few minutes ’ conversation with [Charlotte]107-charlotte , but was scarcely ever prevailed on to get out . Very few days passed in which [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins did not walk to Rosings , and not many in which [[his]134-mr. collins wife]236-his wife did not think it necessary to go likewise ; and till [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth recollected that there might be other family livings to be disposed of , [she]88-elizabeth could not understand the sacrifice of so many hours . Now and then [they]1417-they were honoured with a call from [[her]88-elizabeth Ladyship]3490-her ladyship , and nothing escaped [her]88-elizabeth observation that was passing in [the room]255-the room during these visits . [She]88-elizabeth examined into [their]1417-they employments , looked at [their]1417-they work , and advised [them]1417-they to do it differently ; found fault with the arrangement of the furniture , or detected [the housemaid]1424-the housemaid in negligence ; and if [she]88-elizabeth accepted any refreshment , seemed to do it only for the sake of finding out that [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins ’s joints of meat were too large for [[her]88-elizabeth family]3710-her family . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth soon perceived , that though [this great lady]1382-this great lady was not in the commission of the peace for [the county]1427-the county , [she]1382-this great lady was [a most active magistrate in [[her]1382-this great lady own parish]1429-her own parish]1428-a most active magistrate in her own parish , the minutest concerns of which were carried to [her]1382-this great lady by [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ; and whenever [any of [the cottagers]1431-the cottagers]1430-any of the cottagers were disposed to be quarrelsome , discontented , or too poor , [she]88-elizabeth sallied forth into [the village]320-the village to settle [their]1430-any of the cottagers differences , silence [their]1430-any of the cottagers complaints , and scold [them]1430-any of the cottagers into harmony and plenty . [ Illustration : “ [he]134-mr. collins never failed to inform [them]1430-any of the cottagers ”[88-elizabeth] ] The entertainment of dining at Rosings was repeated about twice a week ; and , allowing for the loss of [Sir William]86-sir william , and there being only one card - table in the evening , every such entertainment was the counterpart of the first . [Their]1433-their other engagements were few , as the style of living of [the neighbourhood]3088-the neighbourhood in general was beyond [the Collinses]1435-the collinses ’ reach . This , however , was no evil to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , and upon the whole [she]88-elizabeth spent [her]88-elizabeth time comfortably enough : there were half hours of pleasant conversation with [Charlotte]107-charlotte , and the weather was so fine for the time of year , that [she]88-elizabeth had often great enjoyment out of doors . [Her]88-elizabeth favourite walk , and where [she]88-elizabeth frequently went while [the others]511-the others were calling on [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , was along [the open grove which edged that side of [the park , where there was a nice sheltered path]1438-the park , where there was a nice sheltered path , which [no one]3336-no one seemed to value but [herself]88-elizabeth]1437-the open grove which edged that side of the park , where there was a nice sheltered path , which no one seemed to value but herself , and where [she]88-elizabeth felt beyond the reach of [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine ’s curiosity . In this quiet way the first fortnight of [her]88-elizabeth visit soon passed away . Easter was approaching , and the week preceding it was to bring an addition to [the family]414-the family at [Rosings]19-rosings , which in so small a circle must be important . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had heard , soon after [her]88-elizabeth arrival , that [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy was expected [there]306-there in the course of a few weeks ; and though there were not many of [her]88-elizabeth acquaintance whom [she]88-elizabeth did not prefer , [his]96-mr. darcy coming would furnish one comparatively new to look at in [their]1442-their Rosings parties , and [she]88-elizabeth might be amused in seeing how hopeless [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s designs on [him]96-mr. darcy were , by [his]96-mr. darcy behaviour to [[his]96-mr. darcy cousin]3538-his cousin , for whom [he]96-mr. darcy was evidently destined by [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , who talked of [his]96-mr. darcy coming with the greatest satisfaction , spoke of [him]96-mr. darcy in terms of the highest admiration , and seemed almost angry to find that [he]96-mr. darcy had already been frequently seen by [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas and [herself]99-miss lucas . [His]96-mr. darcy arrival was soon known at [the Parsonage]1288-the parsonage ; for [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins was walking the whole morning within view of [the lodges opening into [Hunsford Lane]31-hunsford lane]1445-the lodges opening into hunsford lane , in order to have [ [Illustration]110-illustration : “ [The gentlemen]292-the gentlemen accompanied [him]96-mr. darcy . ”[110-illustration] the earliest assurance of it ; and , after making [his]96-mr. darcy bow as [the carriage]3286-the carriage turned into [the park]1317-the park , hurried [home]3288-home with the great intelligence . On the following morning [he]96-mr. darcy hastened to [Rosings]19-rosings to pay [his]96-mr. darcy respects . There were [two nephews of [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine]1449-two nephews of lady catherine to require [them]1449-two nephews of lady catherine , for [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy had brought with [him]96-mr. darcy a Colonel Fitzwilliam , [the younger son of [[his]96-mr. darcy uncle]1451-his uncle]1450-the younger son of his uncle , [Lord ---]1452-lord --- and , to the great surprise of [all the party]1453-all the party , when [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins returned , [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen accompanied [him]96-mr. darcy . [Charlotte]107-charlotte had seen [them]292-the gentlemen from [[[her]107-charlotte husband]260-her husband ’s room]1456-her husband ’s room , crossing [the road]1292-the road , and immediately running into the other , told [the girls]3082-the girls what an honour [they]3082-the girls might expect , adding,-- “ [I]88-elizabeth may thank [you]3082-the girls , [Eliza]88-elizabeth , for this piece of civility . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy would never have come so soon to wait upon [me]88-elizabeth . ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had scarcely time to disclaim all right to the compliment before [their]292-the gentlemen approach was announced by the door - bell , and shortly afterwards [the three gentlemen]1459-the three gentlemen entered [the room]255-the room . [Colonel Fitzwilliam]172-colonel fitzwilliam , who led the way , was about thirty , not handsome , but in person and address most truly [the gentleman]287-the gentleman . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy looked just as [he]96-mr. darcy had been used to look in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , paid [his]96-mr. darcy compliments , with [his]96-mr. darcy usual reserve , to [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins ; and whatever might be [his]96-mr. darcy feelings towards [[her]88-elizabeth friend]400-her friend , met [her]88-elizabeth with every appearance of composure . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth merely courtesied to [him]96-mr. darcy , without saying a word . [Colonel Fitzwilliam]172-colonel fitzwilliam entered into conversation directly , with the readiness and ease of [a well - bred man]1463-a well - bred man , and talked very pleasantly ; but [[his]172-colonel fitzwilliam cousin]3538-his cousin , after having addressed a slight observation on [the house]3075-the house and [garden]1466-garden to [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins , sat for some time without speaking to [anybody]3171-anybody . At length , however , [his]96-mr. darcy civility was so far awakened as to inquire of [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth after the health of [[her]88-elizabeth family]3710-her family . [She]88-elizabeth answered [him]96-mr. darcy in the usual way ; and , after a moment ’s pause , added,-- “ [[My]88-elizabeth eldest sister]4167-my eldest sister has been in [town]268-town these three months . Have [you]96-mr. darcy never happened to see [her]4167-my eldest sister [there]306-there ? ”[88-elizabeth] [She]88-elizabeth was perfectly sensible that [he]96-mr. darcy never had : but [she]88-elizabeth wished to see whether [he]96-mr. darcy would betray any consciousness of what had passed between [the Bingleys]158-the bingleys and [Jane]89-jane ; and [she]88-elizabeth thought [he]96-mr. darcy looked a little confused as [he]96-mr. darcy answered that [he]96-mr. darcy had never been so fortunate as to meet [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth . The subject was pursued no further , and [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen soon afterwards went away . [ Illustration : “ At [Church ”]32-church ”[88-elizabeth] ] CHAPTER XXXI . [ Illustration ] [Colonel Fitzwilliam]172-colonel fitzwilliam ’s manners were very much admired at [the Parsonage]1288-the parsonage , and [the ladies]254-the ladies all felt that [he]96-mr. darcy must add considerably to the pleasure of [their]254-the ladies engagements at Rosings . It was some days , however , before [they]292-the gentlemen received any invitation thither , for while there were [visitors]3943-visitors in [the house]3075-the house [they]292-the gentlemen could not be necessary ; and it was not till Easter - day , almost a week after [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen ’s arrival , that [they]292-the gentlemen were honoured by such an attention , and then [they]292-the gentlemen were merely asked on leaving [church]4096-church to come [there]306-there in the evening . For the last week [they]292-the gentlemen had seen very little of either [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine or [[her]93-lady catherine daughter]461-her daughter . [Colonel Fitzwilliam]172-colonel fitzwilliam had called at [the Parsonage]1288-the parsonage more than once during the time , but [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy [they]292-the gentlemen had only seen at [church]4096-church . The invitation was accepted , of course , and at a proper hour [they]292-the gentlemen joined [the party]3132-the party in [[Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine ’s drawing - room]1481-lady catherine ’s drawing - room . [[Her]93-lady catherine Ladyship]3490-her ladyship received [them]292-the gentlemen civilly , but it was plain that [their]292-the gentlemen company was by no means so acceptable as when [she]3490-her ladyship could get [nobody else]1483-nobody else ; and [she]3490-her ladyship was , in fact , almost engrossed by [[her]3490-her ladyship nephews]1484-her nephews , speaking to [them]1484-her nephews , especially to [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , much more than to [any other person in [the room]255-the room]1485-any other person in the room . [Colonel Fitzwilliam]172-colonel fitzwilliam seemed really glad to see [them]292-the gentlemen : anything was a welcome relief to [him]172-colonel fitzwilliam at Rosings ; and [[Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins ’s pretty friend]1487-mrs. collins ’s pretty friend had , moreover , caught [his]172-colonel fitzwilliam fancy very much . [He]172-colonel fitzwilliam now seated [himself]172-colonel fitzwilliam by [her]1487-mrs. collins ’s pretty friend , and talked so agreeably of [Kent]17-kent and [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , of travelling and staying at [home]3288-home , of new books and music , that [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had never been half so well entertained in [that room]1489-that room before ; and [they]292-the gentlemen conversed with so much spirit and flow as to draw the attention of [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine [herself]93-lady catherine , as well as of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy . [His]172-colonel fitzwilliam eyes had been soon and repeatedly turned towards [them]292-the gentlemen with a look of curiosity ; and that [[her]93-lady catherine Ladyship]3490-her ladyship , after a while , shared the feeling , was more openly acknowledged , for [she]3490-her ladyship did not scruple to call out,-- “ What is that [you]172-colonel fitzwilliam are saying , [Fitzwilliam]172-colonel fitzwilliam ? What is it [you]172-colonel fitzwilliam are talking of ? What are [you]172-colonel fitzwilliam telling [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth ? Let [me]3490-her ladyship hear what it is . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ [We]292-the gentlemen were talking of music , [madam]3346-madam , ”[172-colonel fitzwilliam] said [he]172-colonel fitzwilliam , when no longer able to avoid a reply . “ Of music ! Then pray speak aloud . It is of all subjects [my]96-mr. darcy delight . [I]96-mr. darcy must have [my]96-mr. darcy share in the conversation , if [you]172-colonel fitzwilliam are speaking of music . There are [few people in [England]3-england]4171-few people in england , [I]96-mr. darcy suppose , who have more true enjoyment of music than [myself]96-mr. darcy , or a better natural taste . If [I]96-mr. darcy had ever learnt , [I]96-mr. darcy should have been [a great proficient]4172-a great proficient . And so would [Anne]146-anne , if [her]146-anne health had allowed [her]146-anne to apply . [I]96-mr. darcy am confident that [she]146-anne would have performed delightfully . How does [Georgiana]153-georgiana get on , [Darcy]153-georgiana ? ”[96-mr. darcy] [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy spoke with affectionate praise of [[his]96-mr. darcy sister]565-his sister ’s proficiency . “ [I]93-lady catherine am very glad to hear such a good account of [her]153-georgiana , ”[93-lady catherine] said [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine ; “ and pray tell [her]153-georgiana from [me]93-lady catherine , that [she]153-georgiana can not expect to excel , if [she]153-georgiana does not practise a great deal . ”[93-lady catherine] “ [I]96-mr. darcy assure [you]93-lady catherine , [madam]3346-madam , ”[96-mr. darcy] [he]96-mr. darcy replied , “ that [she]153-georgiana does not need such advice . [She]153-georgiana practises very constantly . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ So much the better . It can not be done too much ; and when [I]96-mr. darcy next write to [her]153-georgiana , [I]96-mr. darcy shall charge [her]153-georgiana not to neglect it on any account . [I]96-mr. darcy often tell [young ladies]3329-young ladies , that no excellence in music is to be acquired without constant practice . [I]96-mr. darcy have told [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth several times , that [she]88-elizabeth will never play really well , unless [she]88-elizabeth practises more ; and though [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins has no instrument , [she]88-elizabeth is very welcome , as [I]96-mr. darcy have often told [her]88-elizabeth , to come to Rosings every day , and play on the pianoforte in [[Mrs. Jenkinson]152-mrs. jenkinson ’s room]4175-mrs. jenkinson ’s room . [She]88-elizabeth would be in [nobody]3152-nobody ’s way , [you]4177-you know , in [that part of [the house]3075-the house]4178-that part of the house . ”[96-mr. darcy] [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy looked a little ashamed of [[his]96-mr. darcy aunt]3747-his aunt ’s ill - breeding , and made no answer . When coffee was over , [Colonel Fitzwilliam]172-colonel fitzwilliam reminded [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth of having promised to play to [him]172-colonel fitzwilliam ; and [she]88-elizabeth sat down directly to the instrument . [He]172-colonel fitzwilliam drew a chair near [her]88-elizabeth . [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine listened to half a song , and then talked , as before , to [[her]93-lady catherine other nephew]1493-her other nephew ; till [the latter]491-the latter walked away from [her]93-lady catherine , and moving with [his]172-colonel fitzwilliam usual deliberation towards the pianoforte , stationed [himself]172-colonel fitzwilliam so as to command a full view of [the fair performer]1495-the fair performer ’s countenance .
