This , [madam]3346-madam , is a faithful narrative of every event in which [we]1686-we have been concerned together ; and if [you]1681-you do not absolutely reject it as false , [you]1681-you will , [I]0-i hope , acquit [me]0-i henceforth of cruelty towards [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham . [I]0-i know not in what manner , under what form of falsehood , [he]142-wickham has imposed on [you]1681-you ; but [his]142-wickham success is not perhaps to be wondered at , ignorant as [you]1681-you previously were of everything concerning either . [Detection]175-detection could not be in [your]1681-you power , and suspicion certainly not in [your]1681-you inclination . [You]1681-you may possibly wonder why all this was not told [you]1681-you last night . But [I]0-i was not then master enough of [myself]0-i to know what could or ought to be revealed . For the truth of everything here related , [I]0-i can appeal more particularly to the testimony of [Colonel Fitzwilliam]172-colonel fitzwilliam , who , from [our]1686-we near relationship and constant intimacy , and still more as [one of the executors of [[my]0-i father]3323-my father ’s will]1687-one of the executors of my father ’s will , has been unavoidably acquainted with every particular of these transactions . If [your]1681-you abhorrence of [me]0-i should make [my]0-i assertions valueless , [you]1681-you can not be prevented by the same cause from confiding in [[my]0-i cousin]3477-my cousin ; and that there may be the possibility of consulting [him]3477-my cousin , [I]0-i shall endeavour to find some opportunity of putting this letter in [your]1681-you hands in the course of the morning . [I]0-i will only add , [God]102-god bless [you]1681-you . “ [FITZWILLIAM DARCY]96-mr. darcy . ”[102-god] [ Illustration ] CHAPTER XXXVI . [ Illustration ] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , when [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy gave [her]88-elizabeth the letter , did not expect it to contain a renewal of [his]96-mr. darcy offers , [she]88-elizabeth had formed no expectation at all of its contents . But such as they were , it may be well supposed how eagerly [she]88-elizabeth went through them , and what a contrariety of emotion [they]1690-they excited . [Her]88-elizabeth feelings as [she]88-elizabeth read were scarcely to be defined . With amazement did [she]88-elizabeth first understand that [he]96-mr. darcy believed any apology to be in [his]96-mr. darcy power ; and steadfastly was [she]88-elizabeth persuaded , that [he]96-mr. darcy could have no explanation to give , which a just sense of shame would not conceal . With a strong prejudice against everything [he]96-mr. darcy might say , [she]88-elizabeth began [his]96-mr. darcy account of what had happened at [Netherfield]2-netherfield . [She]88-elizabeth read with an eagerness which hardly left [her]88-elizabeth power of comprehension ; and from impatience of knowing what the next sentence might bring , was incapable of attending to the sense of the one before [her]88-elizabeth eyes . [His]96-mr. darcy belief of [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ’s insensibility [she]88-elizabeth instantly resolved to be false ; and [his]96-mr. darcy account of the real , the worst objections to the match , made [her]88-elizabeth too angry to have any wish of doing [him]96-mr. darcy justice . [He]96-mr. darcy expressed no regret for what [he]96-mr. darcy had done which satisfied [her]88-elizabeth ; [his]96-mr. darcy style was not penitent , but haughty . It was all pride and insolence . But when this subject was succeeded by [his]96-mr. darcy account of [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham -- when [she]88-elizabeth read , with somewhat clearer attention , a relation of events which , if true , must overthrow every cherished opinion of [his]96-mr. darcy worth , and which bore so alarming an affinity to [his]96-mr. darcy own history of [himself]96-mr. darcy -- [her]88-elizabeth feelings were yet more acutely painful and more difficult of definition . Astonishment , apprehension , and even horror , oppressed [her]88-elizabeth . [She]88-elizabeth wished to discredit it entirely , repeatedly exclaiming , “ This must be false ! This can not be ! This must be the grossest falsehood!”--and[88-elizabeth] when [she]88-elizabeth had gone through the whole letter , though scarcely knowing anything of the last page or two , put it hastily away , protesting that [she]88-elizabeth would not regard it , that [she]88-elizabeth would never look in it again . In this perturbed state of mind , with thoughts that could rest on nothing , [she]88-elizabeth walked on ; but it would not do : in half a minute the letter was unfolded again ; and collecting [herself]88-elizabeth as well as [she]88-elizabeth could , [she]88-elizabeth again began the mortifying perusal of all that related to [Wickham]142-wickham , and commanded [herself]88-elizabeth so far as to examine the meaning of every sentence . The account of [his]96-mr. darcy connection with [the Pemberley family]1692-the pemberley family was exactly what [he]96-mr. darcy had related [himself]96-mr. darcy ; and the kindness of [the late Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , though [she]88-elizabeth had not before known its extent , agreed equally well with [his]96-mr. darcy own words . So far each recital confirmed the other ; but when [she]88-elizabeth came to the will , the difference was great . What [Wickham]142-wickham had said of [the living]900-the living was fresh in [her]88-elizabeth memory ; and as [she]88-elizabeth recalled [his]142-wickham very words , it was impossible not to feel that there was gross duplicity on one side or the other , and , for a few moments , [she]88-elizabeth flattered [herself]88-elizabeth that [her]88-elizabeth wishes did not err . But when [she]88-elizabeth read and re - read , with the closest attention , the particulars immediately following of [Wickham]142-wickham ’s resigning all pretensions to the living , of [his]96-mr. darcy receiving in lieu so considerable a sum as three thousand pounds , again was [she]88-elizabeth forced to hesitate . [She]88-elizabeth put down the letter , weighed every circumstance with what [she]88-elizabeth meant to be impartiality -- deliberated on the probability of each statement -- but with little success . On both sides it was only assertion . Again [she]88-elizabeth read on . But every line proved more clearly that the affair , which [she]88-elizabeth had believed it impossible that any contrivance could so represent as to render [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s conduct in it less than infamous , was capable of a turn which must make [him]96-mr. darcy entirely blameless throughout the whole . The extravagance and general profligacy which [he]96-mr. darcy scrupled not to lay to [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham ’s charge exceedingly shocked [her]88-elizabeth ; the more so , as [she]88-elizabeth could bring no proof of its injustice . [She]88-elizabeth had never heard of [him]96-mr. darcy before [his]96-mr. darcy entrance into the ----shire militia , in which [he]96-mr. darcy had engaged at the persuasion of [the young man]3597-the young man , who , on meeting [him]96-mr. darcy accidentally in [town]268-town , had there renewed a slight acquaintance . Of [his]96-mr. darcy former way of life , nothing had been known in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire but what [he]96-mr. darcy told [ [Illustration]110-illustration : “ Meeting accidentally in [Town]268-town ”[96-mr. darcy] [himself]96-mr. darcy . As to [his]96-mr. darcy real character , had information been in [her]88-elizabeth power , [she]88-elizabeth had never felt a wish of inquiring . [His]96-mr. darcy countenance , voice , and manner , had established [him]96-mr. darcy at once in the possession of every virtue . [She]88-elizabeth tried to recollect some instance of goodness , some distinguished trait of integrity or benevolence , that might rescue [him]96-mr. darcy from the attacks of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ; or at least , by the predominance of virtue , atone for those casual errors , under which [she]88-elizabeth would endeavour to class what [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy had described as the idleness and vice of many years ’ continuance . But no such recollection befriended [her]88-elizabeth . [She]88-elizabeth could see [him]96-mr. darcy instantly before [her]88-elizabeth , in every charm of air and address , but [she]88-elizabeth could remember no more substantial good than the general approbation of [the neighbourhood]3088-the neighbourhood , and the regard which [his]96-mr. darcy social powers had gained [him]96-mr. darcy in the mess . After pausing on this point a considerable while , [she]88-elizabeth once more continued to read . But , alas ! the story which followed , of [his]96-mr. darcy designs on [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy , received some confirmation from what had passed between [Colonel Fitzwilliam]172-colonel fitzwilliam and [herself]88-elizabeth only the morning before ; and at last [she]88-elizabeth was referred for the truth of every particular to [Colonel Fitzwilliam]172-colonel fitzwilliam [himself]172-colonel fitzwilliam -- from whom [she]88-elizabeth had previously received the information of [his]96-mr. darcy near concern in all [[his]96-mr. darcy cousin]3538-his cousin ’s affairs and whose character [she]88-elizabeth had no reason to question . At one time [she]88-elizabeth had almost resolved on applying to [him]96-mr. darcy , but the idea was checked by the awkwardness of the application , and at length wholly banished by the conviction that [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy would never have hazarded such a proposal , if [he]96-mr. darcy had not been well assured of [[his]96-mr. darcy cousin]3538-his cousin ’s corroboration . [She]88-elizabeth perfectly remembered everything that had passed in conversation between [Wickham]142-wickham and [herself]88-elizabeth in [their]1699-their first evening at [[Mr. Philips]116-mr. philips ’s]1700-mr. philips ’s . Many of [his]96-mr. darcy expressions were still fresh in [her]88-elizabeth memory . [She]88-elizabeth was now struck with the impropriety of such communications to [a stranger]3471-a stranger , and wondered it had escaped [her]88-elizabeth before . [She]88-elizabeth saw the indelicacy of putting [himself]96-mr. darcy forward as [he]96-mr. darcy had done , and the inconsistency of [his]96-mr. darcy professions with [his]96-mr. darcy conduct . [She]88-elizabeth remembered that [he]96-mr. darcy had boasted of having no fear of seeing [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy -- that [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy might leave [the country]448-the country , but that [he]96-mr. darcy should stand [his]96-mr. darcy ground ; yet [he]96-mr. darcy had avoided the Netherfield ball the very next week . [She]88-elizabeth remembered , also , that till [the Netherfield family]1703-the netherfield family had quitted [the country]448-the country , [he]96-mr. darcy had told [his]96-mr. darcy story to [no one]3336-no one but [herself]88-elizabeth ; but that after [their]1703-the netherfield family removal , it had been everywhere discussed ; that [he]96-mr. darcy had then no reserves , no scruples in sinking [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s character , though [he]96-mr. darcy had assured [her]88-elizabeth that respect for [the father]265-the father would always prevent [his]96-mr. darcy exposing [the son]1707-the son . How differently did everything now appear in which [he]96-mr. darcy was concerned ! [His]96-mr. darcy attentions to [Miss King]100-miss king were now the consequence of views solely and hatefully mercenary ; and the mediocrity of [her]100-miss king fortune proved no longer the moderation of [his]96-mr. darcy wishes , but [his]96-mr. darcy eagerness to grasp at anything . [His]96-mr. darcy behaviour to [herself]88-elizabeth could now have had no tolerable motive : [he]96-mr. darcy had either been deceived with regard to [her]100-miss king fortune , or had been gratifying [his]96-mr. darcy vanity by encouraging the preference which [she]88-elizabeth believed [she]88-elizabeth had most incautiously shown . Every lingering struggle in [his]96-mr. darcy favour grew fainter and fainter ; and in further justification of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , [she]88-elizabeth could not but allow that [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , when questioned by [Jane]89-jane , had long ago asserted [his]85-mr. bingley blamelessness in the affair -that , proud and repulsive as were [his]85-mr. bingley manners , [she]88-elizabeth had never , in the whole course of [their]1708-their acquaintance -- an acquaintance which had latterly brought [them]1708-their much together , and given [her]88-elizabeth a sort of intimacy with [his]85-mr. bingley ways -- seen anything that betrayed [him]85-mr. bingley to be unprincipled or unjust -- anything that spoke [him]85-mr. bingley of irreligious or immoral habits -that among [his]85-mr. bingley own connections [he]85-mr. bingley was esteemed and valued -that even [Wickham]142-wickham had allowed [him]85-mr. bingley merit as [a brother]439-a brother , and that [she]88-elizabeth had often heard [him]85-mr. bingley speak so affectionately of [[his]85-mr. bingley sister]565-his sister as to prove [him]85-mr. bingley capable of some amiable feeling -that had [his]85-mr. bingley actions been what [Wickham]142-wickham represented [them]1711-them , so gross a violation of everything right could hardly have been concealed from [the world]304-the world ; and that friendship between [a person capable of it]1713-a person capable of it and such [an amiable man]1714-an amiable man as [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley was incomprehensible . [She]88-elizabeth grew absolutely ashamed of [herself]88-elizabeth . Of neither [Darcy]96-mr. darcy nor [Wickham]142-wickham could [she]88-elizabeth think , without feeling that [she]88-elizabeth had been blind , partial , prejudiced , absurd . “ How despicably have [I]88-elizabeth acted ! ”[88-elizabeth] [she]88-elizabeth cried . “ [I]88-elizabeth , who have prided [myself]88-elizabeth on [my]88-elizabeth discernment ! [I]88-elizabeth , who have valued [myself]88-elizabeth on [my]88-elizabeth abilities ! who have often disdained the generous candour of [[my]88-elizabeth sister]3345-my sister , and gratified [my]88-elizabeth vanity in useless or blameless distrust . How humiliating is this discovery ! Yet , how just a humiliation ! Had [I]88-elizabeth been in love , [I]88-elizabeth could not have been more wretchedly blind . But vanity , not love , has been [my]88-elizabeth folly . Pleased with the preference of one , and offended by the neglect of the other , on the very beginning of [our]4296-our acquaintance , [I]88-elizabeth have courted prepossession and ignorance , and driven reason away where [either were concerned]4297-either were concerned . Till this moment , [I]88-elizabeth never knew [myself]88-elizabeth . ”[88-elizabeth] From [herself]88-elizabeth to [Jane]89-jane , from [Jane]89-jane to [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , [her]88-elizabeth thoughts were in a line which soon brought to [her]88-elizabeth recollection that [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s explanation there had appeared very insufficient ; and [she]88-elizabeth read it again . Widely different was the effect of a second perusal . How could [she]88-elizabeth deny that credit to [his]96-mr. darcy assertions , in one instance , which [she]88-elizabeth had been obliged to give in the other ? [He]96-mr. darcy declared [himself]96-mr. darcy to have been totally unsuspicious of [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ’s attachment ; and [she]88-elizabeth could not help remembering what [Charlotte]107-charlotte ’s opinion had always been . Neither could [she]88-elizabeth deny the justice of [his]96-mr. darcy description of [Jane]89-jane . [She]88-elizabeth felt that [Jane]89-jane ’s feelings , though fervent , were little displayed , and that there was a constant complacency in [her]89-jane air and manner , not often united with great sensibility . When [she]88-elizabeth came to that part of the letter in which [[her]88-elizabeth family]3710-her family were mentioned , in tones of such mortifying , yet merited , reproach , [her]88-elizabeth sense of shame was severe . The justice of the charge struck [her]88-elizabeth too forcibly for denial ; and the circumstances to which [he]96-mr. darcy particularly alluded , as having passed at the Netherfield ball , and as confirming all [his]96-mr. darcy first disapprobation , could not have made a stronger impression on [his]96-mr. darcy mind than on [hers]88-elizabeth . The compliment to [herself]88-elizabeth and [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister was not unfelt . It soothed , but it could not console [her]88-elizabeth for the contempt which had been thus self - attracted by [the rest of [[her]88-elizabeth family]3710-her family]1718-the rest of her family ; and as [she]88-elizabeth considered that [Jane]89-jane ’s disappointment had , in fact , been the work of [[her]89-jane nearest relations]1720-her nearest relations , and reflected how materially the credit of [both]1721-both must be hurt by such impropriety of conduct , [she]88-elizabeth felt depressed beyond anything [she]88-elizabeth had ever known before . After wandering along [the lane]3884-the lane for two hours , giving way to every variety of thought , reconsidering events , determining probabilities , and reconciling [herself]88-elizabeth , as well as [she]88-elizabeth could , to a change so sudden and so important , fatigue , and a recollection of [her]88-elizabeth long absence , made [her]88-elizabeth at length return [home]3288-home ; and [she]88-elizabeth entered [the house]3075-the house with the wish of appearing cheerful as usual , and the resolution of repressing such reflections as must make [her]88-elizabeth unfit for conversation . [She]88-elizabeth was immediately told , that [the two gentlemen from Rosings]1725-the two gentlemen from rosings had each called during [her]88-elizabeth absence ; [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , only for a few minutes , to take leave , but that [Colonel Fitzwilliam]172-colonel fitzwilliam had been sitting with [them]1725-the two gentlemen from rosings at least an hour , hoping for [her]88-elizabeth return , and almost resolving to walk after [her]88-elizabeth till [she]88-elizabeth could be found . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth could but just affect concern in missing [him]172-colonel fitzwilliam ; [she]88-elizabeth really rejoiced at it . [Colonel Fitzwilliam]172-colonel fitzwilliam was no longer an object . [She]88-elizabeth could think only of [her]88-elizabeth letter . [ Illustration : “ [His]172-colonel fitzwilliam parting obeisance ”[88-elizabeth] ] CHAPTER XXXVII . [ Illustration ] [The two gentlemen]3593-the two gentlemen left [Rosings]19-rosings the next morning ; and [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins having been in waiting near [the lodges]1727-the lodges , to make [them]3593-the two gentlemen [his]134-mr. collins parting obeisance , was able to bring home the pleasing intelligence of [their]3593-the two gentlemen appearing in very good health , and in as tolerable spirits as could be expected , after the melancholy scene so lately gone through at [Rosings]19-rosings . To [Rosings]19-rosings [he]134-mr. collins then hastened to console [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine and [[her]93-lady catherine daughter]461-her daughter ; and on [his]134-mr. collins return brought back , with great satisfaction , a message from [[her]93-lady catherine Ladyship]3490-her ladyship , importing that [she]93-lady catherine felt [herself]93-lady catherine so dull as to make [her]93-lady catherine very desirous of having [them]3593-the two gentlemen all to dine with [her]93-lady catherine . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth could not see [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine without recollecting that , had [she]88-elizabeth chosen it , [she]88-elizabeth might by this time have been presented to [her]93-lady catherine as [[her]88-elizabeth future niece]1730-her future niece ; nor could [she]88-elizabeth think , without a smile , of what [her]93-lady catherine [Ladyship]176-ladyship ’s indignation would have been . “ What would [she]93-lady catherine have said ? how would [she]93-lady catherine have behaved ? ”[88-elizabeth] were the questions with which [she]88-elizabeth amused [herself]88-elizabeth . [Their]3593-the two gentlemen first subject was the diminution of [the Rosings]1731-the rosings ’ party . “ [I]93-lady catherine assure [you]3593-the two gentlemen , [I]93-lady catherine feel it exceedingly , ”[93-lady catherine] said [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine ; “ [I]93-lady catherine believe [nobody]3152-nobody feels the loss of [friends]1046-friends so much as [I]93-lady catherine do . But [I]93-lady catherine am particularly attached to [these young men]4300-these young men ; and know [them]4300-these young men to be so much attached to [me]93-lady catherine ! [They]4300-these young men were excessively sorry to go ! But so [they]4300-these young men always are . [The dear Colonel]4301-the dear colonel rallied [his]4301-the dear colonel spirits tolerably till just at last ; but [Darcy]96-mr. darcy seemed to feel it most acutely -- more , [I]93-lady catherine think , than last year . [His]96-mr. darcy attachment to [Rosings]18-rosings certainly increases . ”[93-lady catherine] [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins had a compliment and an allusion to throw in here , which were kindly smiled on by [the mother]393-the mother and [daughter]4118-daughter . [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine observed , after dinner , that [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth seemed out of spirits ; and immediately accounting for it [herself]93-lady catherine , by supposing that [she]88-elizabeth did not like to go [home]3288-home again so soon , [she]93-lady catherine added,-- “ But if that is the case , [you]4118-daughter must write to [[your]4118-daughter mother]967-your mother to beg that [you]4118-daughter may stay a little longer . [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins will be very glad of [your]4118-daughter company , [I]93-lady catherine am sure . ”[93-lady catherine] “ [I]88-elizabeth am much obliged to [[your]4118-daughter Ladyship]4164-your ladyship for [your]4118-daughter kind invitation , ”[88-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; “ but it is not in [my]88-elizabeth power to accept it . [I]88-elizabeth must be in [town]268-town next Saturday . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Why , at that rate , [you]4118-daughter will have been [here]3067-here only six weeks . [I]93-lady catherine expected [you]4118-daughter to stay two months . [I]93-lady catherine told [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins so before [you]4118-daughter came . There can be no occasion for [your]4118-daughter going so soon . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet could certainly spare [you]4118-daughter for another fortnight . ”[93-lady catherine] “ But [[my]88-elizabeth father]3323-my father can not . [He]3323-my father wrote last week to hurry [my]88-elizabeth return . ”[88-elizabeth] [ Illustration : “ [Dawson]177-dawson ”[88-elizabeth] “ Oh , [[your]88-elizabeth father]3292-your father , of course , may spare [you]88-elizabeth , if [[your]88-elizabeth mother]967-your mother can . [Daughters]3502-daughters are never of so much consequence to [a father]3312-a father . And if [you]4118-daughter will stay another month complete , it will be in [my]93-lady catherine power to take one of [you]4118-daughter as far as [London]5-london , for [I]93-lady catherine am going [there]306-there early in June , for a week ; and as [Dawson]177-dawson does not object to the barouche - box , there will be very good room for one of [you]4118-daughter -- and , indeed , if the weather should happen to be cool , [I]93-lady catherine should not object to taking [you]4118-daughter both , as [you]4118-daughter are neither of [you]4118-daughter large . ”[93-lady catherine] “ [You]4118-daughter are all kindness , [madam]3346-madam ; but [I]93-lady catherine believe [we]4313-we must abide by [our]4313-we original plan . ”[93-lady catherine] [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine seemed resigned . “ [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins , [you]166-mrs. collins must send [a servant]503-a servant with [them]4118-daughter . [You]166-mrs. collins know [I]93-lady catherine always speak [my]93-lady catherine mind , and [I]93-lady catherine can not bear the idea of [two young women]4315-two young women travelling post by [themselves]4315-two young women . It is highly improper . [You]166-mrs. collins must contrive to send [somebody]837-somebody . [I]93-lady catherine have the greatest dislike in [the world]304-the world to that sort of thing . [Young women]4318-young women should always be properly guarded and attended , according to [their]4318-young women situation in life . When [[my]93-lady catherine niece]4319-my niece [Georgiana]153-georgiana went to [Ramsgate]35-ramsgate last summer , [I]93-lady catherine made a point of [her]153-georgiana having [two men]4320-two men - [servants]1352-servants go with [her]153-georgiana . [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy , [the daughter of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy of [Pemberley]12-pemberley]4322-the daughter of mr. darcy of pemberley , and [Lady Anne]146-anne , could not have appeared with propriety in a different manner . [I]93-lady catherine am excessively attentive to all those things . [You]93-lady catherine must send [John]178-john with [the young ladies]264-the young ladies , [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins . [I]93-lady catherine am glad it occurred to [me]93-lady catherine to mention it ; for it would really be discreditable to [you]93-lady catherine to let [them]264-the young ladies go alone . ”[93-lady catherine] “ [[My]88-elizabeth uncle]721-my uncle is to send [a servant]503-a servant for [us]4326-us . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Oh ! [[Your]88-elizabeth uncle]3438-your uncle ! [He]3438-your uncle keeps [a man - servant]4328-a man - servant , does [he]3438-your uncle ? [I]93-lady catherine am very glad [you]93-lady catherine have [somebody who thinks of those things]4329-somebody who thinks of those things . Where shall [you]93-lady catherine change horses ? Oh , [Bromley]179-bromley , of course . If [you]93-lady catherine mention [my]93-lady catherine name at the Bell , [you]93-lady catherine will be attended to . ”[93-lady catherine] [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine had many other questions to ask respecting [their]1735-their journey ; and as [she]93-lady catherine did not answer [them]1736-them all [herself]93-lady catherine attention was necessary -- which [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth believed to be lucky for [her]88-elizabeth ; or , with a mind so occupied , [she]88-elizabeth might have forgotten where [she]88-elizabeth was . Reflection must be reserved for solitary hours : whenever [she]88-elizabeth was alone , [she]88-elizabeth gave way to it as the greatest relief ; and not a day went by without a solitary walk , in which [she]88-elizabeth might indulge in all the delight of unpleasant recollections . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s letter [she]88-elizabeth was in a fair way of soon knowing by heart . [She]88-elizabeth studied every sentence ; and [her]88-elizabeth feelings towards [its writer]3505-its writer were at times widely different . When [she]88-elizabeth remembered the style of [his]96-mr. darcy address , [she]88-elizabeth was still full of indignation : but when [she]88-elizabeth considered how unjustly [she]88-elizabeth had condemned and upbraided [him]96-mr. darcy , [her]88-elizabeth anger was turned against [herself]88-elizabeth ; and [his]96-mr. darcy disappointed feelings became the object of compassion . [His]96-mr. darcy attachment excited gratitude , [his]96-mr. darcy general character respect : but [she]88-elizabeth could not approve [him]96-mr. darcy ; nor could [she]88-elizabeth for a moment repent [her]88-elizabeth refusal , or feel the slightest inclination ever to see [him]96-mr. darcy again . In [her]88-elizabeth own past behaviour , there was a constant source of vexation and regret : and in the unhappy defects of [[her]88-elizabeth family]3710-her family , a subject of yet heavier chagrin . [They]3710-her family were hopeless of remedy . [[Her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father , contented with laughing at [them]3710-her family , would never exert [himself]249-her father to restrain the wild giddiness of [[his]249-her father youngest daughters]1740-his youngest daughters ; and [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother , with manners so far from right [herself]246-her mother , was entirely insensible of the evil . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had frequently united with [Jane]89-jane in an endeavour to check the imprudence of [Catherine]93-lady catherine and [Lydia]90-lydia ; but while [they]3710-her family were supported by [[their]3710-her family mother]433-their mother ’s indulgence , what chance could there be of improvement ? [Catherine]93-lady catherine , weak - spirited , irritable , and completely under [Lydia]90-lydia ’s guidance , had been always affronted by [their]3710-her family advice ; and [Lydia]90-lydia , self - willed and careless , would scarcely give [them]3710-her family a hearing . [They]3710-her family were ignorant , idle , and vain . While there was [an officer in [Meryton]9-meryton]1743-an officer in meryton , [they]3710-her family would flirt with [him]1743-an officer in meryton ; and while [Meryton]9-meryton was within a walk of [Longbourn]7-longbourn , [they]3710-her family would be going [there]306-there for ever . Anxiety on [Jane]89-jane ’s behalf was another prevailing concern ; and [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s explanation , by restoring [Bingley]85-mr. bingley to all [her]89-jane former good opinion , heightened the sense of what [Jane]89-jane had lost . [His]96-mr. darcy affection was proved to have been sincere , and [his]96-mr. darcy conduct cleared of all blame , unless any could attach to the implicitness of [his]96-mr. darcy confidence in [[his]96-mr. darcy friend]288-his friend . How grievous then was the thought that , of a situation so desirable in every respect , so replete with advantage , so promising for happiness , [Jane]89-jane had been deprived , by the folly and indecorum of [[her]89-jane own family]4222-her own family ! When to these recollections was added the development of [Wickham]142-wickham ’s character , it may be easily believed that the happy spirits which had seldom been depressed before were now so much affected as to make it almost impossible for [her]89-jane to appear tolerably cheerful . [Their]3710-her family engagements at Rosings were as frequent during the last week of [her]89-jane stay as they had been at first . The very last evening was spent [there]306-there ; and [[her]89-jane Ladyship]3490-her ladyship again inquired minutely into the particulars of [their]3710-her family journey , gave [them]3710-her family directions as to the best method of packing , and was so urgent on the necessity of placing gowns in the only right way , that [Maria]101-maria thought [herself]101-maria obliged , on [her]101-maria return , to undo all the work of the morning , and pack [her]101-maria trunk afresh . When [they]3710-her family parted , [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , with great condescension , wished [them]3710-her family a good journey , and invited [them]3710-her family to come to [Hunsford]15-hunsford again next year ; and [Miss de Bourgh]138-miss de bourgh exerted [herself]138-miss de bourgh so far as to courtesy and hold out [her]138-miss de bourgh hand to [both]1721-both . [ Illustration : “ The elevation of [his]134-mr. collins feelings . ”[138-miss de bourgh] ] CHAPTER XXXVIII . [ Illustration ] On Saturday morning [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth and [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins met for breakfast a few minutes before [the others]511-the others appeared ; and [he]134-mr. collins took the opportunity of paying the parting civilities which [he]134-mr. collins deemed indispensably necessary . “ [I]134-mr. collins know not , [Miss Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , ”[134-mr. collins] said [he]134-mr. collins , “ whether [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins has yet expressed [her]166-mrs. collins sense of [your]88-elizabeth kindness in coming to [us]4330-our ; but [I]134-mr. collins am very certain [you]88-elizabeth will not leave [the house]3075-the house without receiving [her]166-mrs. collins thanks for it . The favour of [[your]88-elizabeth company]4332-your company has been much felt , [I]134-mr. collins assure [you]88-elizabeth . [We]4330-our know how little there is to tempt [anyone]3174-anyone to [[our]4330-our humble abode]4334-our humble abode . [Our]4330-our plain manner of living , [[our]4330-our small rooms]4335-our small rooms , and few domestics , and the little [we]4330-our see of [the world]304-the world , must make [Hunsford]15-hunsford extremely dull to [a young lady]3333-a young lady like [yourself]88-elizabeth ; but [I]134-mr. collins hope [you]88-elizabeth will believe [us]4330-our grateful for the condescension , and that [we]4330-our have done everything in [our]4330-our power to prevent [you]88-elizabeth spending [your]88-elizabeth time unpleasantly . ”[134-mr. collins] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was eager with [her]88-elizabeth thanks and assurances of happiness . [She]88-elizabeth had spent six weeks with great enjoyment ; and the pleasure of being with [Charlotte]107-charlotte , and the kind attention [she]107-charlotte had received , must make [her]88-elizabeth feel the obliged . [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins was gratified ; and with a more smiling solemnity replied,-- “ It gives [me]134-mr. collins the greatest pleasure to hear that [you]88-elizabeth have passed [your]88-elizabeth time not disagreeably . [We]4330-our have certainly done [our]4330-our best ; and most fortunately having it in [our]4330-our power to introduce [you]88-elizabeth to [very superior society]4338-very superior society , and from [our]4330-our connection with Rosings , the frequent means of varying the humble home scene , [I]134-mr. collins think [we]4330-our may flatter [ourselves]4330-our that [your]88-elizabeth [Hunsford]15-hunsford visit can not have been entirely irksome . [Our]4330-our situation with regard to [[Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine ’s family]4339-lady catherine ’s family is , indeed , the sort of extraordinary advantage and blessing which [few]4340-few can boast . [You]88-elizabeth see on what a footing [we]4330-our are . [You]88-elizabeth see how continually [we]4330-our are engaged [there]306-there . In truth , [I]134-mr. collins must acknowledge , that , with all the disadvantages of this humble parsonage , [I]134-mr. collins should not think [anyone]3174-anyone abiding in it an object of compassion , while [they]3174-anyone are sharers of [our]4330-our intimacy at Rosings . ”[134-mr. collins] Words were insufficient for the elevation of [his]1751-his feelings ; and [he]1751-his was obliged to walk about [the room]255-the room , while [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth tried to unite civility and truth in a few short sentences . “ [You]88-elizabeth may , in fact , carry a very favourable report of [us]4330-our into [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , [[my]88-elizabeth dear cousin]983-my dear cousin . [I]88-elizabeth flatter [myself]88-elizabeth , at least , that [you]88-elizabeth will be able to do so . [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine ’s great attentions to [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins [you]88-elizabeth have been a daily witness of ; and altogether [I]88-elizabeth trust it does not appear that [[your]88-elizabeth friend]3112-your friend has drawn an unfortunate -- but on this point it will be as well to be silent . Only let [me]88-elizabeth assure [you]88-elizabeth , [[my]88-elizabeth dear]3066-my dear [Miss Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , that [I]88-elizabeth can from [my]88-elizabeth heart most cordially wish [you]88-elizabeth equal felicity in marriage . [[My]88-elizabeth dear]3066-my dear [Charlotte]107-charlotte and [I]88-elizabeth have but one mind and one way of thinking . There is in everything a most remarkable resemblance of character and ideas between [us]1754-their . [We]1754-their seem to have been designed for each other . ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth could safely say that it was a great happiness where that was the case , and with equal sincerity could add , that [she]88-elizabeth firmly believed and rejoiced in [his]1753-his domestic comforts . [She]88-elizabeth was not sorry , however , to have the recital of [them]1754-their interrupted by the entrance of [the lady from whom [they]1754-their sprang]1755-the lady from whom they sprang . [Poor Charlotte]180-charlotte ! it was melancholy to leave [her]180-charlotte to such society ! But [she]180-charlotte had chosen it with [her]180-charlotte eyes open ; and though evidently regretting that [[her]180-charlotte visitors]1369-her visitors were to go , [she]180-charlotte did not seem to ask for compassion . [[Her]180-charlotte home]351-her home and [[her]180-charlotte housekeeping]267-her housekeeping , [[her]180-charlotte parish]1759-her parish and [[her]180-charlotte poultry]1760-her poultry , and all [their]1754-their dependent concerns , had not yet lost [their]1754-their charms . At length the chaise arrived , the trunks were fastened on , the parcels placed within , and it was pronounced to be ready . After an affectionate parting between [the friends]1761-the friends , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was attended to [the carriage]3286-the carriage by [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ; and as [they]1763-they walked down [the garden]1291-the garden , [he]134-mr. collins was commissioning [her]88-elizabeth with [his]134-mr. collins best respects to [all [her]88-elizabeth family]1300-all her family , not forgetting [his]134-mr. collins thanks for the kindness [he]134-mr. collins had received at [Longbourn]7-longbourn in the winter , and [his]134-mr. collins compliments to [Mr.]1766-mr. and [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner , though unknown . [He]134-mr. collins then handed [her]88-elizabeth in , [Maria]101-maria followed , and the door was on the point of being closed , when [he]134-mr. collins suddenly reminded [them]1763-they , with some consternation , that [they]1763-they had hitherto forgotten to leave any message for [the ladies of Rosings]1767-the ladies of rosings . [ [Illustration]110-illustration : “ [They]1763-they had forgotten to leave any message ”[110-illustration] ] “ But , ”[134-mr. collins] [he]134-mr. collins added , “ [you]88-elizabeth will of course wish to have [your]88-elizabeth humble respects delivered to [them]1763-they , with [your]88-elizabeth grateful thanks for [their]1763-they kindness to [you]88-elizabeth while [you]88-elizabeth have been [here]3067-here . ”[134-mr. collins] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth made no objection : the door was then allowed to be shut , and [the carriage]3286-the carriage drove off . “ Good gracious ! ”[101-maria] cried [Maria]101-maria , after a few minutes ’ silence , “ it seems but a day or two since [we]1770-we first came ! and yet how many things have happened ! ”[101-maria] “ A great many indeed , ”[1769-her companion] said [[her]88-elizabeth companion]1769-her companion , with a sigh . “ [We]1770-we have dined nine times at [Rosings]19-rosings , besides drinking tea there twice ! How much [I]88-elizabeth shall have to tell ! ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth privately added , “ And how much [I]88-elizabeth shall have to conceal ! ”[88-elizabeth] [Their]1770-we journey was performed without much conversation , or any alarm ; and within four hours of [their]1770-we leaving [Hunsford]15-hunsford [they]1770-we reached [[Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner ’s house]1771-mr. gardiner ’s house , where [they]1770-we were to remain a few days . [Jane]89-jane looked well , and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had little opportunity of studying [her]88-elizabeth spirits , amidst the various engagements which the kindness of [[her]88-elizabeth aunt]4017-her aunt had reserved for [them]1770-we . But [Jane]89-jane was to go [home]3288-home with [her]88-elizabeth , and at [Longbourn]7-longbourn there would be leisure enough for observation . It was not without an effort , meanwhile , that [she]88-elizabeth could wait even for [Longbourn]7-longbourn , before [she]88-elizabeth told [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s proposals . To know that [she]88-elizabeth had the power of revealing what would so exceedingly astonish [Jane]89-jane , and must , at the same time , so highly gratify whatever of [her]88-elizabeth own vanity [she]88-elizabeth had not yet been able to reason away , was such a temptation to openness as nothing could have conquered , but the state of indecision in which [she]88-elizabeth remained as to the extent of what [she]88-elizabeth should communicate , and [her]88-elizabeth fear , if [she]88-elizabeth once entered on the subject , of being hurried into repeating something of [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , which might only grieve [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister further . [ Illustration : “ How nicely [we]480-the three young ladies are crammed in ”[88-elizabeth] ] CHAPTER XXXIX . [ Illustration ] It was the second week in May , in which [the three young ladies]480-the three young ladies set out together from [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street for [the town of ----]1777-the town of ---- , in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire ; and , as [they]480-the three young ladies drew near [the appointed inn where [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet ’s carriage]1778-the appointed inn where mr. bennet ’s carriage was to meet [them]480-the three young ladies , [they]480-the three young ladies quickly perceived , in token of [the coachman]1779-the coachman ’s punctuality , both [Kitty]93-lady catherine and [Lydia]90-lydia looking out of [a dining - room]1780-a dining - room [upstairs]3537-upstairs . [These two girls]1782-these two girls had been above an hour in [the place]3068-the place , happily employed in visiting [an opposite milliner]1784-an opposite milliner , watching [the sentinel on guard]1785-the sentinel on guard , and dressing a salad and cucumber . After welcoming [[their]480-the three young ladies sisters]447-their sisters , [they]480-the three young ladies triumphantly displayed a table set out with such cold meat as [an inn larder]1787-an inn larder usually affords , exclaiming , “ Is not this nice ? is not this an agreeable surprise ? ”[480-the three young ladies] “ And [we]480-the three young ladies mean to treat [you]1782-these two girls all , ”[90-lydia] added [Lydia]90-lydia ; “ but [you]1782-these two girls must lend [us]480-the three young ladies the money , for [we]480-the three young ladies have just spent [ours]480-the three young ladies at [the shop out there]4348-the shop out there . ”[90-lydia] Then showing [her]90-lydia purchases,--“Look here , [I]90-lydia have bought this bonnet . [I]90-lydia do not think it is very pretty ; but [I]90-lydia thought [I]90-lydia might as well buy it as not . [I]90-lydia shall pull it to pieces as soon as [I]90-lydia get [home]3288-home , and see if [I]90-lydia can make it up any better . ”[90-lydia] And when [[her]90-lydia sisters]3096-her sisters abused it as ugly , [she]90-lydia added , with perfect unconcern , “ Oh , but there were two or three much uglier in [the shop]4350-the shop ; and when [I]90-lydia have bought some prettier - coloured satin to trim it with fresh , [I]90-lydia think it will be very tolerable . Besides , it will not much signify what [one]3113-one wears this summer , after the ----shire have left [Meryton]9-meryton , and [they]3096-her sisters are going in a fortnight . ”[90-lydia] “ Are [they]3096-her sisters , indeed ? ”[88-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , with the greatest satisfaction . “ [They]3096-her sisters are going to be encamped near [Brighton]36-brighton ; and [I]88-elizabeth do so want [papa]181-papa to take [us]4352-us all [there]306-there for the summer ! It would be such a delicious scheme , and [I]88-elizabeth dare say would hardly cost anything at all . [Mamma]119-mamma would like to go , too , of all things ! Only think what a miserable summer else [we]4352-us shall have ! ”[88-elizabeth] “ Yes , ”[88-elizabeth] thought [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; “ that would be a delightful scheme , indeed , and completely do for [us]4352-us at once . [Good Heaven]37-good heaven ! [Brighton]36-brighton and [a whole campful of [soldiers]4355-soldiers]4354-a whole campful of soldiers , to [us]4352-us , who have been overset already by [one poor regiment of militia]4356-one poor regiment of militia , and the monthly balls of [Meryton]9-meryton ! ”[88-elizabeth] “ Now [I]90-lydia have got some news for [you]88-elizabeth , ”[90-lydia] said [Lydia]90-lydia , as [they]1789-they sat down to table . “ What do [you]88-elizabeth think ? It is excellent news , capital news , and about [a certain person that [we]4352-us all like]4357-a certain person that we all like . ”[90-lydia] [Jane]89-jane and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth looked at [each other]3216-each other , and [the waiter]1791-the waiter was told that [he]1791-the waiter need not stay . [Lydia]90-lydia laughed , and said,-- “ Ay , that is just like [your]88-elizabeth formality and discretion . [You]88-elizabeth thought [the waiter]1791-the waiter must not hear , as if [he]1791-the waiter cared ! [I]90-lydia dare say [he]1791-the waiter often hears worse things said than [I]90-lydia am going to say . But [he]1791-the waiter is [an ugly fellow]4359-an ugly fellow ! [I]90-lydia am glad [he]1791-the waiter is gone . [I]90-lydia never saw such a long chin in [my]90-lydia life . Well , but now for [my]90-lydia news : it is about [dear Wickham]142-wickham ; too good for [the waiter]1791-the waiter , is not it ? There is no danger of [Wickham]142-wickham ’s marrying [Mary King]94-mary -- there ’s for [you]88-elizabeth ! [She]94-mary is gone down to [[her]94-mary uncle]579-her uncle at [Liverpool]38-liverpool ; gone to stay . [Wickham]142-wickham is safe . ”[90-lydia] “ And [Mary King]94-mary is safe ! ”[88-elizabeth] added [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; “ safe from a connection imprudent as to fortune . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [She]94-mary is [a great fool]4362-a great fool for going away , if [she]94-mary liked [him]142-wickham . ”[90-lydia] “ But [I]89-jane hope there is no strong attachment on either side , ”[89-jane] said [Jane]89-jane . “ [I]89-jane am sure there is not on [his]142-wickham . [I]89-jane will answer for it , [he]142-wickham never cared three straws about [her]94-mary . Who could about such a nasty little freckled thing ? ”[89-jane] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was shocked to think that , however incapable of such coarseness of expression [herself]88-elizabeth , the coarseness of the sentiment was little other than [her]88-elizabeth own breast had formerly harboured and fancied liberal ! As soon as all had ate , and [the elder ones]1792-the elder ones paid , [the carriage]3286-the carriage was ordered ; and , after some contrivance , [the whole party]525-the whole party , with all [their]525-the whole party boxes , workbags , and parcels , and the unwelcome addition of [Kitty]93-lady catherine ’s and [Lydia]90-lydia ’s purchases , were seated in it . “ How nicely [we]525-the whole party are crammed in ! ”[90-lydia] cried [Lydia]90-lydia . “ [I]90-lydia am glad [I]90-lydia brought [my]90-lydia bonnet , if it is only for the fun of having another band - box ! Well , now let [us]525-the whole party be quite comfortable and snug , and talk and laugh all the way [home]3288-home . And in the first place , let [us]525-the whole party hear what has happened to [you]4364-you all since [you]4364-you went away . Have [you]4364-you seen [any pleasant men]4365-any pleasant men ? Have [you]4364-you had any flirting ? [I]90-lydia was in great hopes that one of [you]4364-you would have got [a husband]1016-a husband before [you]4364-you came back . [Jane]89-jane will be quite [an old maid]3899-an old maid soon , [I]90-lydia declare . [She]89-jane is almost three - and - twenty ! Lord ! how ashamed [I]90-lydia should be of not being married before three - and - twenty ! [[My]90-lydia aunt]3279-my aunt [Philips]116-mr. philips wants [you]4364-you so to get [husbands]4369-husbands [you]4364-you ca n’t think . [She]3279-my aunt says [Lizzy]88-elizabeth had better have taken [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ; but [I]90-lydia do not think there would have been any fun in it . [Lord]4370-lord ! how [I]90-lydia should like to be married before any of [you]4364-you ! and then [I]90-lydia would chaperon [you]4364-you about to all the balls . Dear [me]90-lydia ! [we]4371-we had such a good piece of fun the other day at [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster ’s ! [Kitty]93-lady catherine and [me]90-lydia were to spend the day [there]306-there , and [Mrs. Forster]182-mrs. forster promised to have a little dance in the evening ; ( by - the - bye , [Mrs. Forster]182-mrs. forster and [me]90-lydia are such [friends]1046-friends ! ) and so [she]182-mrs. forster asked [the two Harringtons]4374-the two harringtons to come : but [Harriet]183-harriet was ill , and so [Pen]184-pen was forced to come by [herself]184-pen ; and then , what do [you]4364-you think [we]4371-we did ? [We]4371-we dressed up [Chamberlayne]185-chamberlayne in [woman]4375-woman ’s clothes , on purpose to pass for [a lady,--only]4376-a lady,--only think what fun ! [Not a soul]4377-not a soul knew of it , but [Colonel]113-colonel forster and [Mrs. Forster]182-mrs. forster , and [Kitty]93-lady catherine and [me]90-lydia , except [[my]90-lydia aunt]3279-my aunt , for [we]4371-we were forced to borrow one of [her]3279-my aunt gowns ; and [you]4364-you can not imagine how well [he]185-chamberlayne looked ! When [Denny]141-denny , and [Wickham]142-wickham , and [Pratt]186-pratt , and [two or three more of [the men]4380-the men]4379-two or three more of the men came in , [they]1795-their did not know [him]185-chamberlayne in the least . [Lord]4381-lord ! how [I]90-lydia laughed ! and so did [Mrs. Forster]182-mrs. forster . [I]90-lydia thought [I]90-lydia should have died . And that made [the men]4380-the men suspect something , and then [they]4380-the men soon found out what was the matter . ”[90-lydia] With such kind of histories of [their]1795-their parties and good jokes did [Lydia]90-lydia , assisted by [Kitty]93-lady catherine ’s hints and additions , endeavour to amuse [[her]90-lydia companions]1159-her companions all the way to [Longbourn]7-longbourn . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth listened as little as [she]88-elizabeth could , but there was no escaping the frequent mention of [Wickham]142-wickham ’s name . [Their]1795-their reception at [home]3288-home was most kind . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet rejoiced to see [Jane]89-jane in undiminished beauty ; and more than once during dinner did [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet say voluntarily to [Elizabeth,----]187-elizabeth,---- “ [I]1795-their am glad [you]187-elizabeth,---- are come back , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth . ”[1795-their] [Their]1795-their party in [the dining - room]3520-the dining - room was large , for almost all [the Lucases]106-the lucases came to meet [Maria]101-maria and hear the news ; and various were the subjects which occupied [them]1795-their : [Lady Lucas]87-lady lucas was inquiring of [Maria]101-maria , across the table , after the welfare and poultry of [[her]87-lady lucas eldest daughter]313-her eldest daughter ; [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet was doubly engaged , on one hand collecting an account of the present fashions from [Jane]89-jane , who sat some way below [her]89-jane , and on the other , retailing them all to [the younger Miss Lucases]106-the lucases ; and [Lydia]90-lydia , in a voice rather louder than [any other person]3903-any other person ’s , was enumerating the various pleasures of the morning to [anybody who would hear [her]90-lydia]1801-anybody who would hear her . “ Oh , [Mary]94-mary , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [she]92-mrs. bennet , “ [I]92-mrs. bennet wish [you]94-mary had gone with [us]4383-we , for [we]4383-we had such fun ! as [we]4383-we went along [Kitty]93-lady catherine and [me]92-mrs. bennet drew up all the blinds , and pretended there was [nobody]3152-nobody in [the coach]3290-the coach ; and [I]92-mrs. bennet should have gone so all the way , if [Kitty]93-lady catherine had not been sick ; and when [we]4383-we got to [the George]39-the george , [I]92-mrs. bennet do think [we]4383-we behaved very handsomely , for [we]4383-we treated [the other three]4386-the other three with the nicest cold luncheon in [the world]304-the world , and if [you]94-mary would have gone , [we]4383-we would have treated [you]94-mary too . And then when [we]4383-we came away it was such fun ! [I]92-mrs. bennet thought [we]4383-we never should have got into [the coach]3290-the coach . [I]92-mrs. bennet was ready to die of laughter . And then [we]4383-we were so merry all the way [home]3288-home ! [we]4383-we talked and laughed so loud , that [anybody]3171-anybody might have heard [us]4383-we ten miles off ! ”[92-mrs. bennet] To this , [Mary]94-mary very gravely replied , “ Far be it from [me]94-mary , [[my]94-mary dear sister]1077-my dear sister , to depreciate such pleasures . [They]4392-they would doubtless be congenial with the generality of female minds . But [I]94-mary confess [they]4392-they would have no charms for [me]94-mary . [I]94-mary should infinitely prefer a book . ”[94-mary] But of this answer [Lydia]90-lydia heard not a word . [She]90-lydia seldom listened to [anybody]3171-anybody for more than half a minute , and never attended to [Mary]94-mary at all . In the afternoon [Lydia]90-lydia was urgent with [the rest of [the girls]3082-the girls]1803-the rest of the girls to walk to [Meryton]9-meryton , and see how [everybody]305-everybody went on ; but [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth steadily opposed the scheme . It should not be said , that [the Miss Bennets]105-the bennets could not be at [home]3288-home half a day before [they]105-the bennets were in pursuit of [the officers]452-the officers . There was another reason , too , for [her]88-elizabeth opposition . [She]88-elizabeth dreaded seeing [Wickham]142-wickham again , and was resolved to avoid it as long as possible . The comfort to [her]88-elizabeth , of [the regiment]654-the regiment ’s approaching removal , was indeed beyond expression . In a fortnight [they]105-the bennets were to go , and once gone , [she]88-elizabeth hoped there could be nothing more to plague [her]88-elizabeth on [his]142-wickham account . [She]88-elizabeth had not been many hours at [home]3288-home , before [she]88-elizabeth found that the [Brighton]36-brighton scheme , of which [Lydia]90-lydia had given [them]105-the bennets a hint at [the inn]1810-the inn , was under frequent discussion between [[her]88-elizabeth parents]1811-her parents . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth saw directly that [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father had not the smallest intention of yielding ; but [his]249-her father answers were at the same time so vague and equivocal , that [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother , though often disheartened , had never yet despaired of succeeding at last . [ Illustration ] [CHAPTER XL]188-chapter xl . [ Illustration ] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s impatience to acquaint [Jane]89-jane with what had happened could no longer be overcome ; and at length resolving to suppress every particular in which [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister was concerned , and preparing [her]89-jane to be surprised , [she]88-elizabeth related to [her]89-jane the next morning [the chief of the scene between [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy and [herself]88-elizabeth]1815-the chief of the scene between mr. darcy and herself . [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth ’s astonishment was soon lessened by the strong sisterly partiality which made any admiration of [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth appear perfectly natural ; and all surprise was shortly lost in other feelings . [She]88-elizabeth was sorry that [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy should have delivered [his]96-mr. darcy sentiments in a manner so little suited to recommend them ; but still more was [she]88-elizabeth grieved for the unhappiness which [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ’s refusal must have given [him]96-mr. darcy . “ [His]96-mr. darcy being so sure of succeeding was wrong , ”[88-elizabeth] said [she]88-elizabeth , “ and certainly ought not to have appeared ; but consider how much it must increase [his]96-mr. darcy disappointment . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Indeed , ”[88-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ [I]88-elizabeth am heartily sorry for [him]96-mr. darcy ; but [he]96-mr. darcy has other feelings which will probably soon drive away [his]96-mr. darcy regard for [me]88-elizabeth . [You]88-elizabeth do not blame [me]88-elizabeth , however , for refusing [him]96-mr. darcy ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Blame [you]88-elizabeth ! Oh , no . ”[88-elizabeth] “ But [you]88-elizabeth blame [me]88-elizabeth for having spoken so warmly of [Wickham]142-wickham ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ No -- [I]88-elizabeth do not know that [you]88-elizabeth were wrong in saying what [you]88-elizabeth did . ”[88-elizabeth] “ But [you]88-elizabeth will know it , when [I]88-elizabeth have told [you]88-elizabeth what happened the very next day . ”[88-elizabeth] [She]88-elizabeth then spoke of the letter , repeating the whole of its contents as far as [they]1817-them concerned [George Wickham]149-george wickham . What a stroke was this for [poor [Jane]89-jane , who would willingly have gone through [the world]304-the world without believing that so much wickedness existed in [the whole race of mankind]1819-the whole race of mankind as was here collected in [one individual]1134-one individual]89-jane ! Nor was [Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s vindication , though grateful to [her]89-jane feelings , capable of consoling [her]89-jane for such discovery . Most earnestly did [she]89-jane labour to prove the probability of error , and seek to clear one , without involving the other . “ This will not do , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; “ [you]88-elizabeth never will be able to make both of [them]1817-them good for anything . Take [your]88-elizabeth choice , but [you]88-elizabeth must be satisfied with only one . There is but such a quantity of merit between [them]1817-them ; just enough to make [one good sort of man]4393-one good sort of man ; and of late it has been shifting about pretty much . For [my]88-elizabeth part , [I]88-elizabeth am inclined to believe it all [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s , but [you]88-elizabeth shall do as [you]88-elizabeth choose . ”[88-elizabeth] It was some time , however , before a smile could be extorted from [Jane]89-jane . “ [I]89-jane do not know when [I]89-jane have been more shocked , ”[89-jane] said [she]89-jane . “ [Wickham]142-wickham so very bad ! It is almost past belief . And poor [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ! dear [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , only consider what [he]96-mr. darcy must have suffered . Such a disappointment ! and with the knowledge of [your]88-elizabeth ill opinion too ! and having to relate such a thing of [[his]96-mr. darcy sister]565-his sister ! It is really too distressing , [I]89-jane am sure [you]88-elizabeth must feel it so . ”[89-jane] “ Oh no , [my]89-jane regret and compassion are all done away by seeing [you]88-elizabeth so full of both . [I]89-jane know [you]88-elizabeth will do [him]96-mr. darcy such ample justice , that [I]89-jane am growing every moment more unconcerned and indifferent . [Your]88-elizabeth profusion makes [me]89-jane saving ; and if [you]88-elizabeth lament over [him]96-mr. darcy much longer , [my]89-jane heart will be as light as a feather . ”[89-jane] “ [Poor Wickham]189-poor wickham ! there is such an expression of goodness in [his]96-mr. darcy countenance ! such an openness and gentleness in [his]96-mr. darcy manner . ”[89-jane] “ There certainly was some great mismanagement in the education of [those two young men]4395-those two young men . One has got all the goodness , and the other all the appearance of it . ”[89-jane] “ [I]89-jane never thought [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy so deficient in the appearance of it as [you]89-jane used to do . ”[89-jane] “ And yet [I]89-jane meant to be uncommonly clever in taking so decided a dislike to [him]96-mr. darcy , without any reason . It is such a spur to one ’s genius , such an opening for wit , to have a dislike of that kind . [One]190-one may be continually abusive without saying anything just ; but [one]3113-one can not be always laughing at [a man]3114-a man without now and then stumbling on something witty . ”[89-jane] “ [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , when [you]88-elizabeth first read that letter , [I]89-jane am sure [you]88-elizabeth could not treat the matter as [you]88-elizabeth do now . ”[89-jane] “ Indeed , [I]89-jane could not . [I]89-jane was uncomfortable enough , [I]89-jane was very uncomfortable -- [I]89-jane may say unhappy . And with [no one]3336-no one to speak to of what [I]89-jane felt , [no Jane]4399-no jane to comfort [me]89-jane , and say that [I]89-jane had not been so very weak , and vain , and nonsensical , as [I]89-jane knew [I]89-jane had ! Oh , how [I]89-jane wanted [you]88-elizabeth ! ”[89-jane] “ How unfortunate that [you]88-elizabeth should have used such very strong expressions in speaking of [Wickham]142-wickham to [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , for now [they]4400-they do appear wholly undeserved . ”[89-jane] “ Certainly . But the misfortune of speaking with bitterness is a most natural consequence of the prejudices [I]89-jane had been encouraging . There is one point on which [I]89-jane want [your]88-elizabeth advice . [I]89-jane want to be told whether [I]89-jane ought , or ought not , to make [our]4401-our acquaintance in general understand [Wickham]142-wickham ’s character . ”[89-jane] [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth paused a little , and then replied , “ Surely there can be no occasion for exposing [him]142-wickham so dreadfully . What is [your]88-elizabeth own opinion ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ That it ought not to be attempted . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy has not authorized [me]89-jane to make [his]142-wickham communication public . On the contrary , [every particular relative to [[his]142-wickham sister]565-his sister]4402-every particular relative to his sister was meant to be kept as much as possible to [myself]89-jane ; and if [I]89-jane endeavour to undeceive [people]3299-people as to the rest of [his]142-wickham conduct , who will believe [me]89-jane ? The general prejudice against [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy is so violent , that it would be the death of [half [the good people]4406-the good people in [Meryton]9-meryton]4405-half the good people in meryton , to attempt to place [him]142-wickham in an amiable light . [I]89-jane am not equal to it . [Wickham]142-wickham will soon be gone ; and , therefore , it will not signify to [anybody here]4407-anybody here what [he]142-wickham really is . Some time hence it will be all found out , and then [we]4408-we may laugh at [their]3299-people stupidity in not knowing it before . At present [I]89-jane will say nothing about it . ”[89-jane] “ [You]89-jane are quite right . To have [his]142-wickham errors made public might ruin [him]142-wickham for ever . [He]142-wickham is now , perhaps , sorry for what [he]142-wickham has done , and anxious to re - establish a character . [We]4408-we must not make [him]142-wickham desperate . ”[89-jane] The tumult of [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s mind was allayed by this conversation . [She]88-elizabeth had got rid of two of the secrets which had weighed on [her]88-elizabeth for a fortnight , and was certain of [a willing listener in [Jane]89-jane]1821-a willing listener in jane , whenever [she]88-elizabeth might wish to talk again of either . But there was still something lurking behind , of which prudence forbade the disclosure . [She]88-elizabeth dared not relate the other half of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s letter , nor explain to [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister how sincerely [she]88-elizabeth had been valued by [[his]96-mr. darcy friend]288-his friend . Here was knowledge in which [no one]3336-no one could partake ; and [she]88-elizabeth was sensible that nothing less than a perfect understanding between [the parties]3221-the parties could justify [her]88-elizabeth in throwing off this last encumbrance of mystery . “ And then , ”[88-elizabeth] said [she]88-elizabeth , “ if that very improbable event should ever take place , [I]88-elizabeth shall merely be able to tell what [Bingley]85-mr. bingley may tell in a much more agreeable manner [himself]85-mr. bingley . The liberty of communication can not be mine till it has lost all its value ! ”[88-elizabeth] [She]88-elizabeth was now , on being settled at [home]3288-home , at leisure to observe the real state of [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ’s spirits . [Jane]89-jane was not happy . [She]89-jane still cherished a very tender affection for [Bingley]85-mr. bingley . Having never even fancied [herself]88-elizabeth in love before , [her]88-elizabeth regard had all the warmth of first attachment , and from [her]88-elizabeth age and disposition , greater steadiness than first attachments often boast ; and so fervently did [she]88-elizabeth value [his]85-mr. bingley remembrance , and prefer [him]85-mr. bingley to [every other man]1828-every other man , that all [her]88-elizabeth good sense , and all [her]88-elizabeth attention to the feelings of [[her]88-elizabeth friends]311-her friends , were requisite to check the indulgence of those regrets which must have been injurious to [her]88-elizabeth own health and [their]311-her friends tranquillity . “ Well , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , one day , “ what is [your]88-elizabeth opinion now of this sad business of [Jane]89-jane ’s ? For [my]92-mrs. bennet part , [I]92-mrs. bennet am determined never to speak of it again to [anybody]3171-anybody . [I]92-mrs. bennet told [[my]92-mrs. bennet sister]3345-my sister Philips so the other day . But [I]92-mrs. bennet can not find out that [Jane]89-jane saw anything of [him]85-mr. bingley in [London]5-london . Well , [he]85-mr. bingley is [a very undeserving young man]4411-a very undeserving young man -- and [I]92-mrs. bennet do not suppose there is the least chance in [the world]304-the world of [her]89-jane ever getting [him]85-mr. bingley now . There is no talk of [his]85-mr. bingley coming to [Netherfield]2-netherfield again in the summer ; and [I]92-mrs. bennet have inquired of [everybody]305-everybody , too , who is likely to know . ”[92-mrs. bennet] [ Illustration : “ [I]92-mrs. bennet am determined never to speak of it again ”[92-mrs. bennet] ] “ [I]92-mrs. bennet do not believe that [he]85-mr. bingley will ever live at [Netherfield]2-netherfield any more . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ Oh , well ! it is just as [he]85-mr. bingley chooses . [Nobody]3152-nobody wants [him]85-mr. bingley to come ; though [I]92-mrs. bennet shall always say that [he]85-mr. bingley used [[my]92-mrs. bennet daughter]4415-my daughter extremely ill ; and , if [I]92-mrs. bennet was [her]4415-my daughter , [I]92-mrs. bennet would not have put up with it . Well , [my]92-mrs. bennet comfort is , [I]92-mrs. bennet am sure [Jane]89-jane will die of a broken heart , and then [he]85-mr. bingley will be sorry for what [he]85-mr. bingley has done . ”[92-mrs. bennet] But as [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth could not receive comfort from any such expectation [she]88-elizabeth made no answer . “ Well , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , ”[88-elizabeth] continued [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother , soon afterwards , “ and so [the Collinses]1435-the collinses live very comfortable , do [they]1435-the collinses ? Well , well , [I]246-her mother only hope it will last . And what sort of table do [they]1435-the collinses keep ? [Charlotte]180-charlotte is [an excellent manager]4417-an excellent manager , [I]246-her mother dare say . If [she]180-charlotte is half as sharp as [[her]180-charlotte mother]246-her mother , [she]180-charlotte is saving enough . There is nothing extravagant in [[their]1435-the collinses housekeeping]4419-their housekeeping , [I]246-her mother dare say . ”[246-her mother] “ No , nothing at all . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ A great deal of good management , depend upon it . Yes , yes . [They]1435-the collinses will take care not to outrun [their]1435-the collinses income . [They]1435-the collinses will never be distressed for money . Well , much good may it do [them]1435-the collinses ! And so , [I]92-mrs. bennet suppose , [they]1435-the collinses often talk of having Longbourn when [[your]4420-your father]3292-your father is dead . [They]1435-the collinses look upon it quite as [their]1435-the collinses own , [I]92-mrs. bennet dare say , whenever that happens . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ It was a subject which [they]1435-the collinses could not mention before [me]92-mrs. bennet . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ No ; it would have been strange if [they]1435-the collinses had . But [I]92-mrs. bennet make no doubt [they]1435-the collinses often talk of it between [themselves]1435-the collinses . Well , if [they]1435-the collinses can be easy with [an estate that is not lawfully [their]1435-the collinses own]4422-an estate that is not lawfully their own , so much the better . [I]92-mrs. bennet should be ashamed of having one that was only entailed on [me]92-mrs. bennet . ”[92-mrs. bennet] [ Illustration : “ When [[Colonel Miller]191-colonel miller ’s regiment]4423-colonel miller ’s regiment went away ”[92-mrs. bennet] CHAPTER XLI . [ Illustration ] The first week of [their]1831-their return was soon gone . The second began . It was the last of [the regiment]654-the regiment ’s stay in [Meryton]9-meryton , and [all the young ladies in [the neighbourhood]3088-the neighbourhood]1833-all the young ladies in the neighbourhood were drooping apace . The dejection was almost universal . [The elder Miss Bennets]105-the bennets alone were still able to eat , drink , and sleep , and pursue the usual course of [their]105-the bennets employments . Very frequently were [they]1831-their reproached for this insensibility by [Kitty]93-lady catherine and [Lydia]90-lydia , whose own misery was extreme , and who could not comprehend such hard - heartedness in [any of [the family]414-the family]3904-any of the family . “ [Good Heaven]37-good heaven ! What is to become of [us]1831-their ? What are [we]1831-their to do ? ”[1831-their] would [they]1831-their often exclaim in the bitterness of woe . “ How can [you]1837-their affectionate mother be smiling so , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth ? ”[1831-their] [[Their]1831-their affectionate mother]1837-their affectionate mother shared all [their]1831-their grief ; [she]1837-their affectionate mother remembered what [she]1837-their affectionate mother had [herself]1837-their affectionate mother endured on a similar occasion five - and - twenty years ago . “ [I]1837-their affectionate mother am sure , ”[1837-their affectionate mother] said [she]1837-their affectionate mother , “ [I]1837-their affectionate mother cried for two days together when [[Colonel Miller]191-colonel miller ’s regiment]4423-colonel miller ’s regiment went away . [I]1837-their affectionate mother thought [I]1837-their affectionate mother should have broke [my]1837-their affectionate mother heart . ”[1837-their affectionate mother] “ [I]90-lydia am sure [I]90-lydia shall break [mine]90-lydia , ”[90-lydia] said [Lydia]90-lydia . “ If one could but go to [Brighton]36-brighton ! ”[92-mrs. bennet] observed [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet . “ Oh yes -if [one]3113-one could but go to [Brighton]36-brighton ! But [papa]181-papa is so disagreeable . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ A little sea - bathing would set [me]1837-their affectionate mother up for ever . ”[1837-their affectionate mother] “ And [[my]93-lady catherine aunt]3279-my aunt [Philips]116-mr. philips is sure it would do [me]93-lady catherine a great deal of good , ”[93-lady catherine] added [Kitty]93-lady catherine . Such were the kind of lamentations resounding perpetually through [Longbourn House]22-longbourn house . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth tried to be diverted by [them]1838-them ; but all sense of pleasure was lost in shame . [She]88-elizabeth felt anew the justice of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s objections ; and never had [she]88-elizabeth before been so much disposed to pardon [his]96-mr. darcy interference in the views of [[his]96-mr. darcy friend]288-his friend . But the gloom of [Lydia]90-lydia ’s prospect was shortly cleared away ; for [she]88-elizabeth received an invitation from [Mrs. Forster]182-mrs. forster , [the wife of [the colonel of [the regiment]654-the regiment]1841-the colonel of the regiment]1840-the wife of the colonel of the regiment , to accompany [her]88-elizabeth to [Brighton]36-brighton . [This invaluable friend]1843-this invaluable friend was [a very young woman , and very lately married]1844-a very young woman , and very lately married . A resemblance in good - humour and good spirits had recommended [her]88-elizabeth and [Lydia]90-lydia to [each other]3216-each other , and out of [their]1846-their three months ’ acquaintance [they]1846-their had been intimate two . The rapture of [Lydia]90-lydia on this occasion , [her]90-lydia adoration of [Mrs. Forster]182-mrs. forster , the delight of [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , and the mortification of [Kitty]93-lady catherine , are scarcely to be described . Wholly inattentive to [[her]90-lydia sister]328-her sister ’s feelings , [Lydia]90-lydia flew about [the house]3075-the house in restless ecstasy , calling for [everyone]3873-everyone ’s congratulations , and laughing and talking with more violence than ever ; whilst [the luckless Kitty]93-lady catherine continued in [the parlour]1302-the parlour repining at [her]93-lady catherine fate in terms as unreasonable as [her]93-lady catherine accent was peevish . “ [I]93-lady catherine can not see why [Mrs. Forster]182-mrs. forster should not ask [me]93-lady catherine as well as [Lydia]90-lydia , ”[93-lady catherine] said [she]93-lady catherine , “ though [I]93-lady catherine am not [[her]90-lydia particular friend]4427-her particular friend . [I]93-lady catherine have just as much right to be asked as [she]90-lydia has , and more too , for [I]93-lady catherine am two years older . ”[93-lady catherine] In vain did [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth attempt to make [her]93-lady catherine reasonable , and [Jane]89-jane to make [her]93-lady catherine resigned . As for [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth [herself]88-elizabeth , this invitation was so far from exciting in [her]88-elizabeth the same feelings as in [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother and [Lydia]90-lydia , that [she]88-elizabeth considered it as the death - warrant of all possibility of common sense for the latter ; and detestable as such a step must make [her]88-elizabeth , were it known , [she]88-elizabeth could not help secretly advising [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father not to let [her]88-elizabeth go . [She]88-elizabeth represented to [him]249-her father all the improprieties of [Lydia]90-lydia ’s general behaviour , the little advantage [she]88-elizabeth could derive from the friendship of [such a woman as [Mrs. Forster]182-mrs. forster]1853-such a woman as mrs. forster , and the probability of [her]88-elizabeth being yet more imprudent with [such a companion at [Brighton]36-brighton]1854-such a companion at brighton , where the temptations must be greater than at [home]3288-home . [He]249-her father heard [her]88-elizabeth attentively , and then said,-- “ [Lydia]90-lydia will never be easy till [she]90-lydia has exposed [herself]90-lydia in some public place or other , and [we]4428-our can never expect [her]90-lydia to do it with so little expense or inconvenience to [[her]90-lydia family]3710-her family as under the present circumstances . ”[249-her father] “ If [you]249-her father were aware , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ of the very great disadvantage to [us]4428-our all , which must arise from the public notice of [Lydia]90-lydia ’s unguarded and imprudent manner , nay , which has already arisen from it , [I]88-elizabeth am sure [you]249-her father would judge differently in the affair . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Already arisen ! ”[81-mr. bennet] repeated [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet . “ What ! has [she]90-lydia frightened away [some of [[your]249-her father lovers]4431-your lovers]4430-some of your lovers ? [Poor little Lizzy]88-elizabeth ! But do not be cast down . [Such squeamish youths as can not bear to be connected with a little absurdity]4432-such squeamish youths as can not bear to be connected with a little absurdity are not worth a regret . Come , let [me]81-mr. bennet see the list of [the pitiful fellows who have been kept aloof by [Lydia]90-lydia ’s folly]4433-the pitiful fellows who have been kept aloof by lydia ’s folly . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ Indeed , [you]249-her father are mistaken . [I]81-mr. bennet have no such injuries to resent . It is not of peculiar , but of general evils , which [I]81-mr. bennet am now complaining . [Our]4428-our importance , [our]4428-our respectability in [the world]304-the world , must be affected by the wild volatility , the assurance and disdain of all restraint which mark [Lydia]90-lydia ’s character . Excuse me,--for [I]81-mr. bennet must speak plainly . If [you]249-her father , [[my]81-mr. bennet dear father]4435-my dear father , will not take the trouble of checking [her]90-lydia exuberant spirits , and of teaching [her]90-lydia that [her]90-lydia present pursuits are not to be the business of [her]90-lydia life , [she]90-lydia will soon be beyond the reach of amendment . [Her]90-lydia character will be fixed ; and [she]90-lydia will , at sixteen , be the most determined flirt that ever made [herself]90-lydia and [[her]90-lydia family]3710-her family ridiculous -a flirt , too , in the worst and meanest degree of flirtation ; without any attraction beyond youth and [a tolerable person]4437-a tolerable person ; and , from the ignorance and emptiness of [her]90-lydia mind , wholly unable to ward off any portion of that universal contempt which [her]90-lydia rage for admiration will excite . In this danger [Kitty]93-lady catherine is also comprehended . [She]93-lady catherine will follow wherever [Lydia]90-lydia leads . [Vain , ignorant , idle]4438-vain , ignorant , idle , and absolutely uncontrolled ! Oh , [[my]81-mr. bennet dear father]4435-my dear father , can [you]4435-my dear father suppose it possible that [they]4440-they will not be censured and despised wherever [they]4440-they are known , and that [[their]4440-they sisters]447-their sisters will not be often involved in the disgrace ? ”[81-mr. bennet] [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet saw that [her]1856-you whole heart was in the subject ; and , affectionately taking [her]1856-you hand , said , in reply,-- “ Do not make [yourself]1856-you uneasy , [[my]81-mr. bennet love]3127-my love . Wherever [you]1856-you and [Jane]89-jane are known , [you]1856-you must be respected and valued ; and [you]1856-you will not appear to less advantage for having a couple of -- or [I]81-mr. bennet may say , [three -- very silly sisters]4443-three -- very silly sisters . [We]4444-us shall have no peace at [Longbourn]7-longbourn if [Lydia]90-lydia does not go to [Brighton]36-brighton . Let [her]90-lydia go , then . [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster is [a sensible man]675-a sensible man , and will keep [her]90-lydia out of any real mischief ; and [she]90-lydia is luckily too poor to be an object of prey to [anybody]3171-anybody . At [Brighton]36-brighton [she]90-lydia will be of less importance even as [a common flirt]4447-a common flirt than [she]90-lydia has been [here]3067-here . [The officers]452-the officers will find [women]3180-women better worth [their]452-the officers notice .
