[He]85-mr. bingley observed to [her]88-elizabeth , at a moment when [the others]511-the others were talking together , and in a tone which had something of real regret , that it “ was a very long time since [he]85-mr. bingley had had the pleasure of seeing [her]89-jane ; ”[85-mr. bingley] and , before [she]88-elizabeth could reply , [he]85-mr. bingley added , “ It is above eight months . [We]2197-we have not met since the 26th of November , when [we]2197-we were all dancing together at [Netherfield]2-netherfield . ”[85-mr. bingley] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was pleased to find [his]85-mr. bingley memory so exact ; and [he]85-mr. bingley afterwards took occasion to ask [her]88-elizabeth , when unattended to by any of [the rest]2200-the rest , whether all [[her]88-elizabeth sisters]3096-her sisters were at [Longbourn]7-longbourn . There was not much in the question , nor in the preceding remark ; but there was a look and a manner which gave [them]2202-them meaning . It was not often that [she]88-elizabeth could turn [her]88-elizabeth eyes on [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy [himself]85-mr. bingley ; but whenever [she]88-elizabeth did catch a glimpse [she]88-elizabeth saw an expression of general complaisance , and in all that [he]85-mr. bingley said , [she]88-elizabeth heard an accent so far removed from hauteur or disdain of [[his]85-mr. bingley companions]2203-his companions , as convinced [her]88-elizabeth that the improvement of manners which [she]88-elizabeth had yesterday witnessed , however temporary its existence might prove , had at least outlived one day . When [she]88-elizabeth saw [him]85-mr. bingley thus seeking the acquaintance , and courting the good opinion of [people with whom any intercourse a few months ago would have been a disgrace]2204-people with whom any intercourse a few months ago would have been a disgrace ; when [she]88-elizabeth saw [him]85-mr. bingley thus civil , not only to [herself]88-elizabeth , but to the very relations whom [he]85-mr. bingley had openly disdained , and recollected [their]2205-their last lively scene in [Hunsford Parsonage]52-hunsford parsonage , the difference , the change was so great , and struck so forcibly on [her]88-elizabeth mind , that [she]88-elizabeth could hardly restrain [her]88-elizabeth astonishment from being visible . Never , even in the company of [[his]85-mr. bingley dear friends]2206-his dear friends at [Netherfield]2-netherfield , or [his]85-mr. bingley dignified relations at [Rosings]19-rosings , had [she]88-elizabeth seen [him]85-mr. bingley so desirous to please , so free from self - consequence or unbending reserve , as now , when no importance could result from the success of [his]85-mr. bingley endeavours , and when even the acquaintance of those to whom [his]85-mr. bingley attentions were addressed , would draw down the ridicule and censure of [the ladies both of [Netherfield]2-netherfield and [Rosings]19-rosings]2207-the ladies both of netherfield and rosings . [[Their]2205-their visitors]2208-their visitors stayed with [them]2205-their above half an hour ; and when [they]2205-their arose to depart , [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy called on [[his]96-mr. darcy sister]565-his sister to join [him]96-mr. darcy in expressing [their]2205-their wish of seeing [Mr.]2210-mr. and [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner , and [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , to dinner at [Pemberley]12-pemberley , before [they]2205-their left [the country]448-the country . [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy , though with a diffidence which marked [her]128-miss darcy little in the habit of giving invitations , readily obeyed . [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner looked at [[her]129-mrs. gardiner niece]1279-her niece , desirous of knowing how [she]1279-her niece , whom the invitation most concerned , felt disposed as to its acceptance , but [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had turned away [her]88-elizabeth head . Presuming , however , that this studied avoidance spoke rather a momentary embarrassment than any dislike of the proposal , and seeing in [[her]88-elizabeth husband]260-her husband , who was fond of society , a perfect willingness to accept it , [she]88-elizabeth ventured to engage for [her]88-elizabeth attendance , and the day after the next was fixed on . [Bingley]85-mr. bingley expressed great pleasure in the certainty of seeing [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth again , having still a great deal to say to [her]88-elizabeth , and many inquiries to make after all [[their]2205-their Hertfordshire friends]2214-their hertfordshire friends . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , construing all this into a wish of hearing [her]88-elizabeth speak of [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , was pleased ; and on this account , as well as [some others]2216-some others , found [herself]88-elizabeth , when [[their]2205-their visitors]2208-their visitors left [them]2205-their , capable of considering the last half hour with some satisfaction , though while it was passing the enjoyment of it had been little . Eager to be alone , and fearful of inquiries or hints from [[her]88-elizabeth uncle]579-her uncle and aunt , [she]88-elizabeth stayed with [them]2205-their only long enough to hear [their]2205-their favourable opinion of [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , and then hurried away to dress . But [she]88-elizabeth had no reason to fear [Mr.]2219-mr. and [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner ’s curiosity ; it was not [their]2205-their wish to force [her]88-elizabeth communication . It was evident that [she]88-elizabeth was much better acquainted with [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy than [they]2205-their had before any idea of ; it was evident that [he]96-mr. darcy was very much in love with [her]88-elizabeth . [They]2205-their saw much to interest , but nothing to justify inquiry . Of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy it was now a matter of anxiety to think well ; and , as far as [their]2205-their acquaintance reached , there was no fault to find . [They]2205-their could not be untouched by [his]96-mr. darcy politeness ; and had [they]2205-their drawn [his]96-mr. darcy character from [their]2205-their own feelings and [[his]96-mr. darcy servant]2220-his servant ’s report , without any reference to any other account , [the circle in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire to which [he]96-mr. darcy was known]2221-the circle in hertfordshire to which he was known would not have recognized it for [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy . There was now an interest , however , in believing [the housekeeper]3647-the housekeeper ; and [they]2205-their soon became sensible that the authority of [a servant , who had known [him]96-mr. darcy since [he]96-mr. darcy was four years old , and whose own manners indicated respectability]2223-a servant , who had known him since he was four years old , and whose own manners indicated respectability , was not to be hastily rejected . Neither had anything occurred in the intelligence of [[their]2205-their Lambton friends]2224-their lambton friends that could materially lessen its weight . [They]2205-their had nothing to accuse [him]96-mr. darcy of but pride ; pride [he]96-mr. darcy probably had , and if not , it would certainly be imputed by [the inhabitants of [a small market town where [the family]414-the family did not visit]2226-a small market town where the family did not visit]2225-the inhabitants of a small market town where the family did not visit . It was acknowledged , however , that [he]96-mr. darcy was [a liberal man]2228-a liberal man , and did much good among [the poor]795-the poor . With respect to [Wickham]142-wickham , [the travellers]2230-the travellers soon found that [he]96-mr. darcy was not held [there]306-there in much estimation ; for though the chief of [his]96-mr. darcy concerns with [the son of [[his]96-mr. darcy patron]933-his patron]2232-the son of his patron were imperfectly understood , it was yet a well - known fact that , on [his]96-mr. darcy quitting [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire , [he]96-mr. darcy had left many debts behind [him]96-mr. darcy , which [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy afterwards discharged . As for [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , [her]88-elizabeth thoughts were at [Pemberley]12-pemberley this evening more than the last ; and the evening , though as it passed it seemed long , was not long enough to determine [her]88-elizabeth feelings towards one in [that mansion]2234-that mansion ; and [she]88-elizabeth lay awake two whole hours , endeavouring to make them out . [She]88-elizabeth certainly did not hate [him]96-mr. darcy . No ; hatred had vanished long ago , and [she]88-elizabeth had almost as long been ashamed of ever feeling a dislike against [him]96-mr. darcy , that could be so called . The respect created by the conviction of [his]96-mr. darcy valuable qualities , though at first unwillingly admitted , had for some time ceased to be repugnant to [her]88-elizabeth feelings ; and it was now heightened into somewhat of a friendlier nature by the testimony so highly in [his]96-mr. darcy favour , and bringing forward [his]96-mr. darcy disposition in so amiable a light , which yesterday had produced . But above all , above respect and esteem , there was a motive within [her]88-elizabeth of good - will which could not be overlooked . It was gratitude -gratitude , not merely for having once loved [her]88-elizabeth , but for loving [her]88-elizabeth still well enough to forgive all the petulance and acrimony of [her]88-elizabeth manner in rejecting [him]96-mr. darcy , and all the unjust accusations accompanying [her]88-elizabeth rejection . [He]96-mr. darcy who , [she]88-elizabeth had been persuaded , would avoid [her]88-elizabeth as [[his]96-mr. darcy greatest enemy]2235-his greatest enemy , seemed , on this accidental meeting , most eager to preserve the acquaintance ; and without any indelicate display of regard , or any peculiarity of manner , where [their]2236-their two selves only were concerned , was soliciting the good opinion of [[her]88-elizabeth friends]311-her friends , and bent on making [her]88-elizabeth known to [[his]96-mr. darcy sister]565-his sister . Such a change in [a man of so much pride]2239-a man of so much pride excited not only astonishment but gratitude -- for to love , ardent love , it must be attributed ; and , as such , its impression on [her]88-elizabeth was of a sort to be encouraged , as by no means unpleasing , though it could not be exactly defined . [She]88-elizabeth respected , [she]88-elizabeth esteemed , [she]88-elizabeth was grateful to [him]96-mr. darcy , [she]88-elizabeth felt a real interest in [his]96-mr. darcy welfare ; and [she]88-elizabeth only wanted to know how far [she]88-elizabeth wished that welfare to depend upon [herself]88-elizabeth , and how far it would be for the happiness of both that [she]88-elizabeth should employ the power , which [her]88-elizabeth fancy told [her]88-elizabeth [she]88-elizabeth still possessed , of bringing on the renewal of [his]96-mr. darcy addresses . It had been settled in the evening , between [the aunt]2240-the aunt and [niece]2241-niece , that such a striking civility as [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy ’s , in coming to [them]2242-they on the very day of [her]128-miss darcy arrival at [Pemberley]12-pemberley -- for [she]128-miss darcy had reached it only to a late breakfast -- ought to be imitated , though it could not be equalled , by some exertion of politeness on [their]2242-they side ; and , consequently , that it would be highly expedient to wait on [her]128-miss darcy at [Pemberley]12-pemberley the following morning . [They]2242-they were , therefore , to go . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was pleased ; though when [she]88-elizabeth asked [herself]88-elizabeth the reason , [she]88-elizabeth had very little to say in reply . [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner left [them]2242-they soon after breakfast . The fishing scheme had been renewed the day before , and a positive engagement made of [his]157-mr. gardiner meeting [some of [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen at [Pemberley]12-pemberley]2243-some of the gentlemen at pemberley by noon . [ Illustration : “ Engaged by [the river]1992-the river ”[98-miss bingley] ] CHAPTER XLV . [ Illustration ] Convinced as [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth now was that [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s dislike of [her]88-elizabeth had originated in jealousy , [she]88-elizabeth could not help feeling how very unwelcome [her]88-elizabeth appearance at [Pemberley]12-pemberley must be to [her]88-elizabeth , and was curious to know with how much civility on [that lady]2245-that lady ’s side the acquaintance would now be renewed . On reaching [the house]3075-the house , [they]2242-they were shown through [the hall]3519-the hall into [the saloon]2248-the saloon , whose northern aspect rendered [it]2248-the saloon delightful for summer . [Its]2248-the saloon windows , opening to the ground , admitted a most refreshing view of [the high woody hills behind [the house]3075-the house]2249-the high woody hills behind the house , and of the beautiful oaks and Spanish chestnuts which were scattered over [the intermediate lawn]2251-the intermediate lawn . In [this room]4488-this room [they]2242-they were received by [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy , who was sitting there with [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst and [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , and [the lady with whom [she]128-miss darcy lived in [London]5-london]2253-the lady with whom she lived in london . [Georgiana]153-georgiana ’s reception of [them]2242-they was very civil , but attended with all that embarrassment which , though proceeding from shyness and the fear of doing wrong , would easily give to those who felt [themselves]2254-themselves inferior the belief of [her]153-georgiana being proud and reserved . [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner and [[her]129-mrs. gardiner niece]1279-her niece , however , did [her]153-georgiana justice , and pitied [her]153-georgiana . By [Mrs. Hurst]97-mrs. hurst and [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley [they]2242-they were noticed only by a courtesy ; and on [their]2242-they being seated , a pause , awkward as such pauses must always be , succeeded for a few moments . It was first broken by [Mrs. Annesley]194-mrs. annesley , [a genteel , agreeable - looking woman]2256-a genteel , agreeable - looking woman , whose endeavour to introduce some kind of discourse proved [her]194-mrs. annesley to be more truly well - bred than either of the others ; and between [her]194-mrs. annesley and [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner , with occasional help from [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , the conversation was carried on . [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy looked as if [she]128-miss darcy wished for courage enough to join in it ; and sometimes did venture a short sentence , when there was least danger of its being heard . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth soon saw that [she]88-elizabeth was [herself]88-elizabeth closely watched by [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , and that [she]88-elizabeth could not speak a word , especially to [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy , without calling [her]88-elizabeth attention . This observation would not have prevented [her]88-elizabeth from trying to talk to [the latter]491-the latter , had [they]2242-they not been seated at an inconvenient distance ; but [she]88-elizabeth was not sorry to be spared the necessity of saying much : [her]88-elizabeth own thoughts were employing [her]88-elizabeth . [She]88-elizabeth expected every moment that [some of [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen]2258-some of the gentlemen would enter [the room]255-the room : [she]88-elizabeth wished , [she]88-elizabeth feared , that [the master of [the house]3075-the house]645-the master of the house might be amongst [them]2258-some of the gentlemen ; and whether [she]88-elizabeth wished or feared it most , [she]88-elizabeth could scarcely determine . After sitting in this manner a quarter of an hour , without hearing [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s voice , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was roused by receiving from [her]88-elizabeth a cold inquiry after the health of [[her]88-elizabeth family]3710-her family . [She]88-elizabeth answered with equal indifference and brevity , and [the other]3427-the other said no more . The next variation which [their]2265-they visit afforded was produced by the entrance of [servants]1352-servants with cold meat , cake , and a variety of all the finest fruits in season ; but this did not take place till after many a significant look and smile from [Mrs. Annesley]194-mrs. annesley to [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy had been given , to remind [her]88-elizabeth of [her]88-elizabeth post . There was now employment for [the whole party]525-the whole party ; for though [they]2265-they could not all talk , [they]2265-they could all eat ; and the beautiful pyramids of grapes , nectarines , and peaches , soon collected them round the table . While thus engaged , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had a fair opportunity of deciding whether [she]88-elizabeth most feared or wished for the appearance of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , by the feelings which prevailed on [his]96-mr. darcy entering [the room]255-the room ; and then , though but a moment before [she]88-elizabeth had believed [her]88-elizabeth wishes to predominate , [she]88-elizabeth began to regret that [he]96-mr. darcy came . [He]96-mr. darcy had been some time with [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner , who , with two or [three other gentlemen from [the house]3075-the house]2269-three other gentlemen from the house , was engaged by [the river]1992-the river ; and had left [him]96-mr. darcy only on learning that [the ladies of [the family]414-the family]2272-the ladies of the family intended a visit to [Georgiana]153-georgiana that morning . No sooner did [he]96-mr. darcy appear , than [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth wisely resolved to be perfectly easy and unembarrassed -a resolution the more necessary to be made , but perhaps not the more easily kept , because [she]88-elizabeth saw that the suspicions of [the whole party]525-the whole party were awakened against [them]525-the whole party , and that there was scarcely an eye which did not watch [his]96-mr. darcy behaviour when [he]96-mr. darcy first came into [the room]255-the room . In no countenance was attentive curiosity so strongly marked as in [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s , in spite of the smiles which overspread [her]88-elizabeth face whenever [she]88-elizabeth spoke to [one of its objects]2276-one of its objects ; for jealousy had not yet made [her]88-elizabeth desperate , and [her]88-elizabeth attentions to [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy were by no means over . [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy , on [[her]128-miss darcy brother]3181-her brother ’s entrance , exerted [herself]128-miss darcy much more to talk ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth saw that [he]96-mr. darcy was anxious for [[his]96-mr. darcy sister]565-his sister and [herself]128-miss darcy to get acquainted , and forwarded , as much as possible , every attempt at conversation on either side . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley saw all this likewise ; and , in the imprudence of anger , took the first opportunity of saying , with sneering civility,-- “ Pray , [Miss Eliza]88-elizabeth , are not the ----shire militia removed from [Meryton]9-meryton ? [They]4542-they must be a great loss to [[your]88-elizabeth family]3498-your family . ”[88-elizabeth] In [Darcy]128-miss darcy ’s presence [she]88-elizabeth dared not mention [Wickham]142-wickham ’s name : but [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth instantly comprehended that [he]96-mr. darcy was uppermost in [her]88-elizabeth thoughts ; and the various recollections connected with [him]96-mr. darcy gave [her]88-elizabeth a moment ’s distress ; but , exerting [herself]88-elizabeth vigorously to repel the ill - natured attack , [she]88-elizabeth presently answered the question in a tolerably disengaged tone . While [she]88-elizabeth spoke , an involuntary glance showed [her]88-elizabeth [Darcy]128-miss darcy with a heightened complexion , earnestly looking at [her]88-elizabeth , and [[his]96-mr. darcy sister]565-his sister overcome with confusion , and unable to lift up [her]565-his sister eyes . Had [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley known what pain [she]98-miss bingley was then giving [[her]98-miss bingley beloved friend]2280-her beloved friend , [she]98-miss bingley undoubtedly would have refrained from the hint ; but [she]98-miss bingley had merely intended to discompose [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , by bringing forward the idea of [a man to whom [she]98-miss bingley believed [her]98-miss bingley partial]2281-a man to whom she believed her partial , to make [her]98-miss bingley betray a sensibility which might injure [her]98-miss bingley in [Darcy]128-miss darcy ’s opinion , and , perhaps , to remind [the latter]491-the latter of all the follies and absurdities by which [some part of [[her]98-miss bingley family]3710-her family were connected with that corps]2283-some part of her family were connected with that corps . Not a syllable had ever reached [her]98-miss bingley of [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy ’s meditated elopement . To [no creature]2285-no creature had it been revealed , where secrecy was possible , except to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; and from all [Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s connections [[her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother was particularly anxious to conceal it , from that very wish which [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had long ago attributed to [him]3181-her brother , of [their]2287-their becoming hereafter [her]88-elizabeth own . [He]3181-her brother had certainly formed such a plan ; and without meaning that it should affect [his]3181-her brother endeavour to separate [him]3181-her brother from [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , it is probable that it might add something to [his]3181-her brother lively concern for the welfare of [[his]3181-her brother friend]288-his friend . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s collected behaviour , however , soon quieted [his]3181-her brother emotion ; and as [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley , vexed and disappointed , dared not approach nearer to [Wickham]142-wickham , [Georgiana]153-georgiana also recovered in time , though not enough to be able to speak any more . [[Her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother , whose eye [she]98-miss bingley feared to meet , scarcely recollected [her]98-miss bingley interest in the affair ; and the very circumstance which had been designed to turn [his]3181-her brother thoughts from [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , seemed to have fixed them on [her]98-miss bingley more and more cheerfully . [Their]2290-their visit did not continue long after the question and answer above mentioned ; and while [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy was attending [them]2290-their to [[their]2290-their carriage]3797-their carriage , [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley was venting [her]98-miss bingley feelings in criticisms on [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s person , behaviour , and dress . But [Georgiana]153-georgiana would not join [her]98-miss bingley . [[Her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother ’s recommendation was enough to insure [her]98-miss bingley favour : [his]3181-her brother judgment could not err ; and [he]3181-her brother had spoken in such terms of [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , as to leave [Georgiana]153-georgiana without the power of finding [her]88-elizabeth otherwise than lovely and amiable . When [Darcy]153-georgiana returned to [the saloon]2248-the saloon , [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley could not help repeating to [him]3181-her brother some part of what [she]98-miss bingley had been saying to [[his]3181-her brother sister]565-his sister . “ How very ill [Eliza Bennet]88-elizabeth looks this morning , [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , ”[98-miss bingley] [she]98-miss bingley cried : “ [I]98-miss bingley never in [my]98-miss bingley life saw [anyone]3174-anyone so much altered as [she]88-elizabeth is since the winter . [She]88-elizabeth is grown so brown and coarse ! [Louisa]122-louisa and [I]98-miss bingley were agreeing that [we]4545-we should not have known [her]88-elizabeth again . ”[98-miss bingley] However [little Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy might have liked such an address , [he]3181-her brother contented [himself]3181-her brother with coolly replying , that [he]3181-her brother perceived no other alteration than [her]98-miss bingley being rather tanned,--no miraculous consequence of travelling in the summer . “ For [my]98-miss bingley own part , ”[98-miss bingley] [she]98-miss bingley rejoined , “ [I]98-miss bingley must confess that [I]98-miss bingley never could see any beauty in [her]88-elizabeth . [Her]88-elizabeth face is too thin ; [her]88-elizabeth complexion has no brilliancy ; and [her]88-elizabeth features are not at all handsome . [Her]88-elizabeth nose wants character ; there is nothing marked in its lines . [Her]88-elizabeth teeth are tolerable , but not out of the common way ; and as for [her]88-elizabeth eyes , which have sometimes been called so fine , [I]98-miss bingley never could perceive anything extraordinary in them . [They]4546-they have a sharp , shrewish look , which [I]98-miss bingley do not like at all ; and in [her]88-elizabeth air altogether , there is a self - sufficiency without fashion , which is intolerable . ”[98-miss bingley] Persuaded as [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley was that [Darcy]96-mr. darcy admired [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , this was not the best method of recommending [herself]98-miss bingley ; but [angry people]2295-angry people are not always wise ; and in seeing [him]96-mr. darcy at last look somewhat nettled , [she]98-miss bingley had all the success [she]98-miss bingley expected . [He]96-mr. darcy was resolutely silent , however ; and , from a determination of making [him]96-mr. darcy speak , [she]98-miss bingley continued,-- “ [I]98-miss bingley remember , when [we]4547-we first knew [her]88-elizabeth in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , how amazed [we]4547-we all were to find that [she]88-elizabeth was [a reputed beauty]4548-a reputed beauty ; and [I]98-miss bingley particularly recollect [your]96-mr. darcy saying one night , after [they]4547-we had been dining at [Netherfield]2-netherfield , ‘ [She]88-elizabeth [a beauty]4549-a beauty ! [I]98-miss bingley should as soon call [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother a wit . ’ But afterwards [she]88-elizabeth seemed to improve on [you]96-mr. darcy , and [I]98-miss bingley believe [you]96-mr. darcy thought [her]88-elizabeth rather pretty at one time . ”[98-miss bingley] “ Yes , ”[96-mr. darcy] replied [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , who could contain [himself]96-mr. darcy no longer , “ but that was only when [I]96-mr. darcy first knew [her]88-elizabeth ; for it is many months since [I]96-mr. darcy have considered [her]88-elizabeth as [one of the handsomest women of [my]96-mr. darcy acquaintance]4551-one of the handsomest women of my acquaintance . ”[96-mr. darcy] [He]96-mr. darcy then went away , and [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley was left to all the satisfaction of having forced [him]96-mr. darcy to say what gave [no one]3336-no one any pain but [herself]98-miss bingley . [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth talked of all that had occurred during [their]2297-their visit , as [they]2297-their returned , except what had particularly interested [them]2297-their both . The looks and behaviour of [everybody]305-everybody [they]2297-their had seen were discussed , except of [the person who had mostly engaged [their]2297-their attention]2299-the person who had mostly engaged their attention . [They]2297-their talked of [[his]2299-the person who had mostly engaged their attention sister]565-his sister , [[his]2299-the person who had mostly engaged their attention friends]405-his friends , [[his]2299-the person who had mostly engaged their attention house]3182-his house , [his]2299-the person who had mostly engaged their attention fruit , of everything but [himself]2299-the person who had mostly engaged their attention ; yet [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was longing to know what [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner thought of [him]2299-the person who had mostly engaged their attention , and [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner would have been highly gratified by [[her]129-mrs. gardiner niece]1279-her niece ’s beginning the subject . [ Illustration ] Chapter XLVI . [ Illustration ] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had been a good deal disappointed in not finding a letter from [Jane]89-jane on [their]2297-their first arrival at [Lambton]49-lambton ; and this disappointment had been renewed on each of the mornings that had now been spent [there]306-there ; but on the third [her]88-elizabeth repining was over , and [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister justified , by the receipt of two letters from [her]89-jane at once , on one of which was marked that it had been mis - sent elsewhere . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was not surprised at it , as [Jane]89-jane had written the direction remarkably ill . [They]2297-their had just been preparing to walk as the letters came in ; and [[her]88-elizabeth uncle]579-her uncle and aunt , leaving [her]88-elizabeth to enjoy [them]2307-them in quiet , set off by [themselves]2297-their . The one mis - sent must be first attended to ; it had been written five days ago . The beginning contained an account of all [their]2297-their little parties and engagements , with such news as [the country]448-the country afforded ; but the latter half , which was dated a day later , and written in evident agitation , gave more important intelligence . It was to this effect - “ Since writing the above , dearest [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , something has occurred of a most unexpected and serious nature ; but [I]2309-i am afraid of alarming [you]88-elizabeth -- be assured that [we]2297-their are all well . What [I]2309-i have to say relates to poor [Lydia]90-lydia . An express came at twelve last night , just as [we]2297-their were all gone to bed , from [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster , to inform [us]2297-their that [she]90-lydia was gone off to [Scotland]54-scotland with [one of [[his]113-colonel forster officers]4553-his officers]4552-one of his officers ; to own the truth , with [Wickham]142-wickham ! Imagine [our]2297-their surprise . To [Kitty]93-lady catherine , however , it does not seem so wholly unexpected . [I]2309-i am very , very sorry . So imprudent a match on both sides ! But [I]2309-i am willing to hope the best , and that [his]113-colonel forster character has been misunderstood . Thoughtless and indiscreet [I]2309-i can easily believe [him]113-colonel forster , but this step ( and let [us]2297-their rejoice over it ) marks nothing bad at heart . [His]113-colonel forster choice is disinterested at least , for [he]113-colonel forster must know [[my]2309-i father]3323-my father can give [her]90-lydia nothing . [[Our]2297-their poor mother]4555-our poor mother is sadly grieved . [[My]2309-i father]3323-my father bears it better . How thankful am [I]2309-i , that [we]2297-their never let [them]4557-they know what has been said against [him]3323-my father ; [we]2297-their must forget it [ourselves]2297-their . [They]4557-they were off Saturday night about twelve , as is conjectured , but were not missed till yesterday morning at eight . The express was sent off directly . [[My]2309-i dear]3066-my dear [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , [they]4557-they must have passed within ten miles of [us]2297-their . [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster gives [us]2297-their reason to expect [him]3323-my father [here]3067-here soon . [Lydia]90-lydia left a few lines for [[his]3323-my father wife]236-his wife , informing [her]236-his wife of [their]4557-they intention . [I]2309-i must conclude , for [I]2309-i can not be long from [[my]2309-i poor mother]4561-my poor mother . [I]2309-i am afraid [you]88-elizabeth will not be able to make it out , but [I]2309-i hardly know what [I]2309-i have written . ”[2309-i] Without allowing [herself]2309-i time for consideration , and scarcely knowing what [she]2309-i felt , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , on finishing this letter , instantly seized the other , and opening it with the utmost impatience , read as follows : it had been written a day later than the conclusion of the first . “ By this time , [[my]88-elizabeth dearest sister]4562-my dearest sister , [you]88-elizabeth have received [my]88-elizabeth hurried letter ; [I]88-elizabeth wish this may be more intelligible , but though not confined for time , [my]88-elizabeth head is so bewildered that [I]88-elizabeth can not answer for being coherent . [Dearest Lizzy]88-elizabeth , [I]88-elizabeth hardly know what [I]88-elizabeth would write , but [I]88-elizabeth have bad news for [you]88-elizabeth , and it can not be delayed . Imprudent as a marriage between [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham and [[our]4563-our poor [Lydia]90-lydia]4564-our poor lydia would be , [we]4563-our are now anxious to be assured it has taken place , for there is but too much reason to fear [they]4565-them are not gone to [Scotland]54-scotland . [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster came yesterday , having left [Brighton]36-brighton the day before , not many hours after the express . Though [Lydia]90-lydia ’s short letter to [Mrs. F.]196-mrs. f. gave [them]4565-them to understand that [they]4565-them were going to [Gretna Green]197-gretna green , something was dropped by [Denny]141-denny expressing [his]141-denny belief that [W.]198-w. never intended to go [there]306-there , or to marry [Lydia]90-lydia at all , which was repeated to [Colonel F.]199-colonel f. , who , instantly taking the alarm , set off from [B.]55-b. , intending to trace [their]4565-them route . [He]199-colonel f. did trace [them]4565-them easily to [Clapham]56-clapham , but no farther ; for on entering [that place]4567-that place , [they]4565-them removed into [a hackney - coach]4568-a hackney - coach , and dismissed the chaise that brought [them]4565-them from [Epsom]57-epsom . All that is known after this is , that [they]4565-them were seen to continue [the London road]4569-the london road . [I]88-elizabeth know not what to think . After making every possible inquiry on that side [London]5-london , [Colonel F.]199-colonel f. came on into [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , anxiously renewing them at all the turnpikes , and at [the inns in [Barnet]58-barnet and [Hatfield]59-hatfield]4570-the inns in barnet and hatfield , but without any success,--no [such people]3458-such people had been seen to pass through . With the kindest concern [he]199-colonel f. came on to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , and broke [his]199-colonel f. apprehensions to [us]4572-us in a manner most creditable to [his]199-colonel f. heart . [I]88-elizabeth am sincerely grieved for [him]199-colonel f. and [Mrs. F.]196-mrs. f. ; but [no one]3336-no one can throw any blame on [them]4565-them . [Our]4572-us distress , [[my]88-elizabeth dear]3066-my dear [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , is very great . [[My]88-elizabeth father]3323-my father and [mother]3273-mother believe the worst , but [I]88-elizabeth can not think so ill of [him]199-colonel f. . Many circumstances might make it more eligible for [them]4565-them to be married privately in [town]268-town than to pursue [their]4565-them first plan ; and even if [he]199-colonel f. could form such a design against [a young woman of [Lydia]90-lydia ’s connections]4578-a young woman of lydia ’s connections , which is not likely , can [I]88-elizabeth suppose [her]90-lydia so lost to everything ? Impossible ! [I]88-elizabeth grieve to find , however , that [Colonel F.]199-colonel f. is not disposed to depend upon [their]4565-them marriage : [he]199-colonel f. shook [his]199-colonel f. head when [I]88-elizabeth expressed [my]88-elizabeth hopes , and said [he]199-colonel f. feared [W.]198-w. was not [a man to be trusted]4579-a man to be trusted . [[My]88-elizabeth poor mother]4561-my poor mother is really ill , and keeps [[her]4561-my poor mother room]493-her room . Could [she]4561-my poor mother exert [herself]4561-my poor mother , it would be better , but this is not to be expected ; and as to [[my]88-elizabeth father]3323-my father , [I]88-elizabeth never in [my]88-elizabeth life saw [him]3323-my father so affected . [Poor Kitty]93-lady catherine has anger for having concealed [their]4565-them attachment ; but as it was a matter of confidence , one can not wonder . [I]88-elizabeth am truly glad , dearest [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , that [you]88-elizabeth have been spared something of these distressing scenes ; but now , as the first shock is over , shall [I]88-elizabeth own that [I]88-elizabeth long for [your]88-elizabeth return ? [I]88-elizabeth am not so selfish , however , as to press for it , if inconvenient . [Adieu]200-adieu ! [I]88-elizabeth take up [my]88-elizabeth pen again to do , what [I]88-elizabeth have just told [you]88-elizabeth [I]88-elizabeth would not ; but circumstances are such , that [I]88-elizabeth can not help earnestly begging [you]88-elizabeth all to come here as soon as possible . [I]88-elizabeth know [[my]88-elizabeth dear uncle]1240-my dear uncle and [aunt]1241-aunt so well , that [I]88-elizabeth am not afraid of requesting it , though [I]88-elizabeth have still something more to ask of [the former]327-the former . [[My]88-elizabeth father]3323-my father is going to [London]5-london with [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster instantly , to try to discover [her]1241-aunt . What [he]3323-my father means to do , [I]88-elizabeth am sure [I]88-elizabeth know not ; but [his]3323-my father excessive distress will not allow [him]3323-my father to pursue any measure in the best and safest way , and [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster is obliged to be at [Brighton]36-brighton again to - morrow evening . In such an exigence [[my]88-elizabeth uncle]721-my uncle ’s advice and assistance would be everything in [the world]304-the world ; [he]3323-my father will immediately comprehend what [I]88-elizabeth must feel , and [I]88-elizabeth rely upon [his]3323-my father goodness . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Oh ! where , where is [[my]88-elizabeth uncle]721-my uncle ? ”[88-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , darting from [her]88-elizabeth seat as [she]88-elizabeth finished the letter , in eagerness to follow [him]2310-him , without losing a moment of the time so precious ; but as [she]88-elizabeth reached the door , it was opened by [a servant]503-a servant , and [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy appeared . [Her]88-elizabeth pale face and impetuous manner made [him]2310-him start , and before [he]2310-him could recover [himself]2310-him enough to speak , [she]88-elizabeth , in whose mind every idea was superseded by [Lydia]90-lydia ’s situation , hastily exclaimed , “ [I]88-elizabeth beg [your]2310-him pardon , but [I]88-elizabeth must leave [you]2310-him . [I]88-elizabeth must find [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner this moment on business that can not be delayed ; [I]88-elizabeth have not an instant to lose . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [Good God]102-god ! what is the matter ? ”[2310-him] cried [he]2310-him , with more feeling than politeness ; then recollecting [himself]2310-him , “ [I]2310-him will not detain [you]88-elizabeth a minute ; but let [me]2310-him , or let [the servant]460-the servant , go after [Mr.]4591-mr. and [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner . [You]88-elizabeth are not well enough ; [you]88-elizabeth can not go [yourself]88-elizabeth . ”[2310-him] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth hesitated ; but [her]88-elizabeth knees trembled under [her]88-elizabeth , and [she]88-elizabeth felt how little would be gained by [her]88-elizabeth attempting to pursue [them]2312-them . Calling back [the servant]460-the servant , therefore , [she]88-elizabeth commissioned [him]2310-him , though in so breathless an accent as made [her]88-elizabeth almost unintelligible , to fetch [[his]2310-him master]2061-his master and [mistress]4467-mistress [home]3288-home instantly . On [his]2310-him quitting [the room]255-the room , [she]88-elizabeth sat down , unable to support [herself]88-elizabeth , and looking so miserably ill , that it was impossible for [Darcy]96-mr. darcy to leave [her]88-elizabeth , or to refrain from saying , in a tone of gentleness and commiseration , “ Let [me]88-elizabeth call [[your]88-elizabeth maid]4592-your maid . Is there nothing [you]88-elizabeth could take to give [you]88-elizabeth present relief ? A glass of wine ; shall [I]88-elizabeth get [you]88-elizabeth one ? [You]88-elizabeth are very ill . ”[88-elizabeth] “ No , [I]88-elizabeth thank [you]96-mr. darcy , ”[88-elizabeth] [she]88-elizabeth replied , endeavouring to recover [herself]88-elizabeth . “ There is nothing the matter with [me]88-elizabeth . [I]88-elizabeth am quite well , [I]88-elizabeth am only distressed by some dreadful news which [I]88-elizabeth have just received from [Longbourn]7-longbourn . ”[88-elizabeth] [She]88-elizabeth burst into tears as [she]88-elizabeth alluded to it , and for a few minutes could not speak another word . [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , in wretched suspense , could only say something indistinctly of [his]96-mr. darcy [ Illustration : “ [I]96-mr. darcy have not an instant to lose ”[96-mr. darcy] ] concern , and observe [her]88-elizabeth in compassionate silence . At length [she]88-elizabeth spoke again . “ [I]88-elizabeth have just had a letter from [Jane]89-jane , with such dreadful news . It can not be concealed from [anyone]3174-anyone . [[My]88-elizabeth youngest sister]4594-my youngest sister has left [all [her]4594-my youngest sister friends]4595-all her friends -- has eloped ; has thrown [herself]4594-my youngest sister into the power of -- of [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham . [They]4596-they are gone off together from [Brighton]36-brighton . [You]96-mr. darcy know [him]142-wickham too well to doubt the rest . [She]4594-my youngest sister has no money , no connections , nothing that can tempt [him]142-wickham to -- [she]4594-my youngest sister is lost for ever . ”[88-elizabeth] [Darcy]96-mr. darcy was fixed in astonishment . “ When [I]88-elizabeth consider , ”[88-elizabeth] [she]88-elizabeth added , in a yet more agitated voice , “ that [I]88-elizabeth might have prevented it ! [I]88-elizabeth who knew what [he]142-wickham was . Had [I]88-elizabeth but explained some part of it only -- some part of what [I]88-elizabeth learnt , to [[my]88-elizabeth own family]1174-my own family ! Had [his]142-wickham character been known , this could not have happened . But it is all , all too late now . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]96-mr. darcy am grieved , indeed , ”[96-mr. darcy] cried [Darcy]96-mr. darcy : “ grieved -- shocked . But is it certain , absolutely certain ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Oh , yes ! [They]4596-they left [Brighton]36-brighton together on Sunday night , and were traced almost to [London]5-london , but not beyond : [they]4596-they are certainly not gone to [Scotland]54-scotland . ”[88-elizabeth] “ And what has been done , what has been attempted , to recover [her]4594-my youngest sister ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ [[My]96-mr. darcy father]3323-my father has gone to [London]5-london , and [Jane]89-jane has written to beg [[my]96-mr. darcy uncle]721-my uncle ’s immediate assistance , and [we]4600-we shall be off , [I]96-mr. darcy hope , in half an hour . But nothing can be done ; [I]96-mr. darcy know very well that nothing can be done . How is [such a man]230-such a man to be worked on ? How are [they]4596-they even to be discovered ? [I]96-mr. darcy have not the smallest hope . It is every way horrible ! ”[96-mr. darcy] [Darcy]96-mr. darcy shook [his]96-mr. darcy head in silent acquiescence . “ When [my]96-mr. darcy eyes were opened to [his]96-mr. darcy real character , oh ! had [I]96-mr. darcy known what [I]96-mr. darcy ought , what [I]96-mr. darcy dared to do ! But [I]96-mr. darcy knew not -- [I]96-mr. darcy was afraid of doing too much . Wretched , wretched mistake ! ”[96-mr. darcy] [Darcy]96-mr. darcy made no answer . [He]96-mr. darcy seemed scarcely to hear [her]2318-her , and was walking up and down [the room]255-the room in earnest meditation ; [his]96-mr. darcy brow contracted , [his]96-mr. darcy air gloomy . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth soon observed , and instantly understood it . [Her]88-elizabeth power was sinking ; everything must sink under such a proof of family weakness , such an assurance of the deepest disgrace . [She]88-elizabeth could neither wonder nor condemn ; but the belief of [his]96-mr. darcy self - conquest brought nothing consolatory to [her]88-elizabeth bosom , afforded no palliation of [her]88-elizabeth distress . It was , on the contrary , exactly calculated to make [her]88-elizabeth understand [her]88-elizabeth own wishes ; and never had [she]88-elizabeth so honestly felt that [she]88-elizabeth could have loved [him]96-mr. darcy , as now , when all love must be vain . But self , though it would intrude , could not engross [her]88-elizabeth . [Lydia]90-lydia -- the humiliation , the misery [she]90-lydia was bringing on [them]2320-them all -- soon swallowed up every private care ; and covering [her]88-elizabeth face with [her]88-elizabeth handkerchief , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was soon lost to everything else ; and , after a pause of several minutes , was only recalled to a sense of [her]88-elizabeth situation by the voice of [[her]88-elizabeth companion]1769-her companion , who , in a manner which , though it spoke compassion , spoke likewise restraint , said,-- “ [I]1769-her companion am afraid [you]88-elizabeth have been long desiring [my]1769-her companion absence , nor have [I]1769-her companion anything to plead in excuse of [my]1769-her companion stay , but real , though unavailing concern . Would to [Heaven]60-heaven that anything could be either said or done on [my]1769-her companion part , that might offer consolation to such distress ! But [I]1769-her companion will not torment [you]88-elizabeth with vain wishes , which may seem purposely to ask for [your]88-elizabeth thanks . This unfortunate affair will , [I]1769-her companion fear , prevent [[my]1769-her companion sister]3345-my sister ’s having the pleasure of seeing [you]88-elizabeth at [Pemberley]12-pemberley to - day . ”[1769-her companion] “ Oh , yes ! Be so kind as to apologize for [us]4603-us to [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy . Say that urgent business calls [us]4603-us [home]3288-home immediately . Conceal the unhappy truth as long as it is possible . [I]2322-his know it can not be long . ”[2322-his] [He]2322-his readily assured [her]2323-her of [his]2322-his secrecy , again expressed [his]2322-his sorrow for [her]2323-her distress , wished it a happier conclusion than there was at present reason to hope , and , leaving [his]2322-his compliments for [[her]2323-her relations]583-her relations , with only one serious parting look , went away . As [he]2322-his quitted [the room]255-the room , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth felt how improbable it was that [they]2326-their should ever see [each other]3216-each other again on such terms of cordiality as had marked [their]2326-their several meetings in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire ; and as [she]88-elizabeth threw a retrospective glance over the whole of [their]2326-their acquaintance , so full of contradictions and varieties , sighed at the perverseness of those feelings which would now have promoted its continuance , and would formerly have rejoiced in its termination . If gratitude and esteem are good foundations of affection , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s change of sentiment will be neither improbable nor faulty . But if otherwise , if the regard springing from such sources is unreasonable or unnatural , in comparison of what is so often described as arising on a first interview with its object , and even before two words have been exchanged , nothing can be said in [her]2323-her defence , except that [she]2323-her had given somewhat of a trial to the latter method , in [her]2323-her partiality for [Wickham]142-wickham , and that [its]2328-its ill success might , perhaps , authorize [her]2323-her to seek the other less interesting mode of attachment . Be that as it may , [she]2323-her saw [him]142-wickham go with regret ; and in this early example of what [Lydia]90-lydia ’s infamy must produce , found additional anguish as [she]2323-her reflected on that wretched business . Never since reading [Jane]89-jane ’s second letter had [she]2323-her entertained a hope of [Wickham]142-wickham ’s meaning to marry [her]2323-her . No one but [Jane]89-jane , [she]2323-her thought , could flatter [herself]2323-her with such an expectation . Surprise was the least of all [her]2323-her feelings on this development . While the contents of the first letter remained on [her]2323-her mind , [she]2323-her was all surprise , all astonishment , that [Wickham]142-wickham should marry [a girl whom it was impossible [he]142-wickham could marry for money]2329-a girl whom it was impossible he could marry for money ; and how [Lydia]90-lydia could ever have attached [him]142-wickham had appeared incomprehensible . But now it was all too natural . For such an attachment as this , [she]2323-her might have sufficient charms ; and though [she]2323-her did not suppose [Lydia]90-lydia to be deliberately engaging in an elopement , without the intention of marriage , [she]2323-her had no difficulty in believing that neither [her]2323-her virtue nor [her]2323-her understanding would preserve [her]2323-her from falling an easy prey . [She]2323-her had never perceived , while [the regiment]654-the regiment was in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , that [Lydia]90-lydia had any partiality for [him]142-wickham ; but [she]2323-her was convinced that [Lydia]90-lydia had wanted only encouragement to attach [herself]90-lydia to [anybody]3171-anybody . Sometimes [one officer]2332-one officer , sometimes another , had been [her]2323-her favourite , as [their]2333-their attentions raised [them]2333-their in [her]2323-her opinion . [Her]2323-her affections had been continually fluctuating , but never without an object . The mischief of neglect and mistaken indulgence towards [such a girl]2334-such a girl -- oh ! how acutely did [she]2323-her now feel it ! [She]2323-her was wild to be at [home]3288-home -- to hear , to see , to be upon the spot to share with [Jane]89-jane in the cares that must now fall wholly upon [her]2323-her , in [a family so deranged]2336-a family so deranged ; [a father]3312-a father absent , [a mother]1255-a mother incapable of exertion , and requiring constant attendance ; and though almost persuaded that nothing could be done for [Lydia]90-lydia , [[her]2323-her uncle]579-her uncle ’s interference seemed of the utmost importance , and till [he]579-her uncle entered [the room]255-the room the misery of [her]2323-her impatience was severe . [Mr.]2341-mr. and [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner had hurried back in alarm , supposing , by [the servant]460-the servant ’s account , that [[their]2343-their niece]2062-their niece was taken suddenly ill ; but satisfying [them]2343-their instantly on that head , [she]2323-her eagerly communicated the cause of [their]2343-their summons , reading the two letters aloud , and dwelling on the postscript of the last with trembling energy . Though [Lydia]90-lydia had never been a favourite with [them]2343-their , [Mr.]2345-mr. and [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner could not but be deeply affected . Not [Lydia]90-lydia only , but [all]3588-all were concerned in it ; and after the first exclamations of surprise and horror , [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner readily promised every assistance in [his]157-mr. gardiner power . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , though expecting no less , thanked [him]157-mr. gardiner with tears of gratitude ; and all three being actuated by one spirit , everything relating to [their]2343-their journey was speedily settled . [They]2343-their were to be off as soon as possible . “ But what is to be done about [Pemberley]12-pemberley ? ”[129-mrs. gardiner] cried [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner . “ [John]178-john told [us]2343-their [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy was here when [you]129-mrs. gardiner sent for [us]2343-their -was it so ? ”[129-mrs. gardiner] “ Yes ; and [I]3427-the other told [him]96-mr. darcy [we]2343-their should not be able to keep [our]2343-their engagement . That is all settled . ”[3427-the other] “ What is all settled ? ”[3427-the other] repeated [the other]3427-the other , as [she]3427-the other ran into [[her]3427-the other room]493-her room to prepare . “ And are [they]4605-they upon such terms as for [her]3427-the other to disclose the real truth ? Oh , that [I]3427-the other knew how it was ! ”[3427-the other] But wishes were vain ; or , at best , could serve only to amuse [her]3427-the other in the hurry and confusion of the following hour . Had [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth been at leisure to be idle , [she]88-elizabeth would have remained certain that all employment was impossible to one so wretched as [herself]88-elizabeth ; but [she]88-elizabeth had [her]88-elizabeth share of business as well as [[her]88-elizabeth aunt]4017-her aunt , and amongst the rest there were notes to be written to all [[their]2350-i friends]2351-their friends at [Lambton]49-lambton , with false excuses for [their]2350-i sudden departure . An hour , however , saw the whole completed ; and [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner , meanwhile , having settled [his]157-mr. gardiner account at [the inn]1810-the inn , nothing remained to be done but to go ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , after all the misery of the morning , found [herself]88-elizabeth , in a shorter space of time than [she]88-elizabeth could have supposed , seated in [the carriage]3286-the carriage , and on [the road to [Longbourn]7-longbourn]2354-the road to longbourn . [ Illustration : “ The first pleasing earnest of [their]2350-i welcome ”[157-mr. gardiner] ] CHAPTER XLVII . [ Illustration ] “ [I]2350-i have been thinking it over again , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , ”[2350-i] said [[her]88-elizabeth uncle]579-her uncle , as [they]2350-i drove from [the town]3847-the town ; “ and really , upon serious consideration , [I]2350-i am much more inclined than [I]2350-i was to judge as [[your]88-elizabeth eldest sister]1621-your eldest sister does of the matter . It appears to [me]2350-i so very unlikely that [any young man]4607-any young man should form such a design against [a girl who is by no means unprotected or friendless , and who was actually staying in [[his]4607-any young man Colonel ’s family]4609-his colonel ’s family]4608-a girl who is by no means unprotected or friendless , and who was actually staying in his colonel ’s family , that [I]2350-i am strongly inclined to hope the best . Could [he]4607-any young man expect that [[her]1621-your eldest sister friends]311-her friends would not step forward ? Could [he]4607-any young man expect to be noticed again by [the regiment]654-the regiment , after such an affront to [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster ? [His]4607-any young man temptation is not adequate to the risk . ”[2350-i] “ Do [you]2350-i really think so ? ”[88-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , brightening up for a moment . “ Upon [my]129-mrs. gardiner word , ”[129-mrs. gardiner] said [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner , “ [I]129-mrs. gardiner begin to be of [[your]88-elizabeth uncle]3438-your uncle ’s opinion . It is really too great a violation of decency , honour , and interest , for [him]4607-any young man to be guilty of it . [I]129-mrs. gardiner can not think so very ill of [Wickham]142-wickham . Can [you]88-elizabeth , [yourself]88-elizabeth , [Lizzie]88-elizabeth , so wholly give [him]4607-any young man up , as to believe [him]4607-any young man capable of it ? ”[129-mrs. gardiner] “ Not perhaps of neglecting [his]4607-any young man own interest . But of every other neglect [I]2350-i can believe [him]4607-any young man capable . If , indeed , it should be so ! But [I]2350-i dare not hope it . Why should [they]4613-they not go on to [Scotland]54-scotland , if that had been the case ? ”[2350-i] “ In the first place , ”[157-mr. gardiner] replied [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner , “ there is no absolute proof that [they]4613-they are not gone to [Scotland]54-scotland . ”[157-mr. gardiner] “ Oh , but [their]4613-they removing from the chaise into [a hackney coach]4614-a hackney coach is such a presumption ! And , besides , no traces of them were to be found on [the Barnet road]4615-the barnet road . ”[2350-i] “ Well , then,--supposing [them]4613-they to be in [London]5-london -- [they]4613-they may be [there]306-there , though for the purpose of concealment , for no more exceptionable purpose . It is not likely that money should be very abundant on either side ; and it might strike [them]4613-they that [they]4613-they could be more economically , though less expeditiously , married in [London]5-london , than in [Scotland]54-scotland . ”[157-mr. gardiner] “ But why all this secrecy ? Why any fear of detection ? Why must [their]4613-they marriage be private ? Oh , no , no -- this is not likely . [[His]4607-any young man most particular friend]4617-his most particular friend , [you]4618-you see by [Jane]89-jane ’s account , was persuaded of [his]4607-any young man never intending to marry [her]4617-his most particular friend . [Wickham]142-wickham will never marry [a woman]3084-a woman without some money . [He]142-wickham can not afford it . And what claims has [Lydia]90-lydia , what attractions has [she]90-lydia beyond youth , health , and good humour , that could make [him]4607-any young man for [her]90-lydia sake forego every chance of benefiting [himself]4607-any young man by marrying well ? As to what restraint the apprehensions of disgrace in [the corps]4620-the corps might throw on a dishonourable elopement with [her]90-lydia , [I]2350-i am not able to judge ; for [I]2350-i know nothing of the effects that such a step might produce . But as to [your]4618-you other objection , [I]2350-i am afraid it will hardly hold good . [Lydia]90-lydia has [no brothers]4621-no brothers to step forward ; and [he]4607-any young man might imagine , from [[my]2350-i father]3323-my father ’s behaviour , from [his]4607-any young man indolence and the little attention [he]4607-any young man has ever seemed to give to what was going forward in [[his]4607-any young man family]373-his family , that [he]4607-any young man would do as little and think as little about it , as [any father]4624-any father could do , in such a matter . ”[2350-i] “ But can [you]4618-you think that [Lydia]90-lydia is so lost to everything but love of [him]4607-any young man , as to consent to live with [him]4607-any young man on any other terms than marriage ? ”[2350-i] “ It does seem , and it is most shocking , indeed , ”[88-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , with tears in [her]88-elizabeth eyes , “ that [a sister]436-a sister ’s sense of decency and virtue in such a point should admit of doubt . But , really , [I]88-elizabeth know not what to say . Perhaps [I]88-elizabeth am not doing [her]90-lydia justice . But [she]90-lydia is very young : [she]90-lydia has never been taught to think on serious subjects ; and for the last half year , nay , for a twelvemonth , [she]90-lydia has been given up to nothing but amusement and vanity . [She]90-lydia has been allowed to dispose of [her]90-lydia time in the most idle and frivolous manner , and to adopt any opinions that came in [her]90-lydia way . Since the ----shire were first quartered in [Meryton]9-meryton , nothing but love , flirtation , and [officers]456-officers , have been in [her]90-lydia head . [She]90-lydia has been doing everything in [her]90-lydia power , by thinking and talking on the subject , to give greater -- what shall [I]88-elizabeth call it -susceptibility to [her]90-lydia feelings ; which are naturally lively enough . And [we]4627-we all know that [Wickham]142-wickham has every charm of [person]4628-person and address that can captivate [a woman]3084-a woman . ”[88-elizabeth] “ But [you]2357-you see that [Jane]89-jane , ”[4017-her aunt] said [[her]2357-you aunt]4017-her aunt , “ does not think so ill of [Wickham]142-wickham , as to believe [him]142-wickham capable of the attempt . ”[4017-her aunt] “ Of whom does [Jane]89-jane ever think ill ? And who is there , whatever might be [their]4630-their former conduct , that [she]89-jane would believe capable of such an attempt , till it were proved against [them]4630-their ? But [Jane]89-jane knows , as well as [I]88-elizabeth do , what [Wickham]142-wickham really is . [We]4627-we both know that [he]142-wickham has been profligate in every sense of the word ; that [he]142-wickham has neither integrity nor honour ; that [he]142-wickham is as false and deceitful as [he]142-wickham is insinuating . ”[88-elizabeth] “ And do [you]88-elizabeth really know all this ? ”[129-mrs. gardiner] cried [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner , whose curiosity as to the mode of [her]129-mrs. gardiner intelligence was all alive . “ [I]88-elizabeth do , indeed , ”[88-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , colouring . “ [I]88-elizabeth told [you]88-elizabeth the other day of [his]142-wickham infamous behaviour to [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ; and [you]88-elizabeth , [yourself]88-elizabeth , when last at [Longbourn]7-longbourn , heard in what manner [he]142-wickham spoke of [the man who had behaved with such forbearance and liberality]4631-the man who had behaved with such forbearance and liberality towards [him]142-wickham . And there are other circumstances which [I]88-elizabeth am not at liberty -- which it is not worth while to relate ; but [his]142-wickham lies about [the whole Pemberley family]4632-the whole pemberley family are endless . From what [he]142-wickham said of [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy , [I]88-elizabeth was thoroughly prepared to see [a proud , reserved , disagreeable girl]4633-a proud , reserved , disagreeable girl . Yet [he]142-wickham knew to the contrary [himself]142-wickham . [He]142-wickham must know that [she]4633-a proud , reserved , disagreeable girl was as amiable and unpretending as [we]4634-we have found [her]4633-a proud , reserved , disagreeable girl . ”[88-elizabeth] “ But does [Lydia]90-lydia know nothing of this ? can [she]90-lydia be ignorant of what [you]88-elizabeth and [Jane]89-jane seem so well to understand ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Oh , yes -that , that is the worst of all . Till [I]88-elizabeth was in [Kent]17-kent , and saw so much both of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy and [his]142-wickham relation [Colonel Fitzwilliam]172-colonel fitzwilliam , [I]88-elizabeth was ignorant of the truth [myself]88-elizabeth . And when [I]88-elizabeth returned [home]3288-home [the ----shire]20-the ----shire was to leave [Meryton]9-meryton in a week or fortnight ’s time . As that was the case , neither [Jane]89-jane , to whom [I]88-elizabeth related the whole , nor [I]88-elizabeth , thought it necessary to make [our]4634-we knowledge public ; for of what use could it apparently be to [anyone]3174-anyone , that the good opinion , which all [the neighbourhood]3088-the neighbourhood had of [him]142-wickham , should then be overthrown ? And even when it was settled that [Lydia]90-lydia should go with [Mrs. Forster]182-mrs. forster , the necessity of opening [her]90-lydia eyes to [his]142-wickham character never occurred to [me]88-elizabeth . That [she]90-lydia could be in any danger from the deception never entered [my]88-elizabeth head . That such a consequence as this should ensue , [you]4638-you may easily believe was far enough from [my]88-elizabeth thoughts . ”[88-elizabeth] “ When [they]4639-they all removed to [Brighton]36-brighton , therefore , [you]88-elizabeth had no reason , [I]88-elizabeth suppose , to believe [them]4639-they fond of [each other]3216-each other ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Not the slightest . [I]88-elizabeth can remember no symptom of affection on either side ; and had anything of the kind been perceptible , [you]4638-you must be aware that [ours]4641-ours is not [a family on which it could be thrown away]4642-a family on which it could be thrown away . When first [he]142-wickham entered [the corps]4620-the corps , [she]90-lydia was ready enough to admire [him]142-wickham ; but so [we]4641-ours all were . [Every girl in or near [Meryton]9-meryton]4644-every girl in or near meryton was out of [her]4644-every girl in or near meryton senses about [him]142-wickham for the first two months : but [he]142-wickham never distinguished [her]4644-every girl in or near meryton by any particular attention ; and , consequently , after a moderate period of extravagant and wild admiration , [her]4644-every girl in or near meryton fancy for [him]142-wickham gave way , and others of [the regiment]654-the regiment , who treated [her]4644-every girl in or near meryton with more distinction , again became [her]4644-every girl in or near meryton favourites . ”[88-elizabeth] It may be easily believed , that however little of novelty could be added to [their]2359-their fears , hopes , and conjectures , on this interesting subject by its repeated discussion , [no other]2360-no other could detain [them]2359-their from it long , during the whole of the journey . From [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s thoughts it was never absent . Fixed there by the keenest of all anguish , self - reproach , [she]88-elizabeth could find no interval of ease or forgetfulness . [They]2359-their travelled as expeditiously as possible ; and sleeping one night on [the road]1292-the road , reached [Longbourn]7-longbourn by dinnertime the next day . It was a comfort to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth to consider that [Jane]89-jane could not have been wearied by long expectations . [The little Gardiners , attracted by the sight of a chaise]2362-the little gardiners , attracted by the sight of a chaise , were standing on the steps of [the house]3075-the house , as [they]2359-their entered [the paddock]2364-the paddock ; and when [the carriage]3286-the carriage drove up to the door , the joyful surprise that lighted up [their]2359-their faces and displayed itself over [their]2359-their whole bodies , in a variety of capers and frisks , was the first pleasing earnest of [their]2359-their welcome . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth jumped out ; and after giving each of [them]2359-their a hasty kiss , hurried into [the vestibule]3820-the vestibule , where [Jane]89-jane , who came running [downstairs]2367-downstairs from [[[her]89-jane mother]246-her mother ’s apartment]2369-her mother ’s apartment , immediately met [her]89-jane . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , as [she]88-elizabeth affectionately embraced [her]89-jane , whilst tears filled the eyes of [both]1721-both , lost not a moment in asking whether anything had been heard of [the fugitives]2371-the fugitives . “ Not yet , ”[89-jane] replied [Jane]89-jane . “ But now that [[my]89-jane dear uncle]1240-my dear uncle is come , [I]89-jane hope everything will be well . ”[89-jane] “ Is [[my]88-elizabeth father]3323-my father in [town]268-town ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Yes , [he]3323-my father went on Tuesday , as [I]88-elizabeth wrote [you]89-jane word . ”[88-elizabeth] “ And have [you]88-elizabeth heard from [him]3323-my father often ? ”[89-jane] “ [We]4649-we have heard only once . [He]3323-my father wrote [me]88-elizabeth a few lines on Wednesday , to say that [he]3323-my father had arrived in safety , and to give [me]88-elizabeth [his]3323-my father directions , which [I]88-elizabeth particularly begged [him]3323-my father to do . [He]3323-my father merely added , that [he]3323-my father should not write again , till [he]3323-my father had something of importance to mention . ”[88-elizabeth] “ And [[my]88-elizabeth mother]3295-my mother -- how is [she]3295-my mother ? How are [you]89-jane all ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ [[My]88-elizabeth mother]3295-my mother is tolerably well , [I]88-elizabeth trust ; though [her]3295-my mother spirits are greatly shaken . [She]3295-my mother is [upstairs]3537-upstairs , and will have great satisfaction in seeing [you]89-jane all . [She]3295-my mother does not yet leave [[her]3295-my mother dressing - room]4653-her dressing - room . [Mary]94-mary and [Kitty]93-lady catherine , thank [Heaven]60-heaven ! are quite well . ”[88-elizabeth] “ But [you]88-elizabeth -- how are [you]88-elizabeth ? ”[88-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ [You]88-elizabeth look pale . How much [you]88-elizabeth must have gone through ! ”[88-elizabeth] [[Her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , however , assured [her]88-elizabeth of [her]88-elizabeth being perfectly well ; and [their]2373-their conversation , which had been passing while [Mr.]2374-mr. and [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner were engaged with [[their]2373-their children]2375-their children , was now put an end to by the approach of [the whole party]525-the whole party . [Jane]89-jane ran to [[her]89-jane uncle]579-her uncle and [aunt]1241-aunt , and welcomed and thanked [them]2373-their both , with alternate smiles and tears . When [they]2373-their were all in [the drawing - room]524-the drawing - room , the questions which [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had already asked were of course repeated by [the others]511-the others , and [they]2373-their soon found that [Jane]89-jane had no intelligence to give . The sanguine hope of good , however , which the benevolence of [her]89-jane heart suggested , had not yet deserted [her]89-jane ; [she]89-jane still expected that it would all end well , and that every morning would bring some letter , either from [Lydia]90-lydia or [[her]90-lydia father]249-her father , to explain [their]2373-their proceedings , and , perhaps , announce the marriage . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , to [whose apartment [they]2373-their all repaired]2382-whose apartment they all repaired , after a few minutes ’ conversation together , received [them]2373-their exactly as might be expected ; with tears and lamentations of regret , invectives against the villainous conduct of [Wickham]142-wickham , and complaints of [her]92-mrs. bennet own sufferings and ill - usage ; blaming [everybody]305-everybody but [the person to whose ill - judging indulgence the errors of [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughter]461-her daughter]2384-the person to whose ill - judging indulgence the errors of her daughter must be principally owing . “ If [I]92-mrs. bennet had been able , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [she]92-mrs. bennet , “ to carry [my]92-mrs. bennet point in going to [Brighton]36-brighton with all [[my]92-mrs. bennet family]979-my family , this would not have happened : but [poor dear [Lydia]90-lydia]4655-poor dear lydia had [nobody]3152-nobody to take care of [her]90-lydia . Why did [the Forsters]203-the forsters ever let [her]90-lydia go out of [their]203-the forsters sight ? [I]92-mrs. bennet am sure there was some great neglect or other on [their]203-the forsters side , for [she]90-lydia is not the kind of girl to do such a thing , if [she]90-lydia had been well looked after . [I]92-mrs. bennet always thought [they]203-the forsters were very unfit to have the charge of [her]90-lydia ; but [I]92-mrs. bennet was over - ruled , as [I]92-mrs. bennet always am . Poor , [dear child]4657-dear child ! And now here ’s [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet gone away , and [I]92-mrs. bennet know [he]81-mr. bennet will fight [Wickham]142-wickham , wherever [he]81-mr. bennet meets [him]81-mr. bennet , and then [he]81-mr. bennet will be killed , and what is to become of [us]2386-they all ? [The Collinses]204-the collinses will turn [us]2386-they out , before [he]81-mr. bennet is cold in [his]81-mr. bennet grave ; and if [you]81-mr. bennet are not kind to [us]2386-they , [brother]4658-brother , [I]92-mrs. bennet do not know what [we]2386-they shall do . ”[92-mrs. bennet] [They]2386-they all exclaimed against such terrific ideas ; and [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner , after general assurances of [his]157-mr. gardiner affection for [her]2387-her and [all [her]2387-her family]1300-all her family , told [her]2387-her that [he]157-mr. gardiner meant to be in [London]5-london the very next day , and would assist [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet in every endeavour for recovering [Lydia]90-lydia . “ Do not give way to useless alarm , ”[157-mr. gardiner] added [he]157-mr. gardiner : “ though it is right to be prepared for the worst , there is no occasion to look on it as certain . It is not quite a week since [they]2386-they left [Brighton]36-brighton . In a few days more , [we]2386-they may gain some news of [them]2386-they ; and till [we]2386-they know that [they]2386-they are not married , and have no design of marrying , do not let [us]2386-they give the matter over as lost . As soon as [I]157-mr. gardiner get to [town]268-town , [I]157-mr. gardiner shall go to [[my]157-mr. gardiner brother]465-my brother , and make [him]465-my brother come [home]3288-home with [me]157-mr. gardiner to [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street , and then [we]2386-they may consult together as to what is to be done . ”[157-mr. gardiner] “ Oh , [[my]92-mrs. bennet dear brother]4662-my dear brother , ”[92-mrs. bennet] replied [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , “ that is exactly what [I]92-mrs. bennet could most wish for . And now do , when [you]4662-my dear brother get to [town]268-town , find [them]2386-they out , wherever [they]2386-they may be ; and if [they]2386-they are not married already , make [them]2386-they marry . And as for wedding clothes , do not let [them]2386-they wait for that , but tell [Lydia]90-lydia [she]90-lydia shall have as much money as [she]90-lydia chooses to buy [them]2386-they , after [they]2386-they are married . And , above all things , keep [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet from fighting . Tell [him]81-mr. bennet what a dreadful state [I]92-mrs. bennet am in -- that [I]92-mrs. bennet am frightened out of [my]92-mrs. bennet wits ; and have such tremblings , such flutterings all over [me]92-mrs. bennet , such spasms in [my]92-mrs. bennet side , and pains in [my]92-mrs. bennet head , and such beatings at [my]92-mrs. bennet heart , that [I]92-mrs. bennet can get no rest by night nor by day . And tell [[my]92-mrs. bennet dear]3066-my dear [Lydia]90-lydia not to give any directions about [her]90-lydia clothes till [she]90-lydia has seen [me]92-mrs. bennet , for [she]90-lydia does not know which are the best warehouses . Oh , [brother]4658-brother , how kind [you]4658-brother are ! [I]92-mrs. bennet know [you]4658-brother will contrive it all . ”[92-mrs. bennet] But [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner , though [he]157-mr. gardiner assured [her]2389-her again of [his]157-mr. gardiner earnest endeavours in the cause , could not avoid recommending moderation to [her]2389-her , as well in [her]2389-her hopes as [her]2389-her fears ; and after talking with [her]2389-her in this manner till dinner was on table , [they]2390-they left [her]2389-her to vent all [her]2389-her feelings on [the housekeeper]3647-the housekeeper , who attended in the absence of [[her]3647-the housekeeper daughters]242-her daughters . Though [[her]2389-her brother]3181-her brother and [sister]1153-sister were persuaded that there was no real occasion for such a seclusion from [the family]414-the family , [they]2390-they did not attempt to oppose it ; for [they]2390-they knew that [she]2389-her had not prudence enough to hold [her]2389-her tongue before [the servants]3526-the servants , while [they]2390-they waited at table , and judged it better that [one only of [the household]2398-the household]2397-one only of the household , and [the one whom [they]2390-they could most trust]2399-the one whom they could most trust , should comprehend all [her]2389-her fears and solicitude on the subject . In [the dining - room]3520-the dining - room [they]2390-they were soon joined by [Mary]94-mary and [Kitty]93-lady catherine , who had been too busily engaged in [[their]2390-they separate apartments]2401-their separate apartments to make [their]2390-they appearance before . One came from [her]94-mary books , and the other from [her]94-mary toilette . The faces of both , however , were tolerably calm ; and no change was visible in either , except that the loss of [[her]94-mary favourite sister]2402-her favourite sister , or the anger which [she]94-mary had [herself]94-mary incurred in the business , had given something more of fretfulness than usual to the accents of [Kitty]93-lady catherine . As for [Mary]94-mary , [she]94-mary was mistress enough of [herself]94-mary to whisper to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , with a countenance of grave reflection , soon after [they]2390-they were seated at table,-- “ This is a most unfortunate affair , and will probably be much talked of . But [we]2390-they must stem the tide of malice , and pour into the wounded bosoms of each other the balm of sisterly consolation . ”[94-mary] Then perceiving in [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth no inclination of replying , [she]94-mary added , “ Unhappy as the event must be for [Lydia]90-lydia , [we]2390-they may draw from it this useful lesson -that loss of virtue in [a female]4666-a female is irretrievable , that one false step involves [her]90-lydia in endless ruin , that [her]90-lydia reputation is no less brittle than it is beautiful , and that [she]90-lydia can not be too much guarded in [her]90-lydia behaviour towards the undeserving of the other sex . ”[94-mary] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth lifted up [her]88-elizabeth eyes in amazement , but was too much oppressed to make any reply . [Mary]94-mary , however , continued to console [herself]94-mary with such kind of moral extractions from the evil before [them]2390-they . In the afternoon , [the two elder Miss Bennets]2403-the two elder miss bennets were able to be for half an hour by [themselves]2403-the two elder miss bennets ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth instantly availed [herself]88-elizabeth of the opportunity of making any inquiries which [Jane]89-jane was equally eager to satisfy . After joining in general lamentations over the dreadful sequel of this event , which [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth considered as all but certain , and [Miss Bennet]90-lydia could not assert to be wholly impossible , [the former]327-the former continued the subject by saying , “ But tell [me]327-the former all and everything about it which [I]327-the former have not already heard . Give [me]327-the former further particulars . What did [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster say ? Had [they]2390-they no apprehension of anything before the elopement took place ? [They]2390-they must have seen [them]2390-they together for ever . ”[327-the former] “ [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster did own that [he]113-colonel forster had often suspected some partiality , especially on [Lydia]90-lydia ’s side , but nothing to give [him]113-colonel forster any alarm . [I]327-the former am so grieved for [him]113-colonel forster . [His]113-colonel forster behaviour was attentive and kind to the utmost . [He]113-colonel forster was coming to [us]4667-us , in order to assure [us]4667-us of [his]113-colonel forster concern , before [he]113-colonel forster had any idea of [their]2390-they not being gone to [Scotland]54-scotland : when that apprehension first got abroad , it hastened [his]113-colonel forster journey . ”[327-the former] “ And was [Denny]141-denny convinced that [Wickham]142-wickham would not marry ? Did [he]141-denny know of [their]2390-they intending to go off ? Had [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster seen [Denny]141-denny [himself]113-colonel forster ? ”[327-the former] “ Yes ; but when questioned by [him]141-denny , [Denny]141-denny denied knowing anything of [their]2390-they plan , and would not give [his]141-denny real opinion about it .
