[He]141-denny did not repeat [his]141-denny persuasion of [their]2390-they not marrying , and from that [I]327-the former am inclined to hope [he]141-denny might have been misunderstood before . ”[327-the former] “ And [till Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster came [himself]113-colonel forster , not one of [you]4668-you entertained a doubt , [I]327-the former suppose , of [their]2390-they being really married ? ”[327-the former] “ How was it possible that such an idea should enter [our]2390-they brains ? [I]327-the former felt a little uneasy -- a little fearful of [[my]327-the former sister]3345-my sister ’s happiness with [him]113-colonel forster in marriage , because [I]327-the former knew that [his]113-colonel forster conduct had not been always quite right . [[My]327-the former father]3323-my father and [mother]3273-mother knew nothing of that ; [they]2390-they only felt how imprudent a match it must be . [Kitty]93-lady catherine then owned , with a very natural triumph on knowing more than [the rest of [us]2390-they]4672-the rest of us , that in [Lydia]90-lydia ’s last letter [she]93-lady catherine had prepared [her]93-lady catherine for such a step . [She]93-lady catherine had known , it seems , of [their]2390-they being in love with [each other]3216-each other many weeks . ”[327-the former] “ But not before [they]2390-they went to [Brighton]36-brighton ? ”[327-the former] “ No , [I]327-the former believe not . ”[327-the former] “ And did [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster appear to think ill of [Wickham]142-wickham [himself]113-colonel forster ? Does [he]113-colonel forster know [his]113-colonel forster real character ? ”[327-the former] “ [I]327-the former must confess that [he]113-colonel forster did not speak so well of [Wickham]142-wickham as [he]113-colonel forster formerly did . [He]113-colonel forster believed [him]113-colonel forster to be imprudent and extravagant ; and since this sad affair has taken place , it is said that [he]113-colonel forster left [Meryton]9-meryton greatly in debt : but [I]327-the former hope this may be false . ”[327-the former] “ Oh , [Jane]89-jane , had [we]4674-we been less secret , had [we]4674-we told what [we]4674-we knew of [him]113-colonel forster , this could not have happened ! ”[327-the former] “ Perhaps it would have been better , ”[328-her sister] replied [[her]2405-her sister]328-her sister . “ But to expose the former faults of [any person]4675-any person , without knowing what [their]4675-any person present feelings were , seemed unjustifiable . ”[328-her sister] “ [We]4674-we acted with the best intentions . ”[327-the former] “ Could [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster repeat the particulars of [Lydia]90-lydia ’s note to [[his]113-colonel forster wife]236-his wife ? ”[327-the former] “ [He]113-colonel forster brought it with [him]113-colonel forster for [us]4674-we to see . ”[328-her sister] [Jane]89-jane then took it from [her]89-jane pocket - book , and gave it to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . These were the contents - / * NIND “ [[My]2407-you dear]3066-my dear [Harriet]183-harriet , * / “[2407-you] [You]2407-you will laugh when [you]2407-you know where [I]0-i am gone , and [I]0-i can not help laughing [myself]0-i at [your]2407-you surprise to - morrow morning , as soon as [I]0-i am missed . [I]0-i am going to [Gretna Green]197-gretna green , and if [you]2407-you can not guess with who , [I]0-i shall think [you]2407-you [a simpleton]3212-a simpleton , for there is but [one man in [the world]304-the world [I]0-i love]2409-one man in the world i love , and [he]2409-one man in the world i love is [an angel]2411-an angel . [I]0-i should never be happy without [him]2409-one man in the world i love , so think it no harm to be off . [You]2407-you need not send [them]2412-them word at [Longbourn]7-longbourn of [my]0-i going , if [you]2407-you do not like it , for it will make the surprise the greater when [I]0-i write to [them]2412-them , and sign [my]0-i name [Lydia Wickham]205-lydia wickham . What a good joke it will be ! [I]0-i can hardly write for laughing . Pray make [my]0-i excuses to [Pratt]186-pratt for not keeping [my]0-i engagement , and dancing with [him]186-pratt to - night . Tell [him]186-pratt [I]0-i hope [he]186-pratt will excuse [me]0-i when [he]186-pratt knows all , and tell [him]186-pratt [I]0-i will dance with [him]186-pratt at the next ball [we]2413-we meet with great pleasure . [I]0-i shall send for [my]0-i clothes when [I]0-i get to [Longbourn]7-longbourn ; but [I]0-i wish [you]2414-you would tell [Sally]206-sally to mend a great slit in [my]0-i worked muslin gown before [they]2415-they are packed up . Good - bye . Give [my]0-i love to [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster . [I]0-i hope [you]2414-you will drink to [our]2413-we good journey . “ [[Your]2414-you affectionate friend]4678-your affectionate friend , “[2414-you] [LYDIA BENNET]90-lydia . ” “[90-lydia] Oh , thoughtless , thoughtless [Lydia]90-lydia ! ” cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth when [she]88-elizabeth had finished it . “[90-lydia] What a letter is this , to be written at such a moment ! But at least it shows that [she]90-lydia was serious in the object of [her]90-lydia journey . Whatever [he]2416-he might afterwards persuade [her]90-lydia to , it was not on [her]90-lydia side a scheme of infamy . [[My]0-i poor father]2417-my poor father ! how [he]2417-my poor father must have felt it ! ” “[2417-my poor father] [I]0-i never saw [anyone]3174-anyone so shocked . [He]2417-my poor father could not speak a word for full ten minutes . [[My]0-i mother]3295-my mother was taken ill immediately , and [the whole house]1333-the whole house in such confusion ! ” “[3295-my mother] Oh , [Jane]89-jane , ” cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “[89-jane] was there [a servant belonging to it who did not know the whole story before the end of the day]2421-a servant belonging to it who did not know the whole story before the end of the day ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do not know : [I]0-i hope there was . But to be guarded at such a time is very difficult . [[My]0-i mother]3295-my mother was in hysterics ; and though [I]0-i endeavoured to give [her]3295-my mother every assistance in [my]0-i power , [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i did not do so much as [I]0-i might have done . But the horror of what might possibly happen almost took from [me]0-i [my]0-i faculties . ” “[0-i] [Your]0-i attendance upon [her]3295-my mother has been too much for [you]0-i . [You]0-i do not look well . Oh that [I]0-i had been with [you]0-i ! [you]0-i have had every care and anxiety upon [yourself]0-i alone . ” “[94-mary] [Mary]94-mary and [Kitty]93-lady catherine have been very kind , and would have shared in every fatigue , [I]0-i am sure , but [I]0-i did not think it right for [either of [them]1225-either of them]1225-either of them . [Kitty]93-lady catherine is slight and delicate , and [Mary]94-mary studies so much that [her]94-mary hours of repose should not be broken in on . [[My]0-i aunt]3279-my aunt [Philips]116-mr. philips came to [Longbourn]7-longbourn on Tuesday , after [[my]0-i father]3323-my father went away ; and was so good as to stay till Thursday with [me]0-i . [She]3279-my aunt was of great use and comfort to [[us]2426-us all]2427-us all , and [Lady Lucas]87-lady lucas has been very kind : [she]3279-my aunt walked here on Wednesday morning to condole with [us]2426-us , and offered [her]3279-my aunt services , or any of [[her]3279-my aunt daughters]242-her daughters , if [they]2429-they could be of use to [us]2426-us . ” “[3279-my aunt] [She]3279-my aunt had better have stayed at [home]3288-home , ” cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth : “[3279-my aunt] perhaps [she]3279-my aunt meant well , but , under such a misfortune as this , one can not see too little of [[one]3113-one ’s neighbours]2432-one ’s neighbours . Assistance is impossible ; condolence , insufferable . Let [them]2432-one ’s neighbours triumph over [us]2426-us at a distance , and be satisfied . ” [She]88-elizabeth then proceeded to inquire into the measures which [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father had intended to pursue , while in [town]268-town , for the recovery of [[his]2433-he daughter]3923-his daughter . “[2433-he] [He]2433-he meant , [I]0-i believe , ” replied [Jane]89-jane , “[2433-he] to go to [Epsom]57-epsom , [the place where [they]2435-they last changed horses , see [the postilions]2436-the postilions , and try if anything could be made out from [them]2436-the postilions]2434-the place where they last changed horses , see the postilions , and try if anything could be made out from them . [His]2433-he principal object must be to discover the number of [the hackney coach]2437-the hackney coach which took [them]2435-they from [Clapham]56-clapham . It had come with a fare from [London]5-london ; and as [he]2433-he thought the circumstance of [a gentleman]3470-a gentleman and [lady]427-lady ’s removing from [one carriage]2440-one carriage into another might be remarked , [he]2433-he meant to make inquiries at [Clapham]56-clapham . If [he]2433-he could anyhow discover at what house [the coachman]1779-the coachman had before set down [his]2433-he fare , [he]2433-he determined to make inquiries there , and hoped it might not be impossible to find out the stand and number of [the coach]3290-the coach . [I]0-i do not know of any other designs that [he]2433-he had formed ; but [he]2433-he was in such a hurry to be gone , and [his]2433-he spirits so greatly discomposed , that [I]0-i had difficulty in finding out even so much as this . ” [ Illustration : The Post ] CHAPTER XLVIII . [ Illustration ] [The whole party]525-the whole party were in hopes of a letter from [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet the next morning , but the post came in without bringing a single line from [him]2433-he . [[His]2433-he family]373-his family knew [him]2433-he to be , on all common occasions , [a most negligent and dilatory correspondent]4684-a most negligent and dilatory correspondent ; but at such a time [they]373-his family had hoped for exertion . [They]373-his family were forced to conclude , that [he]2433-he had no pleasing intelligence to send ; but even of that [they]373-his family would have been glad to be certain . [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner had waited only for the letters before [he]2433-he set off . When [he]2433-he was gone , [they]373-his family were certain at least of receiving constant information of what was going on ; and [[their]373-his family uncle]3314-their uncle promised , at parting , to prevail on [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet to return to [Longbourn]7-longbourn as soon as [he]2433-he could , to the great consolation of [[his]2433-he sister]565-his sister , who considered it as the only security for [[her]565-his sister husband]260-her husband ’s not being killed in a duel . [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner and [the children]1941-the children were to remain in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire a few days longer , as [the former]327-the former thought [her]129-mrs. gardiner presence might be serviceable to [[her]129-mrs. gardiner nieces]3117-her nieces . [She]129-mrs. gardiner shared in [their]373-his family attendance on [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , and was a great comfort to [them]373-his family in [their]373-his family hours of freedom . [[Their]373-his family other aunt]4691-their other aunt also visited [them]373-his family frequently , and always , as [she]4691-their other aunt said , with the design of cheering and heartening [them]373-his family up -- though , as [she]4691-their other aunt never came without reporting some fresh instance of [Wickham]142-wickham ’s extravagance or irregularity , [she]4691-their other aunt seldom went away without leaving [them]373-his family more dispirited than [she]4691-their other aunt found [them]373-his family . [All Meryton]9-meryton seemed striving to blacken [the man who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light]4692-the man who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light . [He]4692-the man who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light was declared to be in debt to [every tradesman in [the place]3068-the place]4693-every tradesman in the place , and [his]4692-the man who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light intrigues , all honoured with the title of seduction , had been extended into [[every tradesman]4695-every tradesman ’s family]4696-every tradesman ’s family . [Everybody]305-everybody declared that [he]4692-the man who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light was [the wickedest young man in [the world]304-the world]4698-the wickedest young man in the world ; and [everybody]305-everybody began to find out that [they]305-everybody had always distrusted the appearance of [his]4692-the man who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light goodness . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , though [she]88-elizabeth did not credit above half of what was said , believed enough to make [her]88-elizabeth former assurance of [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ’s ruin still more certain ; and even [Jane]89-jane , who believed still less of it , became almost hopeless , more especially as the time was now come , when , if [they]4702-they had gone to [Scotland]54-scotland , which [she]89-jane had never before entirely despaired of , [they]4702-they must in all probability have gained some news of [them]4702-they . [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner left [Longbourn]7-longbourn on Sunday ; on Tuesday , [[his]157-mr. gardiner wife]236-his wife received a letter from [him]157-mr. gardiner : it told [them]236-his wife , that on [his]157-mr. gardiner arrival [he]157-mr. gardiner had immediately found out [[his]157-mr. gardiner brother]4704-his brother , and persuaded [him]4704-his brother to come to [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street . That [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet had been to [Epsom]57-epsom and [Clapham]56-clapham , before [his]81-mr. bennet arrival , but without gaining any satisfactory information ; and that [he]81-mr. bennet was now determined to inquire at [all the principal hotels in [town]268-town]4705-all the principal hotels in town , as [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet thought it possible [they]236-his wife might have gone to one of [them]4705-all the principal hotels in town , on [their]236-his wife first coming to [London]5-london , before [they]236-his wife procured [lodgings]4707-lodgings . [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner [himself]157-mr. gardiner did not expect any success from this measure ; but as [[his]157-mr. gardiner brother]4704-his brother was eager in it , [he]157-mr. gardiner meant to assist [him]4704-his brother in pursuing it . [He]157-mr. gardiner added , that [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet seemed wholly disinclined at present to leave [London]5-london , and promised to write again very soon . There was also a postscript to this effect - “[0-i] [I]0-i have written to [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster to desire [him]113-colonel forster to find out , if possible , from [some of [the young man]3597-the young man ’s intimates in [the regiment]654-the regiment]2443-some of the young man ’s intimates in the regiment , whether [Wickham]142-wickham has any relations or connections who would be likely to know in [what part of [the town]3847-the town [he]113-colonel forster has now concealed [himself]113-colonel forster]2446-what part of the town he has now concealed himself . If there were [anyone that one could apply to , with a probability of gaining such a clue as that]2448-anyone that one could apply to , with a probability of gaining such a clue as that , it might be of essential consequence . At present [we]2449-us have nothing to guide [us]2449-us . [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster will , [I]0-i dare say , do everything in [his]113-colonel forster power to satisfy [us]2449-us on this head . But , on second thoughts , perhaps [Lizzy]88-elizabeth could tell [us]2449-us what relations [he]113-colonel forster has now living better than [any other person]3903-any other person . ” [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was at no loss to understand from whence this deference for [her]88-elizabeth authority proceeded ; but it was not in [her]88-elizabeth power to give any information of so satisfactory a nature as the compliment deserved . [She]88-elizabeth had never heard of [his]113-colonel forster having had any relations , except [a father]3312-a father and [mother]3273-mother , both of whom had been dead many years . It was possible , however , that [some of [[his]113-colonel forster companions in [the ----shire]4713-the ----shire]4712-his companions in the ----shire]4711-some of his companions in the ----shire might be able to give more information ; and though [she]88-elizabeth was not very sanguine in expecting it , the application was a something to look forward to . Every day at [Longbourn]7-longbourn was now a day of anxiety ; but the most anxious part of each was when the post was expected . The arrival of letters was the first grand object of every morning ’s impatience . Through letters , whatever of good or bad was to be told would be communicated ; and every succeeding day was expected to bring some news of importance . But before [they]2449-us heard again from [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner , a letter arrived for [[their]2449-us father]252-their father , from a different quarter , from [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ; which , as [Jane]89-jane had received directions to open all that came for [him]113-colonel forster in [his]113-colonel forster absence , [she]89-jane accordingly read ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , who knew what curiosities [his]113-colonel forster letters always were , looked over [her]89-jane , and read it likewise . It was as follows - / * “[88-elizabeth] [[My]0-i dear]3066-my dear Sir , * / “ [I]88-elizabeth feel [myself]88-elizabeth called upon , by [our]4715-our relationship , and [my]88-elizabeth situation in life , to condole with [you]3066-my dear on the grievous affliction [you]3066-my dear are now suffering under , of which [we]4715-our were yesterday informed by a letter from [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire . Be assured , [[my]88-elizabeth dear sir]870-my dear sir , that [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins and [myself]88-elizabeth sincerely sympathize with [you]3066-my dear , and all [[your]3066-my dear respectable family]4717-your respectable family , in [your]3066-my dear present distress , which must be of the bitterest kind , because proceeding from a cause which no time can remove . No arguments shall be wanting on [my]88-elizabeth part , that can alleviate so severe a misfortune ; or that may comfort [you]3066-my dear , under a circumstance that must be , of all others , most afflicting to [a parent]4718-a parent ’s mind . The death of [[your]3066-my dear daughter]3298-your daughter would have been a blessing in comparison of this . And it is the more to be lamented , because there is reason to suppose , as [[my]88-elizabeth dear]3066-my dear [Charlotte]180-charlotte informs [me]88-elizabeth , that this licentiousness of behaviour in [your]3066-my dear [ Illustration : “[88-elizabeth] To whom [I]0-i have related the affair ” [daughter]4118-daughter has proceeded from a faulty degree of indulgence ; though , at the same time , for the consolation of [yourself]3066-my dear and [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , [I]0-i am inclined to think that [her]3298-your daughter own disposition must be naturally bad , or [she]3298-your daughter could not be guilty of such an enormity , at so early an age . Howsoever that may be , [you]3066-my dear are grievously to be pitied ; in which opinion [I]0-i am not only joined by [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins , but likewise by [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine and [[her]93-lady catherine daughter]461-her daughter , to whom [I]0-i have related the affair . [They]4723-they agree with [me]0-i in apprehending that this false step in [one daughter]4724-one daughter will be injurious to the fortunes of all the others : for who , as [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine [herself]93-lady catherine condescendingly says , will connect [themselves]4723-they with [such a family]4725-such a family ? And this consideration leads [me]0-i , moreover , to reflect , with augmented satisfaction , on a certain event of last November ; for had it been otherwise , [I]0-i must have been involved in all [your]3066-my dear sorrow and disgrace . Let [me]0-i advise [you]3066-my dear , then , [[my]0-i dear sir]870-my dear sir , to console [yourself]3066-my dear as much as possible , to throw off [[your]3066-my dear unworthy child]4727-your unworthy child from [your]3066-my dear affection for ever , and leave [her]4727-your unworthy child to reap the fruits of [her]4727-your unworthy child own heinous offence . “[0-i] [I]0-i am , [dear sir]3500-dear sir , ” etc . , etc . [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner did not write again , till [he]157-mr. gardiner had received an answer from [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster ; and then [he]157-mr. gardiner had nothing of a pleasant nature to send . It was not known that [Wickham]142-wickham had a single relation with whom [he]142-wickham kept up any connection , and it was certain that [he]142-wickham had [no near one living]4728-no near one living . [[His]142-wickham former acquaintance]4729-his former acquaintance had been numerous ; but since [he]142-wickham had been in [the militia]4730-the militia , it did not appear that [he]142-wickham was on terms of particular friendship with [any of [them]4729-his former acquaintance]3839-any of them . There was [no one]3336-no one , therefore , who could be pointed out as likely to give any news of [him]142-wickham . And in the wretched state of [his]142-wickham own finances , there was a very powerful motive for secrecy , in addition to [his]142-wickham fear of discovery by [Lydia]90-lydia ’s relations ; for it had just transpired that [he]142-wickham had left gaming debts behind [him]142-wickham to a very considerable amount . [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster believed that more than a thousand pounds would be necessary to clear [his]142-wickham expenses at [Brighton]36-brighton . [He]142-wickham owed a good deal in [the town]3847-the town , but [his]142-wickham debts of honour were still more formidable . [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner did not attempt to conceal these particulars from [the Longbourn family]3558-the longbourn family ; [Jane]89-jane heard [them]4729-his former acquaintance with horror . “[0-i] [A gamester]2453-a gamester ! ” [she]89-jane cried . “[2453-a gamester] This is wholly unexpected ; [I]0-i had not an idea of it . ” [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner added , in [his]157-mr. gardiner letter , that [they]3558-the longbourn family might expect to see [[their]3558-the longbourn family father]252-their father at [home]3288-home on the following day , which was Saturday . Rendered spiritless by the ill success of all [their]3558-the longbourn family endeavours , [he]157-mr. gardiner had yielded to [[his]157-mr. gardiner brother - in - law]286-his brother - in - law ’s entreaty that [he]157-mr. gardiner would return to [[his]157-mr. gardiner family]373-his family and leave it to [him]157-mr. gardiner to do whatever occasion might suggest to be advisable for continuing [their]3558-the longbourn family pursuit . When [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet was told of this , [she]92-mrs. bennet did not express so much satisfaction as [[her]92-mrs. bennet children]3811-her children expected , considering what [her]92-mrs. bennet anxiety for [his]2454-he life had been before . “[0-i] What ! is [he]2454-he coming [home]3288-home , and without [poor [Lydia]90-lydia]2456-poor lydia ? ” [she]92-mrs. bennet cried . “[2457-them] Sure [he]2454-he will not leave [London]5-london before [he]2454-he has found [them]2457-them . Who is to fight [Wickham]142-wickham , and make [him]2454-he marry [her]90-lydia , if [he]2454-he comes away ? ” As [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner began to wish to be at [home]3288-home , it was settled that [she]129-mrs. gardiner and [[her]129-mrs. gardiner children]3811-her children should go to [London]5-london at the same time that [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet came from [it]4742-it . [The coach]3290-the coach , therefore , took [them]3811-her children the first stage of [their]3811-her children journey , and brought [its master]3979-its master back to [Longbourn]7-longbourn . [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner went away in all the perplexity about [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth and [[her]88-elizabeth Derbyshire friend]4745-her derbyshire friend , that had attended [her]129-mrs. gardiner from [that part of [the world]304-the world]4746-that part of the world . [His]4745-her derbyshire friend name had never been voluntarily mentioned before [them]3811-her children by [[her]129-mrs. gardiner niece]1279-her niece ; and the kind of half - expectation which [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner had formed , of [their]3811-her children being followed by a letter from [him]4745-her derbyshire friend , had ended in nothing . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had received none since [her]88-elizabeth return , that could come from [Pemberley]12-pemberley . The present unhappy state of [the family]414-the family rendered any other excuse for the lowness of [her]88-elizabeth spirits unnecessary ; nothing , therefore , could be fairly conjectured from that,--though [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , who was by this time tolerably well acquainted with [her]88-elizabeth own feelings , was perfectly aware that , had [she]88-elizabeth known nothing of [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , [she]88-elizabeth could have borne the dread of [Lydia]90-lydia ’s infamy somewhat better . It would have spared [her]88-elizabeth , [she]88-elizabeth thought , one sleepless night out of two . When [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet arrived , [he]81-mr. bennet had all the appearance of [his]81-mr. bennet usual philosophic composure . [He]81-mr. bennet said as little as [he]81-mr. bennet had ever been in the habit of saying ; made no mention of the business that had taken [him]81-mr. bennet away ; and it was some time before [[his]81-mr. bennet daughters]430-his daughters had courage to speak of it . It was not till the afternoon , when [he]81-mr. bennet joined [them]430-his daughters at tea , that [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ventured to introduce the subject ; and then , on [her]88-elizabeth briefly expressing [her]88-elizabeth sorrow for what [he]81-mr. bennet must have endured , [he]81-mr. bennet replied , “[142-wickham] Say nothing of that . Who should suffer but [myself]0-i ? It has been [my]0-i own doing , and [I]0-i ought to feel it . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i must not be too severe upon [yourself]0-i , ” replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “[0-i] [You]0-i may well warn [me]0-i against such an evil . Human nature is so prone to fall into it ! No , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , let [me]0-i once in [my]0-i life feel how much [I]0-i have been to blame . [I]0-i am not afraid of being overpowered by the impression . It will pass away soon enough . ” “[0-i] Do [you]0-i suppose [them]2458-them to be in [London]5-london ? ” “[0-i] Yes ; where else can [they]2458-them be so well concealed ? ” “[0-i] And [Lydia]90-lydia used to want to go to [London]5-london , ” added [Kitty]93-lady catherine . “[90-lydia] [She]90-lydia is happy , then , ” said [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father , drily ; “[90-lydia] and [[her]90-lydia residence]2459-her residence [there]306-there will probably be of some duration . ” Then , after a short silence , [he]0-i continued , “[88-elizabeth] [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , [I]0-i bear [you]88-elizabeth no ill - will for being justified in [your]88-elizabeth advice to [me]0-i last May , which , considering the event , shows some greatness of mind . ” [They]4752-they were interrupted by [Miss Bennet]90-lydia , who came to fetch [[her]90-lydia mother]246-her mother ’s tea . “[88-elizabeth] This is a parade , ” cried [he]0-i , “[88-elizabeth] which does one good ; it gives such an elegance to misfortune ! Another day [I]0-i will do the same ; [I]0-i will sit in [[my]0-i library]2461-my library , in [my]0-i nightcap and powdering gown , and give as much trouble as [I]0-i can,--or perhaps [I]0-i may defer it till [Kitty]93-lady catherine runs away . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am not going to run away , [papa]2462-papa , ” said [Kitty]93-lady catherine , fretfully . “[2462-papa] If [I]0-i should ever go to [Brighton]36-brighton , [I]0-i would behave better than [Lydia]90-lydia . ” “[90-lydia] [You]93-lady catherine go to [Brighton]36-brighton ! [I]0-i would not trust [you]93-lady catherine so near it as [Eastbourne]61-eastbourne , for fifty pounds ! No , [Kitty]93-lady catherine , [I]0-i have at least learnt to be cautious , and [you]93-lady catherine will feel the effects of it . [No officer]2463-no officer is ever to enter [[my]0-i house]2464-my house again , nor even to pass through [the village]320-the village . Balls will be absolutely prohibited , unless [you]93-lady catherine stand up with [one of [[your]93-lady catherine sisters]3134-your sisters]2466-one of your sisters . And [you]93-lady catherine are never to stir out of doors , till [you]93-lady catherine can prove that [you]93-lady catherine have spent ten minutes of every day in a rational manner . ” [Kitty]93-lady catherine , who took all these threats in a serious light , began to cry . “[93-lady catherine] Well , well , ” said [he]0-i , “[93-lady catherine] do not make [yourself]93-lady catherine unhappy . If [you]93-lady catherine are [a good girl]2468-a good girl for the next ten years , [I]0-i will take [you]93-lady catherine to a review at the end of [them]2469-them . ” [ Illustration ] CHAPTER XLIX . [ Illustration ] Two days after [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet ’s return , as [Jane]89-jane and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth were walking together in the shrubbery behind [the house]3075-the house , [they]4755-they saw [the housekeeper]3647-the housekeeper coming towards [them]4755-they , and concluding that [she]3647-the housekeeper came to call [them]4755-they to [[their]4755-they mother]433-their mother , went forward to meet [her]3647-the housekeeper ; but instead of the expected summons , when [they]4755-they approached [her]3647-the housekeeper , [she]3647-the housekeeper said to [Miss Bennet]90-lydia , “[0-i] [I]0-i beg [your]0-i pardon , [madam]3346-madam , for interrupting [you]0-i , but [I]0-i was in hopes [you]0-i might have got some good news from [town]268-town , so [I]0-i took the liberty of coming to ask . ” “[0-i] What do [you]0-i mean , [Hill]133-hill ? [We]2472-we have heard nothing from [town]268-town . ” “[2472-we] [Dear madam]2474-dear madam , ” cried [Mrs. Hill]133-hill , in great astonishment , “[2472-we] do n’t [you]0-i know there is an express come for [master]2475-master from [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner ? [He]2475-master has been [here]3067-here this half hour , and [master]2475-master has had a letter . ” Away ran [the girls]3082-the girls , too eager to get in to have time for speech . [They]3082-the girls ran through [the vestibule]3820-the vestibule into [the breakfast - room]3821-the breakfast - room ; from thence to [the library]3825-the library -their [father]4762-father was in neither ; and [they]3082-the girls were on the point of seeking [him]2475-master [upstairs]3537-upstairs with [[their]3082-the girls mother]433-their mother , when [they]3082-the girls were met by [the butler]4765-the butler , who said,-- “[2475-master] If [you]0-i are looking for [[my]0-i master]4479-my master , [ma’am]3191-ma’am , [he]2475-master is walking towards [the little copse]2480-the little copse . ” Upon this information , [they]3082-the girls instantly passed through [the hall]3519-the hall once more , and ran across [the lawn]2050-the lawn after [[their]3082-the girls father]252-their father , who was deliberately pursuing [his]252-their father way towards a small wood on [one side of [the paddock]2364-the paddock]4769-one side of the paddock . [Jane]89-jane , who was not so light , nor so much in the habit of running as [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , soon lagged behind , while [[her]89-jane sister]328-her sister , panting for breath , came up with [him]252-their father , and eagerly cried out,-- “[2475-master] Oh , [papa]2462-papa , what news ? what news ? have [you]2462-papa heard from [[my]0-i uncle]721-my uncle ? ” “[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i have had a letter from [him]721-my uncle by express . ” “[721-my uncle] Well , and what news does it bring -- good or bad ? ” “[721-my uncle] What is there of good to be expected ? ” said [he]252-their father , taking the letter from [his]252-their father pocket ; “[721-my uncle] but perhaps [you]0-i would like to read it . ” [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth impatiently caught it from [his]252-their father hand . [Jane]89-jane now came up . “[0-i] Read it aloud , ” said [[their]4772-their father]252-their father , “[0-i] for [I]0-i hardly know [myself]0-i what it is about . ” / * RIGHT “[0-i] [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street , Monday , August 2 . * / “ [[My]0-i dear Brother]4662-my dear brother , “[0-i] At last [I]0-i am able to send [you]2462-papa some tidings of [[my]0-i niece]4319-my niece , and such as , upon the whole , [I]0-i hope will give [you]2462-papa satisfaction . Soon after [you]2462-papa left [me]0-i on Saturday , [I]0-i was fortunate enough to find out in what part of [London]5-london [they]2484-they were . The particulars [I]0-i reserve till [we]2485-we meet . It is enough to know [they]2484-they are discovered : [I]0-i have seen [them]2484-they both---- ” [ Illustration : “[0-i] But perhaps [you]2462-papa would like to read it ” “[2462-papa] Then it is as [I]0-i always hoped , ” cried [Jane]89-jane : “[0-i] [they]2484-they are married ! ” [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth read on : “[0-i] [I]0-i have seen [them]2484-they both . [They]2484-they are not married , nor can [I]0-i find there was any intention of being so ; but if [you]2462-papa are willing to perform the engagements which [I]0-i have ventured to make on [your]2462-papa side , [I]0-i hope it will not be long before [they]2484-they are . All that is required of [you]2462-papa is , to assure to [[your]2462-papa daughter]3298-your daughter , by settlement , [her]3298-your daughter equal share of the five thousand pounds , secured among [[your]2462-papa children]2487-your children after the decease of [yourself]2462-papa and [[my]0-i sister]3345-my sister ; and , moreover , to enter into an engagement of allowing [her]3298-your daughter , during [your]2462-papa life , one hundred pounds per annum . These are conditions which , considering everything , [I]0-i had no hesitation in complying with , as far as [I]0-i thought [myself]0-i privileged , for [you]2462-papa . [I]0-i shall send this by express , that no time may be lost in bringing [me]0-i [your]2462-papa answer . [You]2462-papa will easily comprehend , from these particulars , that [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham ’s circumstances are not so hopeless as they are generally believed to be . [The world]304-the world has been deceived in that respect ; and [I]0-i am happy to say , there will be some little money , even when all [his]142-wickham debts are discharged , to settle on [[my]0-i niece]4319-my niece , in addition to [her]4319-my niece own fortune . If , as [I]0-i conclude will be the case , [you]2462-papa send [me]0-i full powers to act in [your]2462-papa name throughout the whole of this business , [I]0-i will immediately give directions to [Haggerston]208-haggerston for preparing a proper settlement . There will not be the smallest occasion for [your]2462-papa coming to [town]268-town again ; therefore stay quietly at [Longbourn]7-longbourn , and depend on [my]0-i diligence and care . Send back [your]2462-papa answer as soon as [you]2462-papa can , and be careful to write explicitly . [We]2492-we have judged it best that [[my]0-i niece]4319-my niece should be married from [this house]3479-this house , of which [I]0-i hope [you]2462-papa will approve . [She]4319-my niece comes to [us]2492-we to - day . [I]0-i shall write again as soon as anything more is determined on . [Yours]2462-papa , etc . “ EDW . [GARDINER]157-mr. gardiner . ”[2462-papa] “ Is it possible ? ”[88-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , when [she]88-elizabeth had finished . “ Can it be possible that [he]4775-he will marry [her]4319-my niece ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ [Wickham]142-wickham is not so undeserving , then , as [we]2492-we have thought [him]142-wickham , ”[328-her sister] said [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister . “ [[My]88-elizabeth dear father]4435-my dear father , [I]88-elizabeth congratulate [you]4435-my dear father . ”[88-elizabeth] “ And have [you]4435-my dear father answered the letter ? ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ No ; but it must be done soon . ”[88-elizabeth] Most earnestly did [she]88-elizabeth then entreat [him]2496-he to lose no more time before [he]2496-he wrote . “ Oh ! [[my]88-elizabeth dear father]4435-my dear father , ”[88-elizabeth] [she]88-elizabeth cried , “ come back and write immediately . Consider how important every moment is in such a case . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Let [me]89-jane write for [you]2496-he , ”[89-jane] said [Jane]89-jane , “ if [you]2496-he dislike the trouble [yourself]2496-he . ”[89-jane] “ [I]2496-he dislike it very much , ”[2496-he] [he]2496-he replied ; “ but it must be done . ”[2496-he] And so saying , [he]2496-he turned back with [them]2497-they , and walked towards [the house]3075-the house . “ And -- may [I]88-elizabeth ask ? ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; “ but the terms , [I]88-elizabeth suppose , must be complied with . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Complied with ! [I]89-jane am only ashamed of [his]2496-he asking so little . ”[89-jane] “ And [they]2497-they must marry ! Yet [he]2496-he is such [a man]3114-a man . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Yes , yes , [they]2497-they must marry . There is nothing else to be done . But there are two things that [I]88-elizabeth want very much to know -one is , how much money [[your]2496-he uncle]3438-your uncle has laid down to bring it about ; and the other , how [I]88-elizabeth am ever to pay [him]2496-he . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Money ! [[my]89-jane uncle]721-my uncle ! ”[89-jane] cried [Jane]89-jane , “ what do [you]721-my uncle mean , [sir]3234-sir ? ”[89-jane] “ [I]88-elizabeth mean that [no man in [his]2496-he proper senses]4782-no man in his proper senses would marry [Lydia]90-lydia on so slight a temptation as one hundred a year during [my]88-elizabeth life , and fifty after [I]88-elizabeth am gone . ”[88-elizabeth] “ That is very true , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; “ though it had not occurred to [me]88-elizabeth before . [His]2496-he debts to be discharged , and something still to remain ! Oh , it must be [[my]88-elizabeth uncle]721-my uncle ’s doings ! [Generous , good man]4784-generous , good man , [I]88-elizabeth am afraid [he]2496-he has distressed [himself]2496-he . A small sum could not do all this . ”[88-elizabeth] “ No , ”[249-her father] said [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father . “ [Wickham]142-wickham ’s [a fool]4785-a fool if [he]2496-he takes [her]2496-he with a farthing less than ten thousand pounds : [I]249-her father should be sorry to think so ill of [him]2496-he , in the very beginning of [our]2500-they relationship . ”[249-her father] “ Ten thousand pounds ! Heaven forbid ! How is half such a sum to be repaid ? ”[81-mr. bennet] [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet made no answer ; and each of [them]2500-they , deep in thought , continued silent till [they]2500-they reached [the house]3075-the house . [[Their]2500-they father]252-their father then went to [the library]3825-the library to write , and [the girls]3082-the girls walked into [the breakfast - room]3821-the breakfast - room . “ And [they]2500-they are really to be married ! ”[88-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , as soon as [they]2500-they were by [themselves]2500-they . “ How strange this is ! and for this [we]2500-they are to be thankful . That [they]2500-they should marry , small as is [their]2500-they chance of happiness , and wretched as is [his]2496-he character , [we]2500-they are forced to rejoice ! Oh , [Lydia]90-lydia ! ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]89-jane comfort [myself]89-jane with thinking , ”[89-jane] replied [Jane]89-jane , “ that [he]2496-he certainly would not marry [Lydia]90-lydia , if [he]2496-he had not a real regard for [her]90-lydia . Though [[our]2500-they kind uncle]4786-our kind uncle has done something towards clearing [him]2496-he , [I]89-jane can not believe that ten thousand pounds , or anything like it , has been advanced . [He]2496-he has [children]4506-children of [his]2496-he own , and may have more . How could [he]2496-he spare half ten thousand pounds ? ”[89-jane] “ If [we]2500-they are ever able to learn what [Wickham]142-wickham ’s debts have been , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ and how much is settled on [his]142-wickham side on [[our]2500-they sister]1054-our sister , [we]2500-they shall exactly know what [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner has done for [them]4506-children , because [Wickham]142-wickham has not sixpence of [his]142-wickham own . The kindness of [[my]88-elizabeth uncle]721-my uncle and [aunt]1241-aunt can never be requited . [Their]4506-children taking [her]1241-aunt [home]3288-home , and affording [her]1241-aunt [their]4506-children personal protection and countenance , is such a sacrifice to [her]1241-aunt advantage as years of gratitude can not enough acknowledge . By this time [she]1241-aunt is actually with [them]4506-children ! If such goodness does not make [her]1241-aunt miserable now , [she]1241-aunt will never deserve to be happy ! What a meeting for [her]1241-aunt , when [she]1241-aunt first sees [[my]88-elizabeth aunt]3279-my aunt ! ”[88-elizabeth] “ [We]4793-we must endeavour to forget all that has passed on either side , ”[89-jane] said [Jane]89-jane : “ [I]89-jane hope and trust [they]4506-children will yet be happy . [His]721-my uncle consenting to marry [her]1241-aunt is a proof , [I]89-jane will believe , that [he]721-my uncle is come to a right way of thinking . [Their]4506-children mutual affection will steady [them]4506-children ; and [I]89-jane flatter [myself]89-jane [they]4506-children will settle so quietly , and live in so rational a manner , as may in time make [their]4506-children past imprudence forgotten . ”[89-jane] “ [Their]4506-children conduct has been such , ”[88-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ as neither [you]4794-you , nor [I]88-elizabeth , nor [anybody]3171-anybody , can ever forget . It is useless to talk of it . ”[88-elizabeth] It now occurred to [the girls]3082-the girls that [[their]3082-the girls mother]433-their mother was in all likelihood perfectly ignorant of what had happened . [They]3082-the girls went to [the library]3825-the library , therefore , and asked [[their]3082-the girls father]252-their father whether [he]252-their father would not wish [them]3082-the girls to make it known to [her]433-their mother . [He]252-their father was writing , and , without raising [his]252-their father head , coolly replied,-- “ Just as [you]88-elizabeth please . ”[252-their father] “ May [we]3082-the girls take [[my]252-their father uncle]721-my uncle ’s letter to read to [her]433-their mother ? ”[252-their father] “ Take whatever [you]252-their father like , and get away . ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth took the letter from [his]252-their father writing - table , and [they]3082-the girls went [upstairs]3537-upstairs together . [Mary]94-mary and [Kitty]93-lady catherine were both with [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet : one communication would , therefore , do for all . After a slight preparation for good news , the letter was read aloud . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet could hardly contain [herself]92-mrs. bennet . As soon as [Jane]89-jane had read [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner ’s hope of [Lydia]90-lydia ’s being soon married , [her]89-jane joy burst forth , and every following sentence added to its exuberance . [She]89-jane was now in an irritation as violent from delight as [she]89-jane had ever been fidgety from alarm and vexation . To know that [[her]89-jane daughter]461-her daughter would be married was enough . [She]89-jane was disturbed by no fear for [her]89-jane felicity , nor humbled by any remembrance of [her]89-jane misconduct . “ [[My]89-jane dear]3066-my dear , dear [Lydia]90-lydia ! ”[89-jane] [she]89-jane cried : “ this is delightful indeed ! [She]90-lydia will be married ! [I]89-jane shall see [her]90-lydia again ! [She]90-lydia will be married at sixteen ! [[My]89-jane good , kind brother]4798-my good , kind brother ! [I]89-jane knew how it would be -- [I]89-jane knew [he]4798-my good , kind brother would manage everything . How [I]89-jane long to see [her]90-lydia ! and to see [dear Wickham]142-wickham too ! But the clothes , the wedding clothes ! [I]89-jane will write to [[my]89-jane sister]3345-my sister [Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner about them directly . [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , [[my]89-jane dear]3066-my dear , run down to [[your]88-elizabeth father]3292-your father , and ask [him]4798-my good , kind brother how much [he]4798-my good , kind brother will give [her]90-lydia . Stay , stay , [I]89-jane will go [myself]89-jane . Ring the bell , [Kitty]93-lady catherine , for [Hill]133-hill . [I]89-jane will put on [my]89-jane things in a moment . [[My]89-jane dear]3066-my dear , dear [Lydia]90-lydia ! How merry [we]4803-we shall be together when [we]4803-we meet ! ”[89-jane] [[Her]2512-her eldest daughter]313-her eldest daughter endeavoured to give some relief to the violence of [these transports]2514-these transports , by leading [her]313-her eldest daughter thoughts to the obligations which [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner ’s behaviour laid [them]2515-them all under . “ For [we]4803-we must attribute this happy conclusion , ”[2512-her] [she]2512-her added , “ in a great measure to [his]157-mr. gardiner kindness . [We]4803-we are persuaded that [he]157-mr. gardiner has pledged [himself]157-mr. gardiner to assist [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham with money . ”[2512-her] “ Well , ”[246-her mother] cried [[her]313-her eldest daughter mother]246-her mother , “ it is all very right ; who should do it but [[her]313-her eldest daughter own uncle]4804-her own uncle ? If [he]157-mr. gardiner had not had [a family of [his]157-mr. gardiner own]4805-a family of his own , [I]246-her mother and [[my]246-her mother children]3267-my children must have had all [his]157-mr. gardiner money , [you]4807-you know ; and it is the first time [we]4803-we have ever had anything from [him]157-mr. gardiner except a few presents . Well ! [I]246-her mother am so happy . In a short time , [I]246-her mother shall have [a daughter]1170-a daughter married . [Mrs. Wickham]209-mrs. wickham ! How well it sounds ! And [she]1170-a daughter was only sixteen last [June]210-june . [[My]246-her mother dear]3066-my dear [Jane]89-jane , [I]246-her mother am in such a flutter , that [I]246-her mother am sure [I]246-her mother ca n’t write ; so [I]246-her mother will dictate , and [you]89-jane write for [me]246-her mother . [We]4810-we will settle with [[your]89-jane father]3292-your father about the money afterwards ; but the things should be ordered immediately . ”[246-her mother] [She]2517-she was then proceeding to all the particulars of calico , muslin , and cambric , and would shortly have dictated some very plentiful orders , had not [Jane]89-jane , though with some difficulty , persuaded [her]2517-she to wait till [[her]89-jane father]249-her father was at leisure to be consulted . One day ’s delay , [she]89-jane observed , would be of small importance ; and [[her]89-jane mother]246-her mother was too happy to be quite so obstinate as usual . Other schemes , too , came into [her]89-jane head . “ [I]89-jane will go to [Meryton]9-meryton , ”[89-jane] said [she]89-jane , “ as soon as [I]89-jane am dressed , and tell the good , good news to [[my]89-jane sister]3345-my sister [Philips]116-mr. philips . And as [I]89-jane come back , [I]89-jane can call on [Lady Lucas]87-lady lucas and [Mrs. Long]82-mrs. long . [Kitty]93-lady catherine , run down and order [the carriage]3286-the carriage . An airing would do [me]89-jane a great deal of good , [I]89-jane am sure . [Girls]3124-girls , can [I]89-jane do anything for [you]3124-girls in [Meryton]9-meryton ? Oh ! here comes [Hill]133-hill . [[My]89-jane dear]3066-my dear [Hill]133-hill , have [you]133-hill heard the good news ? [Miss Lydia]90-lydia is going to be married ; and [you]133-hill shall all have a bowl of punch to make merry at [her]90-lydia wedding . ”[89-jane] [Mrs. Hill]133-hill began instantly to express [her]133-hill joy . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth received [her]88-elizabeth congratulations amongst [the rest]2200-the rest , and then , sick of this folly , took refuge in [[her]88-elizabeth own room]1548-her own room , that [she]88-elizabeth might think with freedom . [Poor Lydia]211-lydia ’s situation must , at best , be bad enough ; but that it was no worse , [she]88-elizabeth had need to be thankful . [She]88-elizabeth felt it so ; and though , in looking forward , neither rational happiness , nor worldly prosperity could be justly expected for [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , in looking back to what [they]2523-they had feared , only two hours ago , [she]88-elizabeth felt all the advantages of what [they]2523-they had gained . [ Illustration : “ [The spiteful old ladies]4816-the spiteful old ladies ”[88-elizabeth] CHAPTER L. [ Illustration ] [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet had very often wished , before this period of [his]81-mr. bennet life , that , instead of spending [his]81-mr. bennet whole income , [he]81-mr. bennet had laid by an annual sum , for the better provision of [[his]81-mr. bennet children]2524-his children , and of [[his]81-mr. bennet wife]236-his wife , if [she]236-his wife survived [him]81-mr. bennet . [He]81-mr. bennet now wished it more than ever . Had [he]81-mr. bennet done [his]81-mr. bennet duty in that respect , [Lydia]211-lydia need not have been indebted to [[her]211-lydia uncle]579-her uncle for whatever of honour or credit could now be purchased for [her]211-lydia . The satisfaction of prevailing on [one of [the most worthless young men in [Great Britain]63-great britain]2528-the most worthless young men in great britain to be [[her]211-lydia husband]260-her husband]2527-one of the most worthless young men in great britain to be her husband might then have rested in its proper place . [He]81-mr. bennet was seriously concerned that a cause of so little advantage to [anyone]3174-anyone should be forwarded at the sole expense of [[his]81-mr. bennet brother - in - law]286-his brother - in - law ; and [he]81-mr. bennet was determined , if possible , to find out the extent of [his]81-mr. bennet assistance , and to discharge the obligation as soon as [he]81-mr. bennet could . When first [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet had married , economy was held to be perfectly useless ; for , of course , [they]2532-their were to have [a son]2533-a son . [This son]2534-this son was to join in cutting off the entail , as soon as [he]2534-this son should be of age , and [the widow]2535-the widow and [younger children]2536-younger children would by that means be provided for . [Five daughters]664-five daughters successively entered [the world]304-the world , but yet [the son]1707-the son was to come ; and [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , for many years after [Lydia]211-lydia ’s birth , had been certain that [he]81-mr. bennet would . This event had at last been despaired of , but it was then too late to be saving . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet had no turn for economy ; and [[her]92-mrs. bennet husband]260-her husband ’s love of independence had alone prevented [their]2532-their exceeding [their]2532-their income . Five thousand pounds was settled by marriage articles on [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet and [the children]1941-the children . But in what proportions it should be divided amongst [the latter]491-the latter depended on the will of [the parents]2543-the parents . This was one point , with regard to [Lydia]211-lydia at least , which was now to be settled , and [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet could have no hesitation in acceding to the proposal before [him]81-mr. bennet . In terms of grateful acknowledgment for the kindness of [[his]81-mr. bennet brother]4704-his brother , though expressed most concisely , [he]81-mr. bennet then delivered on paper [his]81-mr. bennet perfect approbation of all that was done , and [his]81-mr. bennet willingness to fulfil the engagements that had been made for [him]81-mr. bennet . [He]81-mr. bennet had never before supposed that , could [Wickham]142-wickham be prevailed on to marry [[his]142-wickham daughter]3923-his daughter , it would be done with so little inconvenience to [himself]142-wickham as by the present arrangement . [He]142-wickham would scarcely be ten pounds a year [the loser]2546-the loser , by the hundred that was to be paid [them]2547-them ; for , what with [her]211-lydia board and pocket allowance , and the continual presents in money which passed to [her]211-lydia through [[her]211-lydia mother]246-her mother ’s hands , [Lydia]211-lydia ’s expenses had been very little within that sum . That it would be done with such trifling exertion on [his]81-mr. bennet side , too , was another very welcome surprise ; for [his]81-mr. bennet chief wish at present was to have as little trouble in the business as possible . When the first transports of rage which had produced [his]81-mr. bennet activity in seeking [her]211-lydia were over , [he]81-mr. bennet naturally returned to all [his]81-mr. bennet former indolence . [His]81-mr. bennet letter was soon despatched ; for though dilatory in undertaking business , [he]81-mr. bennet was quick in its execution . [He]81-mr. bennet begged to know further particulars of what [he]81-mr. bennet was indebted to [[his]81-mr. bennet brother]4704-his brother ; but was too angry with [Lydia]211-lydia to send any message to [her]211-lydia . The good news quickly spread through [the house]3075-the house ; and with proportionate speed through [the neighbourhood]3088-the neighbourhood . It was borne in the latter with decent philosophy . To be sure , it would have been more for the advantage of conversation , had [Miss Lydia Bennet]90-lydia come upon [the town]3847-the town ; or , as the happiest alternative , been secluded from [the world]304-the world in [some distant farm - house]2554-some distant farm - house . But there was much to be talked of , in marrying [her]211-lydia ; and the good - natured wishes for [her]211-lydia well - doing , which had proceeded before from [all the spiteful old ladies in [Meryton]9-meryton]2555-all the spiteful old ladies in meryton , lost but little of [their]2555-all the spiteful old ladies in meryton spirit in this change of circumstances , because with [such a husband]2556-such a husband [her]211-lydia misery was considered certain . It was a fortnight since [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet had been down [stairs]523-stairs , but on this happy day [she]92-mrs. bennet again took [her]92-mrs. bennet seat at the head of [her]92-mrs. bennet table , and in spirits oppressively high . No sentiment of shame gave a damp to [her]92-mrs. bennet triumph . The marriage of [a daughter]1170-a daughter , which had been the first object of [her]92-mrs. bennet wishes since [Jane]89-jane was sixteen , was now on the point of accomplishment , and [her]92-mrs. bennet thoughts and [her]92-mrs. bennet words ran wholly on [those attendants of elegant nuptials]2559-those attendants of elegant nuptials , fine muslins , new carriages , and [servants]1352-servants . [She]92-mrs. bennet was busily searching through [the neighbourhood]3088-the neighbourhood for a proper situation for [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughter]461-her daughter ; and , without knowing or considering what [their]2563-their income might be , rejected many as deficient in size and importance . “ [Haye Park]64-haye park might do , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [she]92-mrs. bennet , “ if [the Gouldings]212-the gouldings would quit [it]64-haye park , or [the great house at [Stoke]65-stoke]4817-the great house at stoke , if [the drawing - room]524-the drawing - room were larger ; but [Ashworth]66-ashworth is too far off . [I]92-mrs. bennet could not bear to have [her]461-her daughter ten miles from [me]92-mrs. bennet ; and as for [Purvis Lodge]213-purvis lodge , [the attics]4819-the attics are dreadful . ”[92-mrs. bennet] [[Her]92-mrs. bennet husband]260-her husband allowed [her]92-mrs. bennet to talk on without interruption while [the servants]3526-the servants remained . But when [they]3526-the servants had withdrawn , [he]260-her husband said to [her]92-mrs. bennet , “ [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , before [you]92-mrs. bennet take any , or all of [these houses]4820-these houses , for [[your]92-mrs. bennet son]4821-your son and [daughter]4118-daughter , let [us]4823-us come to a right understanding . Into [one house in [this neighbourhood]3380-this neighbourhood]4824-one house in this neighbourhood [they]4820-these houses shall never have admittance . [I]260-her husband will not encourage the imprudence of either , by receiving [them]4820-these houses at [Longbourn]7-longbourn . ”[260-her husband] A long dispute followed this declaration ; but [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet was firm : it soon led to another ; and [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet found , with amazement and horror , that [[her]92-mrs. bennet husband]260-her husband would not advance a guinea to buy clothes for [[his]260-her husband daughter]3923-his daughter . [He]260-her husband protested that [she]92-mrs. bennet should receive from [him]260-her husband no mark of affection whatever on the occasion . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet could hardly comprehend it . That [his]260-her husband anger could be carried to such a point of inconceivable resentment as to refuse [[his]260-her husband daughter]3923-his daughter a privilege , without which [her]92-mrs. bennet marriage would scarcely seem valid , exceeded all that [she]92-mrs. bennet could believe possible . [She]92-mrs. bennet was more alive to the disgrace , which [her]92-mrs. bennet want of new clothes must reflect on [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughter]461-her daughter ’s nuptials , than to any sense of shame at [her]92-mrs. bennet eloping and living with [Wickham]142-wickham a fortnight before [they]2570-they took place . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was now most heartily sorry that [she]88-elizabeth had , from the distress of the moment , been led to make [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy acquainted with [their]2571-their fears for [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ; for since [her]88-elizabeth marriage would so shortly give the proper termination to the elopement , [they]2571-their might hope to conceal its unfavourable beginning from [all those who were not immediately on the spot]2573-all those who were not immediately on the spot . [She]88-elizabeth had no fear of its spreading farther , through [his]96-mr. darcy means . There were [few people on whose secrecy]2574-few people on whose secrecy [she]88-elizabeth would have more confidently depended ; but at the same time there was [no one whose knowledge of]2575-no one whose knowledge of [a sister]436-a sister ’s frailty would have mortified [her]88-elizabeth so much . Not , however , from any fear of disadvantage from it individually to [herself]88-elizabeth ; for at any rate there seemed a gulf impassable between [them]2577-them . Had [Lydia]90-lydia ’s marriage been concluded on the most honourable terms , it was not to be supposed that [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy would connect [himself]96-mr. darcy with [a family]2578-a family , where to every other objection would now be added an alliance and relationship of the nearest kind with [the man whom [he]96-mr. darcy so justly scorned]2579-the man whom he so justly scorned . From such a connection [she]88-elizabeth could not wonder that [he]96-mr. darcy should shrink . The wish of procuring [her]88-elizabeth regard , which [she]88-elizabeth had assured [herself]88-elizabeth of [his]96-mr. darcy feeling in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire , could not in rational expectation survive such a blow as this . [She]88-elizabeth was humbled , [she]88-elizabeth was grieved ; [she]88-elizabeth repented , though [she]88-elizabeth hardly knew of what . [She]88-elizabeth became jealous of [his]96-mr. darcy esteem , when [she]88-elizabeth could no longer hope to be benefited by it . [She]88-elizabeth wanted to hear of [him]96-mr. darcy , when there seemed the least chance of gaining intelligence . [She]88-elizabeth was convinced that [she]88-elizabeth could have been happy with [him]96-mr. darcy , when it was no longer likely [they]2580-they should meet . What a triumph for [him]96-mr. darcy , as [she]88-elizabeth often thought , could [he]96-mr. darcy know that the proposals which [she]88-elizabeth had proudly spurned only four months ago would now have been gladly and gratefully received ! [He]96-mr. darcy was as generous , [she]88-elizabeth doubted not , as the most generous of [his]96-mr. darcy sex . But while [he]96-mr. darcy was mortal , there must be a triumph . [She]88-elizabeth began now to comprehend that [he]96-mr. darcy was exactly [the man who , in disposition and talents , would most suit [her]88-elizabeth]2581-the man who , in disposition and talents , would most suit her . [His]96-mr. darcy understanding and temper , though unlike [her]88-elizabeth own , would have answered all [her]88-elizabeth wishes . It was an union that must have been to the advantage of both : by [her]88-elizabeth ease and liveliness , [his]96-mr. darcy mind might have been softened , [his]96-mr. darcy manners improved ; and from [his]96-mr. darcy judgment , information , and knowledge of [the world]304-the world , [she]88-elizabeth must have received benefit of greater importance . But no such happy marriage could now teach [the admiring multitude]2583-the admiring multitude what connubial felicity really was . An union of a different tendency , and precluding the possibility of the other , was soon to be formed in [[their]2584-their family]2585-their family . How [Wickham]142-wickham and [Lydia]90-lydia were to be supported in tolerable independence [she]88-elizabeth could not imagine . But how little of permanent happiness could belong to [a couple who were only brought together because [their]2586-a couple who were only brought together because their passions were stronger than their virtue , she could easily conjecture passions were stronger than [their]2586-a couple who were only brought together because their passions were stronger than their virtue , she could easily conjecture virtue , [she]88-elizabeth could easily conjecture]2586-a couple who were only brought together because their passions were stronger than their virtue , she could easily conjecture . [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner soon wrote again to [[his]157-mr. gardiner brother]4704-his brother . To [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet ’s acknowledgments [he]157-mr. gardiner briefly replied , with assurances of [his]157-mr. gardiner eagerness to promote the welfare of [any of [[his]157-mr. gardiner family]373-his family]2588-any of his family ; and concluded with entreaties that the subject might never be mentioned to [him]157-mr. gardiner again . The principal purport of [his]157-mr. gardiner letter was to inform [them]2584-their , that [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham had resolved on quitting [the militia]4730-the militia . “ It was greatly [my]157-mr. gardiner wish that [he]142-wickham should do so , ”[157-mr. gardiner] [he]157-mr. gardiner added , “ as soon as [his]142-wickham marriage was fixed on . And [I]157-mr. gardiner think [you]4826-you will agree with [me]157-mr. gardiner , in considering a removal from [that corps]4827-that corps as highly advisable , both on [his]142-wickham account and [[my]157-mr. gardiner niece]4319-my niece ’s . It is [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham ’s intention to go into [the Regulars]67-the regulars ; and , among [[his]142-wickham former friends]4829-his former friends , there are still some who are able and willing to assist [him]142-wickham in [the army]4478-the army . [He]142-wickham has the promise of [an ensigncy in [[General----]214-general---- ’s regiment]4832-general---- ’s regiment , now quartered in [the north]4833-the north]4831-an ensigncy in general---- ’s regiment , now quartered in the north . It is an advantage to have it so far from [this part of [the kingdom]919-the kingdom]4834-this part of the kingdom . [He]142-wickham promises fairly ; and [I]157-mr. gardiner hope among [different people]4836-different people , where [they]4836-different people may each have a character to preserve , [they]4836-different people will both be more prudent . [I]157-mr. gardiner have written to [Colonel Forster]113-colonel forster , to inform [him]113-colonel forster of [our]4837-our present arrangements , and to request that [he]113-colonel forster will satisfy [the various creditors of [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham in and near [Brighton]36-brighton]4838-the various creditors of mr. wickham in and near brighton with assurances of speedy payment , for which [I]157-mr. gardiner have pledged [myself]157-mr. gardiner . And will [you]4839-you give [yourself]4839-you the trouble of carrying similar assurances to [[his]113-colonel forster creditors]4840-his creditors in [Meryton]9-meryton , of whom [I]157-mr. gardiner shall subjoin a list , according to [his]113-colonel forster information ? [He]113-colonel forster has given in all [his]113-colonel forster debts ; [I]157-mr. gardiner hope at least [he]113-colonel forster has not deceived [us]4837-our . [Haggerston]208-haggerston has [our]4837-our directions , and all will be completed in a week . [They]4840-his creditors will then join [[his]113-colonel forster regiment]4841-his regiment , unless [they]4840-his creditors are first invited to [Longbourn]7-longbourn ; and [I]157-mr. gardiner understand from [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner that [[my]157-mr. gardiner niece]4319-my niece is very desirous of seeing [you]4843-you all before [she]4319-my niece leaves [the south]4844-the south . [She]4319-my niece is well , and begs to be dutifully remembered to [you]4843-you and [[her]4319-my niece mother]246-her mother -Yours , etc . “[157-mr. gardiner] [E. GARDINER]215-e. gardiner . ” [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet and [[his]81-mr. bennet daughters]430-his daughters saw all the advantages of [Wickham]142-wickham ’s removal from [the ----shire]20-the ----shire , as clearly as [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner could do . But [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet was not so well pleased with it . [Lydia]90-lydia ’s being settled in [the north]4833-the north , just when [she]2591-she had expected most pleasure and pride in [her]2591-she company , for [she]2591-she had by no means given up [her]2591-she plan of [their]4848-their residing in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , was a severe disappointment ; and , besides , it was such a pity that [Lydia]90-lydia should be taken from [a regiment where [she]2591-she was acquainted with [everybody]305-everybody , and had so many favourites]4849-a regiment where she was acquainted with everybody , and had so many favourites . “[157-mr. gardiner] [She]2591-she is so fond of [Mrs. Forster]182-mrs. forster , ” said [she]2591-she , “[2591-she] it will be quite shocking to send [her]2591-she away ! And there are several of [the young men]2592-the young men , too , that [she]2591-she likes very much . [The officers]452-the officers may not be so pleasant in [General---- ’s regiment]4832-general---- ’s regiment . ” [[His]4851-his daughter]3923-his daughter ’s request , for such it might be considered , of being admitted into [[her]3923-his daughter family]3710-her family again , before [she]3923-his daughter set off for [the north]4833-the north , received at first an absolute negative . But [Jane]89-jane and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , who agreed in wishing , for the sake of [[their]4855-they sister]3763-their sister ’s feelings and consequence , that [she]3923-his daughter should be noticed on [her]3923-his daughter marriage by [[her]3923-his daughter parents]1811-her parents , urged [him]4851-his so earnestly , yet so rationally and so mildly , to receive [her]3923-his daughter and [[her]3923-his daughter husband]260-her husband at [Longbourn]7-longbourn , as soon as [they]4855-they were married , that [he]4851-his was prevailed on to think as [they]4855-they thought , and act as [they]4855-they wished . And [[their]4855-they mother]433-their mother had the satisfaction of knowing , that [she]433-their mother should be able to show [[her]433-their mother married daughter]4860-her married daughter in [the neighbourhood]3088-the neighbourhood , before [she]433-their mother was banished to [the north]4833-the north . When [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet wrote again to [[his]81-mr. bennet brother]4704-his brother , therefore , [he]81-mr. bennet sent [his]81-mr. bennet permission for [them]4855-they to come ; and it was settled , that , as soon as the ceremony was over , [they]4855-they should proceed to [Longbourn]7-longbourn . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was surprised , however , that [Wickham]142-wickham should consent to such a scheme ; and , had [she]88-elizabeth consulted only [her]88-elizabeth own inclination , any meeting with [him]142-wickham would have been the last object of [her]88-elizabeth wishes . [ Illustration : “[452-the officers] With an affectionate smile ” CHAPTER LI . [ Illustration ] [[Their]4855-they sister]3763-their sister ’s wedding - day arrived ; and [Jane]89-jane and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth felt for [her]3763-their sister probably more than [she]3763-their sister felt for [herself]3763-their sister . [The carriage]3286-the carriage was sent to meet [them]4855-they at---- , and [they]4855-they were to return in [it]3286-the carriage by dinnertime . [Their]4855-they arrival was dreaded by [the elder Miss Bennets]105-the bennets -- and [Jane]89-jane more especially , who gave [Lydia]90-lydia the feelings which would have attended [herself]90-lydia , had [she]90-lydia been [the culprit]4866-the culprit , and was wretched in the thought of what [[her]90-lydia sister]328-her sister must endure . [They]4855-they came . [The family]414-the family were assembled in [the breakfast - room]3821-the breakfast - room to receive [them]4855-they . Smiles decked the face of [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , as [the carriage]3286-the carriage drove up to the door ; [[her]92-mrs. bennet husband]260-her husband looked impenetrably grave ; [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughters]242-her daughters , alarmed , anxious , uneasy . [Lydia]90-lydia ’s voice was heard in [the vestibule]3820-the vestibule ; the door was thrown open , and [she]90-lydia ran into [the room]255-the room . [[Her]90-lydia mother]246-her mother stepped forwards , embraced [her]90-lydia , and welcomed [her]90-lydia with rapture ; gave [her]90-lydia hand with an affectionate smile to [Wickham]142-wickham , who followed [[his]142-wickham lady]235-his lady ; and wished [them]4855-they both joy , with an alacrity which showed no doubt of [their]4855-they happiness . [Their]4855-they reception from [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet , to whom [they]4855-they then turned , was not quite so cordial . [His]81-mr. bennet countenance rather gained in austerity ; and [he]81-mr. bennet scarcely opened [his]81-mr. bennet lips . The easy assurance of [the young couple]4877-the young couple , indeed , was enough to provoke [him]81-mr. bennet . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was disgusted , and even [Miss Bennet]90-lydia was shocked . [Lydia]90-lydia was [Lydia]90-lydia still ; untamed , unabashed , wild , noisy , and fearless . [She]90-lydia turned from [sister]1153-sister to [sister]1153-sister , demanding [their]4855-they congratulations ; and when at length [they]4855-they all sat down , looked eagerly round [the room]255-the room , took notice of some little alteration in it , and observed , with a laugh , that it was a great while since [she]90-lydia had been [there]306-there . [Wickham]142-wickham was not at all more distressed than [herself]88-elizabeth ; but [his]142-wickham manners were always so pleasing , that , had [his]142-wickham character and [his]142-wickham marriage been exactly what [they]4855-they ought , [his]142-wickham smiles and [his]142-wickham easy address , while [he]142-wickham claimed [their]4855-they relationship , would have delighted [them]4855-they all . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had not before believed [him]142-wickham quite equal to such assurance ; but [she]88-elizabeth sat down , resolving within [herself]88-elizabeth to draw no limits in future to the impudence of [an impudent man]4882-an impudent man . [She]88-elizabeth blushed , and [Jane]89-jane blushed ; but the cheeks of [the two who caused [their]4855-they confusion]4883-the two who caused their confusion suffered no variation of colour . There was no want of discourse . [The bride]4042-the bride and [[her]4042-the bride mother]246-her mother could neither of [them]4855-they talk fast enough ; and [Wickham]142-wickham , who happened to sit near [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , began inquiring after [his]142-wickham acquaintance in [that neighbourhood]3327-that neighbourhood , with a good - humoured ease , which [she]88-elizabeth felt very unable to equal in [her]88-elizabeth replies . [They]4855-they seemed each of [them]4855-they to have the happiest memories in [the world]304-the world . Nothing of the past was recollected with pain ; and [Lydia]90-lydia led voluntarily to subjects which [[her]90-lydia sisters]3096-her sisters would not have alluded to for [the world]304-the world . “[452-the officers] Only think of its being three months , ” [she]90-lydia cried , “[452-the officers] since [I]0-i went away : it seems but a fortnight , [I]0-i declare ; and yet there have been things enough happened in the time . Good gracious ! when [I]0-i went away , [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i had no more idea of being married till [I]0-i came back again ! though [I]0-i thought it would be very good fun if [I]0-i was . ” [[Her]90-lydia father]249-her father lifted up [his]249-her father eyes , [Jane]89-jane was distressed , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth looked expressively at [Lydia]90-lydia ; but [she]88-elizabeth , who never heard nor saw anything of which [she]88-elizabeth chose to be insensible , gaily continued,-- “[3106-mamma] Oh , [mamma]3106-mamma , do [the people hereabouts]2596-the people hereabouts know [I]0-i am married to - day ? [I]0-i was afraid [they]2596-the people hereabouts might not ; and [we]2597-we overtook [William Goulding]216-william goulding in [his]216-william goulding curricle , so [I]0-i was determined [he]216-william goulding should know it , and so [I]0-i let down the side glass next to [him]216-william goulding , and took off [my]0-i glove and let [my]0-i hand just rest upon the window frame , so that [he]216-william goulding might see the ring , and then [I]0-i bowed and smiled like anything . ” [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth could bear it no longer . [She]88-elizabeth got up and ran out of [the room]255-the room ; and returned no more , till [she]88-elizabeth heard [them]2596-the people hereabouts passing through [the hall]3519-the hall to [the dining - parlour]522-the dining - parlour . [She]88-elizabeth then joined [them]2596-the people hereabouts soon enough to see [Lydia]90-lydia , with anxious parade , walk up to [[her]90-lydia mother]246-her mother ’s right hand , and hear [her]90-lydia say to [[her]90-lydia eldest]4895-her eldest sister,-- “[0-i] Ah , [Jane]89-jane , [I]0-i take [your]89-jane place now , and [you]89-jane must go lower , because [I]0-i am [a married woman]2598-a married woman . ” It was not to be supposed that time would give [Lydia]90-lydia that embarrassment from which [she]90-lydia had been so wholly free at first . [Her]90-lydia ease and good spirits increased . [She]90-lydia longed to see [Mrs. Philips]117-mrs. philips , [the Lucases]418-the lucases , and all [[their]418-the lucases other neighbours]4897-their other neighbours , and to hear [herself]90-lydia called “[2598-a married woman] [Mrs. Wickham]209-mrs. wickham ” by [each of [them]418-the lucases]4898-each of them ; and in the meantime [she]90-lydia went after dinner to show [her]90-lydia ring and boast of being married to [Mrs. Hill]133-hill and [the two housemaids]4899-the two housemaids . “[209-mrs. wickham] Well , [mamma]3106-mamma , ” said [she]90-lydia , when [they]418-the lucases were all returned to [the breakfast - room]3821-the breakfast - room , “[3106-mamma] and what do [you]3106-mamma think of [[my]0-i husband]2600-my husband ? Is not [he]2600-my husband [a charming man]2601-a charming man ? [I]0-i am sure [[my]0-i sisters]2602-my sisters must all envy [me]0-i . [I]0-i only hope [they]2602-my sisters may have half [my]0-i good luck . [They]2602-my sisters must all go to [Brighton]36-brighton . That is the place to get [husbands]4369-husbands . What a pity it is , [mamma]3106-mamma , [we]2602-my sisters did not all go ! ” “[3106-mamma] Very true ; and if [I]0-i had [my]0-i will [we]2602-my sisters should . But , [[my]0-i dear]3066-my dear [Lydia]90-lydia , [I]0-i do n’t at all like [your]90-lydia going such a way off . Must it be so ? ” “[2606-lord] Oh , [Lord]2606-lord ! yes ; there is nothing in that . [I]0-i shall like it of all things . [You]3106-mamma and [papa]2462-papa , and [[my]0-i sisters]2602-my sisters , must come down and see [us]2602-my sisters . [We]2602-my sisters shall be at [Newcastle]68-newcastle all the winter , and [I]0-i dare say there will be some balls , and [I]0-i will take care to get [good partners]2609-good partners for [them]2602-my sisters all . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i should like it beyond anything ! ” said [[her]90-lydia mother]246-her mother . “[0-i] And then when [you]90-lydia go away , [you]90-lydia may leave [one or two of [[my]0-i sisters]2602-my sisters]2610-one or two of my sisters behind [you]90-lydia ; and [I]0-i dare say [I]0-i shall get [husbands]4369-husbands for [them]2602-my sisters before the winter is over . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i thank [you]90-lydia for [my]0-i share of the favour , ” said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; “[0-i] but [I]0-i do not particularly like [your]90-lydia way of getting [husbands]4369-husbands . ” [[Their]2602-my sisters visitors]2208-their visitors were not to remain above ten days with [them]2602-my sisters . [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham had received [his]142-wickham commission before [he]142-wickham left [London]5-london , and [he]142-wickham was to join [[his]142-wickham regiment]4841-his regiment at the end of a fortnight . [No one]3336-no one but [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet regretted that [their]2602-my sisters stay would be so short ; and [she]92-mrs. bennet made the most of the time by visiting about with [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughter]461-her daughter , and having very frequent parties at [home]3288-home . These parties were acceptable to [all]3588-all ; to avoid [a family circle]4908-a family circle was even more desirable to such as did think than such as did not . [Wickham]142-wickham ’s affection for [Lydia]90-lydia was just what [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had expected to find it ; not equal to [Lydia]90-lydia ’s for [him]142-wickham .
