[She]88-elizabeth had scarcely needed [her]88-elizabeth present observation to be satisfied , from the reason of things , that [their]2602-my sisters elopement had been brought on by the strength of [her]88-elizabeth love rather than by [his]142-wickham ; and [she]88-elizabeth would have wondered why , without violently caring for [her]90-lydia , [he]142-wickham chose to elope with [her]90-lydia at all , had [she]88-elizabeth not felt certain that [his]142-wickham flight was rendered necessary by distress of circumstances ; and if that were the case , [he]142-wickham was not [the young man]3597-the young man to resist an opportunity of having [a companion]4910-a companion . [Lydia]90-lydia was exceedingly fond of [him]142-wickham . [He]142-wickham was [[her]90-lydia dear]4911-her dear [Wickham]142-wickham on every occasion ; [no one]3336-no one was to be put in competition with [him]142-wickham . [He]142-wickham did everything best in [the world]304-the world ; and [she]90-lydia was sure [he]142-wickham would kill more birds on the first of September than [anybody else in [the country]448-the country]4914-anybody else in the country . One morning , soon after [their]4916-their arrival , as [she]90-lydia was sitting with [[her]90-lydia two elder sisters]4917-her two elder sisters , [she]90-lydia said to [Elizabeth,--]168-elizabeth,-- “[88-elizabeth] [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , [I]0-i never gave [you]88-elizabeth an account of [my]0-i wedding , [I]0-i believe . [You]88-elizabeth were not by , when [I]0-i told [mamma]3106-mamma , and [the others]511-the others , all about it . Are not [you]88-elizabeth curious to hear how it was managed ? ” “[88-elizabeth] No , really , ” replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; “[88-elizabeth] [I]0-i think there can not be too little said on the subject . ” “[0-i] La ! [You]88-elizabeth are so strange ! But [I]0-i must tell [you]88-elizabeth how it went off . [We]2616-we were married , [you]88-elizabeth know , at [St. Clement ’s]69-st. clement ’s , because [[Wickham]142-wickham ’s lodgings]2617-wickham ’s lodgings were in [that parish]2618-that parish . And it was settled that [we]2616-we should all be [there]306-there by eleven o’clock . [[My]0-i uncle]721-my uncle and [aunt]1241-aunt and [I]0-i were to go together ; and [the others]511-the others were to meet [us]2616-we at [the church]761-the church . “ Well , Monday morning came , and [I]511-the others was in such a fuss ! [I]511-the others was so afraid , [you]88-elizabeth know , that something would happen to put it off , and then [I]511-the others should have gone quite distracted . And there was [[my]511-the others aunt]3279-my aunt , all the time [I]511-the others was dressing , preaching and talking away just as if [she]3279-my aunt was reading a sermon . However , [I]511-the others did not hear above one word in ten , for [I]511-the others was thinking , [you]2624-you may suppose , of [[my]511-the others dear]3066-my dear [Wickham]142-wickham . [I]511-the others longed to know whether [he]142-wickham would be married in [his]142-wickham blue coat . “[511-the others] Well , and so [we]2616-we breakfasted at ten as usual : [I]0-i thought it would never be over ; for , by the bye , [you]2624-you are to understand that [[my]0-i uncle]721-my uncle and [aunt]1241-aunt were horrid unpleasant all the time [I]0-i was with [them]2627-them . If [you]2624-you ’ll believe [me]0-i , [I]0-i did not once put [my]0-i foot out of doors , though [I]0-i was there a fortnight . [Not one party]2628-not one party , or scheme , or anything ! To be sure , [London]5-london was rather thin , but , however , [the Little Theatre]2629-the little theatre was open . “ Well , and so , just as [the carriage]3286-the carriage came to the door , [[my]2628-not one party uncle]721-my uncle was called away upon business to [that horrid man [Mr. Stone]217-mr. stone]4922-that horrid man mr. stone . And then , [you]2624-you know , when once [they]2627-them get together , there is no end of it . Well , [I]2628-not one party was so frightened [I]2628-not one party did not know what to do , for [[my]2628-not one party uncle]721-my uncle was to give [me]2628-not one party away ; and if [we]4924-we were beyond the hour [we]4924-we could not be married all day . But , luckily , [he]721-my uncle came back again in ten minutes ’ time , and then [we]4924-we all set out . However , [I]2628-not one party recollected afterwards , that if [he]721-my uncle had been prevented going , the wedding need not be put off , for [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy might have done as well . ”[2628-not one party] “ [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ! ”[88-elizabeth] repeated [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , in utter amazement . “ Oh , yes ! [he]721-my uncle was to come [there]306-there with [Wickham]142-wickham , [you]96-mr. darcy know . But , gracious [me]88-elizabeth ! [I]88-elizabeth quite forgot ! [I]88-elizabeth ought not to have said a word about it . [I]88-elizabeth promised [them]4926-them so faithfully ! What will [Wickham]142-wickham say ? It was to be such a secret ! ”[88-elizabeth] “ If it was to be a secret , ”[89-jane] said [Jane]89-jane , “ say not another word on the subject . [You]96-mr. darcy may depend upon [my]89-jane seeking no further . ”[89-jane] “ Oh , certainly , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , though burning with curiosity ; “ [we]4927-we will ask [you]96-mr. darcy no questions . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Thank [you]88-elizabeth , ”[90-lydia] said [Lydia]90-lydia ; “ for if [you]88-elizabeth did , [I]90-lydia should certainly tell [you]88-elizabeth all , and then [Wickham]142-wickham would be so angry . ”[90-lydia] On such encouragement to ask , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was forced to put it out of [her]88-elizabeth power , by running away . But to live in ignorance on such a point was impossible ; or at least it was impossible not to try for information . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy had been at [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ’s wedding . It was exactly a scene , and exactly among [people]3299-people , where [he]96-mr. darcy had apparently least to do , and least temptation to go . Conjectures as to the meaning of it , rapid and wild , hurried into [her]88-elizabeth brain ; but [she]88-elizabeth was satisfied with none . Those that best pleased [her]88-elizabeth , as placing [his]96-mr. darcy conduct in the noblest light , seemed most improbable . [She]88-elizabeth could not bear such suspense ; and hastily seizing a sheet of paper , wrote a short letter to [[her]88-elizabeth aunt]4017-her aunt , to request an explanation of what [Lydia]90-lydia had dropped , if it were compatible with the secrecy which had been intended . “ [You]88-elizabeth may readily comprehend , ”[88-elizabeth] [she]88-elizabeth added , “ what [my]88-elizabeth curiosity must be to know how [a person unconnected with any of [us]4929-us]4928-a person unconnected with any of us , and , comparatively speaking , [a stranger to [[our]4929-us family]4931-our family]4930-a stranger to our family , should have been amongst [you]88-elizabeth at such a time . Pray write instantly , and let [me]88-elizabeth understand it -- unless it is , for very cogent reasons , to remain in the secrecy which [Lydia]90-lydia seems to think necessary ; and then [I]88-elizabeth must endeavour to be satisfied with ignorance . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Not that [I]88-elizabeth shall , though , ”[88-elizabeth] [she]88-elizabeth added to [herself]88-elizabeth , and [she]88-elizabeth finished the letter ; “ and , [[my]88-elizabeth dear aunt]1197-my dear aunt , if [you]1197-my dear aunt do not tell [me]88-elizabeth in an honourable manner , [I]88-elizabeth shall certainly be reduced to tricks and stratagems to find it out . ”[88-elizabeth] [Jane]89-jane ’s delicate sense of honour would not allow [her]89-jane to speak to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth privately of what [Lydia]90-lydia had let fall ; [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was glad of it -till it appeared whether [her]88-elizabeth inquiries would receive any satisfaction , [she]88-elizabeth had rather be without [a confidante]2633-a confidante . [ Illustration : “ [I]218-chapter lii am sure [she]90-lydia did not listen . ”[218-chapter lii] ] [CHAPTER LII]218-chapter lii . [ Illustration ] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had the satisfaction of receiving an answer to [her]88-elizabeth letter as soon as [she]88-elizabeth possibly could . [She]88-elizabeth was no sooner in possession of it , than hurrying into [the little copse]2480-the little copse , where [she]88-elizabeth was least likely to be interrupted , [she]88-elizabeth sat down on one of the benches , and prepared to be happy ; for the length of the letter convinced [her]88-elizabeth that it did not contain a denial . / * RIGHT “ [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street , Sept. 6 . * / “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear Niece]2635-my dear niece , “ [I]2636-i have just received [your]2635-my dear niece letter , and shall devote this whole morning to answering it , as [I]2636-i foresee that a little writing will not comprise what [I]2636-i have to tell [you]2635-my dear niece . [I]2636-i must confess [myself]2636-i surprised by [your]2635-my dear niece application ; [I]2636-i did not expect it from [you]2635-my dear niece . Do n’t think [me]2636-i angry , however , for [I]2636-i only mean to let [you]2635-my dear niece know , that [I]2636-i had not imagined such inquiries to be necessary on [your]2635-my dear niece side . If [you]2635-my dear niece do not choose to understand [me]2636-i , forgive [my]2636-i impertinence . [[Your]2635-my dear niece uncle]3438-your uncle is as much surprised as [I]2636-i am ; and nothing but the belief of [your]2635-my dear niece being [a party concerned]4934-a party concerned would have allowed [him]3438-your uncle to act as [he]3438-your uncle has done . But if [you]2635-my dear niece are really innocent and ignorant , [I]2636-i must be more explicit . On the very day of [my]2636-i coming [home]3288-home from [Longbourn]7-longbourn , [[your]2635-my dear niece uncle]3438-your uncle had [a most unexpected visitor]4937-a most unexpected visitor . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy called , and was shut up with [him]3438-your uncle several hours . It was all over before [I]2636-i arrived ; so [my]2636-i curiosity was not so dreadfully racked as [yours]2635-my dear niece seems to have been . [He]3438-your uncle came to tell [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner that [he]3438-your uncle had found out where [[your]2635-my dear niece sister]3211-your sister and [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham were , and that [he]3438-your uncle had seen and talked with [them]4939-them both -- [Wickham]142-wickham repeatedly , [Lydia]90-lydia once . From what [I]2636-i can collect , [he]3438-your uncle left [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire only one day after [ourselves]4940-ourselves , and came to [town]268-town with the resolution of hunting for [them]4939-them . The motive professed was [his]3438-your uncle conviction of its being owing to [himself]3438-your uncle that [Wickham]142-wickham ’s worthlessness had not been so well known as to make it impossible for [any young woman of character]4942-any young woman of character to love or confide in [him]3438-your uncle . [He]3438-your uncle generously imputed the whole to [his]3438-your uncle mistaken pride , and confessed that [he]3438-your uncle had before thought it beneath [him]3438-your uncle to lay [his]3438-your uncle private actions open to [the world]304-the world . [His]3438-your uncle character was to speak for itself . [He]3438-your uncle called it , therefore , [his]3438-your uncle duty to step forward , and endeavour to remedy an evil which had been brought on by [himself]3438-your uncle . If [he]3438-your uncle had another motive , [I]2636-i am sure it would never disgrace [him]3438-your uncle . [He]3438-your uncle had been some days in [town]268-town before [he]3438-your uncle was able to discover them ; but [he]3438-your uncle had something to direct [his]3438-your uncle search , which was more than [we]4945-we had ; and the consciousness of this was another reason for [his]3438-your uncle resolving to follow [us]4945-we . There is [a lady]3226-a lady , it seems , [a Mrs. Younge , who was some time ago governess to [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy , and was dismissed from [her]3226-a lady charge on some cause of disapprobation]128-miss darcy , though [he]3438-your uncle did not say what . [She]3226-a lady then took [a large house in [Edward Street]70-edward street]4947-a large house in edward street , and has since maintained [herself]3226-a lady by letting [lodgings]4707-lodgings . This [Mrs. Younge]128-miss darcy was , [he]3438-your uncle knew , intimately acquainted with [Wickham]142-wickham ; and [he]3438-your uncle went to [her]128-miss darcy for intelligence of [him]3438-your uncle , as soon as [he]3438-your uncle got to [town]268-town . But it was two or three days before [he]3438-your uncle could get from [her]128-miss darcy what [he]3438-your uncle wanted . [She]128-miss darcy would not betray [her]128-miss darcy trust , [I]2636-i suppose , without bribery and corruption , for [she]128-miss darcy really did know where [[her]128-miss darcy friend]400-her friend was to be found . [Wickham]142-wickham , indeed , had gone to [her]128-miss darcy on [their]4951-their first arrival in [London]5-london ; and had [she]128-miss darcy been able to receive [them]4951-their into [[her]128-miss darcy house]4952-her house , [they]4951-their would have taken up [[their]4951-their abode]4953-their abode with [her]128-miss darcy . At length , however , [[our]4954-our kind friend]4955-our kind friend procured the wished - for direction . [They]4951-their were in ---- [Street]71-street . [He]142-wickham saw [Wickham]142-wickham , and afterwards insisted on seeing [Lydia]90-lydia . [His]142-wickham first object with [her]128-miss darcy , [he]142-wickham acknowledged , had been to persuade [her]128-miss darcy to quit [her]128-miss darcy present disgraceful situation , and return to [[her]128-miss darcy friends]311-her friends as soon as [they]311-her friends could be prevailed on to receive [her]128-miss darcy , offering [his]142-wickham assistance as far as it would go . But [he]142-wickham found [Lydia]90-lydia absolutely resolved on remaining where [she]90-lydia was . [She]90-lydia cared for [none of [[her]90-lydia friends]311-her friends]4957-none of her friends ; [she]90-lydia wanted no help of [his]142-wickham ; [she]90-lydia would not hear of leaving [Wickham]142-wickham . [She]90-lydia was sure [they]4959-they should be married some time or other , and it did not much signify when . Since such were [her]90-lydia feelings , it only remained , [he]142-wickham thought , to secure and expedite a marriage , which , in [his]142-wickham very first conversation with [Wickham]142-wickham , [he]142-wickham easily learnt had never been [his]142-wickham design . [He]142-wickham confessed [himself]142-wickham obliged to leave [the regiment]654-the regiment on account of some debts of honour which were very pressing ; and scrupled not to lay all the ill consequences of [Lydia]90-lydia ’s flight on [her]90-lydia own folly alone . [He]142-wickham meant to resign [his]142-wickham commission immediately ; and as to [his]142-wickham future situation , [he]142-wickham could conjecture very little about it . [He]142-wickham must go somewhere , but [he]142-wickham did not know where , and [he]142-wickham knew [he]142-wickham should have nothing to live on . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy asked why [he]142-wickham did not marry [[your]4961-your sister]3211-your sister at once . Though [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet was not imagined to be very rich , [he]142-wickham would have been able to do something for [him]142-wickham , and [his]142-wickham situation must have been benefited by marriage . But [he]142-wickham found , in reply to this question , that [Wickham]142-wickham still cherished the hope of more effectually making [his]142-wickham fortune by marriage , in [some other country]4963-some other country . Under such circumstances , however , [he]142-wickham was not likely to be proof against the temptation of immediate relief . [They]4964-they met several times , for there was much to be discussed . [Wickham]142-wickham , of course , wanted more than [he]142-wickham could get ; but at length was reduced to be reasonable . Everything being settled between [them]4964-they , [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s next step was to make [[your]4961-your uncle]3438-your uncle acquainted with it , and [he]3438-your uncle first called in [Gracechurch Street]28-gracechurch street the evening before [I]2636-i came [home]3288-home . But [Mr. Gardiner]157-mr. gardiner could not be seen ; and [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy found , on further inquiry , that [[your]4961-your father]3292-your father was still with [him]3438-your uncle , but would quit [town]268-town the next morning . [He]96-mr. darcy did not judge [[your]4961-your father]3292-your father to be [a person whom [he]96-mr. darcy could so properly consult as [[your]4961-your uncle]3438-your uncle , and therefore readily postponed seeing [him]3292-your father till after the departure of [the former]327-the former . [He]3292-your father did not leave [his]3292-your father name , and till the next day it was only known that [a gentleman had called on business]4973-a gentleman had called on business . On Saturday [he]3292-your father came again . [[Your]4961-your father]3292-your father was gone , [[your]4961-your uncle]3438-your uncle at [home]3288-home]4970-a person whom he could so properly consult as your uncle , and therefore readily postponed seeing him till after the departure of the former . he did not leave his name , and till the next day it was only known that a gentleman had called on business . on saturday he came again . your father was gone , your uncle at home , and , as [I]2636-i said before , [they]4977-they had a great deal of talk together . [They]4977-they met again on Sunday , and then [I]2636-i saw [him]3292-your father too . It was not all settled before Monday : as soon as it was , the express was sent off to [Longbourn]7-longbourn . But [[our]4978-our visitor]4979-our visitor was very obstinate . [I]2636-i fancy , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , that obstinacy is the real defect of [his]3292-your father character , after all . [He]3292-your father has been accused of many faults at different times ; but this is the true one . Nothing was to be done that [he]3292-your father did not do [himself]3292-your father ; though [I]2636-i am sure ( and [I]2636-i do not speak it to be thanked , therefore say nothing about it ) [[your]4961-your uncle]3438-your uncle would most readily have settled the whole . [They]4977-they battled it together for a long time , which was more than either [the gentleman]287-the gentleman or lady concerned in it deserved . But at last [[your]4961-your uncle]3438-your uncle was forced to yield , and instead of being allowed to be of use to [[his]3438-your uncle niece]4983-his niece , was forced to put up with only having the probable credit of it , which went sorely against the grain ; and [I]2636-i really believe [your]4961-your letter this morning gave [him]3438-your uncle great pleasure , because it required an explanation that would rob [him]3438-your uncle of [his]3438-your uncle borrowed feathers , and give the praise where it was due . But , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , this must go no further than [yourself]4961-your , or [Jane]89-jane at most . [You]4961-your know pretty well , [I]2636-i suppose , what has been done for [the young people]3634-the young people . [His]3438-your uncle debts are to be paid , amounting , [I]2636-i believe , to considerably more than a thousand pounds , another thousand in addition to [her]89-jane own settled upon [her]89-jane , and [his]3438-your uncle commission purchased . The reason why all this was to be done by [him]3438-your uncle alone , was such as [I]2636-i have given above . It was owing to [him]3438-your uncle , to [his]3438-your uncle reserve and want of proper consideration , that [Wickham]142-wickham ’s character had been so misunderstood , and consequently that [he]3438-your uncle had been received and noticed as [he]3438-your uncle was . Perhaps there was some truth in this ; though [I]2636-i doubt whether [his]3438-your uncle reserve , or [anybody]3171-anybody ’s reserve can be answerable for the event . But in spite of all this fine talking , [[my]2636-i dear]3066-my dear [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , [you]88-elizabeth may rest perfectly assured that [[your]88-elizabeth uncle]3438-your uncle would never have yielded , if [we]4988-us had not given [him]3438-your uncle credit for another interest in the affair . When all this was resolved on , [he]3438-your uncle returned again to [[his]3438-your uncle friends , who were still staying at [Pemberley]12-pemberley]4989-his friends , who were still staying at pemberley ; but it was agreed that [he]3438-your uncle should be in [London]5-london once more when the wedding took place , and all money matters were then to receive the last finish . [I]2636-i believe [I]2636-i have now told [you]88-elizabeth everything . It is a relation which [you]88-elizabeth tell [me]2636-i is to give [you]88-elizabeth great surprise ; [I]2636-i hope at least it will not afford [you]88-elizabeth any displeasure . [Lydia]90-lydia came to [us]4988-us , and [Wickham]142-wickham had constant admission to [the house]3075-the house . [He]142-wickham was exactly what [he]142-wickham had been when [I]2636-i knew [him]142-wickham in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire ; but [I]2636-i would not tell [you]88-elizabeth how little [I]2636-i was satisfied with [her]90-lydia behaviour while [she]90-lydia stayed with [us]4988-us , if [I]2636-i had not perceived , by [Jane]89-jane ’s letter last Wednesday , that [her]90-lydia conduct on coming [home]3288-home was exactly of a piece with it , and therefore what [I]2636-i now tell [you]88-elizabeth can give [you]88-elizabeth no fresh pain . [I]2636-i talked to [her]90-lydia repeatedly in the most serious manner , representing to [her]90-lydia the wickedness of what [she]90-lydia had done , and all the unhappiness [she]90-lydia had brought on [[her]90-lydia family]3710-her family . If [she]90-lydia heard [me]2636-i , it was by good luck , for [I]2636-i am sure [she]90-lydia did not listen . [I]2636-i was sometimes quite provoked ; but then [I]2636-i recollected [my]2636-i dear [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth and [Jane]89-jane , and for [their]4993-their sakes had patience with [her]90-lydia . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy was punctual in [his]96-mr. darcy return , and , as [Lydia]90-lydia imformed [you]4994-you , attended the wedding . [He]96-mr. darcy dined with [us]4995-us the next day , and was to leave [town]268-town again on Wednesday or Thursday . Will [you]4994-you be very angry with [me]2636-i , [[my]2636-i dear]3066-my dear [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , if [I]2636-i take this opportunity of saying ( what [I]2636-i was never bold enough to say before ) how much [I]2636-i like [him]96-mr. darcy ? [His]96-mr. darcy behaviour to [us]4995-us has , in every respect , been as pleasing as when [we]4995-us were in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire . [His]96-mr. darcy understanding and opinions all please [me]2636-i ; [he]96-mr. darcy wants nothing but a little more liveliness , and that , if [he]96-mr. darcy marry prudently , [[his]96-mr. darcy wife]236-his wife may teach [him]96-mr. darcy . [I]2636-i thought [him]96-mr. darcy very sly ; [he]96-mr. darcy hardly ever mentioned [your]88-elizabeth name . But slyness seems the fashion . Pray forgive [me]2636-i , if [I]2636-i have been very presuming , or at least do not punish [me]2636-i so far as to exclude [me]2636-i from P. [I]2636-i shall never be quite happy till [I]2636-i have been all round [the park]1317-the park . [A low phaeton with a nice little pair of ponies]5000-a low phaeton with a nice little pair of ponies would be the very thing . But [I]2636-i must write no more . [The children]1941-the children have been wanting [me]2636-i this half hour . “[2636-i] [Yours]2636-i , very sincerely , “ [M. GARDINER]219-m. gardiner . ”[2636-i] The contents of this letter threw [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth into a flutter of spirits , in which it was difficult to determine whether pleasure or pain bore the greatest share . The vague and unsettled suspicions which uncertainty had produced , of what [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy might have been doing to forward [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ’s match -- which [she]88-elizabeth had feared to encourage , as an exertion of goodness too great to be probable , and at the same time dreaded to be just , from the pain of obligation -- were proved beyond their greatest extent to be true ! [He]96-mr. darcy had followed [them]2638-them purposely to [town]268-town , [he]96-mr. darcy had taken on [himself]96-mr. darcy all the trouble and mortification attendant on such a research ; in which supplication had been necessary to [a woman whom [he]96-mr. darcy must abominate and despise]2640-a woman whom he must abominate and despise , and where [he]96-mr. darcy was reduced to meet , frequently meet , reason with , persuade , and finally bribe [the man whom [he]96-mr. darcy always most wished to avoid , and whose very name it was punishment to [him]96-mr. darcy to pronounce]2641-the man whom he always most wished to avoid , and whose very name it was punishment to him to pronounce . [He]96-mr. darcy had done all this for [a girl whom [he]96-mr. darcy could neither regard nor esteem]2642-a girl whom he could neither regard nor esteem . [Her]88-elizabeth heart did whisper that [he]96-mr. darcy had done it for [her]2642-a girl whom he could neither regard nor esteem . But it was a hope shortly checked by other considerations ; and [she]88-elizabeth soon felt that even [her]88-elizabeth vanity was insufficient , when required to depend on [his]96-mr. darcy affection for [her]88-elizabeth , for [a woman who had already refused [him]96-mr. darcy , as able to overcome a sentiment so natural as abhorrence against relationship with [Wickham]142-wickham]2643-a woman who had already refused him , as able to overcome a sentiment so natural as abhorrence against relationship with wickham . [Brother - in - law of [Wickham]142-wickham]2644-brother - in - law of wickham ! Every kind of pride must revolt from the connection . [He]96-mr. darcy had , to be sure , done much . [She]88-elizabeth was ashamed to think how much . But [he]96-mr. darcy had given a reason for [his]96-mr. darcy interference , which asked no extraordinary stretch of belief . It was reasonable that [he]96-mr. darcy should feel [he]96-mr. darcy had been wrong ; [he]96-mr. darcy had liberality , and [he]96-mr. darcy had the means of exercising it ; and though [she]88-elizabeth would not place [herself]88-elizabeth as [his]96-mr. darcy principal inducement , [she]88-elizabeth could perhaps believe , that remaining partiality for [her]88-elizabeth might assist [his]96-mr. darcy endeavours in a cause where [her]88-elizabeth peace of mind must be materially concerned . It was painful , exceedingly painful , to know that [they]2645-they were under obligations to [a person who could never receive a return]2646-a person who could never receive a return . [They]2645-they owed the restoration of [Lydia]90-lydia , [her]88-elizabeth character , everything to [him]96-mr. darcy . Oh , how heartily did [she]88-elizabeth grieve over every ungracious sensation [she]88-elizabeth had ever encouraged , every saucy speech [she]88-elizabeth had ever directed towards [him]96-mr. darcy ! For [herself]88-elizabeth [she]88-elizabeth was humbled ; but [she]88-elizabeth was proud of [him,--proud]2647-him,--proud that in a cause of compassion and honour [he]96-mr. darcy had been able to get the better of [himself]96-mr. darcy . [She]88-elizabeth read over [[her]88-elizabeth aunt]4017-her aunt ’s commendation of [him]96-mr. darcy again and again . It was hardly enough ; but it pleased [her]88-elizabeth . [She]88-elizabeth was even sensible of some pleasure , though mixed with regret , on finding how steadfastly both [she]88-elizabeth and [[her]88-elizabeth uncle]579-her uncle had been persuaded that affection and confidence subsisted between [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy and [herself]88-elizabeth . [She]88-elizabeth was roused from [her]88-elizabeth seat and [her]88-elizabeth reflections , by [someone]2650-someone ’s approach ; and , before [she]88-elizabeth could strike into another path , [she]88-elizabeth was overtaken by [Wickham]142-wickham . “ [I]96-mr. darcy am afraid [I]96-mr. darcy interrupt [your]88-elizabeth solitary ramble , [[my]96-mr. darcy dear sister]1077-my dear sister ? ”[96-mr. darcy] said [he]96-mr. darcy , as [he]96-mr. darcy joined [her]88-elizabeth . “ [You]96-mr. darcy certainly do , ”[88-elizabeth] [she]88-elizabeth replied with a smile ; “ but it does not follow that the interruption must be unwelcome . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]96-mr. darcy should be sorry , indeed , if it were . [We]5003-we were always [good friends]5004-good friends , and now [we]5003-we are better . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ True . Are [the others]511-the others coming out ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]88-elizabeth do not know . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet and [Lydia]90-lydia are going in [the carriage]3286-the carriage to [Meryton]9-meryton . And so , [[my]88-elizabeth dear sister]1077-my dear sister , [I]88-elizabeth find , from [[our]5003-we uncle]5008-our uncle and [aunt]1241-aunt , that [you]1077-my dear sister have actually seen [Pemberley]12-pemberley . ”[88-elizabeth] [She]88-elizabeth replied in the affirmative . “ [I]88-elizabeth almost envy [you]1077-my dear sister the pleasure , and yet [I]88-elizabeth believe it would be too much for [me]88-elizabeth , or else [I]88-elizabeth could take it in [my]88-elizabeth way to [Newcastle]68-newcastle . And [you]1077-my dear sister saw [the old housekeeper]5010-the old housekeeper , [I]88-elizabeth suppose ? [Poor Reynolds]220-poor reynolds , [she]5010-the old housekeeper was always very fond of [me]88-elizabeth . But of course [she]5010-the old housekeeper did not mention [my]88-elizabeth name to [you]1077-my dear sister . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Yes , [she]5010-the old housekeeper did . ”[88-elizabeth] “ And what did [she]5010-the old housekeeper say ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ That [you]1077-my dear sister were gone into [the army]4478-the army , and [she]5010-the old housekeeper was afraid had -- not turned out well . At such a distance as that , [you]1077-my dear sister know , things are strangely misrepresented . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Certainly , ”[2651-i] [he]2651-i replied , biting [his]2651-i lips . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth hoped [she]88-elizabeth had silenced [him]2651-i ; but [he]2651-i soon afterwards said,-- “ [I]2651-i was surprised to see [Darcy]96-mr. darcy in [town]268-town last month . [We]5013-we passed each other several times . [I]2651-i wonder what [he]96-mr. darcy can be doing [there]306-there . ”[2651-i] “ Perhaps preparing for [his]96-mr. darcy marriage with [Miss de Bourgh]138-miss de bourgh , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ It must be something particular to take [him]96-mr. darcy [there]306-there at this time of year . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Undoubtedly . Did [you]1077-my dear sister see [him]96-mr. darcy while [you]1077-my dear sister were at [Lambton]49-lambton ? [I]2651-i thought [I]2651-i understood from [the Gardiners]159-the gardiners that [you]1077-my dear sister had . ”[2651-i] “ Yes ; [he]96-mr. darcy introduced [us]5013-we to [[his]96-mr. darcy sister]565-his sister . ”[88-elizabeth] “ And do [you]1077-my dear sister like [her]565-his sister ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Very much . ”[2651-i] “ [I]88-elizabeth have heard , indeed , that [she]565-his sister is uncommonly improved within this year or two . When [I]88-elizabeth last saw [her]565-his sister , [she]565-his sister was not very promising . [I]88-elizabeth am very glad [you]1077-my dear sister liked [her]565-his sister . [I]88-elizabeth hope [she]565-his sister will turn out well . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]88-elizabeth dare say [she]565-his sister will ; [she]565-his sister has got over the most trying age . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Did [you]1077-my dear sister go by [the village of Kympton]5017-the village of kympton ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]88-elizabeth do not recollect that [we]5018-we did . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]88-elizabeth mention it because it is the living which [I]88-elizabeth ought to have had . [A most delightful place]5019-a most delightful place ! [Excellent parsonage - house]5020-excellent parsonage - house ! [It]5020-excellent parsonage - house would have suited [me]88-elizabeth in every respect . ”[88-elizabeth] “ How should [you]1077-my dear sister have liked making sermons ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Exceedingly well . [I]88-elizabeth should have considered it as part of [my]88-elizabeth duty , and the exertion would soon have been nothing . [One]3113-one ought not to repine ; but , to be sure , it would have been such a thing for [me]88-elizabeth ! The quiet , the retirement of such a life , would have answered all [my]88-elizabeth ideas of happiness ! But it was not to be . Did [you]1077-my dear sister ever hear [Darcy]96-mr. darcy mention the circumstance when [you]1077-my dear sister were in [Kent]17-kent ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]88-elizabeth have heard from authority , which [I]88-elizabeth thought as good , that it was left [you]1077-my dear sister conditionally only , and at the will of [the present patron]5022-the present patron . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [You]1077-my dear sister have ! Yes , there was something in that ; [I]88-elizabeth told [you]1077-my dear sister so from the first , [you]1077-my dear sister may remember . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]88-elizabeth did hear , too , that there was a time when sermon - making was not so palatable to [you]1077-my dear sister as it seems to be at present ; that [you]1077-my dear sister actually declared [your]1077-my dear sister resolution of never taking orders , and that the business had been compromised accordingly . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [You]1077-my dear sister did ! and it was not wholly without foundation . [You]1077-my dear sister may remember what [I]88-elizabeth told [you]1077-my dear sister on that point , when first [we]2652-we talked of it . ”[88-elizabeth] [They]2652-we were now almost at the door of [the house]3075-the house , for [she]2654-she had walked fast to get rid of [him]2655-him ; and unwilling , for [[her]2654-she sister]328-her sister ’s sake , to provoke [him]2655-him , [she]2654-she only said in reply , with a good - humoured smile,-- “ Come , [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham , [we]2652-we are [brother]4658-brother and [sister]1153-sister , [you]2655-him know . Do not let [us]2652-we quarrel about the past . In future , [I]2654-she hope [we]2652-we shall be always of one mind . ”[2654-she] [She]2654-she held out [her]2654-she hand : [he]2655-him kissed it with affectionate gallantry , though [he]2655-him hardly knew how to look , and [they]2652-we entered [the house]3075-the house . [ Illustration : “ [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy with [him]2655-him . ”[2655-him] ] CHAPTER LIII . [ Illustration ] [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham was so perfectly satisfied with this conversation , that [he]2655-him never again distressed [himself]2655-him , or provoked [[his]2655-him dear sister]2658-his dear sister [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , by introducing the subject of it ; and [she]88-elizabeth was pleased to find that [she]88-elizabeth had said enough to keep [him]2655-him quiet . The day of [his]2655-him and [Lydia]90-lydia ’s departure soon came ; and [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet was forced to submit to a separation , which , as [[her]92-mrs. bennet husband]260-her husband by no means entered into [her]92-mrs. bennet scheme of [their]2652-we all going to [Newcastle]68-newcastle , was likely to continue at least a twelvemonth . “ Oh , [[my]92-mrs. bennet dear]3066-my dear [Lydia]90-lydia , ”[92-mrs. bennet] [she]92-mrs. bennet cried , “ when shall [we]2652-we meet again ? ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ Oh , [Lord]5026-lord ! [I]142-wickham do n’t know . Not these two or three years , perhaps . ”[142-wickham] “ Write to [me]92-mrs. bennet very often , [[my]92-mrs. bennet dear]3066-my dear . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ As often as [I]92-mrs. bennet can . But [you]3066-my dear know [married women]5028-married women have never much time for writing . [[My]92-mrs. bennet sisters]2602-my sisters may write to [me]92-mrs. bennet . [They]2602-my sisters will have nothing else to do . ”[92-mrs. bennet] [Mr. Wickham]142-wickham ’s adieus were much more affectionate than [[his]142-wickham wife]236-his wife ’s . [He]142-wickham smiled , looked handsome , and said many pretty things . “ [He]142-wickham is as fine [a fellow]5030-a fellow , ”[81-mr. bennet] said [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet , as soon as [they]2661-they were out of [the house]3075-the house , “ as ever [I]81-mr. bennet saw . [He]142-wickham simpers , and smirks , and makes love to [[us]2661-they all]2427-us all . [I]81-mr. bennet am prodigiously proud of [him]142-wickham . [I]81-mr. bennet defy even [Sir William Lucas]86-sir william [himself]86-sir william to produce [a more valuable son - in - law]5032-a more valuable son - in - law . ”[81-mr. bennet] The loss of [[her]236-his wife daughter]461-her daughter made [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet very dull for several days . “ [I]236-his wife often think , ”[236-his wife] said [she]236-his wife , “ that there is nothing so bad as parting with [[one]3113-one ’s friends]5034-one ’s friends . [One]3113-one seems so forlorn without [them]5034-one ’s friends . ”[236-his wife] “ This is the consequence , [you]92-mrs. bennet see , [madam]3346-madam , of marrying [a daughter]1170-a daughter , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ It must make [you]92-mrs. bennet better satisfied that [[your]92-mrs. bennet other four]5038-your other four are single . ”[88-elizabeth] “ It is no such thing . [Lydia]90-lydia does not leave [me]236-his wife because [she]90-lydia is married ; but only because [[her]90-lydia husband]260-her husband ’s regiment happens to be so far off . If that had been nearer , [she]90-lydia would not have gone so soon . ”[236-his wife] But the spiritless condition which this event threw [her]236-his wife into was shortly relieved , and [her]236-his wife mind opened again to the agitation of hope , by an article of news which then began to be in circulation . [The housekeeper at [Netherfield]2-netherfield]2664-the housekeeper at netherfield had received orders to prepare for the arrival of [[her]2664-the housekeeper at netherfield master]1999-her master , who was coming down in a day or two , to shoot [there]306-there for several weeks . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet was quite in the fidgets . [She]92-mrs. bennet looked at [Jane]89-jane , and smiled , and shook [her]92-mrs. bennet head , by turns . “ Well , well , and so [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley is coming down , [sister]1153-sister , ”[92-mrs. bennet] ( for [Mrs. Philips]117-mrs. philips first brought [her]236-his wife the news ) . “ Well , so much the better . Not that [I]92-mrs. bennet care about it , though . [He]85-mr. bingley is nothing to [us]5041-us , [you]1153-sister know , and [I]92-mrs. bennet am sure [I]92-mrs. bennet never want to see [him]85-mr. bingley again . But , however , [he]85-mr. bingley is very welcome to come to [Netherfield]2-netherfield , if [he]85-mr. bingley likes it . And who knows what may happen ? But that is nothing to [us]5041-us . [You]1153-sister know , [sister]1153-sister , [we]5041-us agreed long ago never to mention a word about it . And so , it is quite certain [he]85-mr. bingley is coming ? ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ [You]1153-sister may depend on it , ”[3427-the other] replied [the other]3427-the other , “ for [Mrs. Nichols]221-mrs. nichols was in [Meryton]9-meryton last night : [I]3427-the other saw [her]221-mrs. nichols passing by , and went out [myself]3427-the other on purpose to know the truth of it ; and [she]221-mrs. nichols told [me]3427-the other that it was certainly true . [He]2668-his comes down on Thursday , at the latest , very likely on Wednesday . [She]221-mrs. nichols was going to [the butcher ’s]5043-the butcher ’s , [she]221-mrs. nichols told [me]3427-the other , on purpose to order in some meat on Wednesday , and [she]221-mrs. nichols has got three couple of ducks just fit to be killed . ”[3427-the other] [Miss Bennet]90-lydia had not been able to hear of [his]2668-his coming without changing colour . It was many months since [she]90-lydia had mentioned [his]2668-his name to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; but now , as soon as [they]2669-they were alone together , [she]90-lydia said,-- “ [I]90-lydia saw [you]2668-his look at [me]90-lydia to - day , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , when [[my]90-lydia aunt]3279-my aunt told [us]2669-they of the present report ; and [I]90-lydia know [I]90-lydia appeared distressed ; but do n’t imagine it was from any silly cause . [I]90-lydia was only confused for the moment , because [I]90-lydia felt that [I]90-lydia should be looked at . [I]90-lydia do assure [you]2668-his that the news does not affect [me]90-lydia either with pleasure or pain . [I]90-lydia am glad of one thing , that [he]2670-him comes alone ; because [we]2669-they shall see the less of [him]2670-him . Not that [I]90-lydia am afraid of [myself]90-lydia , but [I]90-lydia dread [other people]1145-other people ’s remarks . ”[90-lydia] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth did not know what to make of it . Had [she]88-elizabeth not seen [him]2670-him in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire , [she]88-elizabeth might have supposed [him]2670-him capable of coming [there]306-there with no other view than what was acknowledged ; but [she]88-elizabeth still thought [him]2670-him partial to [Jane]89-jane , and [she]88-elizabeth wavered as to the greater probability of [his]2670-him coming [there]306-there with [[his]2670-him friend]288-his friend ’s permission , or being bold enough to come without it . “ Yet it is hard , ”[88-elizabeth] [she]88-elizabeth sometimes thought , “ that [this poor man]5046-this poor man can not come to [a house]3862-a house , which [he]5046-this poor man has legally hired , without raising all this speculation ! [I]88-elizabeth will leave [him]5046-this poor man to [himself]5046-this poor man . ”[88-elizabeth] In spite of what [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister declared , and really believed to be [her]88-elizabeth feelings , in the expectation of [his]2670-him arrival , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth could easily perceive that [her]88-elizabeth spirits were affected by it . [They]2675-they were more disturbed , more unequal , than [she]88-elizabeth had often seen [them]2675-they . The subject which had been so warmly canvassed between [[their]2676-their parents]2677-their parents , about a twelvemonth ago , was now brought forward again . “ As soon as ever [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley comes , [[my]92-mrs. bennet dear]3066-my dear , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , “ [you]3066-my dear will wait on [him]85-mr. bingley , of course . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ No , no . [You]3066-my dear forced [me]2678-i into visiting [him]85-mr. bingley last year , and promised , if [I]2678-i went to see [him]85-mr. bingley , [he]85-mr. bingley should marry [one of [[my]2678-i daughters]3130-my daughters]3129-one of my daughters . But it ended in nothing , and [I]2678-i will not be sent on [a fool]4785-a fool ’s errand again . ”[2678-i] [[His]2678-i wife]236-his wife represented to [him]2678-i how absolutely necessary such an attention would be from all [the neighbouring gentlemen]2680-the neighbouring gentlemen , on [his]2678-i returning to [Netherfield]2-netherfield . “ ’ Tis an etiquette [I]2678-i despise , ”[2678-i] said [he]2678-i . “ If [he]85-mr. bingley wants [our]5052-we society , let [him]85-mr. bingley seek it . [He]85-mr. bingley knows where [we]5052-we live . [I]2678-i will not spend [my]2678-i hours in running after [[my]2678-i neighbours]5053-my neighbours every time [they]5053-my neighbours go away and come back again . ”[2678-i] “ Well , all [I]2681-i know is , that it will be abominably rude if [you]236-his wife do not wait on [him]85-mr. bingley . But , however , that sha n’t prevent [my]2681-i asking [him]85-mr. bingley to dine [here]3067-here , [I]2681-i am determined . [We]5052-we must have [Mrs. Long]82-mrs. long and [the Gouldings]212-the gouldings soon . That will make thirteen with [ourselves]5052-we , so there will be just room at table for [him]85-mr. bingley . ”[2681-i] Consoled by this resolution , [she]2681-i was the better able to bear [[her]2681-i husband]260-her husband ’s incivility ; though it was very mortifying to know that [[her]2681-i neighbours]3652-her neighbours might all see [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , in consequence of it , before [they]3652-her neighbours did . As the day of [his]85-mr. bingley arrival drew near,-- “ [I]89-jane begin to be sorry that [he]85-mr. bingley comes at all , ”[89-jane] said [Jane]89-jane to [[her]89-jane sister]328-her sister . “ It would be nothing ; [I]89-jane could see [him]85-mr. bingley with perfect indifference ; but [I]89-jane can hardly bear to hear it thus perpetually talked of . [[My]89-jane mother]3295-my mother means well ; but [she]3295-my mother does not know , [no one]3336-no one can know , how much [I]89-jane suffer from what [she]3295-my mother says . [Happy]222-happy shall [I]89-jane be when [his]85-mr. bingley stay at [Netherfield]2-netherfield is over ! ”[89-jane] “ [I]88-elizabeth wish [I]88-elizabeth could say anything to comfort [you]85-mr. bingley , ”[88-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; “ but it is wholly out of [my]88-elizabeth power . [You]85-mr. bingley must feel it ; and the usual satisfaction of preaching patience to [a sufferer]5057-a sufferer is denied [me]88-elizabeth , because [you]85-mr. bingley have always so much . ”[88-elizabeth] [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley arrived . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , through the assistance of [servants]1352-servants , contrived to have the earliest tidings of it , that the period of anxiety and fretfulness on [her]92-mrs. bennet side be as long as it could . [She]92-mrs. bennet counted the days that must intervene before [their]2686-their invitation could be sent -- hopeless of seeing [him]85-mr. bingley before . But on the third morning after [his]85-mr. bingley arrival in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , [she]92-mrs. bennet saw [him]85-mr. bingley from [her]92-mrs. bennet dressing - room window enter [the paddock]2364-the paddock , and ride towards [the house]3075-the house . [[Her]92-mrs. bennet daughters]242-her daughters were eagerly called to partake of [her]92-mrs. bennet joy . [Jane]89-jane resolutely kept [her]89-jane place at the table ; but [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , to satisfy [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother , went to the window -- [she]88-elizabeth looked -- [she]88-elizabeth saw [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy with [him]85-mr. bingley , and sat down again by [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister . “ There is [a gentleman]3470-a gentleman with [him]85-mr. bingley , [mamma]3106-mamma , ”[93-lady catherine] said [Kitty]93-lady catherine ; “ who can it be ? ”[93-lady catherine] “ [Some acquaintance]1952-some acquaintance or other , [[my]88-elizabeth dear]3066-my dear , [I]88-elizabeth suppose ; [I]88-elizabeth am sure [I]88-elizabeth do not know . ”[88-elizabeth] “ La ! ”[93-lady catherine] replied [Kitty]93-lady catherine , “ it looks just like [that man that used to be with [him]85-mr. bingley before]5062-that man that used to be with him before . [Mr.]5063-mr. what ’s [his]85-mr. bingley name -- [that tall , proud man]5064-that tall , proud man . ”[93-lady catherine] “ Good gracious ! [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy -and so it does , [I]89-jane vow . Well , [any friend of [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s]5065-any friend of mr. bingley ’s will always be welcome [here]3067-here , to be sure ; but else [I]89-jane must say that [I]89-jane hate the very sight of [him]2694-him . ”[89-jane] [Jane]89-jane looked at [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth with surprise and concern . [She]89-jane knew but little of [their]2692-their meeting in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire , and therefore felt for the awkwardness which must attend [[her]89-jane sister]328-her sister , in seeing [him]2694-him almost for the first time after receiving [his]2694-him explanatory letter . [Both sisters]2695-both sisters were uncomfortable enough . [Each]3692-each felt for [the other]3427-the other , and of course for [themselves]2695-both sisters ; and [[their]2695-both sisters mother]433-their mother talked on of [her]433-their mother dislike of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , and [her]433-their mother resolution to be civil to [him]2694-him only as [[Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s friend]2699-mr. bingley ’s friend , without being heard by [either of [them]2695-both sisters]1225-either of them . But [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had sources of uneasiness which could not yet be suspected by [Jane]89-jane , to whom [she]89-jane had never yet had courage to show [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner ’s letter , or to relate [her]89-jane own change of sentiment towards [him]2694-him . To [Jane]89-jane , [he]2694-him could be only [a man whose proposals [she]89-jane had refused , and whose merits [she]89-jane had undervalued]2701-a man whose proposals she had refused , and whose merits she had undervalued ; but to [her]89-jane own more extensive information , [he]2694-him was [the person to whom [the whole family were indebted for the first of benefits]2703-the whole family were indebted for the first of benefits , and whom [she]89-jane regarded [herself]89-jane with an interest , if not quite so tender , at least as reasonable and just , as what [Jane]89-jane felt for [Bingley]85-mr. bingley]2702-the person to whom the whole family were indebted for the first of benefits , and whom she regarded herself with an interest , if not quite so tender , at least as reasonable and just , as what jane felt for bingley . [Her]89-jane astonishment at [his]85-mr. bingley coming -- at [his]85-mr. bingley coming to [Netherfield]2-netherfield , to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , and voluntarily seeking [her]89-jane again , was almost equal to what [she]89-jane had known on first witnessing [his]85-mr. bingley altered behaviour in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire . The colour which had been driven from [her]89-jane face returned for half a minute with an additional glow , and a smile of delight added lustre to [her]89-jane eyes , as [she]89-jane thought for that space of time that [his]85-mr. bingley affection and wishes must still be unshaken ; but [she]89-jane would not be secure . “ Let [me]89-jane first see how [he]85-mr. bingley behaves , ”[89-jane] said [she]89-jane ; “ it will then be early enough for expectation . ”[89-jane] [She]89-jane sat intently at work , striving to be composed , and without daring to lift up [her]89-jane eyes , till anxious curiosity carried them to the face of [[her]89-jane sister]328-her sister as [the servant]460-the servant was approaching the door . [Jane]89-jane looked a little paler than usual , but more sedate than [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had expected . On [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen ’s appearing , [her]89-jane colour increased ; yet [she]89-jane received [them]292-the gentlemen with tolerable ease , and with a propriety of behaviour equally free from any symptom of resentment , or any unnecessary complaisance . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth said as little to either as civility would allow , and sat down again to [her]88-elizabeth work , with an eagerness which it did not often command . [She]88-elizabeth had ventured only one glance at [Darcy]96-mr. darcy . [He]96-mr. darcy looked serious as usual ; and , [she]88-elizabeth thought , more as [he]96-mr. darcy had been used to look in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , than as [she]88-elizabeth had seen [him]96-mr. darcy at [Pemberley]12-pemberley . But , perhaps , [he]96-mr. darcy could not in [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother ’s presence be what [he]96-mr. darcy was before [[her]88-elizabeth uncle]579-her uncle and [aunt]1241-aunt . It was a painful , but not an improbable , conjecture . [Bingley]85-mr. bingley [she]88-elizabeth had likewise seen for an instant , and in that short period saw [him]96-mr. darcy looking both pleased and embarrassed . [He]96-mr. darcy was received by [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet with a degree of civility which made [[her]92-mrs. bennet two daughters]2710-her two daughters ashamed , especially when contrasted with the cold and ceremonious politeness of [her]92-mrs. bennet courtesy and address of [[his]96-mr. darcy friend]288-his friend . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth particularly , who knew that [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother owed to [the latter]491-the latter the preservation of [[her]246-her mother favourite daughter]2714-her favourite daughter from irremediable infamy , was hurt and distressed to a most painful degree by a distinction so ill applied . [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , after inquiring of [her]88-elizabeth how [Mr.]2715-mr. and [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner did -- a question which [she]88-elizabeth could not answer without confusion -- said scarcely anything . [He]96-mr. darcy was not seated by [her]88-elizabeth : perhaps that was the reason of [his]96-mr. darcy silence ; but it had not been so in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire . There [he]96-mr. darcy had talked to [[her]88-elizabeth friends]311-her friends when [he]96-mr. darcy could not to [herself]88-elizabeth . But now several minutes elapsed , without bringing the sound of [his]96-mr. darcy voice ; and when occasionally , unable to resist the impulse of curiosity , [she]88-elizabeth raised [her]88-elizabeth eyes to [his]96-mr. darcy face , [she]88-elizabeth as often found [him]96-mr. darcy looking at [Jane]89-jane as at [herself]88-elizabeth , and frequently on no object but the ground . More thoughtfulness and less anxiety to please , than when [they]2717-they last met , were plainly expressed . [She]88-elizabeth was disappointed , and angry with [herself]88-elizabeth for being so . “ Could [I]88-elizabeth expect it to be otherwise ? ”[88-elizabeth] said [she]88-elizabeth . “ Yet why did [he]96-mr. darcy come ? ”[88-elizabeth] [She]88-elizabeth was in no humour for conversation with [anyone]3174-anyone but [himself]96-mr. darcy ; and to [him]96-mr. darcy [she]88-elizabeth had hardly courage to speak . [She]88-elizabeth inquired after [[his]96-mr. darcy sister]565-his sister , but could do no more . “ It is a long time , [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , since [you]85-mr. bingley went away , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet . [He]96-mr. darcy readily agreed to it . “ [I]85-mr. bingley began to be afraid [you]85-mr. bingley would never come back again . [People]3299-people did say , [you]85-mr. bingley meant to quit [the place]3068-the place entirely at [Michaelmas]84-michaelmas ; but , however , [I]85-mr. bingley hope it is not true . A great many changes have happened in [the neighbourhood]3088-the neighbourhood since [you]85-mr. bingley went away . [Miss Lucas]99-miss lucas is married and settled : and [one of [[my]85-mr. bingley own daughters]5071-my own daughters]5070-one of my own daughters . [I]85-mr. bingley suppose [you]85-mr. bingley have heard of it ; indeed , [you]85-mr. bingley must have seen it in the papers . It was in the ‘ Times ’ and the ‘ Courier , ’ [I]85-mr. bingley know ; though it was not put in as it ought to be . It was only said , ‘ Lately , [George Wickham]149-george wickham , Esq . , to [Miss Lydia Bennet]90-lydia , ’ without there being a syllable said of [[her]90-lydia father]249-her father , or the place where [she]90-lydia lived , or anything . It was [[my]85-mr. bingley brother]465-my brother [Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner ’s drawing up , too , and [I]85-mr. bingley wonder how [he]465-my brother came to make such an awkward business of it . Did [you]246-her mother see it ? ”[85-mr. bingley] [Bingley]85-mr. bingley replied that [he]85-mr. bingley did , and made [his]85-mr. bingley congratulations . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth dared not lift up [her]88-elizabeth eyes . How [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy looked , therefore , [she]88-elizabeth could not tell . “ It is a delightful thing , to be sure , to have [a daughter]1170-a daughter well married , ”[246-her mother] continued [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother ; “ but at the same time , [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , it is very hard to have [her]1170-a daughter taken away from [me]246-her mother . [They]5075-they are gone down to [Newcastle]68-newcastle , [a place quite northward it seems]5076-a place quite northward it seems , and there [they]5075-they are to stay , [I]246-her mother do not know how long . [[His]96-mr. darcy regiment]4841-his regiment is there ; for [I]246-her mother suppose [you]85-mr. bingley have heard of [his]96-mr. darcy leaving [the ----shire]20-the ----shire , and of [his]96-mr. darcy being gone into [the Regulars]5078-the regulars . Thank heaven ! [he]96-mr. darcy has [some friends]5079-some friends , though , perhaps , not so many as [he]96-mr. darcy deserves . ”[246-her mother] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , who knew this to be levelled at [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , was in such misery of shame that [she]88-elizabeth could hardly keep [her]88-elizabeth seat . It drew from [her]88-elizabeth , however , the exertion of speaking , which nothing else had so effectually done before ; and [she]88-elizabeth asked [Bingley]85-mr. bingley whether [he]85-mr. bingley meant to make any stay in [the country]448-the country at present . A few weeks , [he]85-mr. bingley believed . “ When [you]85-mr. bingley have killed all [your]85-mr. bingley own birds , [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , ”[246-her mother] said [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother , “ [I]246-her mother beg [you]85-mr. bingley will come here and shoot as many as [you]85-mr. bingley please on [[Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet ’s manor]5080-mr. bennet ’s manor . [I]246-her mother am sure [he]81-mr. bennet will be vastly happy to oblige [you]85-mr. bingley , and will save all the best of [the coveys]5081-the coveys for [you]85-mr. bingley . ”[246-her mother] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s misery increased at such unnecessary , such officious attention ! Were the same fair prospect to arise at present , as had flattered [them]2723-them a year ago , everything , [she]88-elizabeth was persuaded , would be hastening to the same vexatious conclusion . At that instant [she]88-elizabeth felt , that years of happiness could not make [Jane]89-jane or [herself]89-jane amends for moments of such painful confusion . “ The first wish of [my]88-elizabeth heart , ”[88-elizabeth] said [she]88-elizabeth to [herself]88-elizabeth , “ is never more to be in company with [either of [them]2723-them]1225-either of them . [[Their]2723-them society]5083-their society can afford no pleasure that will atone for such wretchedness as this ! Let [me]88-elizabeth never see either one or [the other]3427-the other again ! ”[88-elizabeth] Yet the misery , for which years of happiness were to offer no compensation , received soon afterwards material relief , from observing how much the beauty of [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister rekindled the admiration of [[her]88-elizabeth former lover]2725-her former lover . When first [he]2725-her former lover came in , [he]2725-her former lover had spoken to [her]88-elizabeth but little , but every five minutes seemed to be giving [her]88-elizabeth more of [his]2725-her former lover attention . [He]2725-her former lover found [her]88-elizabeth as handsome as [she]88-elizabeth had been last year ; as good - natured , and as unaffected , though not quite so chatty . [Jane]89-jane was anxious that no difference should be perceived in [her]89-jane at all , and was really persuaded that [she]89-jane talked as much as ever ; but [her]89-jane mind was so busily engaged , that [she]89-jane did not always know when [she]89-jane was silent . When [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen rose to go away , [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet was mindful of [her]92-mrs. bennet intended civility , and [they]292-the gentlemen were invited and engaged to dine at [Longbourn]7-longbourn in a few days ’ time . “ [You]2725-her former lover are quite a visit in [my]92-mrs. bennet debt , [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley , ”[92-mrs. bennet] [she]92-mrs. bennet added ; “ for when [you]85-mr. bingley went to [town]268-town last winter , [you]85-mr. bingley promised to take a family dinner with [us]292-the gentlemen as soon as [you]85-mr. bingley returned . [I]92-mrs. bennet have not forgot , [you]85-mr. bingley see ; and [I]92-mrs. bennet assure [you]85-mr. bingley [I]92-mrs. bennet was very much disappointed that [you]85-mr. bingley did not come back and keep [your]85-mr. bingley engagement . ”[92-mrs. bennet] [Bingley]85-mr. bingley looked a little silly at this reflection , and said something of [his]85-mr. bingley concern at having been prevented by business . [They]292-the gentlemen then went away . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet had been strongly inclined to ask [them]292-the gentlemen to stay and dine [there]306-there that day ; but , though [she]92-mrs. bennet always kept a very good table , [she]92-mrs. bennet did not think anything less than two courses could be good enough for [a man on whom [she]92-mrs. bennet had such anxious designs , or satisfy the appetite and pride of one who had ten thousand a year]2728-a man on whom she had such anxious designs , or satisfy the appetite and pride of one who had ten thousand a year . [ Illustration : “ [Jane]89-jane happened to look round ”[92-mrs. bennet] ] CHAPTER LIV . [ Illustration ] As soon as [they]292-the gentlemen were gone , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth walked out to recover [her]88-elizabeth spirits ; or , in other words , to dwell without interruption on those subjects which must deaden [them]292-the gentlemen more . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s behaviour astonished and vexed [her]88-elizabeth . “ Why , if [he]96-mr. darcy came only to be silent , grave , and indifferent , ”[88-elizabeth] said [she]88-elizabeth , “ did [he]96-mr. darcy come at all ? ”[88-elizabeth] [She]88-elizabeth could settle it in no way that gave [her]88-elizabeth pleasure . “ [He]96-mr. darcy could be still amiable , still pleasing to [[my]88-elizabeth uncle]721-my uncle and [aunt]1241-aunt , when [he]96-mr. darcy was in [town]268-town ; and why not to [me]88-elizabeth ? If [he]96-mr. darcy fears [me]88-elizabeth , why come hither ? If [he]96-mr. darcy no longer cares for [me]88-elizabeth , why silent ? Teasing , [teasing man]5089-teasing man ! [I]88-elizabeth will think no more about [him]96-mr. darcy . ”[88-elizabeth] [Her]88-elizabeth resolution was for a short time involuntarily kept by the approach of [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , who joined [her]88-elizabeth with a cheerful look which showed [her]88-elizabeth better satisfied with [[their]2730-their visitors]2208-their visitors than [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ Now , ”[88-elizabeth] said [she]88-elizabeth , “ that this first meeting is over , [I]88-elizabeth feel perfectly easy . [I]88-elizabeth know [my]88-elizabeth own strength , and [I]88-elizabeth shall never be embarrassed again by [his]96-mr. darcy coming . [I]88-elizabeth am glad [he]96-mr. darcy dines here on Tuesday . It will then be publicly seen , that on both sides [we]2730-their meet only as [common and indifferent acquaintance]5090-common and indifferent acquaintance . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Yes , very indifferent , indeed , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , laughingly . “ Oh , [Jane]89-jane ! take care . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [[My]88-elizabeth dear]3066-my dear [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , [you]88-elizabeth can not think [me]88-elizabeth so weak as to be in danger now . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]2732-they think [you]88-elizabeth are in very great danger of making [him]85-mr. bingley as much in love with [you]88-elizabeth as ever . ”[2732-they] [They]2732-they did not see [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen again till Tuesday ; and [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , in the meanwhile , was giving way to all the happy schemes which the good - humour and common politeness of [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , in half an hour ’s visit , had revived . On Tuesday there was a large party assembled at [Longbourn]7-longbourn ; and [the two who were most anxiously expected]2734-the two who were most anxiously expected , to the credit of [their]2734-the two who were most anxiously expected punctuality as [sportsmen]2735-sportsmen , were in very good time . When [they]2732-they repaired to [the dining - room]3520-the dining - room , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth eagerly watched to see whether [Bingley]85-mr. bingley would take the place which , in all [their]2732-they former parties , had belonged to [him]85-mr. bingley , by [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister . [[Her]88-elizabeth prudent mother]2738-her prudent mother , occupied by the same ideas , forbore to invite [him]85-mr. bingley to sit by [herself]2738-her prudent mother . On entering [the room]255-the room , [he]85-mr. bingley seemed to hesitate ; but [Jane]89-jane happened to look round , and happened to smile : it was decided . [He]85-mr. bingley placed [himself]85-mr. bingley by [her]89-jane . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , with a triumphant sensation , looked towards [[his]85-mr. bingley friend]288-his friend . [He]85-mr. bingley bore it with noble indifference ; and [she]88-elizabeth would have imagined that [Bingley]85-mr. bingley had received [his]85-mr. bingley sanction to be happy , had [she]88-elizabeth not seen [his]85-mr. bingley eyes likewise turned towards [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , with an expression of half - laughing alarm . [His]85-mr. bingley behaviour to [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister was such during dinnertime as showed an admiration of [her]88-elizabeth , which , though more guarded than formerly , persuaded [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , that , if left wholly to [himself]85-mr. bingley , [Jane]89-jane ’s happiness , and [his]85-mr. bingley own , would be speedily secured . Though [she]88-elizabeth dared not depend upon the consequence , [she]88-elizabeth yet received pleasure from observing [his]85-mr. bingley behaviour . It gave [her]88-elizabeth all the animation that [her]88-elizabeth spirits could boast ; for [she]88-elizabeth was in no cheerful humour . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy was almost as far from [her]88-elizabeth as the table could divide [them]2742-them . [He]96-mr. darcy was on one side of [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother . [She]88-elizabeth knew how little such a situation would give pleasure to either , or make either appear to advantage . [She]88-elizabeth was not near enough to hear any of [their]2742-them discourse ; but [she]88-elizabeth could see how seldom [they]2742-them spoke to [each other]3216-each other , and how formal and cold was [their]2742-them manner whenever [they]2742-them did . [[Her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother ’s ungraciousness made the sense of what [they]2742-them owed [him]96-mr. darcy more painful to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s mind ; and [she]88-elizabeth would , at times , have given anything to be privileged to tell [him]96-mr. darcy , that [his]96-mr. darcy kindness was neither unknown nor unfelt by [the whole of [the family]414-the family]2746-the whole of the family . [She]88-elizabeth was in hopes that the evening would afford some opportunity of bringing [them]2742-them together ; that the whole of the visit would not pass away without enabling [them]2742-them to enter into something more of conversation , than the mere ceremonious salutation attending [his]96-mr. darcy entrance . Anxious and uneasy , the period which passed in [the drawing - room]524-the drawing - room before [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen came , was wearisome and dull to a degree that almost made [her]88-elizabeth uncivil . [She]88-elizabeth looked forward to [their]2742-them entrance as the point on which all [her]88-elizabeth chance of pleasure for the evening must depend . “ If [he]96-mr. darcy does not come to [me]88-elizabeth , then , ”[88-elizabeth] said [she]88-elizabeth , “ [I]88-elizabeth shall give [him]96-mr. darcy up for ever . ”[88-elizabeth] [The gentlemen]292-the gentlemen came ; and [she]88-elizabeth thought [he]96-mr. darcy looked as if [he]96-mr. darcy would have answered [her]88-elizabeth hopes ; but , alas ! [the ladies]254-the ladies had crowded round the table , where [Miss Bennet]90-lydia was making tea , and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth pouring out the coffee , in so close a confederacy , that there was not a single vacancy near [her]88-elizabeth which would admit of a chair . And on [the gentlemen]292-the gentlemen ’s approaching , [one of [the girls]3082-the girls]2753-one of the girls moved closer to [her]88-elizabeth than ever , and said , in a whisper,-- “ [The men]4380-the men sha n’t come and part [us]5093-we , [I]2753-one of the girls am determined . [We]5093-we want [none of [them]4380-the men]5094-none of them ; do [we]5093-we ? ”[2753-one of the girls] [Darcy]96-mr. darcy had walked away to [another part of [the room]255-the room]2755-another part of the room . [She]88-elizabeth followed [him]96-mr. darcy with [her]88-elizabeth eyes , envied everyone to whom [he]96-mr. darcy spoke , had scarcely patience enough to help [anybody]3171-anybody to coffee , and then was enraged against [herself]88-elizabeth for being so silly ! “ [A man who has once been refused]5095-a man who has once been refused ! How could [I]88-elizabeth ever be foolish enough to expect a renewal of [his]5095-a man who has once been refused love ? Is there [one among the sex who would not protest against such a weakness as a second proposal to [the same woman]5097-the same woman]5096-one among the sex who would not protest against such a weakness as a second proposal to the same woman ? There is no indignity so abhorrent to [their]3171-anybody feelings . ”[88-elizabeth] [She]88-elizabeth was a little revived , however , by [his]96-mr. darcy bringing back [his]96-mr. darcy coffee - cup [himself]96-mr. darcy ; and [she]88-elizabeth seized the opportunity of saying,-- “ Is [[your]96-mr. darcy sister]3211-your sister at [Pemberley]12-pemberley still ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Yes ; [she]3211-your sister will remain [there]306-there till Christmas . ”[88-elizabeth] “ And quite alone ? Have all [[her]3211-your sister friends]311-her friends left [her]3211-your sister ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ [Mrs. Annesley]194-mrs. annesley is with [her]3211-your sister . [The others]511-the others have been gone on to [Scarborough]74-scarborough these three weeks . ”[88-elizabeth] [She]88-elizabeth could think of nothing more to say ; but if [he]96-mr. darcy wished to converse with [her]88-elizabeth , [he]96-mr. darcy might have better success . [He]96-mr. darcy stood by [her]88-elizabeth , however , for some minutes , in silence ; and , at last , on [the young lady]2758-the young lady ’s whispering to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth again , [he]96-mr. darcy walked away . When the tea things were removed , and the card tables placed , [the ladies]254-the ladies all rose ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was then hoping to be soon joined by [him]96-mr. darcy , when all [her]88-elizabeth views were overthrown , by seeing [him]96-mr. darcy fall a victim to [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother ’s rapacity for [whist players]2761-whist players , and in a few moments after seated with [the rest of the party]2762-the rest of the party . [She]88-elizabeth now lost every expectation of pleasure . [They]2763-they were confined for the evening at different tables ; and [she]88-elizabeth had nothing to hope , but that [his]96-mr. darcy eyes were so often turned towards [her]88-elizabeth side of [the room]255-the room , as to make [him]96-mr. darcy play as unsuccessfully as [herself]88-elizabeth . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet had designed to keep [the two Netherfield gentlemen]2765-the two netherfield gentlemen to supper ; but [[their]2765-the two netherfield gentlemen carriage]3797-their carriage was , unluckily , ordered before [any of [the others]511-the others]2767-any of the others , and [she]92-mrs. bennet had no opportunity of detaining [them]2765-the two netherfield gentlemen . “ Well , [girls]3124-girls , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [she]92-mrs. bennet , as soon as [they]2765-the two netherfield gentlemen were left to [themselves]2765-the two netherfield gentlemen , “ what say [you]3124-girls to the day ? [I]92-mrs. bennet think everything has passed off uncommonly well , [I]92-mrs. bennet assure [you]3124-girls . The dinner was as well dressed as any [I]92-mrs. bennet ever saw . The venison was roasted to a turn -- and [everybody]305-everybody said , [they]305-everybody never saw so fat a haunch . The soup was fifty times better than what [we]5104-we had at [the Lucases]418-the lucases ’ last week ; and even [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy acknowledged that the partridges were remarkably well done ; and [I]92-mrs. bennet suppose [he]96-mr. darcy has [two or three French cooks]5106-two or three french cooks at least . And , [[my]92-mrs. bennet dear]3066-my dear [Jane]89-jane , [I]92-mrs. bennet never saw [you]89-jane look in greater beauty . [Mrs. Long]82-mrs. long said so too , for [I]92-mrs. bennet asked [her]82-mrs. long whether [you]89-jane did not . And what do [you]89-jane think [she]82-mrs. long said besides ? ‘ Ah ! [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , [we]5104-we shall have [her]82-mrs. long at [Netherfield]2-netherfield at last ! ’ [She]82-mrs. long did , indeed . [I]92-mrs. bennet do think [Mrs. Long]82-mrs. long is as good a creature as ever lived -- and [[her]82-mrs. long nieces]3117-her nieces are [very pretty behaved girls]5109-very pretty behaved girls , and not at all handsome : [I]92-mrs. bennet like [them]3117-her nieces prodigiously . ”[92-mrs. bennet] [ Illustration : “ M^{rs } . [Long]82-mrs. long and [[her]82-mrs. long nieces]3117-her nieces . ”[92-mrs. bennet] ] [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , in short , was in very great spirits : [she]92-mrs. bennet had seen enough of [Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s behaviour to [Jane]89-jane to be convinced that [she]92-mrs. bennet would get [him]85-mr. bingley at last ; and [her]92-mrs. bennet expectations of advantage to [[her]92-mrs. bennet family]3710-her family , when in a happy humour , were so far beyond reason , that [she]92-mrs. bennet was quite disappointed at not seeing [him]85-mr. bingley [there]306-there again the next day , to make [his]85-mr. bingley proposals . “ It has been a very agreeable day , ”[90-lydia] said [Miss Bennet]90-lydia to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ [The party]3132-the party seemed so well selected , so suitable one with [the other]3427-the other . [I]88-elizabeth hope [we]5113-we may often meet again . ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth smiled . “ [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , [you]88-elizabeth must not do so . [You]88-elizabeth must not suspect [me]88-elizabeth . It mortifies [me]88-elizabeth . [I]88-elizabeth assure [you]88-elizabeth that [I]88-elizabeth have now learnt to enjoy [his]85-mr. bingley conversation as [an agreeable and sensible young man]5114-an agreeable and sensible young man without having a wish beyond it . [I]88-elizabeth am perfectly satisfied , from what [his]85-mr. bingley manners now are , that [he]85-mr. bingley never had any design of engaging [my]88-elizabeth affection . It is only that [he]85-mr. bingley is blessed with greater sweetness of address , and a stronger desire of generally pleasing , than [any other man]5115-any other man . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [You]88-elizabeth are very cruel , ”[328-her sister] said [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , “ [you]88-elizabeth will not let [me]328-her sister smile , and are provoking [me]328-her sister to it every moment . ”[328-her sister] “ How hard it is in some cases to be believed ! And how impossible in others ! But why should [you]88-elizabeth wish to persuade [me]88-elizabeth that [I]88-elizabeth feel more than [I]88-elizabeth acknowledge ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ That is a question which [I]328-her sister hardly know how to answer . [We]5116-we all love to instruct , though [we]5116-we can teach only what is not worth knowing . Forgive [me]328-her sister ; and if [you]88-elizabeth persist in indifference , do not make [me]328-her sister [[your]88-elizabeth confidante]5117-your confidante . ”[328-her sister] [ Illustration : “ [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , [[my]328-her sister dear]3066-my dear , [I]328-her sister want to speak to [you]88-elizabeth . ”[328-her sister] ] [CHAPTER LV]75-chapter lv . [ Illustration ] A few days after this visit , [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley called again , and alone . [[His]85-mr. bingley friend]288-his friend had left [him]85-mr. bingley that morning for [London]5-london , but was to return [home]3288-home in ten days ’ time . [He]85-mr. bingley sat with [them]288-his friend above an hour , and was in remarkably good spirits . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet invited [him]85-mr. bingley to dine with [them]288-his friend ; but , with many expressions of concern , [he]85-mr. bingley confessed [himself]85-mr. bingley engaged elsewhere . “ Next time [you]85-mr. bingley call , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [she]92-mrs. bennet , “ [I]92-mrs. bennet hope [we]288-his friend shall be more lucky . ”[92-mrs. bennet] [He]85-mr. bingley should be particularly happy at any time , etc . , etc . ; and if [she]92-mrs. bennet would give [him]85-mr. bingley leave , would take an early opportunity of waiting on [them]288-his friend . “ Can [you]85-mr. bingley come to - morrow ? ”[92-mrs. bennet] Yes , [he]85-mr. bingley had no engagement at all for to - morrow ; and [her]92-mrs. bennet invitation was accepted with alacrity . [He]85-mr. bingley came , and in such very good time , that [the ladies]254-the ladies were none of [them]254-the ladies dressed . In ran [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet to [[[her]92-mrs. bennet daughters]242-her daughters ’ room]2776-her daughters ’ room , in [her]92-mrs. bennet dressing - gown , and with [her]92-mrs. bennet hair half finished , crying out,-- “ [[My]92-mrs. bennet dear]3066-my dear [Jane]89-jane , make haste and hurry down . [He]85-mr. bingley is come -- [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley is come . [He]85-mr. bingley is , indeed . Make haste , make haste . Here , [Sarah]206-sally , come to [Miss Bennet]90-lydia this moment , and help [her]90-lydia on with [her]90-lydia gown . Never mind [Miss Lizzy]88-elizabeth ’s hair . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ [We]5120-we will be down as soon as [we]5120-we can , ”[89-jane] said [Jane]89-jane ; “ but [I]89-jane dare say [Kitty]93-lady catherine is forwarder than either of [us]5120-we , for [she]93-lady catherine went [upstairs]3537-upstairs half an hour ago . ”[89-jane] “ Oh ! hang [Kitty]93-lady catherine ! what has [she]93-lady catherine to do with it ? Come , be quick , be quick ! where is [your]89-jane sash , [[my]89-jane dear]3066-my dear ? ”[89-jane] But when [[her]89-jane mother]246-her mother was gone , [Jane]89-jane would not be prevailed on to go down without [one of [[her]89-jane sisters]3096-her sisters]2778-one of her sisters . The same anxiety to get [them]3096-her sisters by [themselves]3096-her sisters was visible again in the evening . After tea , [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet retired to [the library]3825-the library , as was [his]81-mr. bennet custom , and [Mary]94-mary went [upstairs]3537-upstairs to [her]94-mary instrument . Two obstacles of the five being thus removed , [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet sat looking and winking at [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth and [Catherine]93-lady catherine for a considerable time , without making any impression on [them]3096-her sisters .
