[Elizabeth]88-elizabeth would not observe [her]246-her mother ; and when at last [Kitty]93-lady catherine did , [she]93-lady catherine very innocently said , “ What is the matter , [mamma]3106-mamma ? What do [you]3106-mamma keep winking at [me]93-lady catherine for ? What am [I]93-lady catherine to do ? ”[93-lady catherine] “ Nothing , [child]926-child , nothing . [I]93-lady catherine did not wink at [you]3106-mamma . ”[93-lady catherine] [She]88-elizabeth then sat still five minutes longer ; but unable to waste such a precious occasion , [she]88-elizabeth suddenly got up , and saying to [Kitty,--]223-kitty,-- “ Come here , [[my]88-elizabeth love]3127-my love , [I]88-elizabeth want to speak to [you]3106-mamma , ”[88-elizabeth] took [her]88-elizabeth out of [the room]255-the room . [Jane]89-jane instantly gave a look at [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth which spoke [her]89-jane distress at such premeditation , and [her]89-jane entreaty that [she]89-jane would not give in to it . In a few minutes , [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet half opened the door and called out,-- “ [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , [[my]92-mrs. bennet dear]3066-my dear , [I]92-mrs. bennet want to speak with [you]88-elizabeth . ”[92-mrs. bennet] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was forced to go . “ [We]5127-we may as well leave [them]5128-them by [themselves]5128-them , [you]88-elizabeth know , ”[246-her mother] said [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother as soon as [she]246-her mother was in [the hall]3519-the hall . “ [Kitty]93-lady catherine and [I]246-her mother are going [upstairs]3537-upstairs to sit in [[my]246-her mother dressing - room]5130-my dressing - room . ”[246-her mother] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth made no attempt to reason with [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother , but remained quietly in [the hall]3519-the hall till [she]88-elizabeth and [Kitty]93-lady catherine were out of sight , then returned into [the drawing - room]524-the drawing - room . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet ’s schemes for this day were ineffectual . [Bingley]85-mr. bingley was everything that was charming , except [the professed lover of [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughter]461-her daughter]2788-the professed lover of her daughter . [His]85-mr. bingley ease and cheerfulness rendered [him]85-mr. bingley a most agreeable addition to [their]2790-their evening party ; and [he]85-mr. bingley bore with the ill - judged officiousness of [the mother]393-the mother , and heard all [her]393-the mother silly remarks with a forbearance and command of countenance particularly grateful to [the daughter]1371-the daughter . [He]85-mr. bingley scarcely needed an invitation to stay supper ; and before [he]85-mr. bingley went away an engagement was formed , chiefly through [his]85-mr. bingley own and [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet ’s means , for [his]85-mr. bingley coming next morning to shoot with [[her]92-mrs. bennet husband]260-her husband . After this day , [Jane]89-jane said no more of [her]89-jane indifference . Not a word passed between [the sisters]496-the sisters concerning [Bingley]85-mr. bingley ; but [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth went to bed in the happy belief that all must speedily be concluded , unless [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy returned within the stated time . Seriously , however , [she]88-elizabeth felt tolerably persuaded that all this must have taken place with [that gentleman]3371-that gentleman ’s concurrence . [Bingley]85-mr. bingley was punctual to [his]85-mr. bingley appointment ; and [he]85-mr. bingley and [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet spent the morning together , as had been agreed on . [The latter]491-the latter was much more agreeable than [[his]85-mr. bingley companion]423-his companion expected . There was nothing of presumption or folly in [Bingley]85-mr. bingley that could provoke [his]85-mr. bingley ridicule , or disgust [him]85-mr. bingley into silence ; and [he]85-mr. bingley was more communicative , and less eccentric , than [the other]3427-the other had ever seen [him]85-mr. bingley . [Bingley]85-mr. bingley of course returned with [him]85-mr. bingley to dinner ; and in the evening [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet ’s invention was again at work to get [everybody]305-everybody away from [him]85-mr. bingley and [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughter]461-her daughter . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , who had a letter to write , went into [the breakfast - room]3821-the breakfast - room for that purpose soon after tea ; for as [the others]511-the others were all going to sit down to cards , [she]88-elizabeth could not be wanted to counteract [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother ’s schemes . But on [her]88-elizabeth returning to [the drawing - room]524-the drawing - room , when [her]88-elizabeth letter was finished , [she]88-elizabeth saw , to [her]88-elizabeth infinite surprise , there was reason to fear that [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother had been too ingenious for [her]88-elizabeth . On opening the door , [she]88-elizabeth perceived [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister and [Bingley]85-mr. bingley standing together over the hearth , as if engaged in earnest conversation ; and had this led to no suspicion , the faces of both , as [they]2807-they hastily turned round and moved away from [each other]3216-each other , would have told it all . [Their]2807-they situation was awkward enough ; but [hers]88-elizabeth [she]88-elizabeth thought was still worse . Not a syllable was uttered by either ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was on the point of going away again , when [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , who as well as [the other]3427-the other had sat down , suddenly rose , and , whispering a few words to [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , ran out of [the room]255-the room . [Jane]89-jane could have no reserves from [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , where confidence would give pleasure ; and , instantly embracing [her]88-elizabeth , acknowledged , with the liveliest emotion , that [she]88-elizabeth was [the happiest creature in [the world]304-the world]2812-the happiest creature in the world . “ ’ Tis too much ! ”[89-jane] [she]89-jane added , “ by far too much . [I]89-jane do not deserve it . Oh , why is not [everybody]305-everybody as happy ? ”[89-jane] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s congratulations were given with a sincerity , a warmth , a delight , which words could but poorly express . Every sentence of kindness was a fresh source of happiness to [Jane]89-jane . But [she]88-elizabeth would not allow [herself]88-elizabeth to stay with [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister , or say half that remained to be said , for the present . “ [I]88-elizabeth must go instantly to [[my]88-elizabeth mother]3295-my mother , ”[88-elizabeth] [she]88-elizabeth cried . “ [I]88-elizabeth would not on any account trifle with [her]3295-my mother affectionate solicitude , or allow [her]3295-my mother to hear it from [[anyone]3174-anyone but [myself]88-elizabeth]5134-anyone but myself . [He]5135-he is gone to [[my]88-elizabeth father]3323-my father already . Oh , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , to know that what [I]88-elizabeth have to relate will give such pleasure to all [[my]88-elizabeth dear family]5137-my dear family ! how shall [I]88-elizabeth bear so much happiness ? ”[88-elizabeth] [She]88-elizabeth then hastened away to [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother , who had purposely broken up the card - party , and was sitting [upstairs]3537-upstairs with [Kitty]93-lady catherine . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , who was left by [herself]88-elizabeth , now smiled at the rapidity and ease with which an affair was finally settled , that had given [them]2817-them so many previous months of suspense and vexation . “ And this , ”[88-elizabeth] said [she]88-elizabeth , “ is the end of all [[his]85-mr. bingley friend]288-his friend ’s anxious circumspection ! of all [[his]85-mr. bingley sister]565-his sister ’s falsehood and contrivance ! the happiest , wisest , and most reasonable end ! ”[88-elizabeth] In a few minutes [she]88-elizabeth was joined by [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , whose conference with [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father had been short and to the purpose . “ Where is [[your]88-elizabeth sister]3211-your sister ? ”[85-mr. bingley] said [he]85-mr. bingley hastily , as [he]85-mr. bingley opened the door . “ With [[my]85-mr. bingley mother]3295-my mother [upstairs]3537-upstairs . [She]3211-your sister will be down in a moment , [I]85-mr. bingley dare say . ”[85-mr. bingley] [He]85-mr. bingley then shut the door , and , coming up to [her]88-elizabeth , claimed the good wishes and affection of [a sister]436-a sister . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth honestly and heartily expressed [her]88-elizabeth delight in the prospect of [their]2820-their relationship . [They]2820-their shook hands with great cordiality ; and then , till [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister came down , [she]88-elizabeth had to listen to all [he]85-mr. bingley had to say of [his]85-mr. bingley own happiness , and of [Jane]89-jane ’s perfections ; and in spite of [his]85-mr. bingley being [a lover]2822-a lover , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth really believed all [his]85-mr. bingley expectations of felicity to be rationally founded , because [they]2823-they had for basis the excellent understanding and super - excellent disposition of [Jane]89-jane , and a general similarity of feeling and taste between [her]89-jane and [himself]85-mr. bingley . It was an evening of no common delight to [them]2820-their all ; the satisfaction of [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth ’s mind gave such a glow of sweet animation to [her]88-elizabeth face , as made [her]88-elizabeth look handsomer than ever . [Kitty]93-lady catherine simpered and smiled , and hoped [her]93-lady catherine turn was coming soon . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet could not give [her]92-mrs. bennet consent , or speak [her]92-mrs. bennet approbation in terms warm enough to satisfy [her]92-mrs. bennet feelings , though [she]92-mrs. bennet talked to [Bingley]85-mr. bingley of nothing else , for half an hour ; and when [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet joined [them]2820-their at supper , [his]81-mr. bennet voice and manner plainly showed how really happy [he]81-mr. bennet was . Not a word , however , passed [his]81-mr. bennet lips in allusion to it , till [[their]2820-their visitor]1549-their visitor took [his]81-mr. bennet leave for the night ; but as soon as [he]81-mr. bennet was gone , [he]81-mr. bennet turned to [[his]81-mr. bennet daughter]3923-his daughter and said,-- “ [Jane]89-jane , [I]81-mr. bennet congratulate [you]89-jane . [You]89-jane will be [a very happy woman]5143-a very happy woman . ”[81-mr. bennet] [Jane]89-jane went to [him]81-mr. bennet instantly , kissed [him]81-mr. bennet , and thanked [him]81-mr. bennet for [his]81-mr. bennet goodness . “ [You]89-jane are [a good girl]2468-a good girl , ”[81-mr. bennet] [he]81-mr. bennet replied , “ and [I]81-mr. bennet have great pleasure in thinking [you]89-jane will be so happily settled . [I]81-mr. bennet have not a doubt of [your]89-jane doing very well together . [Your]89-jane tempers are by no means unlike . [You]89-jane are each of [you]89-jane so complying , that nothing will ever be resolved on ; so easy , that [every servant]5145-every servant will cheat [you]89-jane ; and so generous , that [you]89-jane will always exceed [your]89-jane income . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ [I]236-his wife hope not so . Imprudence or thoughtlessness in money matters would be unpardonable in [me]236-his wife . ”[236-his wife] “ Exceed [their]5146-their income ! [[My]236-his wife dear]3066-my dear [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet , ”[236-his wife] cried [[his]81-mr. bennet wife]236-his wife , “ what are [you]81-mr. bennet talking of ? Why , [he]81-mr. bennet has four or five thousand a year , and very likely more . ”[236-his wife] Then addressing [[her]236-his wife daughter]461-her daughter , “ Oh , [[my]236-his wife dear]3066-my dear , dear [Jane]89-jane , [I]236-his wife am so happy ! [I]236-his wife am sure [I]236-his wife sha n’t get a wink of sleep all night . [I]236-his wife knew how it would be . [I]236-his wife always said it must be so , at last . [I]236-his wife was sure [you]89-jane could not be so beautiful for nothing ! [I]236-his wife remember , as soon as ever [I]236-his wife saw [him]81-mr. bennet , when [he]81-mr. bennet first came into [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire last year , [I]236-his wife thought how likely it was that [you]89-jane should come together . Oh , [he]81-mr. bennet is [the handsomest young man that ever was seen]5149-the handsomest young man that ever was seen ! ”[236-his wife] [Wickham]149-george wickham , [Lydia]90-lydia , were all forgotten . [Jane]89-jane was beyond competition [[her]89-jane favourite child]2828-her favourite child . At that moment [she]89-jane cared for [no other]2360-no other . [[Her]89-jane younger sisters]416-her younger sisters soon began to make interest with [her]89-jane for objects of happiness which [she]89-jane might in future be able to dispense . [Mary]94-mary petitioned for the use of [the library at [Netherfield]2-netherfield]2831-the library at netherfield ; and [Kitty]93-lady catherine begged very hard for a few balls [there]306-there every winter . [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , from this time , was of course [a daily visitor at [Longbourn]7-longbourn]2833-a daily visitor at longbourn ; coming frequently before breakfast , and always remaining till after supper ; unless when [some barbarous neighbour , who could not be enough detested]2834-some barbarous neighbour , who could not be enough detested , had given [him]85-mr. bingley an invitation to dinner , which [he]85-mr. bingley thought [himself]85-mr. bingley obliged to accept . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had now but little time for conversation with [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister ; for while [he]85-mr. bingley was present [Jane]89-jane had no attention to bestow on [anyone else]3412-anyone else : but [she]89-jane found [herself]89-jane considerably useful to both of [them]2837-them , in those hours of separation that must sometimes occur . In the absence of [Jane]89-jane , [he]85-mr. bingley always attached [himself]85-mr. bingley to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth for the pleasure of talking of [her]88-elizabeth ; and when [Bingley]85-mr. bingley was gone , [Jane]89-jane constantly sought the same means of relief . “ [He]85-mr. bingley has made [me]89-jane so happy , ”[89-jane] said [she]89-jane , one evening , “ by telling [me]89-jane that [he]85-mr. bingley was totally ignorant of [my]89-jane being in [town]268-town last spring ! [I]89-jane had not believed it possible . ”[89-jane] “ [I]88-elizabeth suspected as much , ”[88-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ But how did [he]85-mr. bingley account for it ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ It must have been [[his]85-mr. bingley sisters]284-his sisters ’ doing . [They]284-his sisters were certainly no friends to [his]85-mr. bingley acquaintance with [me]89-jane , which [I]89-jane can not wonder at , since [he]85-mr. bingley might have chosen so much more advantageously in many respects . But when [they]284-his sisters see , as [I]89-jane trust [they]284-his sisters will , that [[their]284-his sisters brother]338-their brother is happy with [me]89-jane , [they]284-his sisters will learn to be contented , and [we]5153-we shall be on good terms again : though [we]5153-we can never be what [we]5153-we once were to [each other]3216-each other . ”[89-jane] “ That is the most unforgiving speech , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ that [I]88-elizabeth ever heard [you]89-jane utter . [Good girl]5155-good girl ! It would vex [me]88-elizabeth , indeed , to see [you]89-jane again the dupe of [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s pretended regard . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Would [you]89-jane believe it , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , that when [he]2838-he went to [town]268-town last November [he]2838-he really loved [me]89-jane , and nothing but a persuasion of [my]89-jane being indifferent would have prevented [his]2838-he coming down again ? ”[89-jane] “ [He]2838-he made a little mistake , to be sure ; but it is to the credit of [his]2838-he modesty . ”[88-elizabeth] This naturally introduced a panegyric from [Jane]89-jane on [his]2838-he diffidence , and the little value [he]2838-he put on [his]2838-he own good qualities . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was pleased to find that [he]2838-he had not betrayed the interference of [[his]2838-he friend]288-his friend ; for , though [Jane]89-jane had the most generous and forgiving heart in [the world]304-the world , [she]89-jane knew it was a circumstance which must prejudice [her]89-jane against [him]2838-he . “ [I]89-jane am certainly [the most fortunate creature that ever existed]5157-the most fortunate creature that ever existed ! ”[89-jane] cried [Jane]89-jane . “ Oh , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , why am [I]89-jane thus singled from [[my]89-jane family]979-my family , and blessed above [them]979-my family all ? If [I]89-jane could but see [you]88-elizabeth as happy ! If there were but such another man for [you]88-elizabeth ! ”[89-jane] “ If [you]88-elizabeth were to give [me]92-mrs. bennet forty [such men]5159-such men [I]92-mrs. bennet never could be so happy as [you]88-elizabeth . Till [I]92-mrs. bennet have [your]88-elizabeth disposition , [your]88-elizabeth goodness , [I]92-mrs. bennet never can have [your]88-elizabeth happiness . No , no , let [me]92-mrs. bennet shift for [myself]92-mrs. bennet ; and , perhaps , if [I]92-mrs. bennet have very good luck , [I]92-mrs. bennet may meet with another [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins in time . ”[92-mrs. bennet] The situation of affairs in [the Longbourn family]3558-the longbourn family could not be long a secret . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet was privileged to whisper it to [Mrs. Philips]117-mrs. philips , and [she]92-mrs. bennet ventured , without any permission , to do the same by all [[her]92-mrs. bennet neighbours]3652-her neighbours in [Meryton]9-meryton . [The Bennets]105-the bennets were speedily pronounced to be [the luckiest family in [the world]304-the world]2843-the luckiest family in the world ; though only a few weeks before , when [Lydia]90-lydia had first run away , [they]105-the bennets had been generally proved to be marked out for misfortune . [ Illustration ] CHAPTER LVI . [ Illustration ] One morning , about a week after [Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s engagement with [Jane]89-jane had been formed , as [he]2845-he and [the females of [the family]414-the family]2846-the females of the family were sitting together in [the dining - room]3520-the dining - room , [their]105-the bennets attention was suddenly drawn to the window by the sound of [a carriage]3195-a carriage ; and [they]105-the bennets perceived a chaise and four driving up [the lawn]2050-the lawn . It was too early in the morning for [visitors]3943-visitors ; and besides , the equipage did not answer to that of [any of [[their]105-the bennets neighbours]2853-their neighbours]2852-any of their neighbours . The horses were post ; and neither [the carriage]3286-the carriage , nor the livery of [the servant who preceded it]2855-the servant who preceded it , were familiar to [them]105-the bennets . As it was certain , however , that [somebody]837-somebody was coming , [Bingley]98-miss bingley instantly prevailed on [Miss Bennet]90-lydia to avoid the confinement of such an intrusion , and walk away with [him]2845-he into [the shrubbery]2857-the shrubbery . [They]105-the bennets both set off ; and the conjectures of [the remaining three]2858-the remaining three continued , though with little satisfaction , till the door was thrown open , and [[their]105-the bennets visitor]1549-their visitor entered . It was [Lady Catherine de Bourgh]93-lady catherine . [They]105-the bennets were of course all intending to be surprised : but [their]105-the bennets astonishment was beyond [their]105-the bennets expectation ; and on the part of [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet and [Kitty]93-lady catherine , though [she]93-lady catherine was perfectly unknown to [them]105-the bennets , even inferior to what [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth felt . [She]93-lady catherine entered [the room]255-the room with an air more than usually ungracious , made no other reply to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s salutation than a slight inclination of the head , and sat down without saying a word . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had mentioned [her]88-elizabeth name to [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother on [her]88-elizabeth Ladyship ’s entrance , though no request of introduction had been made . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , all amazement , though flattered by having [a guest of such high importance]2862-a guest of such high importance , received [her]88-elizabeth with the utmost politeness . After sitting for a moment in silence , [she]92-mrs. bennet said , very stiffly , to [Elizabeth,--]168-elizabeth,-- “ [I]88-elizabeth hope [you]88-elizabeth are well , [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth . [That lady]2245-that lady , [I]88-elizabeth suppose , is [[your]88-elizabeth mother]967-your mother ? ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth replied very concisely that [she]88-elizabeth was . “ And that , [I]92-mrs. bennet suppose , is [one of [[your]88-elizabeth sisters]3134-your sisters]2466-one of your sisters ? ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ Yes , [madam]3346-madam , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , delighted to speak to [a Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine . “ [She]93-lady catherine is [[my]92-mrs. bennet youngest girl]5165-my youngest girl but one . [[My]92-mrs. bennet youngest of all]5166-my youngest of all is lately married , and [[my]92-mrs. bennet eldest]5167-my eldest is somewhere about the ground , walking with [a young man , who , [I]92-mrs. bennet believe , will soon become a part of [the family]414-the family]5168-a young man , who , i believe , will soon become a part of the family . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ [You]3346-madam have [a very small park]5170-a very small park [here]3067-here , ”[93-lady catherine] returned [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , after a short silence . “ It is nothing in comparison of [Rosings]18-rosings , [[my]93-lady catherine Lady]5172-my lady , [I]93-lady catherine dare say ; but , [I]93-lady catherine assure [you]92-mrs. bennet , it is much larger than [Sir William Lucas]86-sir william ’s . ”[93-lady catherine] “ This must be a most inconvenient sitting - room for the evening in summer : the windows are full west . ”[92-mrs. bennet] [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet assured [her]92-mrs. bennet that [they]2863-they never sat [there]306-there after dinner ; and then added,-- “ May [I]92-mrs. bennet take the liberty of asking [[your]88-elizabeth Ladyship]4164-your ladyship whether [you]88-elizabeth left [Mr.]5174-mr. and [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins well ? ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ Yes , very well . [I]92-mrs. bennet saw [them]2863-they the night before last . ”[92-mrs. bennet] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth now expected that [she]88-elizabeth would produce a letter for [her]88-elizabeth from [Charlotte]180-charlotte , as it seemed the only probable motive for [her]88-elizabeth calling . But no letter appeared , and [she]88-elizabeth was completely puzzled . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , with great civility , begged [[her]92-mrs. bennet Ladyship]3490-her ladyship to take some refreshment : but [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine very resolutely , and not very politely , declined eating anything ; and then , rising up , said to [Elizabeth,--]168-elizabeth,-- “ [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , there seemed to be a prettyish kind of a little wilderness on one side of [[your]88-elizabeth lawn]5175-your lawn . [I]168-elizabeth,-- should be glad to take a turn in it , if [you]88-elizabeth will favour [me]168-elizabeth,-- with [your]88-elizabeth company . ”[168-elizabeth,--] “ Go , [[my]246-her mother dear]3066-my dear , ”[246-her mother] cried [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother , “ and show [her]93-lady catherine [Ladyship]176-ladyship about the different walks . [I]88-elizabeth think [she]93-lady catherine will be pleased with the hermitage . ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth obeyed ; and , running into [[her]88-elizabeth own room]1548-her own room for [her]88-elizabeth parasol , attended [[her]88-elizabeth noble guest]2868-her noble guest [downstairs]2367-downstairs . As [they]2870-they passed through [the hall]3519-the hall , [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine opened the doors into [the dining - parlour]522-the dining - parlour and drawing - room , and pronouncing [them]2873-them , after a short survey , to be [decent - looking rooms]2874-decent - looking rooms , walked on . [[Her]88-elizabeth carriage]2875-her carriage remained at the door , and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth saw that [[her]88-elizabeth waiting - woman]2876-her waiting - woman was in [it]2875-her carriage . [They]2870-they proceeded in silence along [the gravel walk that led to [the copse]2878-the copse]2877-the gravel walk that led to the copse ; [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was determined to make no effort for conversation with [a woman who was now more than usually insolent and disagreeable]2879-a woman who was now more than usually insolent and disagreeable . [ Illustration : “ After a short survey ”[88-elizabeth] “ How could [I]88-elizabeth ever think [her]2876-her waiting - woman like [[her]2876-her waiting - woman nephew]827-her nephew ? ”[88-elizabeth] said [she]88-elizabeth , as [she]88-elizabeth looked in [her]88-elizabeth face . As soon as [they]2870-they entered [the copse]2878-the copse , [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine began in the following manner - “ [You]88-elizabeth can be at no loss , [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , to understand the reason of [my]93-lady catherine journey hither . [Your]88-elizabeth own heart , [your]88-elizabeth own conscience , must tell [you]88-elizabeth why [I]93-lady catherine come . ”[93-lady catherine] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth looked with unaffected astonishment . “ Indeed , [you]88-elizabeth are mistaken , [madam]3346-madam ; [I]88-elizabeth have not been at all able to account for the honour of seeing [you]88-elizabeth here . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , ”[3490-her ladyship] replied [[her]88-elizabeth Ladyship]3490-her ladyship , in an angry tone , “ [you]88-elizabeth ought to know that [I]3490-her ladyship am not to be trifled with . But however insincere [you]88-elizabeth may choose to be , [you]88-elizabeth shall not find [me]3490-her ladyship so . [My]3490-her ladyship character has ever been celebrated for its sincerity and frankness ; and in a cause of such moment as this , [I]3490-her ladyship shall certainly not depart from it . A report of a most alarming nature reached [me]3490-her ladyship two days ago . [I]3490-her ladyship was told , that not only [[your]88-elizabeth sister]3211-your sister was on the point of being most advantageously married , but that [you]88-elizabeth -- that [Miss Elizabeth Bennet]88-elizabeth would , in all likelihood , be soon afterwards united to [[my]3490-her ladyship nephew]5180-my nephew -- [[my]3490-her ladyship own nephew]5181-my own nephew , [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy . Though [I]3490-her ladyship know it must be a scandalous falsehood , though [I]3490-her ladyship would not injure [him]96-mr. darcy so much as to suppose the truth of it possible , [I]3490-her ladyship instantly resolved on setting off for [this place]4466-this place , that [I]3490-her ladyship might make [my]3490-her ladyship sentiments known to [you]88-elizabeth . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ If [you]88-elizabeth believed it impossible to be true , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , colouring with astonishment and disdain , “ [I]88-elizabeth wonder [you]88-elizabeth took the trouble of coming so far . What could [[your]88-elizabeth Ladyship]4164-your ladyship propose by it ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ At once to insist upon having such a report universally contradicted . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ [Your]88-elizabeth coming to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , to see [me]88-elizabeth and [[my]88-elizabeth family]979-my family , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth coolly , “ will be rather a confirmation of it -- if , indeed , such a report is in existence . ”[88-elizabeth] “ If ! do [you]88-elizabeth then pretend to be ignorant of it ? Has it not been industriously circulated by [yourselves]88-elizabeth ? Do [you]88-elizabeth not know that such a report is spread abroad ? ”[3490-her ladyship] “ [I]3490-her ladyship never heard that it was . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ And can [you]88-elizabeth likewise declare , that there is no foundation for it ? ”[3490-her ladyship] “ [I]3490-her ladyship do not pretend to possess equal frankness with [[your]88-elizabeth Ladyship]4164-your ladyship . [You]88-elizabeth may ask questions which [I]3490-her ladyship shall not choose to answer . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ This is not to be borne . [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , [I]3490-her ladyship insist on being satisfied . Has [he]5186-his , has [[my]3490-her ladyship nephew]5180-my nephew , made [you]88-elizabeth an offer of marriage ? ”[3490-her ladyship] “ [[Your]88-elizabeth Ladyship]4164-your ladyship has declared it to be impossible . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ It ought to be so ; it must be so , while [he]5186-his retains the use of [his]5186-his reason . But [your]88-elizabeth arts and allurements may , in a moment of infatuation , have made [him]5186-his forget what [he]5186-his owes to [himself]5186-his and to [all [his]5186-his family]5189-all his family . [You]88-elizabeth may have drawn [him]5186-his in . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ If [I]3490-her ladyship have , [I]3490-her ladyship shall be [the last person to confess it]5190-the last person to confess it . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , do [you]88-elizabeth know who [I]3490-her ladyship am ? [I]3490-her ladyship have not been accustomed to such language as this . [I]3490-her ladyship am almost [the nearest relation [he]5186-his has in [the world]304-the world]5191-the nearest relation he has in the world , and am entitled to know all [his]5186-his dearest concerns . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ But [you]88-elizabeth are not entitled to know [mine]3490-her ladyship ; nor will such behaviour as this ever induce [me]3490-her ladyship to be explicit . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ Let [me]3490-her ladyship be rightly understood . This match , to which [you]88-elizabeth have the presumption to aspire , can never take place . No , never . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy is engaged to [[my]3490-her ladyship daughter]4415-my daughter . Now , what have [you]88-elizabeth to say ? ”[3490-her ladyship] “ Only this,--that if [he]96-mr. darcy is so , [you]88-elizabeth can have no reason to suppose [he]96-mr. darcy will make an offer to [me]93-lady catherine . ”[93-lady catherine] [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine hesitated for a moment , and then replied,-- “ The engagement between [them]5194-their is of a peculiar kind . From [their]5194-their infancy , [they]5194-their have been intended for [each other]3216-each other . It was the favourite wish of [[his]5186-his mother]5196-his mother , as well as of [hers]5196-his mother . While in [their]5194-their cradles [we]5197-we planned the union ; and now , at the moment when the wishes of [both sisters]2695-both sisters would be accomplished , is [their]5194-their marriage to be prevented by [a young woman of inferior birth]5199-a young woman of inferior birth , of no importance in [the world]304-the world , and wholly unallied to [the family]414-the family ? Do [you]88-elizabeth pay no regard to the wishes of [[his]5186-his friends]405-his friends -- to [his]5186-his tacit engagement with [Miss de Bourgh]138-miss de bourgh ? Are [you]88-elizabeth lost to every feeling of propriety and delicacy ? Have [you]88-elizabeth not heard [me]93-lady catherine say , that from [his]5186-his earliest hours [he]5186-his was destined for [[his]5186-his cousin]3538-his cousin ? ”[93-lady catherine] “ Yes ; and [I]3490-her ladyship had heard it before . But what is that to [me]3490-her ladyship ? If there is no other objection to [my]3490-her ladyship marrying [[your]88-elizabeth nephew]5204-your nephew , [I]3490-her ladyship shall certainly not be kept from it by knowing that [[his]5186-his mother]5196-his mother and [aunt]1241-aunt wished [him]5186-his to marry [Miss de Bourgh]138-miss de bourgh . [You]88-elizabeth both did as much as [you]88-elizabeth could in planning the marriage . Its completion depended on [others]3175-others . If [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy is neither by honour nor inclination confined to [[his]96-mr. darcy cousin]3538-his cousin , why is not [he]96-mr. darcy to make another choice ? And if [I]3490-her ladyship am that choice , why may not [I]3490-her ladyship accept [him]96-mr. darcy ? ”[3490-her ladyship] “ Because honour , decorum , prudence -- nay , interest -- forbid it . Yes , [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , interest ; for do not expect to be noticed by [[his]96-mr. darcy family]373-his family or [friends]1046-friends , if [you]88-elizabeth wilfully act against the inclinations of all . [You]88-elizabeth will be censured , slighted , and despised , by [everyone connected with [him]96-mr. darcy]828-everyone connected with him . [Your]88-elizabeth alliance will be a disgrace ; [your]88-elizabeth name will never even be mentioned by any of [us]5212-us . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ These are heavy misfortunes , ”[88-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ But [the wife of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy]5213-the wife of mr. darcy must have such extraordinary sources of happiness necessarily attached to [her]5213-the wife of mr. darcy situation , that [she]5213-the wife of mr. darcy could , upon the whole , have no cause to repine . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [Obstinate , headstrong girl]5214-obstinate , headstrong girl ! [I]3490-her ladyship am ashamed of [you]88-elizabeth ! Is this [your]88-elizabeth gratitude for [my]3490-her ladyship attentions to [you]88-elizabeth last spring ? Is nothing due to [me]3490-her ladyship on that score ? Let [us]5212-us sit down . [You]88-elizabeth are to understand , [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , that [I]3490-her ladyship came here with the determined resolution of carrying [my]3490-her ladyship purpose ; nor will [I]3490-her ladyship be dissuaded from it . [I]3490-her ladyship have not been used to submit to [any person]4675-any person ’s whims . [I]3490-her ladyship have not been in the habit of brooking disappointment . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ That will make [[your]88-elizabeth Ladyship]4164-your ladyship ’s situation at present more pitiable ; but it will have no effect on [me]3490-her ladyship . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ [I]88-elizabeth will not be interrupted ! Hear [me]88-elizabeth in silence . [[My]88-elizabeth daughter]4415-my daughter and [[my]88-elizabeth nephew]5180-my nephew are formed for each other . [They]5219-they are descended , on the maternal side , from [the same noble line]5220-the same noble line ; and , on [the father]265-the father ’s , from respectable , honourable , and ancient , though untitled , [families]4146-families . [Their]5219-they fortune on both sides is splendid . [They]5219-they are destined for each other by the voice of [every member of [[their]5219-they respective houses]5224-their respective houses]5223-every member of their respective houses ; and what is to divide [them]5219-they -the upstart pretensions of [a young woman without family , connections , or fortune]5225-a young woman without family , connections , or fortune ! Is this to be endured ? But it must not , shall not be ! If [you]88-elizabeth were sensible of [your]88-elizabeth own good , [you]88-elizabeth would not wish to quit the sphere in which [you]88-elizabeth have been brought up . ”[88-elizabeth] “ In marrying [[your]88-elizabeth nephew]5204-your nephew , [I]3490-her ladyship should not consider [myself]3490-her ladyship as quitting that sphere . [He]5204-your nephew is [a gentleman]3470-a gentleman ; [I]3490-her ladyship am [[a gentleman]3470-a gentleman ’s daughter]5229-a gentleman ’s daughter ; so far [we]5230-we are equal . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ True . [You]3490-her ladyship are [[a gentleman]3470-a gentleman ’s daughter]5229-a gentleman ’s daughter . But what was [[your]3490-her ladyship mother]967-your mother ? Who are [[your]3490-her ladyship uncles]5234-your uncles and [aunts]5235-aunts ? Do not imagine [me]3490-her ladyship ignorant of [their]5236-their condition . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ Whatever [my]88-elizabeth connections may be , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ if [[your]88-elizabeth nephew]5204-your nephew does not object to [them]5236-their , [they]5236-their can be nothing to [you]88-elizabeth . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Tell [me]3490-her ladyship , once for all , are [you]3490-her ladyship engaged to [him]5204-your nephew ? ”[3490-her ladyship] Though [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth would not , for the mere purpose of obliging [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , have answered this question , [she]88-elizabeth could not but say , after a moment ’s deliberation,-- “ [I]93-lady catherine am not . ”[93-lady catherine] [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine seemed pleased . “ And will [you]3490-her ladyship promise [me]93-lady catherine never to enter into such an engagement ? ”[93-lady catherine] “ [I]3490-her ladyship will make no promise of the kind . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , [I]3490-her ladyship am shocked and astonished . [I]3490-her ladyship expected to find [a more reasonable young woman]5238-a more reasonable young woman . But do not deceive [yourself]88-elizabeth into a belief that [I]3490-her ladyship will ever recede . [I]3490-her ladyship shall not go away till [you]88-elizabeth have given [me]3490-her ladyship the assurance [I]3490-her ladyship require . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ And [I]93-lady catherine certainly never shall give it . [I]93-lady catherine am not to be intimidated into anything so wholly unreasonable . [[Your]88-elizabeth Ladyship]4164-your ladyship wants [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy to marry [[your]88-elizabeth daughter]3298-your daughter ; but would [my]93-lady catherine giving [you]88-elizabeth the wished - for promise make [their]5241-their marriage at all more probable ? Supposing [him]96-mr. darcy to be attached to [me]93-lady catherine , would [my]93-lady catherine refusing to accept [his]96-mr. darcy hand make [him]96-mr. darcy wish to bestow it on [[his]96-mr. darcy cousin]3538-his cousin ? Allow [me]93-lady catherine to say , [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , that the arguments with which [you]88-elizabeth have supported this extraordinary application have been as frivolous as the application was ill - judged . [You]88-elizabeth have widely mistaken [my]93-lady catherine character , if [you]88-elizabeth think [I]93-lady catherine can be worked on by such persuasions as these . How far [[your]88-elizabeth nephew]5204-your nephew might approve of [your]88-elizabeth interference in [his]5204-your nephew affairs , [I]93-lady catherine can not tell ; but [you]88-elizabeth have certainly no right to concern [yourself]88-elizabeth in [mine]93-lady catherine . [I]93-lady catherine must beg , therefore , to be importuned no further on the subject . ”[93-lady catherine] “ Not so hasty , if [you]88-elizabeth please . [I]3490-her ladyship have by no means done . To all the objections [I]3490-her ladyship have already urged [I]3490-her ladyship have still another to add . [I]3490-her ladyship am no stranger to the particulars of [[your]88-elizabeth youngest sister]5244-your youngest sister ’s infamous elopement . [I]3490-her ladyship know it all ; that [the young man]3597-the young man ’s marrying [her]5244-your youngest sister was a patched - up business , at the expense of [[your]88-elizabeth father]3292-your father and [uncle]5247-uncle . And is such [a girl]802-a girl to be [[my]3490-her ladyship nephew ’s sister]5249-my nephew ’s sister ? Is [[her]5244-your youngest sister husband]260-her husband , who is [the son of [[his]260-her husband late father ’s steward]5252-his late father ’s steward , to be [[his]260-her husband brother]4704-his brother]5251-the son of his late father ’s steward , to be his brother ? [Heaven and earth]5254-heaven and earth -of what are [you]2882-you thinking ? Are the shades of [Pemberley]12-pemberley to be thus polluted ? ”[3490-her ladyship] “ [You]2882-you can now have nothing further to say , ”[2882-you] [she]2882-you resentfully answered . “ [You]2882-you have insulted [me]2882-you , in every possible method . [I]2882-you must beg to return to [the house]3075-the house . ”[2882-you] And [she]2882-you rose as [she]2882-you spoke . [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine rose also , and [they]2883-they turned back . [[Her]93-lady catherine Ladyship]3490-her ladyship was highly incensed . “ [You]2882-you have no regard , then , for the honour and credit of [[my]3490-her ladyship nephew]5180-my nephew ! Unfeeling , [selfish girl]5257-selfish girl ! Do [you]2882-you not consider that a connection with [you]2882-you must disgrace [him]5180-my nephew in the eyes of [everybody]305-everybody ? ”[3490-her ladyship] “ [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , [I]2882-you have nothing further to say . [You]93-lady catherine know [my]2882-you sentiments . ”[2882-you] “ [You]2882-you are then resolved to have [him]5180-my nephew ? ”[3490-her ladyship] “ [I]3490-her ladyship have said no such thing . [I]3490-her ladyship am only resolved to act in that manner , which will , in [my]3490-her ladyship own opinion , constitute [my]3490-her ladyship happiness , without reference to [you]93-lady catherine , or to [any person so wholly unconnected with [me]3490-her ladyship]5259-any person so wholly unconnected with me . ”[3490-her ladyship] “ It is well . [You]93-lady catherine refuse , then , to oblige [me]2882-you . [You]93-lady catherine refuse to obey the claims of duty , honour , and gratitude . [You]93-lady catherine are determined to ruin [him]5180-my nephew in the opinion of all [[his]5180-my nephew friends]405-his friends , and make [him]5180-my nephew the contempt of [the world]304-the world . ”[2882-you] “ Neither duty , nor honour , nor gratitude , ”[88-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ has any possible claim on [me]88-elizabeth , in the present instance . No principle of either would be violated by [my]88-elizabeth marriage with [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy . And with regard to the resentment of [[his]5180-my nephew family]373-his family , or the indignation of [the world]304-the world , if [the former]327-the former were excited by [his]5180-my nephew marrying [me]88-elizabeth , it would not give [me]88-elizabeth one moment ’s concern -- and [the world]304-the world in general would have too much sense to join in the scorn . ”[88-elizabeth] “ And this is [your]93-lady catherine real opinion ! This is [your]93-lady catherine final resolve ! Very well . [I]93-lady catherine shall now know how to act . Do not imagine , [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth , that [your]93-lady catherine ambition will ever be gratified . [I]93-lady catherine came to try [you]93-lady catherine . [I]93-lady catherine hoped to find [you]93-lady catherine reasonable ; but depend upon it [I]93-lady catherine will carry [my]93-lady catherine point . ”[93-lady catherine] In this manner [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine talked on till [they]2885-they were at the door of [the carriage]3286-the carriage , when , turning hastily round , [she]93-lady catherine added,-- “ [I]93-lady catherine take no leave of [you]93-lady catherine , [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth . [I]93-lady catherine send no compliments to [[your]93-lady catherine mother]967-your mother . [You]93-lady catherine deserve no such attention . [I]93-lady catherine am most seriously displeased . ”[93-lady catherine] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth made no answer ; and without attempting to persuade [[her]88-elizabeth Ladyship]3490-her ladyship to return into [the house]3075-the house , walked quietly into [it]3075-the house [herself]88-elizabeth . [She]88-elizabeth heard [the carriage]3286-the carriage drive away as [she]88-elizabeth proceeded [upstairs]3537-upstairs . [[Her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother impatiently met [her]88-elizabeth at the door of [[her]246-her mother dressing - room]4653-her dressing - room , to ask why [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine would not come in again and rest [herself]93-lady catherine . “ [She]93-lady catherine did not choose it , ”[461-her daughter] said [[her]246-her mother daughter]461-her daughter ; “ [she]93-lady catherine would go . ”[461-her daughter] “ [She]93-lady catherine is [a very fine - looking woman]5267-a very fine - looking woman ! and [her]93-lady catherine calling [here]3067-here was prodigiously civil ! for [she]93-lady catherine only came , [I]88-elizabeth suppose , to tell [us]5269-us [the Collinses]1435-the collinses were well . [She]93-lady catherine is on [[her]93-lady catherine road]5271-her road somewhere , [I]88-elizabeth dare say ; and so , passing through [Meryton]9-meryton , thought [she]93-lady catherine might as well call on [you]88-elizabeth . [I]88-elizabeth suppose [she]93-lady catherine had nothing particular to say to [you]88-elizabeth , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth ? ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was forced to give in to a little falsehood here ; for to acknowledge the substance of [their]2894-their conversation was impossible . [ Illustration : “ But now it comes out ”[461-her daughter] ] [CHAPTER LVII]224-chapter lvii . [ Illustration ] The discomposure of spirits which this extraordinary visit threw [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth into could not be easily overcome ; nor could [she]88-elizabeth for many hours learn to think of it less than incessantly . [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , it appeared , had actually taken the trouble of this journey from [Rosings]18-rosings for the sole purpose of breaking off [her]93-lady catherine supposed engagement with [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy . It was a rational scheme , to be sure ! but from what the report of [their]2894-their engagement could originate , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was at a loss to imagine ; till [she]88-elizabeth recollected that [his]96-mr. darcy being [the intimate friend of [Bingley]98-miss bingley]2895-the intimate friend of bingley , and [her]93-lady catherine being [the sister of [Jane]89-jane]2896-the sister of jane , was enough , at a time when the expectation of one wedding made [everybody eager for another]2897-everybody eager for another , to supply the idea . [She]88-elizabeth had not [herself]88-elizabeth forgotten to feel that the marriage of [[her]88-elizabeth sister]328-her sister must bring [them]2894-their more frequently together . And [[her]88-elizabeth neighbours at [Lucas Lodge]10-lucas lodge]2899-her neighbours at lucas lodge , therefore , ( for through [their]2899-her neighbours at lucas lodge communication with [the Collinses]1435-the collinses , the report , [she]88-elizabeth concluded , had reached [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , ) had only set that down as almost certain and immediate which [she]88-elizabeth had looked forward to as possible at some future time . In revolving [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine ’s expressions , however , [she]93-lady catherine could not help feeling some uneasiness as to the possible consequence of [her]93-lady catherine persisting in this interference . From what [she]93-lady catherine had said of [her]93-lady catherine resolution to prevent the marriage , it occurred to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth that [she]88-elizabeth must meditate an application to [[her]88-elizabeth nephew]827-her nephew ; and how [he]827-her nephew might take a similar representation of the evils attached to a connection with [her]88-elizabeth [she]88-elizabeth dared not pronounce . [She]88-elizabeth knew not the exact degree of [his]827-her nephew affection for [[his]827-her nephew aunt]3747-his aunt , or [his]827-her nephew dependence on [her]88-elizabeth judgment , but it was natural to suppose that [he]827-her nephew thought much higher of [[her]88-elizabeth Ladyship]3490-her ladyship than [she]88-elizabeth could do ; and it was certain , that in enumerating the miseries of a marriage with one whose immediate connections were so unequal to [his]827-her nephew own , [[his]827-her nephew aunt]3747-his aunt would address [him]827-her nephew on [his]827-her nephew weakest side . With [his]827-her nephew notions of dignity , [he]827-her nephew would probably feel that the arguments , which to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had appeared weak and ridiculous , contained much good sense and solid reasoning . If [he]827-her nephew had been wavering before , as to what [he]827-her nephew should do , which had often seemed likely , the advice and entreaty of [so near a relation]2905-so near a relation might settle every doubt , and determine [him]827-her nephew at once to be as happy as dignity unblemished could make [him]827-her nephew . In that case [he]827-her nephew would return no more . [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine might see [him]827-her nephew in [her]93-lady catherine way through [town]268-town ; and [his]827-her nephew engagement to [Bingley]98-miss bingley of coming again to [Netherfield]2-netherfield must give way . “ If , therefore , an excuse for not keeping [his]827-her nephew promise should come to [[his]827-her nephew friend]288-his friend within a few days , ”[88-elizabeth] [she]88-elizabeth added , “ [I]88-elizabeth shall know how to understand it . [I]88-elizabeth shall then give over every expectation , every wish of [his]827-her nephew constancy . If [he]827-her nephew is satisfied with only regretting [me]88-elizabeth , when [he]827-her nephew might have obtained [my]88-elizabeth affections and hand , [I]88-elizabeth shall soon cease to regret [him]827-her nephew at all . ”[88-elizabeth] The surprise of [the rest of [the family]414-the family]3699-the rest of the family , on hearing who [[their]3699-the rest of the family visitor]1549-their visitor had been , was very great : but [they]3699-the rest of the family obligingly satisfied it with the same kind of supposition which had appeased [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet ’s curiosity ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was spared from much teasing on the subject . The next morning , as [she]88-elizabeth was going down [stairs]523-stairs , [she]88-elizabeth was met by [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father , who came out of [[his]249-her father library]263-his library with a letter in [his]249-her father hand . “ [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , ”[249-her father] said [he]249-her father , “ [I]249-her father was going to look for [you]88-elizabeth : come into [[my]249-her father room]1005-my room . ”[249-her father] [She]88-elizabeth followed [him]249-her father thither ; and [her]88-elizabeth curiosity to know what [he]249-her father had to tell [her]88-elizabeth was heightened by the supposition of its being in some manner connected with the letter [he]249-her father held . It suddenly struck [her]88-elizabeth that it might be from [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine , and [she]88-elizabeth anticipated with dismay all the consequent explanations . [She]88-elizabeth followed [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father to the fireplace , and [they]2914-they both sat down . [He]249-her father then said,-- “ [I]249-her father have received a letter this morning that has astonished [me]249-her father exceedingly . As it principally concerns [yourself]88-elizabeth , [you]88-elizabeth ought to know its contents . [I]249-her father did not know before that [I]249-her father had [two daughters on the brink of matrimony]5274-two daughters on the brink of matrimony . Let [me]249-her father congratulate [you]88-elizabeth on a very important conquest . ”[249-her father] The colour now rushed into [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s cheeks in the instantaneous conviction of its being a letter from [the nephew]2915-the nephew , instead of [the aunt]2240-the aunt ; and [she]88-elizabeth was undetermined whether most to be pleased that [he]249-her father explained [himself]249-her father at all , or offended that [his]249-her father letter was not rather addressed to [herself]88-elizabeth , when [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father continued,-- “ [You]88-elizabeth look conscious . [Young ladies]3329-young ladies have great penetration in such matters as these ; but [I]249-her father think [I]249-her father may defy even [your]88-elizabeth sagacity to discover the name of [[your]88-elizabeth admirer]5276-your admirer . This letter is from [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins . ”[249-her father] “ From [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ! and what can [he]134-mr. collins have to say ? ”[249-her father] “ Something very much to the purpose , of course . [He]134-mr. collins begins with congratulations on the approaching nuptials of [[my]88-elizabeth eldest daughter]5277-my eldest daughter , of which , it seems , [he]134-mr. collins has been told by [some of [the good - natured , gossiping Lucases]5279-the good - natured , gossiping lucases]5278-some of the good - natured , gossiping lucases . [I]88-elizabeth shall not sport with [your]88-elizabeth impatience by reading what [he]134-mr. collins says on that point . What relates to [yourself]88-elizabeth is as follows -‘Having thus offered [you]88-elizabeth the sincere congratulations of [Mrs. Collins]166-mrs. collins and [myself]88-elizabeth on this happy event , let [me]88-elizabeth now add a short hint on the subject of another , of which [we]5280-we have been advertised by the same authority . [[Your]88-elizabeth daughter]3298-your daughter [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , it is presumed , will not long bear the name of [Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , after [[her]88-elizabeth eldest sister]3743-her eldest sister has resigned it ; and [the chosen partner of [her]88-elizabeth fate]5283-the chosen partner of her fate may be reasonably looked up to as [one of [the most illustrious personages in [this land]5286-this land]5285-the most illustrious personages in this land]5284-one of the most illustrious personages in this land . ’ Can [you]88-elizabeth possibly guess , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , who is meant by this ? ‘ [This young gentleman]5287-this young gentleman is blessed , in a peculiar way , with everything the heart of [mortal can most desire,--splendid property]5288-mortal can most desire,--splendid property , noble kindred , and extensive patronage . Yet , in spite of all these temptations , let [me]88-elizabeth warn [[my]88-elizabeth cousin]3477-my cousin [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , and [yourself]88-elizabeth , of what evils [you]88-elizabeth may incur by a precipitate closure with [this gentleman]3252-this gentleman ’s proposals , which , of course , [you]88-elizabeth will be inclined to take immediate advantage of . ’ Have [you]88-elizabeth any idea , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , who [this gentleman]3252-this gentleman is ? But now it comes out . ‘ [My]88-elizabeth motive for cautioning [you]88-elizabeth is as follows -We have reason to imagine that [[his]3252-this gentleman aunt]3747-his aunt , [Lady Catherine de Bourgh]93-lady catherine , does not look on the match with a friendly eye . ’ [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , [you]88-elizabeth see , is [the man]3163-the man ! Now , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , [I]88-elizabeth think [I]88-elizabeth have surprised [you]88-elizabeth . Could [he]96-mr. darcy , or [the Lucases]106-the lucases , have pitched on [any man]744-any man , within the circle of [our]5295-our acquaintance , whose name would have given the lie more effectually to what [they]5295-our related ? [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , who never looks at [any woman]603-any woman but to see a blemish , and who probably never looked at [you]88-elizabeth in [his]96-mr. darcy life ! It is admirable ! ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth tried to join in [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father ’s pleasantry , but could only force one most reluctant smile . Never had [his]249-her father wit been directed in a manner so little agreeable to [her]88-elizabeth . “ Are [you]249-her father not diverted ? ”[249-her father] “ Oh , yes . Pray read on . ”[249-her father] “ ‘ After mentioning the likelihood of this marriage to [[her]88-elizabeth Ladyship]3490-her ladyship last night , [she]88-elizabeth immediately , with [her]88-elizabeth usual condescension , expressed what [she]88-elizabeth felt on the occasion ; when it became apparent , that , on the score of some family objections on the part of [[my]249-her father cousin]3477-my cousin , [she]88-elizabeth would never give [her]88-elizabeth consent to what [she]88-elizabeth termed so disgraceful a match . [I]249-her father thought it [my]249-her father duty to give the speediest intelligence of this to [[my]249-her father cousin]3477-my cousin , that [she]88-elizabeth and [[her]88-elizabeth noble admirer]5300-her noble admirer may be aware of what [they]5301-they are about , and not run hastily into a marriage which has not been properly sanctioned . ’ [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins , moreover , adds , ‘ [I]249-her father am truly rejoiced that [[my]249-her father cousin]3477-my cousin [Lydia]90-lydia ’s sad business has been so well hushed up , and am only concerned that [their]5301-they living together before the marriage took place should be so generally known . [I]249-her father must not , however , neglect the duties of [my]249-her father station , or refrain from declaring [my]249-her father amazement , at hearing that [you]5303-your received [the young couple]4877-the young couple into [[your]5303-your house]3326-your house as soon as [they]4877-the young couple were married . It was an encouragement of vice ; and had [I]249-her father been [the rector of [Longbourn]7-longbourn]5306-the rector of longbourn , [I]249-her father should very strenuously have opposed it . [You]5303-your ought certainly to forgive [them]4877-the young couple as [a Christian]5307-a christian , but never to admit [them]4877-the young couple in [your]5303-your sight , or allow [their]4877-the young couple names to be mentioned in [your]5303-your hearing . ’ That is [his]249-her father notion of Christian forgiveness ! The rest of [his]249-her father letter is only about [his]249-her father dear [Charlotte]180-charlotte ’s situation , and [his]249-her father expectation of [a young olive - branch]5308-a young olive - branch . But , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , [you]88-elizabeth look as if [you]88-elizabeth did not enjoy it . [You]88-elizabeth are not going to be missish , [I]249-her father hope , and pretend to be affronted at an idle report . For what do [we]5309-our live , but to make sport for [[our]5309-our neighbours]5310-our neighbours , and laugh at [them]5310-our neighbours in [our]5309-our turn ? ”[249-her father] “ Oh , ”[88-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ [I]88-elizabeth am exceedingly diverted . But it is so strange ! ”[88-elizabeth] “ Yes , that is what makes it amusing . Had [they]4877-the young couple fixed on [any other man]5115-any other man it would have been nothing ; but [his]249-her father perfect indifference and [your]88-elizabeth pointed dislike make it so delightfully absurd ! Much as [I]249-her father abominate writing , [I]249-her father would not give up [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ’s correspondence for any consideration . Nay , when [I]249-her father read a letter of [his]249-her father , [I]249-her father can not help giving [him]249-her father the preference even over [Wickham]149-george wickham , much as [I]249-her father value the impudence and hypocrisy of [[my]249-her father son - in - law]5312-my son - in - law . And pray , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , what said [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine about this report ? Did [she]93-lady catherine call to refuse [her]93-lady catherine consent ? ”[249-her father] To this question [[his]2919-his daughter]3923-his daughter replied only with a laugh ; and as it had been asked without the least suspicion , [she]3923-his daughter was not distressed by [his]2919-his repeating it . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had never been more at a loss to make [her]88-elizabeth feelings appear what they were not . It was necessary to laugh when [she]88-elizabeth would rather have cried . [[Her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father had most cruelly mortified [her]88-elizabeth by what [he]249-her father said of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s indifference ; and [she]88-elizabeth could do nothing but wonder at such a want of penetration , or fear that , perhaps , instead of [his]249-her father seeing too little , [she]88-elizabeth might have fancied too much . [ Illustration : “ The efforts of [[his]2919-his aunt]3747-his aunt ”[2919-his] CHAPTER LVIII . [ Illustration ] Instead of receiving any such letter of excuse from [[his]2919-his friend]288-his friend , as [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth half expected [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley to do , [he]2919-his was able to bring [Darcy]96-mr. darcy with [him]2919-his to [Longbourn]7-longbourn before many days had passed after [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine ’s visit . [The gentlemen]292-the gentlemen arrived early ; and , before [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet had time to tell [him]2919-his of [their]292-the gentlemen having seen [[his]2919-his aunt]3747-his aunt , of which [[her]92-mrs. bennet daughter]461-her daughter sat in momentary dread , [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , who wanted to be alone with [Jane]89-jane , proposed [their]292-the gentlemen all walking out . It was agreed to . [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet was not in the habit of walking , [Mary]94-mary could never spare time , but [the remaining five]2926-the remaining five set off together . [Bingley]85-mr. bingley and [Jane]89-jane , however , soon allowed [the others]511-the others to outstrip [them]2926-the remaining five . [They]2926-the remaining five lagged behind , while [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , [Kitty]93-lady catherine , and [Darcy]96-mr. darcy were to entertain [each other]3216-each other . Very little was said by either ; [Kitty]93-lady catherine was too much afraid of [him]2919-his to talk ; [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was secretly forming a desperate resolution ; and , perhaps , [he]2919-his might be doing the same . [They]292-the gentlemen walked towards [the Lucases]106-the lucases ’ , because [Kitty]93-lady catherine wished to call upon [Maria]101-maria ; and as [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth saw no occasion for making it a general concern , when [Kitty]93-lady catherine left [them]292-the gentlemen [she]93-lady catherine went boldly on with [him]2919-his alone . Now was the moment for [her]93-lady catherine resolution to be executed ; and while [her]93-lady catherine courage was high , [she]93-lady catherine immediately said,-- “ [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , [I]93-lady catherine am [a very selfish creature]5314-a very selfish creature , and for the sake of giving relief to [my]93-lady catherine own feelings care not how much [I]93-lady catherine may be wounding [yours]96-mr. darcy . [I]93-lady catherine can no longer help thanking [you]96-mr. darcy for [your]96-mr. darcy unexampled kindness to [[my]93-lady catherine poor sister]5315-my poor sister . Ever since [I]93-lady catherine have known it [I]93-lady catherine have been most anxious to acknowledge to [you]96-mr. darcy how gratefully [I]93-lady catherine feel it . Were it known to [the rest of [[my]93-lady catherine family]979-my family]5316-the rest of my family [I]93-lady catherine should not have merely [my]93-lady catherine own gratitude to express . ”[93-lady catherine] “ [I]96-mr. darcy am sorry , exceedingly sorry , ”[96-mr. darcy] replied [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , in a tone of surprise and emotion , “ that [you]96-mr. darcy have ever been informed of what may , in a mistaken light , have given [you]96-mr. darcy uneasiness . [I]96-mr. darcy did not think [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner was so little to be trusted . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ [You]96-mr. darcy must not blame [[my]93-lady catherine aunt]3279-my aunt . [Lydia]90-lydia ’s thoughtlessness first betrayed to [me]93-lady catherine that [you]96-mr. darcy had been concerned in the matter ; and , of course , [I]93-lady catherine could not rest till [I]93-lady catherine knew the particulars . Let [me]93-lady catherine thank [you]96-mr. darcy again and again , in the name of all [[my]93-lady catherine family]979-my family , for that generous compassion which induced [you]96-mr. darcy to take so much trouble , and bear so many mortifications , for the sake of discovering them . ”[93-lady catherine] “ If [you]96-mr. darcy will thank [me]96-mr. darcy , ”[96-mr. darcy] [he]96-mr. darcy replied , “ let it be for [yourself]96-mr. darcy alone . That the wish of giving happiness to [you]96-mr. darcy might add force to the other inducements which led [me]96-mr. darcy on , [I]96-mr. darcy shall not attempt to deny . But [[your]96-mr. darcy family]3498-your family owe [me]96-mr. darcy nothing . Much as [I]96-mr. darcy respect [them]3498-your family , [I]96-mr. darcy believe [I]96-mr. darcy thought only of [you]96-mr. darcy . ”[96-mr. darcy] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth was too much embarrassed to say a word . After a short pause , [[her]88-elizabeth companion]1769-her companion added , “ [You]88-elizabeth are too generous to trifle with [me]1769-her companion . If [your]88-elizabeth feelings are still what they were last April , tell [me]1769-her companion so at once . [My]1769-her companion affections and wishes are unchanged ; but one word from [you]88-elizabeth will silence [me]1769-her companion on this subject for ever . ”[1769-her companion] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , feeling all the more than common awkwardness and anxiety of [his]1769-her companion situation , now forced [herself]88-elizabeth to speak ; and immediately , though not very fluently , gave [him]1769-her companion to understand that [her]88-elizabeth sentiments had undergone so material a change since the period to which [he]1769-her companion alluded , as to make [her]88-elizabeth receive with gratitude and pleasure [his]1769-her companion present assurances . The happiness which this reply produced was such as [he]1769-her companion had probably never felt before ; and [he]1769-her companion expressed [himself]1769-her companion on the occasion as sensibly and as warmly as [a man violently in love]2930-a man violently in love can be supposed to do . Had [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth been able to encounter [his]1769-her companion eyes , [she]88-elizabeth might have seen how well the expression of heartfelt delight diffused over [his]1769-her companion face became [him]1769-her companion : but though [she]88-elizabeth could not look [she]88-elizabeth could listen ; and [he]1769-her companion told [her]88-elizabeth of feelings which , in proving of what importance [she]88-elizabeth was to [him]1769-her companion , made [his]1769-her companion affection every moment more valuable . [They]2931-they walked on without knowing in what direction . There was too much to be thought , and felt , and said , for attention to any other objects . [She]88-elizabeth soon learnt that [they]2931-they were indebted for [their]2931-they present good understanding to the efforts of [[his]1769-her companion aunt]3747-his aunt , who did call on [him]1769-her companion in [her]3747-his aunt return through [London]5-london , and there relate [her]3747-his aunt journey to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , its motive , and the substance of [her]3747-his aunt conversation with [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; dwelling emphatically on every expression of the latter , which , in [her]88-elizabeth Ladyship ’s apprehension , peculiarly denoted [her]88-elizabeth perverseness and assurance , in the belief that such a relation must assist [her]88-elizabeth endeavours to obtain that promise from [[her]88-elizabeth nephew]827-her nephew which [she]88-elizabeth had refused to give . But , unluckily for [[her]88-elizabeth Ladyship]3490-her ladyship , its effect had been exactly contrariwise . “ It taught [me]1769-her companion to hope , ”[1769-her companion] said [he]1769-her companion , “ as [I]1769-her companion had scarcely ever allowed [myself]1769-her companion to hope before . [I]1769-her companion knew enough of [your]88-elizabeth disposition to be certain , that had [you]88-elizabeth been absolutely , irrevocably decided against [me]1769-her companion , [you]88-elizabeth would have acknowledged it to [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine frankly and openly . ”[1769-her companion] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth coloured and laughed as [she]88-elizabeth replied , “ Yes , [you]88-elizabeth know enough of [my]88-elizabeth frankness to believe [me]88-elizabeth capable of that . After abusing [you]88-elizabeth so abominably to [your]88-elizabeth face , [I]88-elizabeth could have no scruple in abusing [you]88-elizabeth to all [your]88-elizabeth relations . ”[88-elizabeth] “ What did [you]88-elizabeth say of [me]1769-her companion that [I]1769-her companion did not deserve ? For though [your]88-elizabeth accusations were ill - founded , formed on mistaken premises , [my]1769-her companion behaviour to [you]88-elizabeth at the time had merited the severest reproof . It was unpardonable . [I]1769-her companion can not think of it without abhorrence . ”[1769-her companion] “ [We]5321-we will not quarrel for the greater share of blame annexed to that evening , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ The conduct of neither , if strictly examined , will be irreproachable ; but since then [we]5321-we have both , [I]88-elizabeth hope , improved in civility . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]1769-her companion can not be so easily reconciled to [myself]1769-her companion . The recollection of what [I]1769-her companion then said , of [my]1769-her companion conduct , [my]1769-her companion manners , [my]1769-her companion expressions during the whole of it , is now , and has been many months , inexpressibly painful to [me]1769-her companion . [Your]88-elizabeth reproof , so well applied , [I]1769-her companion shall never forget : ‘ Had [you]88-elizabeth behaved in a more gentlemanlike manner . ’ Those were [your]88-elizabeth words . [You]88-elizabeth know not , [you]88-elizabeth can scarcely conceive , how [they]5322-their have tortured [me]1769-her companion ; though it was some time , [I]1769-her companion confess , before [I]1769-her companion was reasonable enough to allow [their]5322-their justice . ”[1769-her companion] “ [I]88-elizabeth was certainly very far from expecting [them]5322-their to make so strong an impression . [I]88-elizabeth had not the smallest idea of [their]5322-their being ever felt in such a way . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]88-elizabeth can easily believe it . [You]88-elizabeth thought [me]88-elizabeth then devoid of every proper feeling , [I]88-elizabeth am sure [you]88-elizabeth did . The turn of [your]88-elizabeth countenance [I]88-elizabeth shall never forget , as [you]88-elizabeth said that [I]88-elizabeth could not have addressed [you]88-elizabeth in any possible way that would induce [you]88-elizabeth to accept [me]88-elizabeth . ”[88-elizabeth] “ Oh , do not repeat what [I]1769-her companion then said . These recollections will not do at all . [I]1769-her companion assure [you]88-elizabeth that [I]1769-her companion have long been most heartily ashamed of it . ”[1769-her companion] [Darcy]96-mr. darcy mentioned [his]96-mr. darcy letter . “ Did it , ”[96-mr. darcy] said he,--“did it soon make [you]2935-i think better of [me]2935-i ? Did [you]2935-i , on reading it , give any credit to its contents ? ”[2935-i] [She]2935-i explained what its effects on [her]2935-i had been , and how gradually all [her]2935-i former prejudices had been removed . “ [I]96-mr. darcy knew , ”[96-mr. darcy] said [he]96-mr. darcy , “ that what [I]96-mr. darcy wrote must give [you]2935-i pain , but it was necessary . [I]96-mr. darcy hope [you]2935-i have destroyed the letter . There was one part , especially the opening of it , which [I]96-mr. darcy should dread [your]2935-i having the power of reading again . [I]96-mr. darcy can remember some expressions which might justly make [you]2935-i hate [me]96-mr. darcy . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ The letter shall certainly be burnt , if [you]2935-i believe it essential to the preservation of [my]2935-i regard ; but , though [we]5323-we have both reason to think [my]2935-i opinions not entirely unalterable , they are not , [I]2935-i hope , quite so easily changed as that implies . ”[2935-i] “ When [I]96-mr. darcy wrote that letter , ”[96-mr. darcy] replied [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , “ [I]96-mr. darcy believed [myself]96-mr. darcy perfectly calm and cool ; but [I]96-mr. darcy am since convinced that it was written in a dreadful bitterness of spirit . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ The letter , perhaps , began in bitterness , but it did not end so . The adieu is charity itself . But think no more of the letter . The feelings of [the person who wrote]5324-the person who wrote and [the person who received it]5325-the person who received it are now so widely different from what [they]5323-we were then , that every unpleasant circumstance attending it ought to be forgotten . [You]2935-i must learn some of [my]2935-i philosophy . Think only of the past as its remembrance gives [you]2935-i pleasure . ”[2935-i] “ [I]2935-i can not give [you]2935-i credit for any philosophy of the kind . [Your]2935-i retrospections must be so totally void of reproach , that the contentment arising from them is not of philosophy , but , what is much better , of ignorance . But with [me]2935-i , it is not so . Painful recollections will intrude , which can not , which ought not to be repelled . [I]2935-i have been [a selfish being]5326-a selfish being all [my]2935-i life , in practice , though not in principle . As [a child]804-a child [I]2935-i was taught what was right , but [I]2935-i was not taught to correct [my]2935-i temper . [I]2935-i was given good principles , but left to follow [them]5323-we in pride and conceit . Unfortunately [an only son]5328-an only son ( for many years [an only child]5329-an only child ) , [I]2935-i was spoiled by [[my]2935-i parents]5330-my parents , who , though good [themselves]5330-my parents , ( [[my]2935-i father]3323-my father particularly , all that was benevolent and amiable , ) allowed , encouraged , almost taught [me]2935-i to be selfish and overbearing , to care for [none beyond [[my]2935-i own family circle]5333-my own family circle]5332-none beyond my own family circle , to think meanly of all the rest of [the world]304-the world , to wish at least to think meanly of [their]5330-my parents sense and worth compared with [my]2935-i own . Such [I]2935-i was , from eight to eight - and - twenty ; and such [I]2935-i might still have been but for [you]5335-you , dearest , loveliest [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ! What do [I]2935-i not owe [you]5335-you ! [You]5335-you taught [me]2935-i a lesson , hard indeed at first , but most advantageous . By [you]5335-you , [I]2935-i was properly humbled . [I]2935-i came to [you]5335-you without a doubt of [my]2935-i reception . [You]5335-you showed [me]2935-i how insufficient were all [my]2935-i pretensions to please [a woman worthy of being pleased]5336-a woman worthy of being pleased . ”[2935-i] “ Had [you]2935-i then persuaded [yourself]2935-i that [I]96-mr. darcy should ? ”[96-mr. darcy] “ Indeed [I]2935-i had . What will [you]5335-you think of [my]2935-i vanity ? [I]2935-i believed [you]5335-you to be wishing , expecting [my]2935-i addresses . ”[2935-i] “ [My]2935-i manners must have been in fault , but not intentionally , [I]2935-i assure [you]5335-you . [I]2935-i never meant to deceive [you]5335-you , but [my]2935-i spirits might often lead [me]2935-i wrong . How [you]5335-you must have hated [me]2935-i after that evening ! ”[2935-i] “ Hate [you]5335-you ! [I]96-mr. darcy was angry , perhaps , at first , but [my]96-mr. darcy anger soon began to take a proper direction . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ [I]2935-i am almost afraid of asking what [you]5335-you thought of [me]2935-i when [we]5337-we met at [Pemberley]12-pemberley . [You]5335-you blamed [me]2935-i for coming ? ”[2935-i] “ No , indeed , [I]2935-i felt nothing but surprise . ”[2935-i] “ [Your]2935-i surprise could not be greater than [mine]2935-i in being noticed by [you]5335-you . [My]96-mr. darcy conscience told [me]96-mr. darcy that [I]96-mr. darcy deserved no extraordinary politeness , and [I]96-mr. darcy confess that [I]96-mr. darcy did not expect to receive more than [my]96-mr. darcy due . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ [My]96-mr. darcy object then , ”[96-mr. darcy] replied [Darcy]96-mr. darcy , “ was to show [you]5335-you , by every civility in [my]96-mr. darcy power , that [I]96-mr. darcy was not so mean as to resent the past ; and [I]96-mr. darcy hoped to obtain [your]5335-you forgiveness , to lessen [your]5335-you ill opinion , by letting [you]5335-you see that [your]5335-you reproofs had been attended to . How soon any other wishes introduced [themselves]5338-themselves , [I]96-mr. darcy can hardly tell , but [I]96-mr. darcy believe in about half an hour after [I]96-mr. darcy had seen [you]5335-you . ”[96-mr. darcy] [He]96-mr. darcy then told [her]2936-her of [Georgiana]153-georgiana ’s delight in [her]153-georgiana acquaintance , and of [her]2936-her disappointment at its sudden interruption ; which naturally leading to the cause of that interruption , [she]2936-her soon learnt that [his]96-mr. darcy resolution of following [her]2936-her from [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire in quest of [[her]2936-her sister]328-her sister had been formed before [he]96-mr. darcy quitted [the inn]1810-the inn , and that [his]96-mr. darcy gravity and thoughtfulness there had arisen from no other struggles than what such a purpose must comprehend . [She]2936-her expressed [her]2936-her gratitude again , but it was too painful a subject to each to be dwelt on farther . After walking several miles in a leisurely manner , and too busy to know anything about it , [they]2939-their found at last , on examining [their]2939-their watches , that it was time to be at [home]3288-home . “ What could have become of [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley and [Jane]89-jane ? ”[88-elizabeth] was a wonder which introduced the discussion of [their]2939-their affairs . [Darcy]153-georgiana was delighted with [their]2939-their engagement ; [[his]96-mr. darcy friend]288-his friend had given [him]96-mr. darcy the earliest information of it . “ [I]88-elizabeth must ask whether [you]96-mr. darcy were surprised ? ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . “ Not at all . When [I]88-elizabeth went away , [I]88-elizabeth felt that it would soon happen . ”[88-elizabeth] “ That is to say , [you]96-mr. darcy had given [your]96-mr. darcy permission . [I]96-mr. darcy guessed as much . ”[96-mr. darcy] And though [he]96-mr. darcy exclaimed at the term , [she]88-elizabeth found that it had been pretty much the case . “ On the evening before [my]96-mr. darcy going to [London]5-london , ”[96-mr. darcy] said [he]96-mr. darcy , “ [I]96-mr. darcy made a confession to [him]96-mr. darcy , which [I]96-mr. darcy believe [I]96-mr. darcy ought to have made long ago . [I]96-mr. darcy told [him]96-mr. darcy of all that had occurred to make [my]96-mr. darcy former interference in [his]96-mr. darcy affairs absurd and impertinent . [His]96-mr. darcy surprise was great . [He]96-mr. darcy had never had the slightest suspicion .
