[I]96-mr. darcy told [him]96-mr. darcy , moreover , that [I]96-mr. darcy believed [myself]96-mr. darcy mistaken in supposing , as [I]96-mr. darcy had done , that [[your]2942-your sister]3211-your sister was indifferent to [him]96-mr. darcy ; and as [I]96-mr. darcy could easily perceive that [his]96-mr. darcy attachment to [her]3211-your sister was unabated , [I]96-mr. darcy felt no doubt of [their]5340-their happiness together . ”[96-mr. darcy] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth could not help smiling at [his]2942-your easy manner of directing [[his]2942-your friend]288-his friend . “ Did [you]2942-your speak from [your]2942-your own observation , ”[88-elizabeth] said [she]88-elizabeth , “ when [you]2942-your told [him]96-mr. darcy that [[my]88-elizabeth sister]3345-my sister loved [him]96-mr. darcy , or merely from [my]88-elizabeth information last spring ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ From the former . [I]96-mr. darcy had narrowly observed [her]3211-your sister , during the two visits which [I]96-mr. darcy had lately made [her]3211-your sister [here]3067-here ; and [I]96-mr. darcy was convinced of [her]3211-your sister affection . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ And [your]2942-your assurance of it , [I]96-mr. darcy suppose , carried immediate conviction to [him]96-mr. darcy . ”[96-mr. darcy] “ It did . [Bingley]85-mr. bingley is most unaffectedly modest . [His]85-mr. bingley diffidence had prevented [his]85-mr. bingley depending on [his]85-mr. bingley own judgment in so anxious a case , but [his]85-mr. bingley reliance on [mine]96-mr. darcy made everything easy . [I]96-mr. darcy was obliged to confess one thing , which for a time , and not unjustly , offended [him]85-mr. bingley . [He]85-mr. bingley was angry . But [his]85-mr. bingley anger , [I]96-mr. darcy am persuaded , lasted no longer than [he]85-mr. bingley remained in any doubt of [[your]2942-your sister]3211-your sister ’s sentiments . [He]85-mr. bingley has heartily forgiven [me]96-mr. darcy now . ”[96-mr. darcy] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth longed to observe that [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley had been [a most delightful friend]2944-a most delightful friend ; so easily guided that [his]85-mr. bingley worth was invaluable ; but [she]88-elizabeth checked [herself]88-elizabeth . [She]88-elizabeth remembered that [he]85-mr. bingley had yet to learn to be laughed at , and it was rather too early to begin . In anticipating the happiness of [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , which of course was to be inferior only to [his]85-mr. bingley own , [he]85-mr. bingley continued the conversation till [they]2945-they reached [the house]3075-the house . In [the hall]3519-the hall [they]2945-they parted . [ Illustration : “ Unable to utter a syllable ”[85-mr. bingley] CHAPTER LIX . [ Illustration ] “ [[My]88-elizabeth dear]3066-my dear [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , where can [you]88-elizabeth have been walking to ? ”[88-elizabeth] was a question which [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth received from [Jane]89-jane as soon as [she]88-elizabeth entered [the room]255-the room , and from all [the others]511-the others when [they]2945-they sat down to table . [She]88-elizabeth had only to say in reply , that [they]2945-they had wandered about till [she]88-elizabeth was beyond [her]88-elizabeth own knowledge . [She]88-elizabeth coloured as [she]88-elizabeth spoke ; but neither that , nor anything else , awakened a suspicion of the truth . The evening passed quietly , unmarked by anything extraordinary . [The acknowledged lovers]2950-the acknowledged lovers talked and laughed ; the unacknowledged were silent . [Darcy]153-georgiana was not of a disposition in which happiness overflows in mirth ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , agitated and confused , rather knew that [she]88-elizabeth was happy than felt [herself]88-elizabeth to be so ; for , besides the immediate embarrassment , there were other evils before [her]88-elizabeth . [She]88-elizabeth anticipated what would be felt in [the family]414-the family when [her]88-elizabeth situation became known : [she]88-elizabeth was aware that [no one]3336-no one liked [him]2953-him but [Jane]89-jane ; and even feared that with [the others]511-the others it was a dislike which not all [his]2953-him fortune and consequence might do away . At night [she]88-elizabeth opened [her]88-elizabeth heart to [Jane]89-jane . Though suspicion was very far from [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth ’s general habits , [she]88-elizabeth was absolutely incredulous here . “ [You]89-jane are joking , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth . This can not be ! Engaged to [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ! No , no , [you]89-jane shall not deceive [me]88-elizabeth : [I]88-elizabeth know it to be impossible . ”[88-elizabeth] “ This is a wretched beginning , indeed ! [My]89-jane sole dependence was on [you]89-jane ; and [I]89-jane am sure [nobody else]1483-nobody else will believe [me]89-jane , if [you]89-jane do not . Yet , indeed , [I]89-jane am in earnest . [I]89-jane speak nothing but the truth . [He]96-mr. darcy still loves [me]89-jane , and [we]5348-we are engaged . ”[89-jane] [Jane]89-jane looked at [her]89-jane doubtingly . “ Oh , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth ! it can not be . [I]89-jane know how much [you]89-jane dislike [him]96-mr. darcy . ”[89-jane] “ [You]89-jane know nothing of the matter . That is all to be forgot . Perhaps [I]88-elizabeth did not always love [him]96-mr. darcy so well as [I]88-elizabeth do now ; but in such cases as these a good memory is unpardonable . This is the last time [I]88-elizabeth shall ever remember it [myself]88-elizabeth . ”[88-elizabeth] [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth still looked all amazement . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth again , and more seriously , assured [her]88-elizabeth of its truth . “ Good heaven ! can it be really so ? Yet now [I]89-jane must believe [you]89-jane , ”[89-jane] cried [Jane]89-jane . “ [[My]89-jane dear]3066-my dear , dear [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , [I]89-jane would , [I]89-jane do congratulate [you]88-elizabeth ; but are [you]88-elizabeth certain -- forgive the question -- are [you]88-elizabeth quite certain that [you]88-elizabeth can be happy with [him]96-mr. darcy ? ”[89-jane] “ There can be no doubt of that . It is settled between [us]5350-we already that [we]5350-we are to be [the happiest couple in [the world]304-the world]5351-the happiest couple in the world . But are [you]88-elizabeth pleased , [Jane]89-jane ? Shall [you]88-elizabeth like to have [such a brother]5353-such a brother ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Very , very much . Nothing could give either [Bingley]85-mr. bingley or [myself]88-elizabeth more delight . But [we]5350-we considered it , [we]5350-we talked of it as impossible . And do [you]88-elizabeth really love [him]85-mr. bingley quite well enough ? Oh , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth ! do anything rather than marry without affection . Are [you]88-elizabeth quite sure that [you]88-elizabeth feel what [you]88-elizabeth ought to do ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Oh , yes ! [You]88-elizabeth will only think [I]89-jane feel more than [I]89-jane ought to do when [I]89-jane tell [you]88-elizabeth all . ”[89-jane] “ What do [you]88-elizabeth mean ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Why , [I]88-elizabeth must confess that [I]88-elizabeth love [him]85-mr. bingley better than [I]88-elizabeth do [Bingley]85-mr. bingley . [I]88-elizabeth am afraid [you]88-elizabeth will be angry . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [[My]89-jane dearest sister]4562-my dearest sister , now be , be serious . [I]89-jane want to talk very seriously . When convinced on that article , [Miss Bennet]88-elizabeth had nothing further to wish . “ Now [I]88-elizabeth am quite happy , ”[88-elizabeth] said [she]88-elizabeth , “ for [you]89-jane will be as happy as [myself]88-elizabeth . [I]88-elizabeth always had a value for [him]85-mr. bingley . [She]88-elizabeth had been unwilling to mention [Bingley]85-mr. bingley ; and the unsettled state of [her]88-elizabeth own feelings had made [her]88-elizabeth equally avoid the name of [[his]85-mr. bingley friend]288-his friend : but now [she]88-elizabeth would no longer conceal from [her]88-elizabeth [his]85-mr. bingley share in [Lydia]90-lydia ’s marriage . All was acknowledged , and half the night spent in conversation . “ Good gracious ! ”[92-mrs. bennet] cried [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , as [she]92-mrs. bennet stood at a window the next morning , “ if that disagreeable [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy is not coming here again with [[our]5358-our dear]5359-our dear [Bingley]85-mr. bingley ! What can [he]96-mr. darcy mean by being so tiresome as to be always coming here ? [I]92-mrs. bennet had no notion but [he]96-mr. darcy would go a - shooting , or something or other , and not disturb [us]5358-our with [his]96-mr. darcy company . What shall [we]5358-our do with [him]96-mr. darcy ? [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , [you]88-elizabeth must walk out with [him]96-mr. darcy again , that [he]96-mr. darcy may not be in [Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s way . ”[92-mrs. bennet] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth could hardly help laughing at so convenient a proposal ; yet was really vexed that [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother should be always giving [him]2958-him such an epithet . As soon as [they]2959-they entered , [Bingley]85-mr. bingley looked at [her]88-elizabeth so expressively , and shook hands with such warmth , as left no doubt of [his]85-mr. bingley good information ; and [he]85-mr. bingley soon afterwards said aloud , “ [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , have [you]92-mrs. bennet no more lanes hereabouts in which [Lizzy]88-elizabeth may lose [her]88-elizabeth way again to - day ? ”[85-mr. bingley] “ [I]92-mrs. bennet advise [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy , and [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , and [Kitty]93-lady catherine , ”[92-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet , “ to walk to [Oakham Mount]76-oakham mount this morning . It is a nice long walk , and [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy has never seen the view . ”[92-mrs. bennet] “ It may do very well for the others , ”[85-mr. bingley] replied [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley ; “ but [I]85-mr. bingley am sure it will be too much for [Kitty]93-lady catherine . Wo n’t it , [Kitty]93-lady catherine ? ”[85-mr. bingley] [Kitty]93-lady catherine owned that [she]93-lady catherine had rather stay at [home]3288-home . [Darcy]96-mr. darcy professed a great curiosity to see the view from [the Mount]2961-the mount , and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth silently consented . As [she]88-elizabeth went [upstairs]3537-upstairs to get ready , [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet followed [her]88-elizabeth , saying,-- “ [I]92-mrs. bennet am quite sorry , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , that [you]88-elizabeth should be forced to have [that disagreeable man]5360-that disagreeable man all to [yourself]88-elizabeth ; but [I]92-mrs. bennet hope [you]88-elizabeth will not mind it . It is all for [Jane]89-jane ’s sake , [you]88-elizabeth know ; and there is no occasion for talking to [him]5360-that disagreeable man except just now and then ; so do not put [yourself]88-elizabeth to inconvenience . ”[92-mrs. bennet] During [their]2963-their walk , it was resolved that [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet ’s consent should be asked in the course of the evening : [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth reserved to [herself]88-elizabeth the application for [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother ’s . [She]88-elizabeth could not determine how [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother would take it ; sometimes doubting whether all [his]81-mr. bennet wealth and grandeur would be enough to overcome [her]246-her mother abhorrence of [the man]3163-the man ; but whether [she]88-elizabeth were violently set against the match , or violently delighted with it , it was certain that [her]88-elizabeth manner would be equally ill adapted to do credit to [her]88-elizabeth sense ; and [she]88-elizabeth could no more bear that [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy should hear the first raptures of [her]88-elizabeth joy , than the first vehemence of [her]88-elizabeth disapprobation . In the evening , soon after [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet withdrew to [the library]3825-the library , [she]88-elizabeth saw [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy rise also and follow [him]96-mr. darcy , and [her]88-elizabeth agitation on seeing it was extreme . [She]88-elizabeth did not fear [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father ’s opposition , but [he]249-her father was going to be made unhappy , and that it should be through [her]88-elizabeth means ; that [she]88-elizabeth , [[his]249-her father favourite child]2969-his favourite child , should be distressing [him]249-her father by [her]88-elizabeth choice , should be filling [him]249-her father with fears and regrets in disposing of [her]88-elizabeth , was a wretched reflection , and [she]88-elizabeth sat in misery till [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy appeared again , when , looking at [him]96-mr. darcy , [she]88-elizabeth was a little relieved by [his]96-mr. darcy smile . In a few minutes [he]96-mr. darcy approached the table where [she]88-elizabeth was sitting with [Kitty]93-lady catherine ; and , while pretending to admire [her]88-elizabeth work , said in a whisper , “ Go to [[your]88-elizabeth father]3292-your father ; [he]249-her father wants [you]88-elizabeth in [the library]3825-the library . ”[88-elizabeth] [She]88-elizabeth was gone directly . [[Her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father was walking about [the room]255-the room , looking grave and anxious . “ [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , ”[249-her father] said [he]249-her father , “ what are [you]88-elizabeth doing ? Are [you]88-elizabeth out of [your]88-elizabeth senses to be accepting [this man]3178-this man ? Have not [you]88-elizabeth always hated [him]3178-this man ? ”[249-her father] How earnestly did [she]88-elizabeth then wish that [her]88-elizabeth former opinions had been more reasonable , [her]88-elizabeth expressions more moderate ! It would have spared [her]88-elizabeth from explanations and professions which it was exceedingly awkward to give ; but they were now necessary , and [she]88-elizabeth assured [him]249-her father , with some confusion , of [her]88-elizabeth attachment to [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy . “ Or , in other words , [you]88-elizabeth are determined to have [him]3178-this man . [He]3178-this man is rich , to be sure , and [you]88-elizabeth may have more fine clothes and [fine carriages]5364-fine carriages than [Jane]89-jane . But will [they]5365-they make [you]88-elizabeth happy ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Have [you]249-her father any other objection , ”[88-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , “ than [your]249-her father belief of [my]88-elizabeth indifference ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ None at all . [We]5366-we all know [him]3178-this man to be [a proud , unpleasant sort of man]5367-a proud , unpleasant sort of man ; but this would be nothing if [you]249-her father really liked [him]3178-this man . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]88-elizabeth do , [I]88-elizabeth do like [him]3178-this man , ”[88-elizabeth] [she]88-elizabeth replied , with tears in [her]88-elizabeth eyes ; “ [I]88-elizabeth love [him]3178-this man . Indeed [he]3178-this man has no improper pride . [He]3178-this man is perfectly amiable . [You]249-her father do not know what [he]3178-this man really is ; then pray do not pain [me]88-elizabeth by speaking of [him]3178-this man in such terms . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , ”[249-her father] said [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father , “ [I]249-her father have given [him]3178-this man [my]249-her father consent . [He]3178-this man is [the kind of man]5368-the kind of man , indeed , to whom [I]249-her father should never dare refuse anything , which [he]3178-this man condescended to ask . [I]249-her father now give it to [you]88-elizabeth , if [you]88-elizabeth are resolved on having [him]3178-this man . But let [me]249-her father advise [you]88-elizabeth to think better of it . [I]249-her father know [your]88-elizabeth disposition , [Lizzy]88-elizabeth . [I]249-her father know that [you]88-elizabeth could be neither happy nor respectable , unless [you]88-elizabeth truly esteemed [[your]88-elizabeth husband]5357-your husband , unless [you]88-elizabeth looked up to [him]5357-your husband as [a superior]5370-a superior . [Your]88-elizabeth lively talents would place [you]88-elizabeth in the greatest danger in an unequal marriage . [You]88-elizabeth could scarcely escape discredit and misery . [[My]249-her father child]5371-my child , let [me]249-her father not have the grief of seeing [you]88-elizabeth unable to respect [[your]88-elizabeth partner]3145-your partner in life . [You]88-elizabeth know not what [you]88-elizabeth are about . ”[249-her father] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , still more affected , was earnest and solemn in [her]88-elizabeth reply ; and , at length , by repeated assurances that [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy was really the object of [her]88-elizabeth choice , by explaining the gradual change which [her]88-elizabeth estimation of [him]96-mr. darcy had undergone , relating [her]88-elizabeth absolute certainty that [his]96-mr. darcy affection was not the work of a day , but had stood the test of many months ’ suspense , and enumerating with energy all [his]96-mr. darcy good qualities , [she]88-elizabeth did conquer [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father ’s incredulity , and reconcile [him]96-mr. darcy to the match . “ Well , [[my]249-her father dear]3066-my dear , ”[249-her father] said [he]249-her father , when [she]88-elizabeth ceased speaking , “ [I]249-her father have no more to say . If this be the case , [he]96-mr. darcy deserves [you]3066-my dear . [I]249-her father could not have parted with [you]3066-my dear , [[my]249-her father [Lizzy]88-elizabeth]5374-my lizzy , to [anyone less worthy]5375-anyone less worthy . ”[249-her father] To complete the favourable impression , [she]88-elizabeth then told [him]249-her father what [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy had voluntarily done for [Lydia]90-lydia . [He]249-her father heard [her]88-elizabeth with astonishment . “ This is an evening of wonders , indeed ! And so , [Darcy]96-mr. darcy did everything ; made up the match , gave the money , paid [the fellow]5376-the fellow ’s debts , and got [him]96-mr. darcy [his]96-mr. darcy commission ! So much the better . It will save [me]249-her father a world of trouble and economy . Had it been [[your]3066-my dear uncle]3438-your uncle ’s doing , [I]249-her father must and would have paid [him]96-mr. darcy ; but [these violent young lovers]5378-these violent young lovers carry everything [their]5378-these violent young lovers own way . [I]249-her father shall offer to pay [him]96-mr. darcy to - morrow , [he]96-mr. darcy will rant and storm about [his]96-mr. darcy love for [you]3066-my dear , and there will be an end of the matter . ”[249-her father] [He]249-her father then recollected [her]88-elizabeth embarrassment a few days before on [his]249-her father reading [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins ’s letter ; and after laughing at [her]88-elizabeth some time , allowed [her]88-elizabeth at last to go , saying , as [she]88-elizabeth quitted [the room]255-the room , “ If [any young men]5379-any young men come for [Mary]94-mary or [Kitty]93-lady catherine , send [them]5379-any young men in , for [I]88-elizabeth am quite at leisure . ”[88-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s mind was now relieved from a very heavy weight ; and , after half an hour ’s quiet reflection in [[her]88-elizabeth own room]1548-her own room , [she]88-elizabeth was able to join [the others]511-the others with tolerable composure . Everything was too recent for gaiety , but the evening passed tranquilly away ; there was no longer anything material to be dreaded , and the comfort of ease and familiarity would come in time . When [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother went up to [[her]246-her mother dressing - room]4653-her dressing - room at night , [she]246-her mother followed [her]246-her mother , and made the important communication . Its effect was most extraordinary ; for , on first hearing it , [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet sat quite still , and unable to utter a syllable . Nor was it under many , many minutes , that [she]92-mrs. bennet could comprehend what [she]92-mrs. bennet heard , though not in general backward to credit what was for the advantage of [[her]92-mrs. bennet family]3710-her family , or that came in the shape of [a lover]2822-a lover to any of [them]3710-her family . [She]92-mrs. bennet began at length to recover , to fidget about in [her]92-mrs. bennet chair , get up , sit down again , wonder , and bless [herself]92-mrs. bennet . “ [Good gracious]5380-good gracious ! [Lord]5381-lord bless [me]92-mrs. bennet ! only think ! dear [me]92-mrs. bennet ! [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ! Who would have thought it ? And is it really true ? Oh , [my]92-mrs. bennet sweetest [Lizzy]88-elizabeth ! how rich and how great [you]88-elizabeth will be ! What pin - money , what jewels , what carriages [you]88-elizabeth will have ! [Jane]89-jane ’s is nothing to it -- nothing at all . [I]92-mrs. bennet am so pleased -- so happy . [Such a charming man]5382-such a charming man ! so handsome ! so tall ! Oh , [my]92-mrs. bennet dear [Lizzy]88-elizabeth ! pray apologize for [my]92-mrs. bennet having disliked [him]5382-such a charming man so much before . [I]92-mrs. bennet hope [he]5382-such a charming man will overlook it . Dear , [dear Lizzy]88-elizabeth . [A house in [town]268-town]3244-a house in town ! Everything that is charming ! [Three daughters]558-three daughters married ! Ten thousand a year ! Oh , [Lord]5386-lord ! what will become of [me]92-mrs. bennet ? [I]92-mrs. bennet shall go distracted . ”[92-mrs. bennet] This was enough to prove that [her]2981-her approbation need not be doubted ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , rejoicing that such an effusion was heard only by [herself]88-elizabeth , soon went away . But before [she]88-elizabeth had been three minutes in [[her]88-elizabeth own room]1548-her own room , [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother followed [her]88-elizabeth . “ [[My]246-her mother dearest child]5387-my dearest child , ”[246-her mother] [she]246-her mother cried , “ [I]246-her mother can think of nothing else . Ten thousand a year , and very likely more ! ’ Tis as good as [a lord]5388-a lord ! And a special licence -- [you]5387-my dearest child must and shall be married by a special licence . But , [[my]246-her mother dearest love]5389-my dearest love , tell [me]246-her mother what [dish Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy is particularly fond of , that [I]246-her mother may have it to - morrow . ”[246-her mother] This was a sad omen of what [[her]88-elizabeth mother]246-her mother ’s behaviour to [the gentleman]287-the gentleman [himself]287-the gentleman might be ; and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth found that , though in the certain possession of [his]287-the gentleman warmest affection , and secure of [[her]88-elizabeth relations]583-her relations ’ consent , there was still something to be wished for . But the morrow passed off much better than [she]88-elizabeth expected ; for [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet luckily stood in such awe of [[her]92-mrs. bennet intended son - in - law]2987-her intended son - in - law , that [she]92-mrs. bennet ventured not to speak to [him]287-the gentleman , unless it was in [her]92-mrs. bennet power to offer [him]287-the gentleman any attention , or mark [her]92-mrs. bennet deference for [his]287-the gentleman opinion . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had the satisfaction of seeing [[her]88-elizabeth father]249-her father taking pains to get acquainted with [him]287-the gentleman ; and [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet soon assured [her]88-elizabeth that [he]287-the gentleman was rising every hour in [his]287-the gentleman esteem . “ [I]81-mr. bennet admire all [[my]81-mr. bennet three sons - in - law]5390-my three sons - in - law highly , ”[81-mr. bennet] said [he]81-mr. bennet . “ [Wickham]142-wickham , perhaps , is [my]81-mr. bennet favourite ; but [I]81-mr. bennet think [I]81-mr. bennet shall like [[your]88-elizabeth husband]5357-your husband quite as well as [Jane]89-jane ’s . ”[81-mr. bennet] [ Illustration : “ The obsequious civility . ”[81-mr. bennet] CHAPTER LX . [ Illustration ] [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s spirits soon rising to playfulness again , [she]88-elizabeth wanted [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy to account for [his]96-mr. darcy having ever fallen in love with [her]88-elizabeth . “ How could [you]96-mr. darcy begin ? ”[88-elizabeth] said [she]88-elizabeth . “ [I]88-elizabeth can comprehend [your]96-mr. darcy going on charmingly , when [you]96-mr. darcy had once made a beginning ; but what could set [you]96-mr. darcy off in the first place ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ [I]81-mr. bennet can not fix on the hour , or the spot , or the look , or the words , which laid the foundation . It is too long ago . [I]81-mr. bennet was in the middle before [I]81-mr. bennet knew that [I]81-mr. bennet had begun . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ [My]88-elizabeth beauty [you]88-elizabeth had early withstood , and as for [my]88-elizabeth manners -- [my]88-elizabeth behaviour to [you]88-elizabeth was at least always bordering on the uncivil , and [I]88-elizabeth never spoke to [you]88-elizabeth without rather wishing to give [you]88-elizabeth pain than not . Now , be sincere ; did [you]88-elizabeth admire [me]88-elizabeth for [my]88-elizabeth impertinence ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ For the liveliness of [your]88-elizabeth mind [I]88-elizabeth did . ”[88-elizabeth] “ [You]88-elizabeth may as well call it impertinence at once . It was very little less . The fact is , that [you]88-elizabeth were sick of civility , of deference , of officious attention . [You]88-elizabeth were disgusted with the women who were always speaking , and looking , and thinking for [your]88-elizabeth approbation alone . [I]81-mr. bennet roused and interested [you]88-elizabeth , because [I]81-mr. bennet was so unlike [them]5392-them . Had [you]88-elizabeth not been really amiable [you]88-elizabeth would have hated [me]81-mr. bennet for it : but in spite of the pains [you]88-elizabeth took to disguise [yourself]88-elizabeth , [your]88-elizabeth feelings were always noble and just ; and in [your]88-elizabeth heart [you]88-elizabeth thoroughly despised [the persons who so assiduously courted [you]88-elizabeth]5393-the persons who so assiduously courted you . There -- [I]81-mr. bennet have saved [you]88-elizabeth the trouble of accounting for it ; and really , all things considered , [I]81-mr. bennet begin to think it perfectly reasonable . To be sure [you]88-elizabeth know no actual good of [me]81-mr. bennet -- but [nobody]3152-nobody thinks of that when [they]3152-nobody fall in love . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ Was there no good in [your]88-elizabeth affectionate behaviour to [Jane]89-jane , while [she]89-jane was ill at [Netherfield]2-netherfield ? ”[81-mr. bennet] “ [Dearest Jane]225-jane ! who could have done less for [her]89-jane ? But make a virtue of it by all means . [My]88-elizabeth good qualities are under [your]88-elizabeth protection , and [you]88-elizabeth are to exaggerate them as much as possible ; and , in return , it belongs to [me]88-elizabeth to find occasions for teasing and quarrelling with [you]88-elizabeth as often as may be ; and [I]88-elizabeth shall begin directly , by asking [you]88-elizabeth what made [you]88-elizabeth so unwilling to come to the point at last ? What made [you]88-elizabeth so shy of [me]88-elizabeth , when [you]88-elizabeth first called , and afterwards dined [here]3067-here ? Why , especially , when [you]88-elizabeth called , did [you]88-elizabeth look as if [you]88-elizabeth did not care about [me]88-elizabeth ? ”[88-elizabeth] “ Because [you]88-elizabeth were grave and silent , and gave [me]81-mr. bennet no encouragement . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ But [I]81-mr. bennet was embarrassed . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ And so was [I.]81-mr. bennet ”[81-mr. bennet] “ [You]88-elizabeth might have talked to [me]81-mr. bennet more when [you]88-elizabeth came to dinner . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ [A man who had felt less might]5396-a man who had felt less might . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ How unlucky that [you]88-elizabeth should have a reasonable answer to give , and that [I]81-mr. bennet should be so reasonable as to admit it ! But [I]81-mr. bennet wonder how long [you]88-elizabeth would have gone on , if [you]88-elizabeth had been left to [yourself]88-elizabeth . [I]81-mr. bennet wonder when [you]88-elizabeth would have spoken if [I]81-mr. bennet had not asked [you]88-elizabeth ! [My]81-mr. bennet resolution of thanking [you]88-elizabeth for [your]88-elizabeth kindness to [Lydia]90-lydia had certainly great effect . Too much , [I]81-mr. bennet am afraid ; for what becomes of the moral , if [our]5397-our comfort springs from a breach of promise , for [I]81-mr. bennet ought not to have mentioned the subject ? This will never do . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ [You]88-elizabeth need not distress [yourself]88-elizabeth . The moral will be perfectly fair . [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine ’s unjustifiable endeavours to separate [us]5397-our were the means of removing all [my]81-mr. bennet doubts . [I]81-mr. bennet am not indebted for [my]81-mr. bennet present happiness to [your]88-elizabeth eager desire of expressing [your]88-elizabeth gratitude . [I]81-mr. bennet was not in a humour to wait for an opening of [yours]88-elizabeth . [[My]81-mr. bennet aunt]3279-my aunt ’s intelligence had given [me]81-mr. bennet hope , and [I]81-mr. bennet was determined at once to know everything . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine has been of infinite use , which ought to make [her]93-lady catherine happy , for [she]93-lady catherine loves to be of use . But tell [me]81-mr. bennet , what did [you]88-elizabeth come down to [Netherfield]2-netherfield for ? Was it merely to ride to [Longbourn]7-longbourn and be embarrassed ? or had [you]88-elizabeth intended any more serious consequences ? ”[81-mr. bennet] “ [My]81-mr. bennet real purpose was to see [you]88-elizabeth , and to judge , if [I]81-mr. bennet could , whether [I]81-mr. bennet might ever hope to make [you]88-elizabeth love [me]81-mr. bennet . [My]81-mr. bennet avowed one , or what [I]81-mr. bennet avowed to [myself]81-mr. bennet , was to see whether [[your]88-elizabeth sister]3211-your sister was still partial to [Bingley]85-mr. bingley , and if [she]3211-your sister were , to make the confession to [him]85-mr. bingley which [I]81-mr. bennet have since made . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ Shall [you]88-elizabeth ever have courage to announce to [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine what is to befall [her]93-lady catherine ? ”[81-mr. bennet] “ [I]81-mr. bennet am more likely to want time than courage , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . But it ought to be done ; and if [you]88-elizabeth will give [me]81-mr. bennet a sheet of paper it shall be done directly . ”[81-mr. bennet] “ And if [I]81-mr. bennet had not a letter to write [myself]81-mr. bennet , [I]81-mr. bennet might sit by [you]88-elizabeth , and admire the evenness of [your]88-elizabeth writing , as [another young lady]5400-another young lady once did . But [I]81-mr. bennet have [an aunt]5401-an aunt , too , who must not be longer neglected . ”[81-mr. bennet] From an unwillingness to confess how much [her]2989-her intimacy with [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy had been overrated , [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had never yet answered [Mrs. Gardiner]129-mrs. gardiner ’s long letter ; but now , having that to communicate which [she]88-elizabeth knew would be most welcome , [she]88-elizabeth was almost ashamed to find that [[her]88-elizabeth uncle]579-her uncle and [aunt]1241-aunt had already lost three days of happiness , and immediately wrote as follows - “ [I]88-elizabeth would have thanked [you]88-elizabeth before , [[my]88-elizabeth dear aunt]1197-my dear aunt , as [I]88-elizabeth ought to have done , for [your]88-elizabeth long , kind , satisfactory detail of particulars ; but , to say the truth , [I]88-elizabeth was too cross to write . [You]88-elizabeth supposed more than really existed . But now suppose as much as [you]88-elizabeth choose ; give a loose to [your]88-elizabeth fancy , indulge [your]88-elizabeth imagination in every possible flight which the subject will afford , and unless [you]88-elizabeth believe [me]88-elizabeth actually married , [you]88-elizabeth can not greatly err . [You]88-elizabeth must write again very soon , and praise [him]579-her uncle a great deal more than [you]88-elizabeth did in [your]88-elizabeth last . [I]88-elizabeth thank [you]88-elizabeth again and again , for not going to [the Lakes]77-the lakes . How could [I]88-elizabeth be so silly as to wish it ! [Your]88-elizabeth idea of the ponies is delightful . [We]5403-we will go round [the park]1317-the park every day . [I]88-elizabeth am [the happiest creature in [the world]304-the world]2812-the happiest creature in the world . Perhaps [other people]1145-other people have said so before , but [no one with such justice]5408-no one with such justice . [I]88-elizabeth am happier even than [Jane]225-jane ; [she]225-jane only smiles , [I]88-elizabeth laugh . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy sends [you]88-elizabeth all the love in [the world]304-the world that can be spared from [me]88-elizabeth . [You]88-elizabeth are all to come to [Pemberley]12-pemberley at Christmas . [Yours]88-elizabeth , ”[88-elizabeth] etc . [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s letter to [Lady Catherine]93-lady catherine was in a different style , and still different from either was what [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet sent to [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins , in return for [his]134-mr. collins last . / * “ [Dear Sir]3500-dear sir , * / “[0-i] [I]0-i must trouble [you]96-mr. darcy once more for congratulations . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth will soon be [the wife of [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy]5213-the wife of mr. darcy . [Console Lady Catherine]226-lady catherine as well as [you]96-mr. darcy can . But , if [I]0-i were [you]96-mr. darcy , [I]0-i would stand by [the nephew]2915-the nephew . [He]2915-the nephew has more to give . “ [Yours]96-mr. darcy sincerely , ”[2915-the nephew] etc . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s congratulations to [[her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother on [his]3181-her brother approaching marriage were all that was affectionate and insincere . [She]98-miss bingley wrote even to [Jane]225-jane on the occasion , to express [her]98-miss bingley delight , and repeat all [her]98-miss bingley former professions of regard . [Jane]225-jane was not deceived , but [she]225-jane was affected ; and though feeling no reliance on [her]98-miss bingley , could not help writing [her]98-miss bingley a much kinder answer than [she]98-miss bingley knew was deserved . The joy which [Miss Darcy]128-miss darcy expressed on receiving similar information was as sincere as [[her]98-miss bingley brother]3181-her brother ’s in sending it . Four sides of paper were insufficient to contain all [her]98-miss bingley delight , and all [her]98-miss bingley earnest desire of being loved by [[her]98-miss bingley sister]328-her sister . Before any answer could arrive from [Mr. Collins]134-mr. collins , or any congratulations to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth from [[his]134-mr. collins wife]236-his wife , [the Longbourn family]3558-the longbourn family heard that [the Collinses]204-the collinses were come [themselves]3558-the longbourn family to [Lucas Lodge]10-lucas lodge . The reason of this sudden removal was soon evident . [Lady Catherine]226-lady catherine had been rendered so exceedingly angry by the contents of [[her]226-lady catherine nephew]827-her nephew ’s letter , that [Charlotte]180-charlotte , really rejoicing in the match , was anxious to get away till the storm was blown over . At such a moment , the arrival of [[her]180-charlotte friend]400-her friend was a sincere pleasure to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , though in the course of [their]3001-their meetings [she]180-charlotte must sometimes think the pleasure dearly bought , when [she]180-charlotte saw [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy exposed to all the parading and obsequious civility of [[her]180-charlotte husband]260-her husband . [He]96-mr. darcy bore it , however , with admirable calmness . [He]96-mr. darcy could even listen to [Sir William Lucas]86-sir william , when [he]96-mr. darcy complimented [him]96-mr. darcy on carrying away the brightest jewel of [the country]448-the country , and expressed [his]96-mr. darcy hopes of [their]3001-their all meeting frequently at [[St. James]11-st. james ’s]377-st. james ’s , with very decent composure . If [he]96-mr. darcy did shrug [his]96-mr. darcy shoulders , it was not till [Sir William]86-sir william was out of sight . [Mrs. Philips]117-mrs. philips ’s vulgarity was another , and , perhaps , a greater tax on [his]96-mr. darcy forbearance ; and though [Mrs. Philips]117-mrs. philips , as well as [[her]117-mrs. philips sister]328-her sister , stood in too much awe of [him]96-mr. darcy to speak with the familiarity which [Bingley]98-miss bingley ’s good - humour encouraged ; yet , whenever [she]117-mrs. philips did speak , [she]117-mrs. philips must be vulgar . Nor was [her]117-mrs. philips respect for [him]96-mr. darcy , though it made [her]117-mrs. philips more quiet , at all likely to make [her]117-mrs. philips more elegant . [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth did all [she]88-elizabeth could to shield [him]96-mr. darcy from the frequent notice of either , and was ever anxious to keep [him]96-mr. darcy to [herself]88-elizabeth , and to [those of [[her]88-elizabeth family]3710-her family with whom [he]96-mr. darcy might converse without mortification]3006-those of her family with whom he might converse without mortification ; and though the uncomfortable feelings arising from all this took from the season of courtship much of its pleasure , it added to the hope of the future ; and [she]88-elizabeth looked forward with delight to the time when [they]3008-they should be removed from society so little pleasing to either , to all the comfort and elegance of [[their]3008-they family]2585-their family party at [Pemberley]12-pemberley . [ Illustration ] CHAPTER LXI . [ Illustration ] Happy for all [her]117-mrs. philips maternal feelings was the day on which [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet got rid of [[her]117-mrs. philips two most deserving daughters]3010-her two most deserving daughters . With what delighted pride [she]117-mrs. philips afterwards visited [Mrs. Bingley]227-mrs. bingley , and talked of [Mrs. Darcy]128-miss darcy , may be guessed . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could say , for the sake of [[her]117-mrs. philips family]3710-her family , that the accomplishment of [her]117-mrs. philips earnest desire in the establishment of so many of [[her]117-mrs. philips children]3811-her children produced so happy an effect as to make [her]117-mrs. philips [a sensible , amiable , well - informed woman]3013-a sensible , amiable , well - informed woman for the rest of [her]117-mrs. philips life ; though , perhaps , it was lucky for [[her]117-mrs. philips husband]260-her husband , who might not have relished domestic felicity in so unusual a form , that [she]117-mrs. philips still was occasionally nervous and invariably silly . [Mr. Bennet]81-mr. bennet missed [[his]81-mr. bennet second daughter]245-his second daughter exceedingly ; [his]81-mr. bennet affection for [her]245-his second daughter drew [him]81-mr. bennet oftener from [home]3288-home than anything else could do . [He]81-mr. bennet delighted in going to [Pemberley]12-pemberley , especially when [he]81-mr. bennet was least expected . [Mr. Bingley]85-mr. bingley and [Jane]225-jane remained at [Netherfield]2-netherfield only a twelvemonth . So near a vicinity to [[her]245-his second daughter mother]246-her mother and [Meryton]9-meryton relations was not desirable even to [his]81-mr. bennet easy temper , or [her]117-mrs. philips affectionate heart . The darling wish of [[his]81-mr. bennet sisters]284-his sisters was then gratified : [he]81-mr. bennet bought [an estate in [a neighbouring county]3020-a neighbouring county to [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire]3019-an estate in a neighbouring county to derbyshire ; and [Jane]225-jane and [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , in addition to every other source of happiness , were within thirty miles of each other . [Kitty]226-lady catherine , to [her]226-lady catherine very material advantage , spent the chief of [her]226-lady catherine time with [[her]226-lady catherine two elder sisters]4917-her two elder sisters . In society so superior to what [she]226-lady catherine had generally known , [her]226-lady catherine improvement was great . [She]226-lady catherine was not of so ungovernable a temper as [Lydia]90-lydia ; and , removed from the influence of [Lydia]90-lydia ’s example , [she]226-lady catherine became , by proper attention and management , less irritable , less ignorant , and less insipid . From the further disadvantage of [Lydia]90-lydia ’s society [she]226-lady catherine was of course carefully kept ; and though [Mrs. Wickham]209-mrs. wickham frequently invited [her]226-lady catherine to come and stay with [her]226-lady catherine , with the promise of balls and [young men]3022-young men , [[her]226-lady catherine father]249-her father would never consent to [her]226-lady catherine going . [Mary]94-mary was [the only daughter who remained at [home]3288-home]3024-the only daughter who remained at home ; and [she]94-mary was necessarily drawn from the pursuit of accomplishments by [Mrs. Bennet]92-mrs. bennet ’s being quite unable to sit alone . [Mary]94-mary was obliged to mix more with [the world]304-the world , but [she]94-mary could still moralize over every morning visit ; and as [she]94-mary was no longer mortified by comparisons between [[her]94-mary sisters]3096-her sisters ’ beauty and [her]94-mary own , it was suspected by [[her]94-mary father]249-her father that [she]94-mary submitted to the change without much reluctance . As for [Wickham]209-mrs. wickham and [Lydia]90-lydia , [[their]3029-their characters]3030-their characters suffered no revolution from the marriage of [[her]94-mary sisters]3096-her sisters . [He]249-her father bore with philosophy the conviction that [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth must now become acquainted with whatever of [his]249-her father ingratitude and falsehood had before been unknown to [her]88-elizabeth ; and , in spite of everything , was not wholly without hope that [Darcy]128-miss darcy might yet be prevailed on to make [his]249-her father fortune . The congratulatory letter which [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth received from [Lydia]90-lydia on [her]90-lydia marriage explained to [her]88-elizabeth that , by [[his]249-her father wife]236-his wife at least , if not by [himself]249-her father , such a hope was cherished . The letter was to this effect - / * “ [[My]0-i dear]3066-my dear [Lizzy]88-elizabeth , * / “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [you]88-elizabeth joy . If [you]88-elizabeth love [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy half so well as [I]0-i do [[my]0-i dear]3066-my dear [Wickham]209-mrs. wickham , [you]88-elizabeth must be very happy . It is a great comfort to have [you]88-elizabeth so rich ; and when [you]88-elizabeth have nothing else to do , [I]0-i hope [you]88-elizabeth will think of [us]3034-us . [I]0-i am sure [Wickham]209-mrs. wickham would like a place at [court]3035-court very much ; and [I]0-i do not think [we]3034-us shall have quite money enough to live upon without some help . [Any place]3243-any place would do of about three or four hundred a year ; but , however , do not speak to [Mr. Darcy]96-mr. darcy about it , if [you]88-elizabeth had rather not . “ [Yours]88-elizabeth , ”[96-mr. darcy] etc . As it happened that [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth had much rather not , [she]88-elizabeth endeavoured in [her]88-elizabeth answer to put an end to every entreaty and expectation of the kind . Such relief , however , as it was in [her]88-elizabeth power to afford , by the practice of what might be called economy in [her]88-elizabeth own private expenses , [she]88-elizabeth frequently sent [them]3037-them . It had always been evident to [her]88-elizabeth that such an income as [theirs]3034-us , under the direction of [two persons so extravagant in [their]3038-two persons so extravagant in their wants wants]3038-two persons so extravagant in their wants , and heedless of the future , must be very insufficient to [their]3038-two persons so extravagant in their wants support ; and whenever [they]3038-two persons so extravagant in their wants changed [[their]3038-two persons so extravagant in their wants quarters]3039-their quarters , either [Jane]225-jane or [herself]225-jane were sure of being applied to for some little assistance towards discharging [their]3038-two persons so extravagant in their wants bills . [Their]3038-two persons so extravagant in their wants manner of living , even when the restoration of peace dismissed [them]3038-two persons so extravagant in their wants to [a home]3040-a home , was unsettled in the extreme . [They]3038-two persons so extravagant in their wants were always moving from place to place in quest of a cheap situation , and always spending more than [they]3038-two persons so extravagant in their wants ought . [His]3041-his affection for [her]88-elizabeth soon sunk into indifference : [hers]88-elizabeth lasted a little longer ; and , in spite of [her]88-elizabeth youth and [her]88-elizabeth manners , [she]88-elizabeth retained all the claims to reputation which [her]88-elizabeth marriage had given [her]88-elizabeth . Though [Darcy]96-mr. darcy could never receive [him]3041-his at [Pemberley]12-pemberley , yet , for [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s sake , [he]96-mr. darcy assisted [him]3041-his further in [his]3041-his profession . [Lydia]90-lydia was occasionally [a visitor there]3042-a visitor there , when [[her]88-elizabeth husband]260-her husband was gone to enjoy [himself]260-her husband in [London]5-london or [Bath]78-bath ; and with [the Bingleys]158-the bingleys [they]3044-they both of [them]3044-they frequently stayed so long , that even [Bingley]85-mr. bingley ’s good - humour was overcome , and [he]85-mr. bingley proceeded so far as to talk of giving [them]3044-they a hint to be gone . [Miss Bingley]98-miss bingley was very deeply mortified by [Darcy]96-mr. darcy ’s marriage ; but as [she]98-miss bingley thought it advisable to retain the right of visiting at [Pemberley]12-pemberley , [she]98-miss bingley dropped all [her]98-miss bingley resentment ; was fonder than ever of [Georgiana]153-georgiana , almost as attentive to [Darcy]153-georgiana as heretofore , and paid off every arrear of civility to [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth . [Pemberley]12-pemberley was now [[Georgiana]153-georgiana ’s home]3045-georgiana ’s home ; and the attachment of [the sisters]496-the sisters was exactly what [Darcy]153-georgiana had hoped to see . [They]3044-they were able to love [each other]3216-each other , even as well as [they]3044-they intended . [Georgiana]153-georgiana had the highest opinion in [the world]304-the world of [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ; though at first [she]153-georgiana often listened with an astonishment bordering on alarm at [her]153-georgiana lively , sportive manner of talking to [[her]153-georgiana brother]3181-her brother . [He]3181-her brother , who had always inspired in [herself]153-georgiana a respect which almost overcame [her]153-georgiana affection , [she]153-georgiana now saw the object of open pleasantry . [Her]153-georgiana mind received knowledge which had never before fallen in [her]153-georgiana way . By [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s instructions [she]153-georgiana began to comprehend that [a woman]3084-a woman may take liberties with [[her]3084-a woman husband]260-her husband , which [a brother]439-a brother will not always allow in [a sister more than ten years younger than [himself]439-a brother]3053-a sister more than ten years younger than himself . [Lady Catherine]226-lady catherine was extremely indignant on the marriage of [[her]226-lady catherine nephew]827-her nephew ; and as [she]226-lady catherine gave way to all the genuine frankness of [her]226-lady catherine character , in [her]226-lady catherine reply to the letter which announced its arrangement , [she]226-lady catherine sent [him]827-her nephew language so very abusive , especially of [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , that for some time all intercourse was at an end . But at length , by [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth ’s persuasion , [he]827-her nephew was prevailed on to overlook the offence , and seek a reconciliation ; and , after a little further resistance on the part of [[his]827-her nephew aunt]3747-his aunt , [her]88-elizabeth resentment gave way , either to [her]88-elizabeth affection for [him]827-her nephew , or [her]88-elizabeth curiosity to see how [[his]827-her nephew wife]236-his wife conducted [herself]236-his wife ; and [she]88-elizabeth condescended to wait on [them]3057-them at [Pemberley]12-pemberley , in spite of that pollution which [[its]12-pemberley woods]3058-its woods had received , not merely from the presence of [such a mistress]3059-such a mistress , but the visits of [[her]88-elizabeth uncle]579-her uncle and aunt from [the city]3061-the city . With [the Gardiners]159-the gardiners [they]3057-them were always on the most intimate terms . [Darcy]153-georgiana , as well as [Elizabeth]88-elizabeth , really loved [them]3057-them ; and [they]3057-them were both ever sensible of the warmest gratitude towards [the persons who , by bringing [her]88-elizabeth into [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire]3062-the persons who , by bringing her into derbyshire , had been the means of uniting [them]3057-them .
